description: Daniel Murphy was on the field early Friday afternoon, taking ground balls at third base, as Fred Wilpon, the Mets owner, and Manager Terry Collins watched.

title: A Letdown for the Masses, but a Treat for Aficionados
description: LAS VEGAS  There were not enough superlatives to describe the excitement in the buildup to the superfight between Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao.

title: Corrections: May 3, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats On Sunday
description: 10 P.M. (Showtime) PENNY DREADFUL Drawing on characters from 19th-century literature and historical events like the Jack the Ripper murders, the series begins a second season as Vanessa Ives (Eva Green, above) is haunted by macabre occult images conjured by the mysterious Evelyn Poole (Helen McCrory). Ethan Chandler (Josh Hartnett), meanwhile, decides to leave London in the aftermath of the massacre he committed at the Mariners Inn. The Creature (Rory Kinnear) pressures Dr. Frankenstein (Harry Treadaway) to resurrect Brona (Billie Piper). And Sir Malcolm (Timothy Dalton) returns to London to encounter a new evil. Mike Hale, writing in The New York Times, called the show the best of its kind on TV right now.

title: Review: With Original Lineup, Blur Returns to New York in Punky Form
description: Blur came on punky for its first New York City concert with its original lineup in 15 years at the Music Hall of Williamsburg on Friday.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Catch up on the weeks top stories.

title: 1915: Germans Use Poisonous Gases on British Troops
description: LONDON  Field-Marshal Sir John French sends the following to the War Office under date of to-day [May 3]:

title: Hard but Hopeful Home to Lot of Freddies
description: Troubles follow Freddie Grays close-knit Baltimore neighborhood.

title: US External Debt: A Curious Case
description: As Tim Taylor notes, the U.S. net international investment position  the difference between US assets abroad and foreign claims on the US  has moved substantially deeper into the red in recent years:

title: Mayweather Wins, Preens and Is Booed
description: LAS VEGAS  Sometimes Darth Vader wins.

title: Afghan and Taliban Representatives Meet in Qatar
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghan government officials and Taliban militants began two days of meetings on Sunday in the gulf state of Qatar, and for once neither side denied that the sessions were taking place.

title: In a Blended Family, Your Dad Becomes Dad
description: My new husband, Felipe, traveled a lot for work, leaving me to parent my daughter and new stepdaughter. I felt good about my one-on-one time with each of our girls. The trouble emerged when the three of us were in a room together. I struggled with starting a conversation about Felipe that engaged both of them.

title: 1965: Marines With Unloaded Guns: Viet Cong? Sing Em a Song?
description: DA NANG, South Vietnam  United States Marines guarding theAmerican air base complex here are complaining about ordersthat make them wait for the Viet Cong without a bullet in thechamber of their weapons.

title: Everyday Life in Katmandu
description: This weeks video, by Jonah M. Kessel, captures the beauty and cultural vibrancy of Katmandu, the capital of Nepal. It was shot on assignment for the New York Times travel section, just one month before the latest earthquake struck.

title: Queens Man Charged With Assault and Attempted Murder in Shooting of Officer
description: With a loaded handgun tucked into the waistband of his bluejeans, the authorities said, Demetrius Blackwell walked the familiar blocks near his home in Queens Village on Saturday.

title: Japanese American Museum Acquires Internee Artifacts
description: The Japanese American National Museum in Los Angeles has acquired a collection of artifacts that Japanese-Americans produced while in internment camps during World War II. A planned auction of about 450 pieces last month, at the auction house Rago in Lambertville, N.J., was canceled amid global social media protests.

title: In Baltimore, National Guard Pullout Begins as Citywide Curfew Is Lifted
description: BALTIMORE  In a pair of gestures on Sunday that suggested that this riot-scarred city was staggering toward normalcy, the National Guard began to pull its troops from Baltimore, and the mayor lifted a curfew that, after several days of relative calm, had come under mounting criticism.

title: Abducted as an Infant, Revisiting It as an Adult
description: You wrote a story about me in 1994, the voice on the phone said, but I lost the clipping. Could you send me another copy?

title: In Skunk Cabbage Growth, Watching Spring Spring
description: Its easy to see why this season is called spring when you track the explosive growth of skunk cabbage in the Hudson Valley. Some fascinating background on this wetland plant is here and here.

title: Nepals Bureaucracy Is Blamed as Earthquake Relief Supplies Pile Up
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  Relief supplies for earthquake victims have been piling up at the airport and in warehouses here because of bureaucratic interference by Nepalese authorities who insist that standard customs inspections and other procedures be followed, even in an emergency, officials with Western governments and aid organizations said on Sunday.

title: Nonprofits Chief During Its Fall Seeks $1.2 Million Payday, and Outrage Ensues
description: Over the past four months, most of its multimillion dollar government contracts and its poor and disabled clients have been handed over to new agencies. Its employees have scattered, with some in new positions, some still unemployed and others struggling to get by in jobs that pay less than they once earned.

title: After Protest Over Award, Neil Gaiman and Art Spiegelman Agree to Be Table Hosts at PEN Gala
description: Neil Gaiman, Art Spiegelman, and Alison Bechdel are among writers who have agreed to be table hosts at the PEN American Center gala on Tuesday, replacing those who dropped out to protest the presentation of the groups freedom of expression courage award to the French satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo.

title: Start-Ups Try to Challenge Google, at Least on Mobile Search
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Europes competition regulator filed antitrust charges against Google on the belief that the companys search business had become so powerful that it was pretty much impossible to compete with. But do not tell that to Bobby Lo.

title: Duck Dynasty Musical to Close After Brief Run
description: After taking flight very briefly, Duck Commander Musical, the Las Vegas musical about the Robertson family of Duck Dynasty fame, will close its doors on May 17.

title: An Engaging Call Elevates Welterweight Title Bout Above Distractions
description: Early on, it appeared that the HBO/Showtime broadcast of the welterweight title fight between Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao would sink under a sea of hype and celebrity gazing. The host, James Brown, sounded overwhelmed by the atmosphere and marketing when, soon after 9 p.m. Eastern, he said, This is the Super Bowl, the World Series, Final Four, World Cup and Kentucky Derby all rolled into one 12-round fight.

title: Ashley and JaQuavis Coleman: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
description: Urban fiction, or street lit, has been snubbed by the publishing industry and scorned by black intellectuals. Yet these authors may just be the most successful literary couple in America.

title: Shakespeares Globe Gets New Director, Emma Rice
description: LONDON  Emma Rice, the co-artistic director of Kneehigh, a spectacle-based theater company headquartered in Cornwall, England, will take over as the next artistic director of Shakespeares Globe in the spring of 2016, the theater announced.

title: Anti-Police Protest in Israel Turns Violent
description: TEL AVIV  A protest on Sunday by thousands of Ethiopian-Israelis and sympathizers against police harassment and brutality turned by nightfall into a chaotic and unusually violent confrontation with the police in the center of Tel Aviv.

title: Dave Goldberg Was Lifelong Womens Advocate
description: Even as a high school student, Dave Goldberg was urging female classmates to speak up. As a young dot-com executive, he had one girlfriend after another, but fell hard for a driven friend named Sheryl Sandberg, pining after her for years. After they wed, Mr. Goldberg pushed her to negotiate hard for high compensation and arranged his schedule so that he could be home with their children when she was traveling for work.

title: Al Qaeda Branch Claims Responsibility for Bangladeshi Bloggers Killing
description: The leader of Al Qaedas branch in the Indian subcontinent has published a video claiming responsibility for the death of Avijit Roy, an atheist Bangladeshi-American blogger who was killed by a group of men with machetes on Feb. 26 as he was leaving a book fair in Dhaka, Bangladesh.

title: Indian Soldiers Killed in Militant Ambush in Nagaland
description: NEW DELHI  At least eight Indian soldiers were fatally shot by separatist militants in the northeastern state of Nagaland on Sunday, according to the police. The killings took place in the afternoon when a truck carrying soldiers was ambushed by militants from a faction of the Nationalist Socialist Council of Nagaland in the Mon district.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of May 4
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Relief Supplies Are Delayed in Nepal
description: Relief supplies for earthquake victims have been piling up in Nepals capital because of government interference, Western officials say.

title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2 Falls Just Shy of a Zero Percent Rotten Tomatoes Rating
description: LOS ANGELES  Studio movies, even exceptionally bad ones, almost always eke out an upbeat review or two. Last year, not one wide-release film received a zero percent score on RottenTomatoes.com, which aggregates reviews.

title: Relief Supplies Are Delayed in Nepal
description: Relief supplies for earthquake victims have been piling up in Nepals capital because of government interference, Western officials say.

title: Bernie Sanders, Admirer of Scandinavia, Stands Firm on His Ideas
description: Senator Bernie Sanders, the Vermont independent, isnt afraid to be attacked for his admiration of Scandinavian government programs, like health care and education.

title: U.S.- Japan Alliance
description: Rolling out the welcome rug.

title: Quiet Bats and a Flub Send the Mets to Another Loss
description: A week and a half ago, the Mets were the hottest team in baseball, having won 11 straight games. Citi Field was shedding its longstanding reputation for being desolate for much of April, attracting boisterous fans who, having been roused from their hibernation, were championing the ballpark as the home of the best pitching staff in the major leagues.

title: Earnings From Tesla; Volkswagens Annual Meeting
description: Here are some of the top business stories to pay attention to in the coming week.

title: Avengers Dominates Weekend Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  The Avengers: Age of Ultron took in $187.7 million over the weekend in North America, a staggering total that nonetheless fell slightly below Hollywoods expectations, as major sporting events siphoned away viewers.

title: English Ensembles Crown a Festival of Early Music
description: Carnegie Halls groundbreaking early-music festival Before Bach, a varied and eventful journey, ended on Friday evening more or less where it had begun on April 7, in the young but ebullient world of 17th-century Italian opera.

title: Review: Meredith Monk Ends Carnegie Hall Run With Mystery and Mastery
description: The composer, performance artist and vocal wizard Meredith Monk has been weaving her strange magic in a series of concerts at Carnegie Hall this season, where she has been composer in residence. On Saturday she concluded this run, billed as a celebration of 50 years of work created and performed in New York. Addressing the audience in the sold-out auditorium of Zankel Hall, she said her aim that night was above all to thank and celebrate the musicians who have traveled and performed alongside her.

title: ABC No Rio Fondly Recalls the Saturdays of Its Gritty Youth
description: Destruction is a New York tradition. There was the beloved Pennsylvania Station, designed by McKim, Mead & White; destroyed in 1963. The Solomons Temple of punk rock, CBGB, that couldnt be saved from closure in 2006; replaced by an upscale fashion boutique. The Frank Lloyd Wright-designed Hoffman Auto Showroom at 430 Park Avenue; disemboweled by developers in 2013. The list goes on and on.

title: Relative of Cinderella
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Welcome to a new edition of Pedantic Mondays. Dont panic, this is not a regular feature. Its always easy to play Monday morning quarterback, but if this had been my idea  and I am fully aware that I didnt think of it first  I might have approached it a bit differently.

title: Review: Electronic Africa Pushes Dance Rhythms to a Breakneck Speed
description: Nozinja, a South African producer and D.J., started a chant during his set at Villain in Williamsburg on Friday night: One! Eight! Nine! That was for 189 beats per minute, the frenetic pace of the dance music he has pioneered, Shangaan Electro. You must be ready to dance! he shouted. A heartbeat that fast would be tachycardia.

title: Review: Frontline Looks at Missteps During the Ebola Outbreak
description: Heartbreaking stories from the Ebola outbreak are familiar by now, although that doesnt make them any easier to hear, and a Frontline installment being broadcast on PBS on Tuesday night has its share. But it also has something less familiar: Officials acknowledging that they could have done a better job of responding to the crisis.

title: Review: 9-Man Is More Than a Game for Chinese-Americans
description: Basketball isnt the only sport being played on urban asphalt. A less visible game, but one just as important culturally to those who play it, is profiled Tuesday night on the World Channel in an absorbing documentary called 9-Man.

title: China, Pursuing Strategic Interests, Builds Presence in Antarctica
description: HOBART, Tasmania  Few places seem out of reach for Chinas leader, Xi Jinping, who has traveled from European capitals to obscure Pacific and Caribbean islands in pursuit of his nations strategic interests.

title: Meet Mago, Former Heavyweight
description: GREENWICH, Conn.  Mago is in the bedroom. You can go in.

title: Review: Six Rounds of Vengeance, in Vegas, No Actual Boxers Necessary
description: There are curved scimitars and long broadswords in the Vampire Cowboys Six Rounds of Vengeance at the New Ohio Theater. Also arrows, pistols, homemade grenades, fists of steel, an ancient Egyptian dagger and what sounds a lot like a chain saw.

title: David Cameron and Ed Miliband Enter Final Straight in British Election
description: LONDON  They are a remarkable contrast: David Cameron, 48, the red-cheeked toff who went to Eton and belonged to snooty clubs; and Ed Miliband, 45, the gawky, adenoidal, agnostic son of a Marxist Jewish refugee and historian.

title: Review: The Wright Brothers by David McCullough
description: A lot of books about the Wright Brothers are written for children. Maybe thats because these two aviation pioneers are better known for their work than for anything personal, and because inventing the first viable airplane is more exciting than anything else about them. Or because the Wrights asceticism and single-mindedness sound so uncomplicatedly heroic.

title: The GHE20G0TH1K in Brooklyn
description: Scenes from the party at the Brooklyn Night Bazaar in Williamsburg.

title: 40 Busy Years Later, Paul Allen, a Microsoft Founder, Considers His Creation
description: SEATTLE Looking at Microsofts sprawling product line and 118,000 or so employees, its easy to forget that the company started with one modest product made by two ambitious people.

title: Review: The GHE20G0TH1K Party Says It Is Flicking On the Lights
description: For about six years, the GHE20G0TH1K party has been one of New Yorks most essential and least predictable night-life institutions. These semiregular shows have captured and disseminated a fantastical world where dance floor-based musical subcultures from underrepresented communities  juke, ballroom house, dark hip-hop, and much more  could coexist, making for a coalition of the overlooked.

title: City Ballet to Present La Sylphide, a Romantic Ballet Standard
description: Leave this world behind. All choreography takes us on a trip, but where? Its curious that in the Romantic ballets of the 19th century the journey takes us into the risky terrain of unconfined nature. Into the woods!

title: Safety on Fire
description: There are over 80,000 chemicals in use today. The story of TRIS, removed from childrens pajamas in the 1970s, illustrates just how hard it is to regulate chemicals, or to even know if theyre safe.

title: A Flame Retardant That Came With Its Own Threat to Health
description: If you closely examine your living room couch, your favorite easy chair or your childs car seat, the odds are strong that you will find upholstery that is filled with polyurethane foam treated with a chemical flame retardant. Some may find that comforting: Isnt it desirable to hold an accidental fire at bay, one caused by, say, a burning cigarette or faulty electrical wiring? But studies show that many flame-resistant chemicals loom as potential health menaces, associated with cancers, memory loss, lower I.Q.s and impaired motor skills in children, to name a few woes. Isnt it just as desirable, some would also say, to keep such substances out of peoples lives?

title: Long Before British Vote, Financiers Weigh In
description: LONDON  No political party in Europe has done more for hedge funds and bankers in recent years than the British Conservatives.

title: Ben Carson Says Hell Seek 2016 G.O.P. Nomination
description: Ben Carson, a retired neurosurgeon who has never held elective office, said on Sunday that he would seek the 2016 Republican nomination for president, joining the partys fast-growing field.

title: Moving West Side Books: A Sequel
description: Dear Diary:

title: Ex-C.I.A. Official Rebuts Republican Claims on Benghazi Attack in The Great War of Our Time
description: WASHINGTON  The former deputy director of the C.I.A. asserts in a forthcoming book that Republicans, in their eagerness to politicize the killing of the American ambassador to Libya, repeatedly distorted the agencys analysis of events. But he also argues that the C.I.A. should get out of the business of providing talking points for administration officials in national security events that quickly become partisan, as happened after the Benghazi attack in 2012.

title: Top Talent Makes for More Dazzling Triple Crown
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  American Pharoah did what so many had hoped he would in the 141st running of the Kentucky Derby. Besides merely win, he lived up to his promise. The colt showed he could stalk and pounce. He proved that when challenged in the stretch he could out-will and outrun a tough rival.

title: Slow Rebound for a Bridge in Brooklyn Whose Bounce Became Worse
description: It was supposed to be the coolest little bridge in New York City. Designed by the winner of a MacArthur genius grant and built at a cost of $4.1 million, it zigzagged just 400 feet down from Brooklyn Heights to the waterfront, bouncing slightly underfoot and adding a touch of rustic adventure to the bustling Brooklyn Bridge Park.

title: For-Profit Colleges Face a Loan Revolt by Thousands Claiming Trickery
description: Brittany Prock of Merit, Tex., had a longstanding dream of becoming a detective. To pursue her ambition, she enrolled in the criminal justice program of Everest University Online, operated by Corinthian Colleges, one of the nations largest for-profit education companies.

title: Christies Grip onRepublican Politics in New Jersey Shows Signs of Slipping
description: At the height of his political celebrity, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey persuaded dozens of Democratic officeholders to back his 2013 re-election campaign. The implied transaction seemed simple: Support a well-liked Republican and win a measure of good will from him, perhaps even some acclaim by association.

title: Mummy Displayed in Hungary Sets Chinese Villagers in Pursuit of Lost Icon
description: YANGCHUN, China  One day in March, Lin Yongtuan was on his lunch break scrolling through the news on his phone when a story with an interesting photo caught his eye. Researchers in Europe had made a remarkable discovery: the nearly 1,000-year-old mummified body of a monk encased in a statue.

title: Rhapsody, a Lofty Literary Journal, Perused at 39,000 Feet
description: Last summer at a writers workshop in Oregon, the novelists Anthony Doerr, Karen Russell and Elissa Schappell were chatting over cocktails when they realized they had all published work in the same magazine. It wasnt one of the usual literary outlets, like Tin House, The Paris Review or The New Yorker. It was Rhapsody, an in-flight magazine for United Airlines.

title: Competitive Environment Complicates Decisions About Head Injuries
description: Ali Krieger has a lot on her plate this year. As a defender for the United States womens national team, she is weeks away from the start of her second World Cup. And as one of the most prominent members of the National Womens Soccer League, she is helping build an audience for her team and the fledgling league.

title: World Science Festival Announces Schedule
description: The stars will be out at the World Science Festival at the end of May, in multiple senses of the word. The actor Alan Alda, the authors Diane Ackerman and David Quammen, and three renowned scientists, Brian Greene, Edward Witten and Steven Weinberg, will be among those to appear at the five-day festival, which also includes a night of stargazing in Brooklyn Bridge Park.

title: Remembering Craig Allen
description: One of the fiercest roller hockey players on the streets of New York City in the 1970s died on April 26. He was remembered at an annual reunion on Saturday.

title: Tribute for a Roller Hockey Warrior Who Broke the Color Barrier
description: Hockey is not exactly known as a city game, but played on roller skates, it once held sway as the sport of choice in many New York neighborhoods.

title: As Vice Moves More to TV, It Tries to Keep Brash Voice
description: The live music at the Vice Media party on Friday shook the room. Shane Smith, Vices chief executive, was standing near the stage  with a drink in his hand, pants sagging, tattoos showing  watching the rapper-cum-chef Action Bronson make pizzas.

title: Yemeni Fighters Trained in Persian Gulf Are Said to Join Saudi-Led Mission
description: MUKALLA, Yemen  Yemeni fighters who are believed to have received training and weapons in the Persian Gulf entered combat around the southern city of Aden on Sunday, joining with militiamen who are battling Houthi rebels, according to local militia fighters in Aden.

title: Rangers Have Their Hands Full With Alex Ovechkin
description: It was hard enough for the Rangers to deal with Sidney Crosby in the first round of the postseason. They turned back Crosby and his Pittsburgh Penguins teammates in five games, but all four of the Rangers victories were by the same, taut 2-1 score, and two of them came in overtime. Crosby was a constant nemesis, and the Rangers were glad to say goodbye to him in the handshake line after Game 5 and move on.

title: Long-Term Data on Complications Adds to Criticism of Essure Contraceptive Implant
description: When a new contraceptive implant came on the market over a decade ago, it was considered a breakthrough for women who did not want to have more children, a sterilization procedure that could be done in a doctors office in just 10 minutes.

title: Campaign Coverage via Snapchat Could Shake Up the 2016 Elections
description: During the 2008 presidential race, two online upstarts, Politico and The Huffington Post, elbowed their way onto the rope line and, for better or for worse, helped change the way campaigns were covered. In 2012, it was BuzzFeeds turn. The site that specialized in cute kittens and funny lists turned up at the Iowa caucuses and sped up the news cycle even further, flooding Twitter feeds with tidbits from the trail.

title: The Formaldehyde Fight
description: The E.P.A. is close to imposing restrictions on the use of the chemical in wood products. But the furniture industry, with the help of some members of Congress, has been trying to get the proposed new rule scaled back. Here is a look at that effort.

title: The Uphill Battle to Better Regulate Formaldehyde
description: WASHINGTON  A decade after emergency trailers meant to shelter Hurricane Katrina victims instead caused burning eyes, sore throats and other more serious ailments, the Environmental Protection Agency is on the verge of regulating the culprit: formaldehyde, a chemical that can be found in commonplace things like clothes and furniture.

title: Criminal Complaint Against Demetrius Blackwell
description: A Queens man was charged in the shooting of a police officer on Saturday.

title: Decades After a Famous Shot, the Fall Guy Is Still Recovering
description: Eras apart, we have a renewal of the rivalry between the franchises of Jordan and James.

title: Ben Carson on the Issues
description: Ben Carson, a retired pediatric neurosurgeon, announced Sunday that he is running for the Republican presidential nomination. A Fox News commentator, he is a fierce critic of President Obamas health care law, calling it the worst thing that has happened in this nation since slavery. Here is where he stands on some of the biggest issues of the 2016 campaign.

title: G.O.P. Hopefuls Now Aiming to Woo the Middle Class
description: WASHINGTON  The last three men to win the Republican nomination have been the prosperous son of a president (George W. Bush), a senator who could not recall how many homes his family owned (John McCain of Arizona; it was seven) and a private equity executive worth an estimated $200 million (Mitt Romney).

title: Game of Thrones Recap: Call Him Swordcatcher
description: Here be spoilers and snakes.

title: What Ben Carson Would Need to Do to Win
description: Ben Carson has entered the race for the Republican nomination for president. Here is a look at what he will need to do if he hopes to win.

title: Behind the Yankees: Their Best Days, and A.L. East Foes
description: BOSTON  When the baseball season ended at Fenway Park two Octobers ago, Koji Uehara threw the final pitch to David Ross. The winning pitcher was John Lackey, and the most valuable player of that World Series was David Ortiz. All of them were at least 35 years old.

title: Clippers and Chris Paul Survive the Spurs With Trust, Toughness and Resolve
description: LOS ANGELES  On Saturday night, after nearly three hours of unscripted theater, Chris Paul wore an unconventional ensemble to his news conference.

title: The Good Wife Recap: I Cant Take Another Failure
description: Season 6, Episode 21: Dont Fail

title: Review: My Morning Jacket Stays True to Its Strengths on The Waterfall
Popular Demand
description: Auto sales were up more than 4 percent in April, compared with April 2014. Midsize and compact crossover S.U.V.s  which are built on car frames instead of truck frames  saw large gains, far outselling midsize traditional S.U.V.s and large traditional S.U.V.s.

title: Alex Rodriguez Avoids Discussing Cashmans Stand on Bonus
description: BOSTON  The day after General Manager Brian Cashman stated that the Yankees had no intention of paying Alex Rodriguez a $6 million bonus for tying Willie Mays for fourth place on the career home run list, Rodriguez did little more than shrug.

title: Hispanic Group Brings New Voice in Washington to Coveted Demographic
description: As both political parties make Hispanic voters a focus in 2016, a group working to ensure that voices of Latinos are reflected at every level of government will host its first major conference in Washington on Monday.

title: Effort to Strip Pensions From Corrupt New York Officials Stalls
description: Weeks after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo declared victory on new ethics laws, one measure  to strip pensions from corrupt public officials  has stalled in the New York Assembly because of objections from unions representing public employees.

title: Not Your Average Pickup Game: Sandlot Action at North Carolina Draws Elite Talent
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  Chris Rich, awaiting word from Anson Dorrance, glanced at his phone and made an announcement.

title: Plainclothes Officers in New York Find Danger in Recognition
description: For most city residents, the New York Police Departments elite anticrime officers are invisible observers, prowling the streets in unmarked cars and civilian clothes in a bid to stop felony crimes before they start.

title: Texas Police Kill Gunmen at Exhibit Featuring Cartoons of Muhammad
description: Two gunmen were killed after they opened fire Sunday evening outside an event hosted by an anti-Islam group in Garland, Tex., featuring cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad, local officials said. According to the authorities, the two assailants shot a security guard and were, in turn, shot and killed by police officers.

title: Veep Recap: The Happy Cupcake Virus
description: Season 4, Episode 4: Tehran

title: Wolf Hall Recap: Henry Is All Heat, Fury and Menace
description: Part 5, Crows

title: Joseph Lechleider, a Father of the DSL Internet Technology, Dies at 82
description: In the late 1980s, Joseph W. Lechleider came up with a clever solution to a puzzling technical problem, making it possible to bring high-speed Internet service to millions of households. His idea earned him a place in the National Inventors Hall of Fame as one of the fathers of the Internet service known as DSL.

title: Democratic Party Is Without a Nominee in a Brooklyn Assembly Race
description: The race to replace New York State Assemblyman Karim Camara, who announced in January that he would be stepping down from his seat to join the governors office, was supposed to be a leisurely stroll.

title: Tournaments New Format Begets Unexpected Ending
description: SAN FRANCISCO  On a raw Sunday morning at TPC Harding Park, a voice cut through the marine layer like a foghorn after Rory McIlroy dispatched his opponent, Paul Casey. It was their first hole of the day and the 22nd of their suspended quarterfinal.

title: Uncertainty on Long Island Sound
description: The Mamaroneck Beach & Yacht Club has sought for years to build seasonal apartments on the grounds. That may still happen, but the club is up for sale.

title: Iran Nuclear Talks Open a Tangled Path to Ending Syrias War
description: UNITED NATIONS  Wearing pinstripes and a pince-nez, Staffan de Mistura, the United Nations envoy for Syria, arrived at the Security Council one Tuesday afternoon in February and announced that President Bashar al-Assad had agreed to halt airstrikes over Aleppo. Would the rebels, Mr. de Mistura suggested, agree to halt their shelling?

title: Word of the Day | consonance
description: consonance  \kn(t)-s(-)nn(t)s\  noun

title: The Quest for Transgender Equality
description: Being transgender today is still unreasonably hard, but it is far from hopeless. This is the first in a series of editorials looking at the challenges ahead.

title: Whats On TV Monday
description: 9:30 P.M. (CBS) DAVID LETTERMAN: A LIFE ON TELEVISION When he retires on May 20, Mr. Letterman, above, will have reigned over 6,028 late-night talk-show broadcasts across 33 years  more than any other host. This salute, M.C.d by Ray Romano, mines Mr. Lettermans video vault to present his interviews with world leaders, sports figures and stars in entertainment, as well as his show from Sept. 17, 2001, his first after the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks.

title: After Eight-Run Lead, Yankees Lean on Bullpen to Finish Off a Sweep
description: BOSTON  If, as David Ortiz suggested earlier this season, the Red Sox-Yankees series are not as salty as they used to be, then a little spice was added back to the rivalry Sunday night.

title: Game of Thrones Q&A: Keisha Castle-Hughes on the Tao of the Sand Snakes
description: This post contains spoilers for Sundays episode, The Sons of the Harpy.

title: The Best and Worst Places to Grow Up: How Your Area Compares
description: Children growing up in some places go on to earn more than they would if they had grown up elsewhere.

title: Corrections: May 4, 2015
description: NEW YORK

title: Mad Men Recap: On the Road Again
description: Season 7, Episode 12: Lost Horizon

title: Why the New Research on Mobility Matters: An Economists View
description: Hundreds of studies have demonstrated that the odds of economic success vary across neighborhoods. The far more difficult question is whether thats because neighborhoods nurture success (or failure), or whether they just attract those who would succeed (or fail) anyway.

title: Andre Kertesz, Watching From Above
description: The word surveillance is often loaded with heavy connotations that spark concerns about privacy lost to everything from government eavesdropping to video cameras on every street corner. But what if that word was paired with the story and photographs of the Hungarian photographer Andre Kertesz?

title: The Polk Familys Quest for a Better Life
description: WOOD DALE, Ill.  Latonya Polk knew by the early summer of 2012 that she and her family had to leave their home in one of Illinoiss most violence-prone suburbs, outside Chicago.

title: An Atlas of Upward Mobility Shows Paths Out of Poverty
description: In the wake of the Los Angeles riots more than 20 years ago, Congress created an anti-poverty experiment called Moving to Opportunity. It gave vouchers to help poor families move to better neighborhoods and awarded them on a random basis, so researchers could study the effects.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The data show we can do something about upward mobility. Every extra year of childhood spent in a better neighborhood seems to matter.

title: Jeb Bushs Paleo Diet
description: To the Editor:

title: Cameras at the Supreme Court
description: To the Editor:

title: Our Students Below-Average Math Abilities
description: To the Editor:

title: Race, Class and Neglect
description: Every time youre tempted to say that America is moving forward on race  that prejudice is no longer as important as it used to be  along comes an atrocity to puncture your complacency. Almost everyone realizes, I hope, that the Freddie Gray affair wasnt an isolated incident, that its unique only to the extent that for once there seems to be a real possibility that justice may be done.

title: Insuring for Disaster
description: NATURAL disasters like the devastating earthquake in Nepal constitute a highly uncertain but quantifiable risk. No one can say for sure when a major earthquake will strike. But the fault lines are known. We need a new global system of disaster insurance, akin to how homeowners guard against calamity.

title: When Food Is Genetically Modified
description: To the Editor:

title: Stand Your Ground Makes No Sense
description: ITS been 10 years since Florida enacted a beefed-up Stand Your Ground law. Since 2005, roughly half the states have passed this law, or one like it. The National Rifle Association led the charge, arguing that Stand Your Ground laws would improve public safety and protect honest citizens. Similar laws have existed elsewhere for over a century, but Floridas law substantially altered the legal equation.

title: Restoring Faith in Justice
description: Last week, Baltimores chief prosecutor, Marilyn J. Mosby, charged six officers in the death of Freddie Gray. The charges included second-degree murder, manslaughter, assault, misconduct in office and false imprisonment.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Floyd Mayweather Jr. Defeats Manny Pacquiao
description: In Floyd Mayweather Jr. Defeats Manny Pacquiao in Boxings Big Matchup, John Branch reports on what some observers called the fight of the century.

title: Test Yourself | A Luxury Toilet Seat
description: Below, several paragraphs from the April 29 article Electronic Bidet Toilet Seat Is the Luxury You Wont Want to Live Without.

title: Review: The Rakes Progress Makes a Brief Visit at the Metropolitan Opera
description: Blink and youve missed it. On Friday evening the Metropolitan Opera revived Jonathan Millers stylish and moving production of Stravinskys The Rakes Progress, with James Levine conducting a cast led by a radiant Paul Appleby in the lead role. This coming Saturday afternoon it will once again pack up Peter J. Davisons handsome sets and stash them away alongside Judy Levins spectacular 1920s costumes in a storage room marked with a sign that reads: Neglect Until Further Notice.

title: 2 With Ties to Christie Plead Not Guilty in Bridge Scandal
description: NEWARK  Two former top officials in Gov. Chris Christies administration pleaded not guilty on Monday to federal charges that they conspired to disrupt traffic leading to the George Washington Bridge, to punish a mayor who did not endorse the governor for re-election.

title: Odd Push in Drug-Averse Norway: LSD Is O.K.
description: OSLO  In a country so wary of drug abuse that it limits the sale of aspirin, Pal-Orjan Johansen, a Norwegian researcher, is pushing what would seem a doomed cause: the rehabilitation of LSD.

title: Justices Opinions Grow in Size, Accessibility and Testiness, Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court seems to be in a foul mood.

title: Yoga Rooms Offer a Quiet Break in Hectic Airports
description: Sallie Jo Cunningham wasnt expecting a good nights sleep. Waiting for her 12:30 a.m. flight out of San Francisco International Airport to depart, Ms. Cunningham, a business development professional, had resigned herself to a groggy trip back home.

title: For Mamaroneck Yacht Club, a Decade of Clashing Views on Preserving Vistas
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y.  Even on a quiet weekday afternoon in April, sloops, schooners, motorboats and yachts glide out through the mouth of the river that gives this village of 20,000 on Long Island Sound its name. Just as traffic picks up on the roads after work, the waters become more crowded  sailors who happen to be lawyers, bankers and plumbers sneaking in one good float before dinner.

title: Droughts Extremes Tallied at Record-Low Lake Mead
description: LAKE MEAD NATIONAL RECREATION AREA, Nev.  Gail Kaiser has spent much of her life here on Lake Mead, with its crystal blue water pouring into canyons and splintering off like blood vessels into coves and bays, forming the vast reservoir that stretches into two states.

title: Our Demand Is Simple: Stop Killing Us
description: On the evening of April 25 at the corner of Pratt and Light Streets, in Baltimores revitalized downtown district, more than 100 police officers in riot gear stood shoulder to shoulder, shields up. Six officers on horseback fidgeted behind them, staring down at a crowd of about 40, an odd mixture of protesters, journalists and protester-journalists. Earlier in the afternoon, well over a thousand people marched from the Western District police station to City Hall to protest the death of Freddie Gray, a 25-year-old black man whose spinal cord was severely injured while he was in the custody of the Baltimore Police Department. Only a handful of live-streamers, an older man in a kente-cloth kufi, five or six teenagers with bandannas drawn across their faces and two young women in cocktail attire who had just been kicked out of a wedding were left. Each person was filming the police.

title: Would You Like to Ride in a Car That Drives Itself?
description: Driving a car: Some people enjoy it, others are simply glad to have the skill that helps them get from place to place. But what if a car could drive itself?

title: The Wright Brothers, by David McCullough
description: Its been nearly half a century since David McCullough published The Johnstown Flood, which initiated his career as our matchless master of popular history. His 10th book, The Wright Brothers, has neither the heft of his earlier volumes nor, in its intense focus on a short period in its subjects lives, the grandness of vision that made those works as ambitious as they were compelling. Yet this is nonetheless unmistakably McCullough: a story of timeless importance, told with uncommon empathy and fluency.

title: Kate Atkinsons A God in Ruins
description: In recent years, a number of talented novelists have experienced a sudden and alarming loss of faith in their chosen literary form. David Shields thinks most novels are boring and disconnected from reality. Nicole Krauss is sick of plot and characters and scenes and climax and resolution. Rachel Cusk has decided that conventional fiction is fake and embarrassing. Karl Ove Knausgaard goes even further, dismissing the entire enterprise: Fictional writing has no value.

title: Fructose May Increase Cravings for High-Calorie Foods
description: The type of sugar you eat may affect your cravings for high-calorie foods, researchers report.

title: As We Age, Keys to Remembering Where the Keys Are
description: I recently told my 70s-something walking group that I wanted to write about retrieval disorder, our shared problem with remembering names and dates, what we had just read and where, even what we had for dinner last night. Or, in my case, the subject of the column I wrote the day before.

title: 1863: Custers First Stand
description: This feature looks at some of the earliest mentions of famous names or terms in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Send a suggestion in the comments section.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: New York Today: One, Two, Tree
description: Good morning on this summery Monday.

title: Internet Customers Surpass Cable Subscribers at Comcast
description: The Internet is taking over television.

title: Obama Finds a Bolder Voice on Race Issues
description: As he reflected on the festering wounds deepened by race and grievance that have been on painful display in Americas cities lately, President Obama on Monday found himself thinking about a young man he had just met named Malachi.

title: Chinese Leader and Head of Taiwans Kuomintang Discuss Economy and Disaster Response
description: The head of Taiwans governing party told President Xi Jinping of China during a meeting in Beijing on Monday that he hoped the two sides could forge greater cooperation on issues of regional interest, including economic integration and disaster response.

title: Review: Beyond Sacred: Voices of Muslim Identity, Young New Yorkers Tell Their Stories
description: Ferdous Dehqans earliest memory is drenched with fear. He is 4 years old in Kabul, Afghanistan, clutching his mothers hand as they cross the street, approaching a Taliban station.

title: Carly Fiorina and Mike Huckabee Joining G.O.P. Race on Heels of Ben Carson
description: WASHINGTON  For the Republican Party, the presidential candidates keep coming.

title: The Conference Manifesto
description: We are weary of academic conferences.

title: Is Testing Students the Answer to America's Education Woes?
The Fox Who Came to Dinner
description: I dont like anyone to go hungry. So when a red fox showed up at my door almost three years ago, it was no surprise that he ended up as my dinner guest.

title: ScienceTake | Inside Out Embryo
description: Seeing how growth unfolds, and folds, in a simple organism.

title: With Sickest Patients, Cost Sharing Comes at a Price
description: The growth in health care spending is slowing down, and one reason might be that cost sharing is rising.

title: Birth? Trivial Next to Cellular Doughnut-Making Process
description: If modern science is right, the great mystery of embryonic development is less about how life unfolds, and more about how it folds.

title: How Whitman Remembered Lincoln
description: The train that brought Abraham Lincolns body back to Springfield, Ill., took almost two weeks to complete its journey, making a long, northeasterly loop through Maryland, Pennsylvania, New York, Ohio and Indiana. The last stretch, from Chicago to Springfield, was completed on the morning of May 3, 1865.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | May 4, 2015
description: Updated: May 5, 2015

title: Britains Leap Into the Unknown
description: LONDON  The impetus of existing plans is always stronger than the impulse to change. So wrote Barbara W. Tuchman in her great 1962 account of World War I, The Guns of August  a book admired by President John F. Kennedy and much quoted by politicians since. In the final days of Britains general election campaign, Mrs. Tuchmans warning about the perils of fighting new battles according to old rules is as resonant as ever.

title: Today in Politics: Republicans to Increase Their Boots on the Trail
description: Good Monday morning from Washington. Congressional maneuvers continue over Iran, and Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey is still gauging how the George Washington Bridge indictments will affect his presidential hopes. But for those already on the campaign trail, or about to join the race, it will be a busy day.

title: Morning Agenda: Britains Conservatives Get Hedge Funds Vote
description: BRITAINS CONSERVATIVES GET HEDGE FUNDS VOTE | The British elections are on Thursday, and members of one constituency, the financiers, have already made their preference extremely clear, Danny Hakim writes in DealBook. Britains Conservative-led government has been a staunch supporter of hedge funds and banks, battling at home and in the European Union on their behalf, and some hedge fund managers have written eye-popping checks to the party. More than $2.3 million came from Michael Hintze, an Australian billionaire who lives in London, where he founded the hedge fund CQS; Michael Farmer, another hedge fund manager, has donated roughly $2.2 million over the same reporting period; and Stanley Fink, who once ran the Man Group and has been party treasurer, has donated $1.3 million since the 2010 election.

title: Syrian Forces Kill Attackers in Damascus
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Security forces battled insurgents in a heavily guarded area of Damascus on Monday, killing two attackers as one blew himself up, local news media reported, in a clash that was unusually intense for the center of the capital even after more than four years of war in Syria.

title: Carly Fiorina Announces 2016 Presidential Bid, Citing Years Leading Hewlett-Packard
description: Carly Fiorina became the second woman and the first former chief executive to enter the 2016 presidential campaign when she announced on Monday that her private-sector background and conservative credentials made her best positioned to capture the Republican nomination and take on Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: Carly Fiorina on the Issues
description: Carly Fiorina, the former chief executive of Hewlett-Packard, announced her candidacy Monday for the Republican presidential nomination, saying her experience running a major multinational corporation shaped her views on everything from foreign affairs to the economy. Here is a look at where she stands on some of the major issues of the 2016 campaign.

title: What Carly Fiorina Would Need to Do to Win
description: Carly Fiorina is entering the race for the Republican nomination for president. Here is a look at what she will need to do if she hopes to win.

title: Silicon Valley Recap: Im Not a Woman Engineer
description: Season 2, Episode 4: The Lady

title: Nepal Asks Foreign Rescuers to Leave as Hopes Fade
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  The government of Nepal is asking foreign search-and-rescue teams to leave now that the likelihood of finding survivors buried by last months earthquake has largely passed, and a top Nepalese tourism official said Monday that no more climbers were likely to ascend Mount Everest this season.

title: Review: Eric Clapton, at Madison Square Garden, Travels a Familiar Road
description: For his encore at Madison Square Garden on Sunday night, Eric Clapton reconvened all four of the guitarists he had brought on as guests in the show for a climactic tear through High Time We Went, the Joe Cocker song. Their solos ran down the line, brief but full of distinguishing traits: shapely but biting for Doyle Bramhall II; ecstatic but measured for John Mayer; flinty and raw for Jimmie Vaughan; fluid and singing for Derek Trucks.

title: Soldier Becomes Unlikely Face of Ethiopian-Israeli Discontent
description: JERUSALEM  A slender and boyish-looking Israeli soldier, wearing a skullcap and an army shirt with sleeves too long for him, has become the unlikely and unwitting face of an outburst of anger and violent protests that have shaken Israel.

title: Filipino Bomb Maker, Sought by U.S., Is Said to Die in Fight With Rebels
description: MANILA  Abdul Basit Usman, a Filipino bomb-making expert wanted by the United States, was killed in a gun battle with rebels, the Philippine military said on Monday.

title: Burpee Nights
description: In the City That Never Sleeps, circuit training has overthrown circuit parties as the preferred path to endorphin-fueled transcendence. The 19th-century cathedral that once housed the notorious N.Y.C. nightclub the Limelight is now home to a David Barton Gym, complete with a turntable overlooking the nave. The success of SoulCycle  owed in part to its dark rooms and pounding music  has spawned offshoots, like NoHos Mile High Run Club, a cheekily named studio devoted to cardio. And Equinox gyms around the country mark their namesake biannually with a party designed to jumpstart your high-performance lifestyle, while the location in Brooklyn Heights recently hosted a Deep House Yoga night with shots of pressed lemon, cayenne and turmeric.

title: Will the Met Gala Make Fashion Love Yahoo?
description: When Anna Wintour takes her place in the reception line Monday night at the Met Gala, a.k.a. the Metropolitan Museum of Arts Costume Institute benefit (arent you glad you dont have to read that again?), next to her will be not just the usual celebrity co-host (Jennifer Lawrence this time) and the exhibition-relevant big names (the subject is China, so the actress Gong Li and the producer Wendi Murdoch are on the invitation as well), but a blond woman whose credentials are more Silicon Valley than Parisian atelier: Marissa Mayer, the chief executive of Yahoo.

title: Verbatim: Bill Clinton on Paid Speeches
description: Former President Bill Clinton, in an interview with NBC News, on why he will continue to give paid speeches even though his wife is running for president. Mr. Clinton also defended his familys charitable foundation, saying There is no doubt in my mind that we have never done anything knowingly inappropriate in terms of taking money to influence any kind of American government policy.

title: John Chambers Steps Aside at Cisco as Generational Shift Arrives
description: Technologys older generation of rebels has now almost completely disrupted itself.

title: Israeli Foreign Minister Says He Wont Join Netanyahus New Government
description: JERUSALEM  Avigdor Lieberman, Israels foreign minister, stunned the political establishment Monday by announcing he would not join the next government, leaving Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu with two fraught options: a conservative coalition whose razor-thin majority would be inherently unstable, or a unity government riven over how to deal with the states critical challenges.

title: PartnerRe Rejects $6.4 Billion Offer from Agnellis Exor
description: Exor, the investment firm controlled by the Agnelli family, had its $6.4 billion offer for the reinsurance group PartnerRe rejected on Monday.

title: Parties Coming to More Agreement (Just Not on Who Deserves Credit)
description: WASHINGTON  As the House and Senate head into a challenging few weeks after some early legislative successes, the fight over who deserves credit for getting Congress back to work is almost as intense as the policy and political struggles being waged on the floor.

title: New York Senate Leader and Son Are Arrested on Corruption Charges
description: ALBANY  Dean G. Skelos, the leader of the New York State Senate, and his son were arrested on Monday by federal authorities on extortion, fraud and bribe solicitation charges, expanding the corruption investigation that has cast a renewed spotlight on Albanys intractable corruption problem.

title: Gang Life in Baltimore
description: Nathaniel Batty III is a member of the Black Guerilla Family. At 25, he has been in jail every year since he was 11 years old. He is finding a new sense of purpose after the death of Freddie Gray.

title: Israeli President on Violent Protests
description: President Reuven Rivlin of Israel said on Monday that protests like those by Ethiopian-Israelis were an essential tool in democracy, but violence is neither the way nor the solution.

title: Gunman in Texas Shooting Was F.B.I. Suspect in Jihad Inquiry
description: GARLAND, Tex.  One was an extrovert drawn to basketball as well as to Islam, who had been identified by the F.B.I. as a jihadist terrorism suspect and was once a regular at Friday Prayer at a mosque near his Phoenix apartment. The other was more quiet, ran a carpet cleaning business in Phoenix and often prayed at the same mosque, sometimes accompanied by his young son.

title: 1915: War Credits Are Sought
description: Prefacing his exposition of the new Budget, Mr. Lloyd George, in the House of Commons today [May 4], declared that, while if the war is prolonged it may be the duty of the House to consider the need for further contributions from the community, at present no fresh taxation was proposed. Continuing, Mr. Lloyd George said that if the war lasted for a year, the following credits would be necessary: 600,000,000 for the army, 146,000,000 for the navy and 200,000,000 for the Allies and the Dominions.  The New York Herald, European edition, May 5, 1915

title: Mediamacro Crosses the Atlantic
description: Simon Wren-Lewis has been on a lonely crusade against mediamacro, a narrative about the British economy that is untrue  or at the very least easily challenged and at odds with textbook economics  yet is stated in the news media not as a hypothesis but as a fact.

title: Step Inside Star Wars
description: Next month at a still-undisclosed location in London, Secret Cinema, the uniquely immersive production company known for its film-inspired happenings, will recreate scenes from the original Star Wars, perhaps the desert landscape of Tatooine or the dark corridors of the Death Star, as a lead-in to regular screenings of The Empire Strikes Back. The eight-year-old British firm took on Back to the Future last summer in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, where a tricked-out DeLorean and actors dressed in 1950s costumes brought the town of Hill Valley to roaring life for a crowd of roughly 80,000 over 22 shows. Theres no telling how the company plans to tackle the largely inhospitable worlds made famous by Luke and Leia, but thats all part of the fun.

title: M.T.A. Chairman Asks New York City for More Money
description: The chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority called on Monday for New York City to substantially increase its funding for the agencys $32 billion capital plan.

title: McDonalds Chief Promises Turnaround in a Restructuring
description: Faced with slumping sales in its biggest markets, McDonalds on Monday announced the first steps of a global turnaround strategy, acknowledging that a business that has served up billions of burgers on the cheap was in urgent need of change.

title: Unsatisfied? Look Beyond Mayweather and Pacquiao
description: The fight of the century is over, but it may not turn out to be the fight of the year.

title: Bernie Sanderss Brother Faces British Voters
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont promised to fight for the middle class, to challenge Hillary Rodham Clinton, and to push back against the influence of the Koch brothers in announcing his long-shot bid for president last week.

title: With Monsoon Nigh, Tent Shortage After Nepal Earthquake Prompts a D.I.Y. Response
description: By now, youve probably read about the  bureaucratic tangles that have been delaying the arrival and distribution of tents, food and other international relief supplies following the April 25 7.8-magnitude earthquake that has shattered or damagedseveral hundred thousand homesand other structures in Nepal.

title: 1965: FBI Informer Testifies
description: HAYNEVILLE, Ala.  An undercover FBI plant in the Ku Klux Klan described today [May 4] a careening 100-mph pursuit that ended with the slaying of a white freedom marcher, Mrs. Viola Liuzzo. Testifying at the first-degree murder trial of Klansman Collie Leroy Wilkins, 21, the FBI informer, Fary Thomas Rowe Jr., told a jury: Wilkins put a gun out the window at elbow length as we got even with the front window of the other car, the lady driving the auto looked at us and Wilkins fired two or three shots. Moments later as the Klan car sped on down the highway leaving Mrs. Liuzzo dead at the wheel of her vehicle. Mr. Rowe said that Wilkins declared: Baby brother, I dont miss.  New York Herald Tribune, European edition, May 5, 1965

title: Daily Report: Dave Goldberg Was Lifelong Womens Advocate
description: Even as a high school student, Dave Goldberg was urging female classmates to speak up. As a young dot-com executive, he had one girlfriend after another, but fell hard for a driven friend named Sheryl Sandberg, pining after her for years, Jodi Kantor reports. After they wed, Mr. Goldberg pushed her to negotiate hard for high compensation and arranged his schedule so that he could be home with their children when she was traveling for work.

title: Surviving an Earthquake and an Avalanche on Mount Everest
description: Roberto Schmidt had gone to Mount Everest to work on stories a year after Sherpa guides died in an avalanche. But then a massive earthquake hit, triggering an avalanche that buried the base camp.

title: For Nicole Ponseca, Filipino Recipes Call for Banana Leaves
description: The banana leaf was chalky and stiff from the freezer, in need of revival. Nicole Ponseca laid it across the stove and swept it gently over the flames. To unlock the oils, she said.

title: Harlem Nights/U Street Lights Samples Two Jazz Sources

Harlem Nights/U Street Lights promises something a little closer to ground level. Jointly organized by the broad-minded jazz pianists (and Harlem residents) Jason Moran and Marc Cary, its a look at the connections between African-American musical communities in Harlem and in Washington a story that goes back even further than Duke Ellington, though hes sure to be a part of it.

The Workout with Rocco DiSpirito

description: Mike Maccagnan continued his revamping of the Jets scouting department on Monday, firing five college scouts and the teams longtime pro personnel director.

description: LONDON  In the week of an election that has failed to make hearts flutter, many in Britain rejoiced on Monday after Kensington Palace announced that Britains new princess would be named Charlotte Elizabeth Diana.

description: Former President Bill Clinton gave an impassioned defense of his familys charitable foundation while on a trip to Africa, saying it had never done anything knowingly inappropriate and that he would not stop giving paid speeches because he had to pay our bills.

description: In an online video on Monday, Carly Fiorina announced she was joining the Republican field in the 2016 race for president of the United States.

title: Ex-Goldman Sachs Programmers Twisting Case Has a Few Turns Left
description: The legal journey of Sergey Aleynikov, the former Goldman Sachs computer programmer, has been almost Kafkaesque. The latest  but certainly not last  step came in a verdict last week in New York State court that hit all three possible outcomes: guilty of one charge of unlawful use of secret scientific material based on computer code he took from Goldman, a hung jury on a nearly identical charge, and an acquittal for unlawful duplication of computer-related material.

title: Bus Crash in Central India Kills More Than 20
description: NEW DELHI  A crowded minibus skidded off a highway in central India and plunged down a gorge Monday afternoon, catching fire on the way, according to a district police official. More than 20 people were killed and at least 10 more were injured, some with severe burns.

title: As the Euro Slides, a Coin Meets Its Waterloo
description: BRUSSELS  Here at the Belgian Royal Mint, machines called giraffes spit out as many as 850 euros a minute.

title: Paranoia Strikes Derp
description: You may think that the big news story lately has been riots in Baltimore  or, if you have different priorities, either that boxing match or Kates baby. But in certain circles, the big thing has been the right-wing belief that operation Jade Helm 15, a military training exercise in Texas, is a cover for Obama to seize control of the state and force its citizens to accept universal health care at gunpoint.

title: Nepalis in New York Improvise a Relief Effort for Earthquake Victims
description: The day after the earthquake in Nepal, Lila Lamini, who lives in Woodside, Queens, gathered a dozen of her friends, all of them fellow domestic workers in New York and all from the same rural area of Nepal. The quake had destroyed their villages, blocked access to the region, and killed and injured residents.

title: The Chat: Ben Carsons Announcement, Instantly Analyzed
description: Ben Carson, a retired neurosurgeon who has developed a passionate Republican following as a critic of President Obama, returned to his hometown of Detroit on Monday morning to deliver a kickoff speech for his 2016 presidential candidate. Over instant messages during the speech, two correspondents for The New York Times analyzed Mr. Carsons remarks. Here, lightly edited, is their full chat.

title: E.P.A. Carbon Emissions Plan Could Save Thousands of Lives, Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON  New carbon emissions standards that were proposed last year for coal-fired power plants in the United States would substantially improve human health and prevent more than 3,000 premature deaths per year, according to a new study.

title: Police Rethink Long Tradition on Using Force
description: WASHINGTON  During a training course on defending against knife attacks, a young Salt Lake City police officer asked a question: How close can somebody get to me before Im justified in using deadly force?

title: Ben Carson Announces Presidential Bid
description: The retired neurosurgeon, in Detroit on Monday, discussed his decision to seek the 2016 Republican nomination for president.

title: Kurt Cobain Album to Arrive This Summer
description: Expect more Kurt Cobain this summer. Brett Morgen, the director of the recent documentary Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck, is culling archival recordings and plans to issue an album of unreleased material.

title: In Arizona, an Aquarium Blooms
description: In Scottsdale, Ariz., the Phoenix suburb that describes itself as The Wests Most Western Town, a new attraction is in the works. But its not what you might expect for a city known for its cactus-meets-cowboy chic.

title: Fantasy Football: Winners and Losers in the N.F.L. Draft
description: After three days, seven rounds and 256 picks, it is time to sit back and reflect on the madness of the N.F.L. draft. As we discussed in our preview of the draft, how a player fits into his teams scheme is truly the deciding factor in fantasy value, and now we know the matches of teams, depth charts and opportunities.

title: Tell Us What You Think
description: Thanks for using The Timess app on the Apple Watch. Please tell us what you like about it, and what you want to see.

title: How the Experts Brew Tea
description: Tea can be prepared in several styles, ranging from the formal Japanese tea ceremony to the Chinese method of steeping in a gaiwan vessel and pouring into small cups. Matcha is typically served in bowls, and in a tea ceremony, the server follows a prescribed order, carefully measuring the powdered tea into a heated bowl, whipping it with a bamboo whisk, wiping the lip of the bowl with a cloth and offering the bowl to a guest. For regular green tea leaves, the Japanese often use a kyusu, a one-handled teapot with a built-in strainer.

title: Tea Culture Blossoms in New York
description: For decades, to be a tea lover in the United States was to wander in a wasteland. Even as Americans discovered fine coffee, with specialty coffee shops springing up across the country and debates over the merits of pour-over and cold brew, tea remained a largely pedestrian choice among mass-produced brands.

title: How Do You Know Whether to Have Another Child?
description: Every so often, we invite readers to help answer a question that has come up via the comments or email  an ethical quandary, a dilemma of modern manners, or just a decision thats tough to make.

title: For Carly Fiorina, White House Run Poses Financial Test

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week

title: A New Documentary Sheds Light on the Troublemakers of Land Art
description: Isolation may be the essence of land art, as the director and art historian James Crump says, but if the soaring views of earthworks  straddling canyons; riddled with lightning  in his new documentary are any indication, the genres second nature is wonder. Premiering exclusively on T, the trailer for the film Troublemakers reveals an intersecting group of artists in the late 60s and early 70s, united equally by their communion with the elements and their anti-authoritarian attitudes. Often shirtless and shot in grainy black-and-white footage, some of which has never before been shown, the literal groundbreakers profiled  such as Michael Heizer, Walter de Maria and Robert Smithson  do little to undercut their mythologies as difficult or headstrong or rebellious, Crump says. But troublemaking can also mean instigation or stirring up the waters, and it implies critique, he adds, noting that land art emerged at the same time Americans were confronting images of bombed-out landscapes from the Vietnam War and of the cratered surface of the moon. There was an urgency to make the work, Crump says  even if the artworks, like the open vistas that animated them, defied collecting as an investable asset class.

description: Q. Did dinosaurs peel or shed their skins?

title: Brian Moore, New York Police Officer Shot in the Head, Dies

Some of the actual contenders (like Jeb Bush) are hanging around on the sidelines acting as though theyre still thinking about running, while sucking up as much cash as possible from the dark money trough.

The drugmaker is suing its former lawyers at Kirkland & Ellis over advising Teva Pharmaceutical on its $40 billion hostile bid to buy the company. The lawyers say Mylan consented, but a court may finally rule such waivers unethical. An even better outcome would be if the case emboldens clients to stop signing them.

title: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev Weeps as Relatives Try to Spare Him
