description: Should Apple Watch, the latest smartwatch to hit the streets, be as much a part of your travels as your passport and toothbrush?

title: Mike Huckabee on the Issues
description: Mike Huckabee, a former Republican governor of Arkansas and preacher who has announced his run for the presidency on Tuesday, has been outspoken on a range of matters, particularly foreign policy and social issues like same-sex marriage. Here are his stances on important issues.

title: Returning the Spoils of World War II, Taken by Americans
description: As the Allies stormed through Germany in 1945, museum officials in Dessau scurried to hide their art treasures in a nearby salt mine, where they would soon be discovered by American soldiers.

title: At the Met Gala, Cher and Marc Jacobs Make a Dream Duo
description: Squeezed into an elevator at the Four Seasons with a sampling of her entourage, Cher was entertaining a moment of doubt.

title: 1940: The Danger of Independence
description: NEW YORK  While the United States Commissioner to the Philippines conferred in Tokio with Foreign Minister Hachiro Arita, hoping for an improvement in strained Japanese-American relations, the New York Herald Tribune today [May 5] forecast that the Philippines independence in 1946 might be a dangerous thing. Commenting on the State Departments refusal to intervene in the Philippine Assemblys decision to restrict immigration, which was aimed at Japan, the editorial declared that the influx of Japanese immigrants has continued into the Philippines for years, and that their tradesmen have penetrated into the most remote villages to replace the customary Chinese merchant.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, May 6, 1940

title: 1965: Santo Domingo Fight Flares
description: SANTO DOMINGO  The Organization of American States peace mission today [May 5] announced that opposing factions in the Dominican Republic had formally agreed on a cease-fire. But only hours after the agreement was signed, sharp gunfire broke out again in various parts of this capital city. Official military sources said four Americans were wounded and there were unverified reports that at least four U.S. soldiers were captured by the rebels.  New York Herald Tribune, European edition, May 6, 1965

title: What Mike Huckabee Would Need to Do to Win
description: Mike Huckabee, the former governor of Arkansas, has entered the race for the Republican nomination for president on Tuesday. Here is a look at what he will need to do to win.

title: Hotel Review: Vault Karakoy in Istanbul
description: Doubles start at 169 euros in low season ($180 at $1.07 to the euro), 239 euros in high.

title: Two Premises on Poverty and Culture
description: The last time I followedcertain of my colleagues into an argument about poverty, economics and culture, it took several thousand words to find my way back out. This time Im going totry a briefer intervention, stressing again that I think conversations about policing are a more productive response to whats happened in Baltimore than leaping up a level to the persistent right-left argument about the welfare state. But since that debate is happening no matter what, it might be helpful to describe a framework in which I think these arguments should take place, because quite often the two sides cant even decide on where the argument should start. So here, for your consideration, are two premises aboutthe last fifty years of American history.

title: Readers Turn: Why Location Is Important
description: Each Tuesday, The Upshots newsletter will feature a selection of comments from an article that resonated with our readers in the past week.

title: Review: Chamber Music Society Performs Ligetis Trio
description: Every student who aspires to a career in classical music should be able to do what the pianist Jeremy Denk did on Sunday afternoon at Alice Tully Hall. Im not just talking about playing beautifully, as he did in works by Beethoven and Ligeti for a program with the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center.

title: Nicola Sturgeon, Not Running in British Election, May Yet Prevail
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland  Nicola Sturgeon was late getting to her burgundy helicopter. It had taken her 45 minutes to traverse the 50 yards between the medieval church and the high street  and not just because of her perilous-looking designer heels.

title: Restaurant Report: Kazerne in the Netherlands
description: On paper, the plan for Kazerne must have sounded pie-in-the-sky: renovate a beat-up, cavernous building in the center of Eindhoven, a southern Dutch city in the midst of a reawakening. Transform it into a restaurant-slash-showcase for design and technology. Throw in meeting spaces, a design shop and lodging.

title: Astros Start the Season Revamped and on Top
description: With more than a month gone in the baseball season, there is an unexpected team at the top of the standings: the Houston Astros, long a major league doormat. A 2-1 loss to the Texas Rangers on Monday night ended a 10-game winning streak, but Houston still has the best record in the American League, 18-8 heading into Tuesdays games.

title: The Most On-Theme Red Carpet Looks at Last Nights Met Gala
description: Guests of last nights Met Gala, reliably the most exciting red carpet each year, were asked to dress in line with the Costume Institutes China: Through the Looking Glass exhibition. As usual, a small crop of models and actresses showed up in classic black anyway (shout-out to the Olsen twins and Miley Cyrus, chic as ever)  but we celebrate the guests who did the beauty of the Far East justice. Here are the standouts.

title: Details of HP Lawsuit Against Autonomy ExecutivesEmerge
description: LONDON  New details emerged on Tuesday in Hewlett-Packards $5.1 billion lawsuit against two former top executives at Autonomy, the British data intelligence company that HP acquired in 2011 for $11 billion.

title: Burundi Court Backs Presidents Bid for Third Term
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Burundis constitutional court on Tuesday approved President Pierre Nkurunzizas bid for a third term, brushing aside more than a week of deadly protests and the refusal of the courts deputy president to sign its ruling. The dissenting justice has fled to neighboring Rwanda.

title: Lawmakers in France Move to Vastly Expand Surveillance
description: PARIS  At a moment when American lawmakers are reconsidering the broad surveillance powers assumed by the government after Sept. 11, the lower house of the French Parliament took a long stride in the opposite direction Tuesday, overwhelmingly approving a bill that could give the authorities their most intrusive domestic spying abilities ever, with almost no judicial oversight.

title: Whats the Best Book Thats Been Made Into a Great Movie?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Alice Gregory and Charles McGrath discuss the best literature thats succeeded on the big screen.

title: Mediterranean Shipwreck Kills 40 Before a Rescue
description: ROME  A rubber boat crowded with migrants deflated and foundered in the Mediterranean, and as many as 40 people apparently drowned before an approaching merchant ship could reach them, witnesses told the humanitarian group Save the Children on Tuesday.

title: Sierra Leones Hidden Ebola Outbreak
description: Sheri Fink, a New York Times reporter, recounts her discovery that Sierra Leones outbreak started much earlier than the official story suggests. An exclusive video by the PBS series Frontline.

title: Tracing the Ebola Outbreak, Scientists Hunt a Silent Epidemic
description: Scientists are using blood samples collected throughout the Ebola outbreak to map the viruss spread from country to country by tracking tiny mutations in its gene sequences.

title: Walkabout: Resistance to Airplane Cockpit Cameras
description: Watchful Eye After the recent presumed suicide crash of a Germanwings flight, a movement is underway to have video cameras installed in cockpits  but pilot unions are against the idea. (The Wall Street Journal)

title: Verbatim: Huckabee Formally Enters 2016 Race
description: Former Gov. Mike Huckabee of Arkansas, telling an audience of supporters in Hope, Ark., that he is running for president.

title: Cloudy Skies
description: Inspired by The Observers Book of Weather by Reginald M. Lester, published by Frederick Warne & Co. Ltd, 1962.Part of a series of paintings from books, by Leanne Shapton for T Magazine.

title: Migrants Rescued From Dinghy at Sea
description: A video showing migrants in an overcrowded rubber dinghy in the Mediterranean scrambling to reach a line lowered to them from a vessel on Sunday.

title: Review: All Dancing! All Singing! Irving Berlin in Hollywood, a Lighter-Than-Air Revue
description: Who remembers The Piccolino, an Irving Berlin novelty from the 1935 movie musical Top Hat? This giddy production number, a playful attempt to initiate a dance craze like the Continental and the Carioca, rhymes the title with casino, bambino, vino and scallopino.

title: Mu Ramen
description: The ramen shop finds a new home in Long Island City, Queens, following a nine-month absence.

title: Restaurant Review: Mu Ramen in Long Island City, Queens
description: Before telling you how impressed I am by the new Mu Ramen in Long Island City, Queens, I want to clear up my role in the demise of the first Mu Ramen.

title: Goncourt First Novel Prize Is Awarded to Kamel Daoud of Algeria
description: PARIS  TheAcadmie Goncourton Tuesday awarded the Algerian novelist Kamel Daoud its 2015 prize for best first novel, for The Meursault Investigation. The book is a retelling of Albert Camuss 1942 classic The Stranger from the perspective of the brother of the Arab man killed by that novels protagonist, Meursault.

title: Behind the Dateline: Kathmandu Becomes Times Style
description: Philip B. Corbett is the associate masthead editor for standards and oversees The Timess style manual.

title: Democrats Plan Six Presidential Debates, Starting This Fall
description: The Democratic National Committee said Tuesday that it would sanction six debates in the current presidential nominating fight, holding at least one in each of four early-nominating states: Iowa, New Hampshire, South Carolina and Nevada.

title: Sophisticated Crepes to Sweeten Mothers Day
description: In the early days of my career, I had a catering service in Austin, Tex., called Breakfast in Bed. It was my first claim to fame. With 24 hours notice, I would deliver omelets and crepes to homes all over Austin.

title: Google Pushes Advertisers to Smaller Screens
description: Google has spent the last few years tweaking its search engine for mobile screens. Now it is trying to get advertisers to join in.

title: How to Live It Up in Austin, the Simon Miller Way
description: Last week, the bicoastally produced brand Simon Miller  developed between its New York showroom and its Los Angeles denim studio, using textiles from Japan landed smack in the middle of the continental U.S., down South, on a business trip of sorts. To kick off our trip to Austin, we hosted our Indigo Market at By George, our favorite shop in Austin, says Daniel Corrigan, the labels co-creative director. For this, we created a world of indigo including vintage Japanese artifacts, indigo textiles and garments, Simon Miller lifestyle product, such as indigo hemp blankets and Kahoko x Simon Miller indigo rugs, along with an assortment of Simon Miller Spring 15 product. But the trip wasnt all work, as anyone who has ever attended South by Southwest or spent a weekend on Sixth Street would guess. Corrigan and Jake Sargent, the other creative director at Simon Miller, loved the music scene and bar culture in Austin, he says. Its like nowhere else, always something going on. In the above slide show, the duo share snapshots of their adventures in Texass capital, where they sipped margaritas, shopped for vintage treasures and cacti, went for a swim (or two) and just couldnt get enough brunch.

title: Young African Migrants Caught in Trafficking Machine
description: ZAWIYAH, Libya  The no-money-down offer was too tempting for the children to resist.

title: Northern Ireland Unionists Hope for Power Gain in British Election
description: CARRICKFERGUS, Northern Ireland  Ambling around this seaside town on a sunny afternoon, Sammy Wilson greeted smiling constituents like long-lost friends ahead of this weeks British general election.

title: In Misbehaving, an Economics Professor Isnt Afraid to Attack His Own
description: The economist Richard H. Thaler has written a sly and somewhat subversive history of his profession.

title: John Kerry Makes Unannounced Visit to Somalia
description: Secretary of State John Kerry made a brief but symbolically significant stopover in Somalia on Tuesday, becoming the highest-ranking American official to visit the war-ravaged country since a disastrous foray by American forces more than 20 years ago.

title: Daniel Clowess The Complete Eightball Comes Out Next Month
description: When Daniel Clowes started his comics series Eightball in 1989, it was miles away from the superhero fare that then dominated comics (and still does). With an acrid storytelling voice and a clean, spare drawing style, Mr. Clowes used Eightball  which usually contained four or five unrelated short stories per issue  to skewer pop culture, spin surrealistic horrors and sympathetically portray youth adrift.

title: Jury in Etan Patz TrialAgain Says It Is Deadlocked
description: The jury in the Etan Patz murder trial ended its 15th day of deliberations on Tuesday without reaching a verdict, after sending a note to the judge earlier in the day saying it was deadlocked.

title: Air Ambulances Offer a Lifeline, and Then a Sky-High Bill
description: Clarence W. Kendall, a rancher in Pearce, Ariz., was moving bales on top of a haystack when he fell eight feet and struck his head on the corner of a truck below. His health insurance covered most of the cost of treating the head trauma caused by the accident.

title: Hero, a New Work in Florence, Pays Tribute to Michelangelos David
description: ROME  Until mid-September, visitors to the Accademia Gallery in Florence will be able to see two Carrara marble statues of David for the price of one.

title: New York to Adopt a Uniform Bar Exam Used in 15 Other States
description: New York State will begin using a standard bar examination given in 15 other states next summer, making it the largest state so far to adopt what amounts to a national credential for lawyers, the states chief judge, Jonathan Lippman, announced on Tuesday.

title: Review: Hold Still, Sally Manns Memoir, Reveals a Photographers Rich Life
description: There arent many important memoirs by American photographers. I wish especially that, along with Robert Frank and Diane Arbus, Walker Evans had left one behind. How good was Evanss prose? He once described James Agees sartorial style as knowingly comical inverted dandyism. He added: wind, rain, work and mockery were his tailors.

title: The Chat: Mike Huckabees Presidential Announcement, Instantly Analyzed
description: Former Gov. Mike Huckabee of Arkansas, perhaps best known as a Fox News talk show host until recently, on Tuesday became the latest Republican to announce he would run for president. Over instant messages during the speech, two correspondents for The New York Times analyzed Mr. Huckabees remarks. Here, lightly edited, is their full chat.

title: Perfectly Reasonable Question: Keeping Track of Congressional Votes
description: I thought Richard White of West Hartford, Conn., had a solid idea. He wrote to me this week, as follows:

title: Video Review: Slugging Through the Mud to Find the Best S.U.V.s
description: YEARS ago, my friend Roger asked me for advice about buying a sport utility vehicle. His two needs were being able to drive his pregnant wife to the hospital after a cataclysmic earthquake and intimidating other drivers. My suggestion? A psychotherapist.

title: Driven | A Mud Test For the Best S.U.V.
description: How do you choose the best S.U.V.? Test drive, test drive, test drive. And a little mud doesnt hurt.

title: A Mothers Cookbook Shares More Than Recipes
description: The last full sentence I heard from my mom was around Easter. You better call Michael, she said.

title: It Now Looks as if the Economy Shrank in the First Quarter
description: Last fall when the dollar was soaring on global currency markets, it seemed only a matter of time before it started to increase the United States trade deficit and dampen growth.

title: Isiah Thomas Is Back at Garden in Surprising Role: President of Liberty
description: The strange Madison Square Garden world of James L. Dolan and his complicated relationship with Isiah Thomas became a whole lot stranger Tuesday with the announcement that Thomas had been hired to run the W.N.B.A.s Liberty franchise as team president, one with an ownership stake.

title: New York Citys Libraries Need Money
description: New Yorks public libraries want about $1.5 billion from the city over the next 10 years so they can fix their buildings, which are old, crowded, falling apart or lacking in things they need to be useful in the 21st century, like electrical outlets. They also want more operating money, $378 million, up from about $320 million, to improve programs and services in the coming fiscal year and to stay open longer  a basic indicator of library-system vigor in which New York lags embarrassingly behind Chicago, Los Angeles, Dallas, Phoenix, Philadelphia, San Antonio and San Diego. And the citys suburbs. And Albany.

title: Scene City: After the Met Gala, the Partying is Nonstop
description: Michael Kors, Yahoo and Rihanna host various parties after the Met Gala.

title: Big Questions Hover Over HSBC
description: HSBCs revival is overshadowed by its existential angst.

title: Before the Met Gala, Mingling at the Mark
description: Fashion people and celebrities feel liberated here, said Izak Senbahar, the owner of the Mark hotel, as attendees of the annual Costume Institute Gala mingled in his lobby on Monday afternoon. They feel like they can be themselves.

title: Joseph Dunford, Joint Chiefs Nominee, Known to Maneuver Between Roles
description: WASHINGTON  Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr. took the same punishing combat fitness test the lowest-ranking Marine must pass, and dressed in his formal uniform in Afghanistan to meet with that nations president.

title: Your Evening Briefing for May 4, 2015
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Inside the Met Gala Cocktails
description: Anna Wintour, Jennifer Lawrence, Marissa Mayer, Gong Li and Wendi Murdoch receive guests at the Mets Costume Institute Gala.

title: Obama Announces Joint Chiefs Nominations
description: The president on Tuesday named Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr. and Gen. Paul J. Selva as his nominees for the new chairman and vice chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

title: Click Here for the Beach
description: In his book The Mysterious Opacity of Other Beings, the photographer Richard Misrach offers a unique beach experience. The birds-eye images of swimmers, sunbathers and expanses of beach and ocean were takenby Mr. Misrach on a digital camera from a hotel balcony in Honolulu.

title: Kerry Meets With Somali President
description: Secretary of State John Kerry met with President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud of Somalia during an unannounced visit to the country on Tuesday.

title: At Sohn Conference, Masters of Moves Recognize the Good Ones
description: William A. Ackman, the founder and chief executive of Pershing Square Capital Management, and Ian Bremmer, the president of the Eurasia Group, are used to commanding center stage and charming crowds. But on Monday afternoon at the annual Sohn Investment Conference, they stood transfixed just off the main stage at Avery Fisher Hall at Lincoln Center, watching something they had never seen before.

title: Jason Atherton Takes the Helm at the Clocktower
description: Headliner

title: Iran Arrests Prominent Rights Activist
description: TEHRAN  Iranian security forces arrested a prominent human rights activist, Narges Mohammadi, on Tuesday, the reformist Baharnews website reported. Ms. Mohammadi is one of the best-known activists remaining in Iran.

title: Mike Huckabee Announces Presidential Run
description: Mr. Huckabee, a former governor of Arkansas, announced his candidacy for the Republican presidential nomination on Tuesday.

title: French Army Is Buying Fleet of Ford Pickup Trucks
description: PARIS  In what might be construed as a blow to Gallic pride, the French Army will soon be patrolling La Belle France, the land of Renaults and Peugeots, in Ford Ranger pickups.

title: 80-Hour Work Week? This is How She (or He) Does It
description: Call it faking, or call it flexibility by omission, but sometimes the answer to the question how does she do everything is she doesnt. Or at least, not exactly the way you think she does.

title: At This New York Hotel, Theyll Remember Mama
description: There may be no better portrayal of the complicated bond between mother and child than the classic cult film Mommie Dearest, which starred Faye Dunaway as Joan Crawford and Diana Scarwid as her adopted daughter, Christina.

title: News From the Republican Campaign
description: If youre waiting for a Republican to give a good reason for running for president other than a desire to run against Hillary Clinton (or really against Bill Clintons memory), Mike Huckabees candidacy announcement today will disappoint.

title: What You Get for  $550,000
description: This weeks properties include a contemporary in New Yorks Catskills, an adobe house in New Mexico and a townhouse in Virginia.

title: A Feistier Mike Huckabee Than in 2008
description: It has been more than eight years since former Gov. Mike Huckabee of Arkansas announced his first presidential bid, making his plans known in an interview with Tim Russert on NBCs Meet the Press. While he did not reveal any big policy shifts in announcing his second bid in Arkansas on Tuesday, the differences, including a festive rally and feistier rhetoric, reflect a changed world and a more experienced candidate.

title: Astronomers Measure Distance to Farthest Galaxy Yet
description: Leapfrogging backward in time to when the universe was apparently feeling its oats, a group of astronomers reported Tuesday that they had measured a bona fide distance to one of the farthest and thus earliest galaxies known.

title: A Five-Bedroom Townhouse in Dublin
description: Recently restored and retaining period details, the house, in the Ballsbridge neighborhood, is on the market for $2.76 million.

title: Lady Gagas Stylist Shares the Making of Her Custom Balenciaga Met Gala Look
description: Brandon Maxwell recounts every detail of the making of her showstopping ensemble, complete with personal, behind-the-scenes images before last nights red carpet.

title: A Mothers Day Gift That Benefits More Women Than Just Mom
description: A package on Moms doorstep from EuGenia Shea, a company launched two months ago by the former Wall Street analyst Naa-Sakle Akuete, is a thoughtful Mothers Day gift for reasons both practical and symbolic. Yes, pure shea butter is among the best all-natural moisturizers  a luxurious present for a woman whos surely earned a little pampering. (Plus, it works wonders on stretch marks, though you didnt hear it from me.) But EuGenias backstory makes the gift all the more sweetly fitting. Akuete founded the company with, and named it after, her own mother, who is herself an entrepreneur: She runs the company that supplies EuGenia with its shea nuts. Its a girl-power operation all the way down: EuGenia works with all-female cooperatives in northern Ghana, providing above-average wages and job training to the workers who harvest the nuts  many of whom are mothers themselves.

title: Havana at Night
description: To wander through the dimly lit streets of Old Havana after dark is to enter a world of shadows, silhouettes and half lit faces.

title: Worker at Manhattan Construction Site Falls Down Elevator Shaft and Dies
description: A worker at a construction site for a luxury hotel in Midtown Manhattan fell down an elevator shaft on Tuesday, plunging hundreds of feet to his death, the police said.

title: International Star Will Miss Triple Crown Races With Injury
description: International Star, who was scratched the morning of the Kentucky Derby with the hope that he might compete in the Preakness or the Belmont Stakes, will instead be sidelined until at least the fall with a chip in his left front ankle that will require surgery.

title: Benjamin F. Logan, Engineer by Day and Bluegrass Fiddler by Night, Dies at 87
description: On weekdays, Benjamin F. Logan worked as a mathematician and electrical engineer at AT&T Bell Laboratories in New Jersey. On nights and weekends, he donned a 10-gallon hat and took to the stage as a pre-eminent bluegrass fiddler.

title: Pictures of the Day: Nepal and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Nepal, Burundi, Australia and Ukraine.

title: De La Souls Kickstarter Campaign Raises $600,874
description: Twenty superfans of De La Soul, the old-school hip-hop trio, recently paid $300 each for a schmoozy Skype video chat with the group. Another spent $1,500 on a vintage boom box from one members personal collection. But this wasnt a charity auction. Instead, these perks  and many more  were offered in exchange for financial support as the act raised money to make its eighth studio album.

title: Pictures of the Day  May 5, 2015
description: Photos from Nepal, Burundi, Australia and Ukraine.

title: Stan Smith, Accidental Sneaker Icon
description: In the 1960s, when Stan Smith was a tennis star at the University of Southern California, players wore canvas shoes. Americans preferred Converse, Smith recalls, and Australians favored the Dunlop Green Flash, with its zigzag sole promising sure-footedness on grass. In 1971, when Smith was the No. 1 player in the world, Adidas approached him about endorsing a fleeter alternative: the first leather tennis shoe, which had first been marketed seven years earlier and was originally named for the French pro Robert Haillet. They struck a deal that landed a sketch of Smiths face on the models tongue.

title: Even the Stars at the Met Gala Get Star-Struck
description: Imagine, for a moment, that you were at Monday nights Met Gala, and Larry David was your date. It wouldnt have taken long to feel that you had traveled back in time and ended up in an episode of Seinfeld.

title: Dave Goldberg Mourned by Charmed Leaders of Tech and Poker Buddies
description: STANFORD, Calif.  For a few hours on Tuesday, Silicon Valley stopped rushing headlong into the future.

title: Review: The Realization of Emily Linder Is a Comedic Drama About Approaching Death
description: The Realization of Emily Linder features a measure of wit and a moderately intriguing plot, but cringes and crying mark the best moments of the show.

title: Berenice Abbott, Writing Her Own History
description: The expanded archives of the pioneering photographer Berenice Abbott detail not just the range of her eye, but also the obstacles she confronted and overcame.

title: Juventus Serves Notice That It Belongs in Mix for the Title
description: TURIN, Italy  Massimiliano Allegri does not have Carlo Ancelottis three Champions League titles or his seemingly limitless payroll or his squad of stars like Cristiano Ronaldo and Gareth Bale and Toni Kroos.

title: Review: The Floatones, Making Song and Sense of Life and Nonsense
description: Very nearly unclassifiable and utterly delightful, The Floatones, Jim Neus fantastical, irrational Zen koan of a musical, returns to La MaMa about 20 years after its premiere there. Four characters, named for the actors who portray them, stand on a bare stage chanting mottos and jingles and riddles that make no sense except when they do.

title: Living in Flatbush, Brooklyn
description: The sprawling neighborhood is economically and socially diverse, and offers a wide variety of housing stock.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Germany, Too, Is Accused of Spying on Friends
description: BERLIN  About 18 months ago, Chancellor Angela Merkel was the wronged American ally whose cellphone number was among data sucked up by American intelligence as it kept watch on Europeans.

title: What the Debate on Inequality Is Missing
description: The United States economy is one of the most effective on earth in terms of generating new wealth. But for all the wealth it generates, it does an exceptionally dismal job at sharing it broadly among Americans.

title: The Nepal Earthquakes Lingering Impact
description: Ten days after the quake survivors were trying to reclaim whatever possessions they could salvage from the rubble, and mourning victims just now found.

title: Treadmill May Be Riskiest Machine, but Injuries From It Still Rare
description: WASHINGTON  The death of David Goldberg on a treadmill while on vacation in Mexico was tragic, untimely and a shock to those who knew him.

title: Labor Games Is a Brilliantly Absurd TV Game Show
description: This would have been an interesting moment in television game-show evolution even without the show that is having its premiere Wednesday night on TLC. But that debut elevates it to near historic status. Labor Games may be simultaneously the most brilliant and the most head-shaking game-show idea ever.

title: Galactic Hot Dogs Hopes Readers on Funbrain Will Buy at Bookstores
description: Max Brallier didnt have very realistic career goals as a child.

title: Review: I Am Big Bird Tells Caroll Spinneys Story
description: The worlds most famous giant bird has a human performer inside it, and it turns out that this nearly anonymous fellow has interesting stories to tell. Theres the one about the puppeteer who was almost part of a space-travel disaster. Theres the one about the guy who wanted to quit the job he was born to do practically before he had started it.

title: The Apple Watch: More Than Just a Bracelet
description: The musings, observations and procrastinations of Ts critic at large Jody Rosen.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: The Met Gala and Its After-Parties, as Captured on Instagram
description: The Met Gala and its after-parties were rife with Instagram material this year. Celebrities mingled with fashion designers and scenesters at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and at various New York City hot spots. Hair came down, selfies were taken and poses were struck. Handy cameras were there to capture it all.

title: Senate Passes Cost-Cutting Budget Plan
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate gave final approval Tuesday to the first joint congressional budget plan in six years, ratifying a 10-year blueprint that would cut spending by $5.3 trillion, overhaul programs for the poor, repeal President Obamas health care law and ostensibly produce a balanced budget in less than a decade.

title: Americans Views on the 2016 Presidential Campaign and the Issues
description: See what Americans think about Hillary Rodham Clinton, the Republican candidates and issues like the health care law and same-sex marriage.

title: How the New York Times/CBS News Poll Was Conducted
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted April 30 to May 3 with 1,027 adults throughout the United States. Of these, 868 said they were registered to vote.

title: A New York Times/CBS News Poll on the 2016 Presidential Campaign and the Issues
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton is now viewed more favorably and as a stronger leader than she was earlier in the year despite weeks of scrutiny about her ethics, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.

title: Hillary Clintons Appeal Survives Scrutiny, Poll Says
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton appears to have initially weathered a barrage of news about her use of a private email account when she was secretary of state and the practices of her familys foundation, an indication that she is starting her second presidential bid with an unusual durability among Democratic voters.

title: Sprinkling a Little Celebrity Stardust on Silicon Valley
description: Snoop Dogg is raising a venture capital fund to invest in the marijuana industry.

title: Snapping the Windows Screen
description: Q. How do you take a screenshot on a Windows 8.1 tablet if you dont have a real keyboard with a PrtScrn key?

title: Struggling With Migration in Britain
description: Migration into Britain from Eastern Europe has become one of the most contentious issues of the 2015 election.

title: Detective Accused in Assault Expected Mayhem in Bikers Tour, Colleague Testifies
description: An undercover New York police detective accused of taking part in a motorcycle gangs assault on a driver on the West Side Highway told his handler in the Police Department the day before the attack that he was joining a citywide motorcycle tour that he expected would cause mayhem, the handler testified at a hearing on Tuesday.

title: Recent Commercial Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: The Lessons Google Ventures Learned From Secret
description: For many in Silicon Valley, the rapid rise and precipitous fall of Secret, the prominent start-up that recently closed its doors, will most likely serve as a cautionary tale of how not to run a company.

title: Charlie Hebdo Editor Seeks to Distance Newspaper From Anti-Islam Causes
description: The top editor at Charlie Hebdo, the satirical Paris newspaper that was attacked four months ago by militant gunmen over its cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad, sought on Tuesday to reject attempts by right-wing activists to exploit that attack for their own agendas.

title: A Conversation With Gary E. Handel
description: Mr. Handel, 60, is the founding partner and president of Handel Architects, a design firm perhaps best known for its work on the National September 11 Memorial, where the World Trade Center twin towers once stood. The company, which Mr. Handel founded in 1994, is involved in dozens of big projects around the world, including the Greenpoint Landing development in Brooklyn.

title: Lynch Visits Baltimore in First Official Trip as Attorney General
description: In her first official trip as attorney general, Loretta E. Lynch went to Baltimore on Tuesday, offering similar words of praise and reassurance to factions that have often had very different views on recent clashes there.

title: Alexander Rich Dies at 90; Confirmed DNAs Double Helix
description: James Watson and Francis Crick worked out the spiral structure of DNA in 1953, but they were not proved right until Dr. Alexander Rich used X-rays to produce a distinct image of the famous double helix in 1973. After he saw it, Dr. Watson phoned Dr. Rich to thank him; it was the first good nights sleep Dr. Watson had enjoyed in 20 years.

title: Jeeps, Repaired in Recall, Catch Fire, Prompting New Inquiry
description: Auto safety regulators are investigating a recall last year of some 895,000 Jeep and Dodge S.U.V.s with sun visors that can short-circuit and ignite after some of them apparently caught fire even after being repaired.

title: Bankers and Regulators Voice Fears on Bond Market Volatility
description: Wall Street chieftains, huge investment firms and top bank regulators are all sounding the same alarm.

title: F.E.C. Data Shows Campaign Fines Hit Record Low in 2014
description: WASHINGTON  Penalties levied by the Federal Election Commission for campaign finance violations have plummeted to record lows even as political spending has soared, according to newly released data from the agency.

title: Ellen Albertini Dow, Actress, Dies at 101; Rapping Granny in Wedding Singer
description: Ellen Albertini Dow, who found acting success in her 70s and portrayed feisty grandmothers in the hit film comedies Wedding Crashers and The Wedding Singer, stealing the show in that one when she rapped onstage, died on Monday in Los Angeles. She was 101.

title: Dollars Rise Lifts Imports and Widens Trade Gap
description: A roof-raising trade gap in March highlighted concerns that the rise of the dollar against other currencies was weakening the economy, chipping away at the ability of American manufacturers to compete abroad while encouraging more imports to fill retailers shelves.

title: U.S. Licenses Ferry Service to Operate Cuba Route
description: MEXICO CITY  Ferries carrying Cuban and American passengers could soon be sailing between Miami and Havana for the first time in more than 50 years, after the Treasury Department on Tuesday issued licenses to at least two companies as part of a thaw between the Cold War foes.

title: Dean Skelos, New York Senate Leader, Stands Firm Despite Calls to Resign
description: ALBANY  If State Senator Dean G. Skelos was trying to keep his mind off his legal troubles, Tuesday was probably the wrong day to do it here.

title: Transgender Resources
description: The Trevor Project

title: Palestinians Unpaid Electric Bills in the West Bank Thicken Tension With Israel
description: TULKARM REFUGEE CAMP, West Bank  Like many Palestinians in this forlorn jumble of concrete buildings, Fakhriya Zeidan labored to recall when she last paid her power bill: maybe in 2001?

title: Now, Spotlight Turns to AT&T-DirecTV Deal
description: Just three months after Comcast announced its $45 billion takeover of Time Warner Cable last year, its rival AT&T announced a $48 billion takeover of DirecTV.

title: Patachou, French Singer With a Habit of Snipping Neckties, Dies at 96
description: Patachou, a Parisian chanteuse who built a reputation on an offbeat name, a penchant for guillotining mens ties and the fact that she does not look, act or croon like dith Piaf, as The New York Times put it in 1958, died on Thursday at her home in Neuilly-sur-Seine, outside Paris. She was 96.

title: An Actor Takes His Portrayal of La Guardia Far Beyond Broadway
description: The actor who would become Mayor Fiorello H. La Guardia in a few hours sat in his living room, the windows framing a sparkling spring landscape of the Central Park Reservoir and the Upper East Side. The fat suit that would help transform the actor, Tony Lo Bianco, into New Yorks 99th mayor had been folded into a large suitcase nearby.

title: Grass-Roots Push in the Plains to Block the Keystone Pipelines Path
description: ROSEBUD INDIAN RESERVATION, S.D.  In early 2010, the South Dakota government gave its blessing to a Canadian company seeking to move crude oil in a pipeline beneath the American heartland. Opposition had been minimal.

title: Review: John Raymond, Uncovering the Possibilities of the Familiar
description: The emblematic gesture on Foreign Territory, an impressive new album by the trumpeter John Raymond, could be summed up by a track called Deeper. Its an original composition based on familiar chord changes  for a songbook standard, How Deep Is the Ocean? So, its the sort of thing that jazz musicians have been doing more or less since the beginning. Which means the difference is in the details.

title: A Gun From Georgia Is Linked to a New York Officers Death, Again
description: Early one October morning in 2011, two masked men with gloved hands smashed their way into a roadside pawnshop in rural Georgia, fleeing with 23 handguns.

title: A National Discussion About Policing, and a Reminder in New York of Its Dangers
description: Perched at Guetteline Vasmes bedroom window on Saturday evening, two of her grandsons peered out at the commotion of anxious, rushing police officers on their street in Queens Village. Ms. Vasme has lived on 214th Street since 1977, staying there through retirement from Verizon and her own four children going and coming.

title: High in the Himalayas, a Search After the Nepal Quake Yields Grim Results
description: BARPAK, Nepal  In this village high above a picturesque valley that lies at the epicenter of the earthquake that flattened much of the country, residents are still finding bodies.

title: Sleepless Nights as a Struggling Tiger Woods Recalls His Father
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla.  The cheese on the burgers served in the clubhouse was sharper than Tiger Woodss game Tuesday. Playing TPC Sawgrass for the first time since winning the Players Championship two years ago, Woods found two fairways and three water hazards in nine practice holes.

title: James Dolan Gives an Executive Another Shot, Deserved or Not
description: James L. Dolan, owner of the New York Knicks, a semiprofessional basketball team, has decided to get into the business of raising reputations from the ashes.

title: Al Jazeera America, Its Newsroom in Turmoil, Is Now the News
description: Nearly two years ago, Ehab Al Shihabi, the chief executive of Al Jazeera America, took the stage at the Aspen Ideas Festival and proposed something grand: An American cable news station that would be thoughtful, probing and smart.

title: Donovan, Staten Island Prosecutor, Wins Congressional Seat Grimm Held
description: The Staten Island district attorney, Daniel M. Donovan Jr., whose office investigated the chokehold death of Eric Garner in a struggle with the police last year, easily won a special election for the House of Representatives on Tuesday, according to unofficial results.

title: Police Struggle With Loss of Privileged Position
description: WASHINGTON  Early this year, Megan E. Green, a St. Louis alderwoman, met with officials of a local police union to discuss a proposal for a civilian oversight board that would look into accusations of police misconduct. After Ms. Green refused to soften her support for the proposal, the union backed an aggressive mailing campaign against her.

title: Tom Cottons Procedural Move Interrupts Smooth Sailing for Iran Bill
description: WASHINGTON  It was, for a moment anyway, the Senate in its platonic ideal. Bipartisan legislation to give Congress a voice in any nuclear agreement with Iran soared, over White House objections, through the Foreign Relations Committee and onto the Senate floor, a rare glide path to successful compromise.

title: Saudi Arabia: Yemeni Rebels Attack
description: Rebels in Yemen struck a border town in Saudi Arabia with mortar and rocket fireon Tuesday, damaging buildings and leading the national airline to cancel flights to the area. The attack on the town of Najran near the Saudi southern border was the first direct assault on an inhabited area in the kingdom since Saudi Arabia and its Arab allies began bombing the rebels, known as Houthis, in Yemen in March.

title: Noted Quartet
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Hands up if Joe Krozel and Will Shortz fooled you with this one, at least at first glance.

title: Review: ToasT Where Words Are a Cellblocks Weapon of Choice
description: Watch out for the boys in Cellblock D. They may appear less threatening than some of the other Attica prison inmates in the tumultuous year of 1971. But these guys are packing poetry. Try messing with one of them, and before you can say Jean Genet, hell have pulled a loaded metaphor on you.

title: A Path to Citizenship, Hillary Clinton Says, Is at Its Heart a Family Issue
description: LAS VEGAS  For months, Latino activists frustrated by President Obamas inability to overhaul the immigration system have pressed Hillary Rodham Clinton about what she would do differently.

title: Rare Inning of Offense Holds Up for Mets Against Orioles
description: It had been 21 innings since any Mets player had experienced the rubbery sensation of home plate under his feet. But once they finally scored, in the fourth inning Tuesday night, it seemed to alleviate the angst that clung to the ball club like globs of pine tar throughout the weekend.

title: Iran: Rights Advocate Is Arrested
description: Iranian security forces arrested a prominent human rights activist, Narges Mohammadi, on Tuesday, the reformist Baharnews website reported. Ms. Mohammadi is one of the best-known activists remaining in Iran. For more than a decade, she has worked with the Defenders of Human Rights Center, founded by the Nobel Peace Prize laureate Shirin Ebadi. This week, Ms. Mohammadi, who has been sentenced to prison terms before for her work, was scheduled to appear in court in connection with a new case filed against her. A request for a delay in that case was denied, leaving her lawyer no time to study the charges against her, Baharnews reported.

title: U.S. Offers Millions in Rewards for Information on ISIS Leaders
description: The State Department announced multimillion-dollar rewards on Tuesday for information leading to the whereabouts of four Islamic State leaders. The departments Rewards for Justice program is offering up to $7 million for information on Abd al-Rahman Mustafa al-Qaduli, up to $5 million each for Abu Mohammed al-Adnani and Tarkhan Tayumurazovich Batirashvili, and up to $3 million for Tariq Bin-al-Tahar Bin al Falih al-Awni al-Harzi. According to the department, Mr. Qaduli is a senior Islamic State official who originally joined the Qaeda affiliate in Iraq, Mr. Adnani is an official Islamic State spokesman, Mr. Batirashvili is a battlefield commander in northern Syria, and Mr. Harzi is the groups leader for the region along the Syria-Turkey border. A $10 million reward had already been offered for the groups top leader, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

title: New Mexico: Deal Is Reached to Reopen Nuclear Waste Plant
description: The United States Department of Energy agreed on Tuesday to spend $73 million to improve the transportation and handling of nuclear waste stored in Carlsbad, where a leak exposed 17 employees to radiation in February 2014. The Waste Isolation Pilot Plant, overseen by the Energy Department, has been closed since then. The agreement, forged with the New Mexico Energy Department, allows the plant to reopen. It also includes improvements to roads and infrastructure in and around Los Alamos National Laboratory, where a drum of plutonium waste erupted last year in an underground dump. The agreement relieves the federal agency from facing $54 million in civil penalties levied against it by the State of New Mexico.

title: Review: Let Us Now Praise Susan Sontag, by Sibyl Kempson
description: In the giddily frantic semi-solo show Crime or Emergency and the untranslatable Halloween chiller Ich, Krbisgeist, the playwright, performer and director Sibyl Kempson distinguished herself as one of the most distinctive and delirious writers working downtown. So you had to be excited when Ms. Kempson, a graduate of Mac Wellmans M.F.A. program at Brooklyn College and an associate of the celebrated experimentalist group Elevator Repair Service, announced that she was creating a company of her own, 7 Daughters of Eve Thtr. & Perf. Co.

title: Chirlane McCray Promises Millions of Dollars for Mental Health and Social Service Programs
description: The speaker stood behind the lectern, a cadre of aides and commissioners in tow, shifting gamely to Spanish toward the end of her prepared remarks.

title: Working Families Candidate Diana Richardson Wins Brooklyn Assembly Post
description: The candidate for the small, progressive Working Families Party decisively won a four-way special election for New York State Assembly in Brooklyn on Tuesday night, a strong showing for the labor-backed group.

title: Rangers Scoring Machine Needs Recharging
description: WASHINGTON  The most remarkable thing happened to the Rangers on Tuesday at Verizon Center. Rick Nash stationed himself at the top of the crease, fought off a check and, with a deft flick of his stick, redirected a point shot into the net.

title: Fresh Bat Awaits, but Yankees Have All They Need Against Blue Jays
description: TORONTO  Gregorio Petit and Jose Pirela, each carrying a bat in his hand, were engaged in friendly conversation late Tuesday afternoon as they walked from the batting cages back to the clubhouse here.

title: Sister of Marine Veteran Imprisoned in Iran Asks Red Cross to Visit Him
description: The sister of Amir Hekmati, the Marine veteran from Michigan who has been imprisoned in Iran more than three and a half years, asked the International Committee of the Red Cross on Tuesday to visit him in Evin Prison in Tehran, one day after she said that Mr. Hekmati had resumed a suspended hunger strike out of despair over the apparent paralysis in his appeal.

title: What Happens When You Give Linda Rodin Some Crayons
description: In this new series for T, notables from the worlds of fashion, art, design and entertainment illustrate their responses to a brief questionnaire, revealing their favorite things, darkest secrets  and how they see themselves and the world around them.

title: The Beatrice Inn Shares a Recipe From Its Secret, Off-Menu Tribute to In-N-Out Burger
description: The Beatrice Inn  Graydon Carters West Village follow-up to the Waverly Inn  is many things: a downtown power spot; a celebrity rookery (Demi Moore, Karlie Kloss, Kristen Wiig and Michael Keaton have all been spotted there recently); a place to get a decent martini. Its about as far as one can get from burger joint, and yet, this May, in honor of National Hamburger Month, chef Angie Mar is creating a secret burger menu, offering a dry-aged lamb burger ($38), a black truffle burger with duck egg ($52) and a smoky Animal Style burger ($28), in honor of In-N-Out (the L.A. fast-food chain that famously keeps its Animal Style option off-menu, and whose burgers are served as a late-night snack at Mr. Carters annual Oscar bash).

title: Ponchos With Panache
description: A wanderers wardrobe for the urban adventurer.

title: A New Skincare Line Aims to Cut Through the Clutter
description: You could say that Kal Vepuri, an entrepreneur and e-commerce investor, and Lauren Hoffman, a former Kiehls product developer, have a typical boy-meets-girl story, but with a tech twist. In their case, an introduction by a mutual friend led to a business match made in heaven, and their new baby is Onomie, a direct-to-customer beauty brand launching online tomorrow. The name is a variation on the classic spelling of the suffix -onomy, which means body of knowledge. As Vepuri explains, Were about intelligent women and intelligent beauty.

title: IBM and Facebook in Marketing Partnership
description: Personalized marketing  the product pitch or message that really hits its target, the right person at the right time  is the much-discussed ideal in advertising and sales.

description: decoy  \de-koi, di-\  noun and verb

title: After Protests, Charlie Hebdo Members Receive Standing Ovation at PEN Gala
description: Two members of Charlie Hebdo, the French satirical magazine, took the stage to a thundering standing ovation at PEN American Centers literary gala on Tuesday night, capping a 10-day debate over free speech, blasphemy and Islamophobia that started in the cozy heart of the New York literary world and spread to social media and op-ed pages worldwide.

title: International Star Is Sidelined Until Fall
description: International Star, who was scratched the morning of the Kentucky Derby with the hope that he might compete in the Preakness or the Belmont Stakes, will instead be sidelined until at least the fall with a chip in his left front ankle that will require surgery.

title: Van Gogh Painting Is Star During Sothebys Auction
description: On Nov. 1, 1888, Vincent van Gogh set up his easel in an ancient Roman necropolis in Arles, France, and painted an avenue of stone sarcophagi lined by towering poplars aflame with the colors of autumn.

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 9 P.M. (Pivot) GARDENERS OF EDEN Kristin Davis (Sex and the City) travels to the David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust in Kenya, where conservationists are battling the poaching of elephants for the illegal ivory trade while rescuing orphaned offspring that are eventually returned to the wild. (Above, an orphan visiting a Trust keeper, Benjamin Kyalo.) She also examines the elephants role in maintaining the habitats that support it and other species.

title: Leftist Partys Win in Alberta May Affect Future of Oil Sands
description: OTTAWA  With an economy dominated by the oil industry and a conservative, free-market political tradition, Alberta has long been cast as the Texas of Canada. But on Tuesday, not only did the provinces voters put the Progressive Conservative Party out of power after 43 years, they elected a government from the far left of Canadas mainstream political spectrum.

title: Berenice Abbott, Writing Her Own History
description: Laid out on the counter were portraits of the famous and the nameless, unpretentious wedding pictures, grandiose industrial architectural details, midcentury American scenes and close-ups of a brain, a wrench and a creepy-crawler. Next to them, a few yellowed notes. One, signed by the French writer Jean Cocteau, declared: She exposes her delicious memory. She is a chess game between light and shadow.

title: How to Solve the E.R. Problem
description: BACK in 2009, a big selling point of health care reform was the idea that expanding insurance coverage would increase Americans access to preventive and primary care and decrease the unnecessary use of emergency rooms, saving billions. President Obama said it this way: One of the areas where we can potentially see some saving is a lot of those patients are being seen in the emergency room anyway, and if we are increasing prevention, if we are increasing wellness programs, were reducing the amount of emergency room care.

title: Catholicism Undervalues Women
description: Like a Pringles vendor sounding an alarm about obesity, Pope Francis fashioned himself a feminist last week.

title: Germany, the Green Superpower
description: BERLIN  A week at the American Academy in Berlin leaves me with two contradictory feelings: one is that Germany today deserves a Nobel Peace Prize, and the other is that Germany tomorrow will have to overcome its deeply ingrained post-World War II pacifism and become a more serious, activist global power. And I say both as a compliment.

title: Open Up, Europe! Let Migrants In
description: LONDON  THOUSANDS of people drown trying to reach Europe  an estimated 1,250 did so in April alone. By denying desperate people the opportunity to cross borders legally, European governments are driving them to risk death.

title: Curbing Abusive Patent Lawsuits
description: Congress is once again trying to reform patent law to reduce the number of frivolous lawsuits that have made a mockery of the protections the government grants to inventors. This time lawmakers seem much closer to legislation that could become law.

title: An Opening for Afghan Peace Talks
description: The talks between representatives of the Afghan government and the Taliban in Qatar over the weekend were a breakthrough of sorts. It has long been apparent, including to American generals who have spent more than a decade leading the fight in Afghanistan, that political reconciliation presents the only possibility of a solution to the conflict. While the two days of meetings produced modest progress and a productive tone, they were just a new and tentative start of what is likely to be a long and risky process.

title: Women Who Choose Engineering
Socit Gnrale and Crdit Agricole Results Beat Market Expectations
description: PARIS  Socit Gnrale and Crdit Agricole, two of Frances largest banks, on Wednesday reported stronger first-quarter results as the European economy picked up steam and the European Central Bank began a program of aggressive stimulus.

title: Scene of Iraqi Massacre Becomes Shiite Pilgrimage Site
description: TIKRIT, Iraq  The concrete platform at the rivers edge is festooned with flowers and streaked with blood. Along a back wall are photographs taken from a video of the horror that unfolded here last year: a procession of Shiite men, shot in the head one by one by Islamic State fighters and shoved into the waters of the Tigris.

description: If you listen to party leaders, you might think that the nation is hopelessly divided on abortion. Recently, for example, three presidential candidates  Mike Huckabee, Rand Paul and Hillary Rodham Clinton  addressed the issue in very different ways.

description: Mike Huckabee drew roaring cheers from supporters on Tuesday as the latest entrant in a sprawling field of Republican presidential candidates by declaring himself the guardian of so-called entitlement programs, warning, Let them end their own congressional pensions, not your Social Security!

description: SAN FRANCISCO  There are two ways for start-ups to take on Amazon, the reigning monarch of American online shopping.

title: Big Names in New York Real Estate Figure Into Skelos and Silver Cases
description: Dean G. Skelos, the Republican majority leader in the State Senate, was a featured guest at a Sept. 19, 2012, luncheon of the Real Estate Board of New York at the organizations Art Deco office tower in Midtown Manhattan.

description: Last weekends Travel section was devoted to family travel, with ideas from driving the California coast to spending 36 hours in Key West to exploring Atlanta.

title: Speak Now, by Kenji Yoshino
description: At weddings these days, its rare to hear the warning Speak now or forever hold your peace directed at anyone who can show just cause why the couple shouldnt be married. When Kenji Yoshino and his husband were married in 2009, however, they asked the judge who officiated to include the line in the ceremony. It was a reminder, Yoshino says in his new book, that many Americans feel they have just cause to object to any marriage between two people of the same sex.

title: An Unexpected Death Rattles the Fitness Community
description: The recent death of the tech executive Dave Goldberg, reportedly during a treadmill workout on a vacation, has saddened and rattled the fitness community. The death of Mr. Goldberg, the chief executive of SurveyMonkey and husband of Sheryl Sandberg of Facebook, has left many people wondering if the exercise itself might have triggered a serious health event. Was it a heart attack? Another health problem? An unfortunate accident?

title: Afghan Judge Sentences 4 to Death Over Mob Killing
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Four men were sentenced to death by an Afghan judge on Wednesday for the mob killing of a woman who had been falsely accused of burning a Quran. But the judge released many of the 49 defendants in the case and delayed verdicts for 19 police officers who were also charged.

title: Bird Flu: Our Plague Reporter Weighs In
description: Every time I write about an epidemic  Ebola in 2014, swine flu in 2009, H5N1 avian flu in 2004-6, SARS in 2003  I have to gauge whether Im adding to the panic, calming the panic, or maybe underplaying something that calls for a little panic, meaning a more vigorous effort to stamp it out.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

description: LONDON  European officials on Wednesday opened an antitrust investigation into whether large technology companies were impeding competition in online shopping, the latest in a string of inquiries in Europe focused on the webs biggest players.

title: Germanwings Co-Pilot Is Said to Have Rehearsed Steps for Crash
description: PARIS  Andreas Lubitz, the co-pilot suspected of deliberately flying a German airliner into the French Alps, appears to have rehearsed preparations for the planes fatal dive during an earlier flight on the day of the crash, the French authorities said in a preliminary report published on Wednesday.

title: The Civil War Veterans of London
description: In 1915, 50 years after Appomattox, the London Branch of Civil War Veterans counted 115 members. The list can be found in Harvards Houghton Library, and it provides the names, addresses, ages and length and general location of the service of all its members. One man, listed only as E. Munro, was reported as being 105 years old. Presumably, there were many other veterans who made their way to Britain after the war, who had either died by 1915 or had never bothered to join the branch.

title: Lets Make Food Issues Real
description: There is some talk about the food movements winning. Im not even sure such a thing as a food movement exists.

description: In the fall of 1969, Merle Haggard topped the Billboard country charts for four weeks with Okie from Muskogee, the song that quickly became the anthem of red America, even before we called it that.

title: Today in Politics: Clinton Has Weathered Early Storms, Poll Suggests
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where the Senate has passed a budget, and is thinking about giving some help to the United States bourbon industry. Hillary Rodham Clinton heads to California to raise some cash and might be breathing a little easier since controversies have seemed to gain little traction with voters.

title: Should Britain Change the Way It Elects Its Leaders?
Tragedy in the Mediterranean: Learning About Europes Immigration Crisis
description: Thousands of people are fleeing the Middle East and Northern Africa for the shores of Europe this spring because of unrest in their home countries, and many arent surviving the trip.

title: A Sauce Worth Mastering
description: Here is the magic flavor of spring in my Brooklyn kitchen: barnaise sauce, a golden velvet of butter and egg yolk enlivened by the faint aromas of anise and pine. It tastes like the first sunny day after months of chill. We nap asparagus with it, blanket burgers and steaks and salmon in it, use it as a dip for fried or oven-roasted potatoes. The sauces richness improves virtually everything it touches.

title: Wickr Adds a New Chief Executive and a Nonprofit
description: Wickr, the free messaging app, is scheduled to announce on Wednesday that it is splitting into two businesses.

description: The End of the Tour, about a Rolling Stone writers encounter with David Foster Wallace, and Queen of Earth, the second pairing of indie filmmaker Alex Ross Perry and star Elisabeth Moss, are among the highlights of the seventh annual BAMcinemaFest, organizers announced Wednesday.

title: What Should I Do About a Nanny Who Drinks?
description: The ethicists answer reader questions about a questionable child-care provider and bending a parks leash laws.

title: What Should I Do About a Nanny Who Drinks?
description: Last April, I hired a woman to take care of my then-8-month-old daughter. The references she gave me all spoke highly of her, though only one family seemed to know her well. Fast-forward three months. I come home one evening, and the nanny is not yet back with my daughter. When she arrives, half an hour late, she is visibly intoxicated and reeks of alcohol. I immediately fire her after getting a verbal admission that she was drinking. I later found out that the nanny was previously fired by another family for being drunk on the job. The nanny lives with her 10-year-old son in my neighborhood, where many people use a local email list to seek out nannies. I know that she responds to these email ads, and I have just found out that she currently has another job with a family, but I dont know who the family is or how to contact them. My husband does not want me to post anything on our local email list, for fear of retribution. I am losing sleep that this woman is still taking care of children, and I am also worried about her sons safety. What can I do that does not put my family at risk but does not make me feel complicit? NAME WITHHELD

title: What Do Baseball Players Want Parents to Do During the Game? Nothing
description: Mike Matheny is a father, and particularly, a sports dad. He is also the manager of the St. Louis Cardinals. As a player, he spent 13 years catching in the big leagues. When he coached his sons baseball team, he wrote a letter to parents, called  the Matheny Manifesto, about how he hoped they would support their children during the season.

description: NEW DELHI  The Bollywood actor Salman Khan was found guilty on Wednesday in the death of a homeless man in a long-running hit-and-run case and sentenced to five years in prison.

description: If you missed the chance to watch some of comedys greatest performers in their prime  whether because of scheduling conflicts, scarce tickets or the fact that you werent born yet  a new attraction in upstate New York wants to give you another chance to see them, at least in hologram form.

description: Affirm, a San Francisco-based consumer lending start-up, is adding $275 million in debt and equity to accelerate its growth plans.

description: Hot on the heels of its successful introduction of London Collections: Men, the mens wear week whose success has become the envy of all other fashion weeks and spurred the Council of Fashion Designers of America to introduce its own mens week, the British Fashion Council has announced yet another formalized presentation period: London Pre-Collections.

title: House Hunting in ... Ireland
description: A FIVE-BEDROOM TOWNHOUSE IN DUBLIN

title: The Ghost in the Machine
description: The month after my grandmother died, I received several emails from her. Not from her, of course, but from an old AOL email account of hers that had been taken over by spammers. My mother and other family members called to ask me  the granddaughter who studies computer security  to make the emails stop. We were all strangely unsettled by these messages from beyond the grave, by my grandmothers sudden appearance in our inboxes so soon after wed lost her. More than just spam, this felt like a ghost in the machine.

title: Daily Report: Silicon Valley Remembers Dave Goldberg
description: For a few hours on Tuesday, Silicon Valley stopped rushing headlong into the future, Quentin Hardy reports.

title: At Home by the Sea
description: This little tale of a Vietnamese family begins in a simple way. In a fishing village by the sea there is a small house, the first double-page spread reads. To the left, a fisherman stands in his boat, looking up at the house, which sits high on a cliff. We cant see his face, but his posture and upturned glance suggest wistfulness. Around him other fishermen ply the waters in their own small boats. If you look closely, you can see a white-yellow dog making its way up the steep, winding path to the house. April Chus serene, intensely detailed artwork offers a lovely and fully realized scene, and invites us into an equally well-calibrated story by the Vietnamese-born Muon Van. Together, theyve made a picture book thats somehow both modest and captivating.

title: Gosha Rubchinskiy, From Russia With Love
description: A restless anxiety runs through the clothing of the 30-year-old designer, photographer and video artist Gosha Rubchinskiy, reflecting the complicated past and uncertain future of his native Russia. Raised on a diet of Michael Jackson videos and Arnold Schwarzenegger movies, Rubchinskiy says his early designs were costumes modeled after those worn by the flamboyant Freddie Mercury. Underground magazines later turned him on to the music and rave scenes of the generation born after the collapse of the Soviet Union; skateboarder culture in particular became an obsession and an inspiration. Rubchinskiy has since moved beyond streetwear  and into Dover Street Market  but his work still smacks of youthful irreverence: His latest collection included sweatshirts with the word sport printed in Cyrillic and Chinese, and pants, loose, acid-washed and cinched at the waist with shoelaces.

title: The Worst Ex-Chairman Ever
description: When Alan Greenspan left the Fed, he had nearly divine status in the eyes of the financial press and, Im sorry to say, quite a few economists. In retrospect, of course, his reputation has faltered badly; whether or not you blame Fed policy for the housing bubble (you shouldnt), Greenspan denied the bubbles existence and even its possibility as it was inflating, while actively blocking efforts to tighten financial regulation.

title: 1915: Premier Tells of Allies Landing
description: LONDON  In the House of Commons this evening [May 6], Mr. Asquith gave details of the landing of the Allied forces in the Dardanelles. The disembarkation, he said, commenced at daybreak on April 25, in face of great opposition from entrenched infantry and artillery, and by nightfall 29,000 men had landed. The British and Indian troops disembarked at Seddul Bahr. The Indians were held up during the whole day, but eventually succeeded by a fine attack in taking up their positions, enabling them to cover the landing of the remainder of the forces. The disembarkation of the Australians and New Zealanders at Gaba Tepe was opposed by heavy fire at point- blank range, but with a rush they carried the position and pushing forward the attack with the greatest dash. The French forces which landed at Hum Kalessi, on the Asiatic shore, advanced with great gallantry.  The New York Herald, European edition, May 7, 1915

title: E.C.B. Doubts Add to Uncertainties on Greek Debt Lifeline
description: FRANKFURT  As Greece mounts an 11th-hour diplomatic offensive across Europe to secure financial aid that it desperately needs to avoid a default, patience with Athens is wearing thin at the European Central Bank.

title: 1965: 2 U.S. Marines Killed
description: SANTO DOMINGO  Two U.S. Marines were killed today [May 6] and two others captured when their jeep convoy took a wrong turn into rebel territory and they were blasted with automatic- weapon fire. The Marine Corps said a third Marine may have been killed.  New York Herald Tribune, European edition, May 7, 1965

title: Co-Pilot Found to Have Rehearsed Dive
description: Rmi Jouty, the director of the French Bureau of Investigations and Analyses, discussed the findings of the preliminary report into the crash of the Germanwings Airbus A320.

title: East London Goes Bohemian-Chic, but Stays Quirky
description: The unpolished Hackney pocket of East London surrounding Chatsworth Road used to look derelict with shuttered shops among African hairdressers, kebab shops and fried chicken joints. But in recent years, its affordable housing prices have lured middle-class families. A host of young entrepreneurs with taste and vision has followed. The area now teems with bohemian cafes, organic grocery stores, boutiques and a bustling outdoor fruit and vegetable market on Sundays. However, Chatsworth Road is still very much a culturally diverse main artery of the neighborhood that retains its quirky allure. The street runs parallel to the River Lea, a picturesque setting of live-in barges  perfect for a summer stroll.

title: Millions Miss Out Because They Are Credit Invisible
description: About 26 million Americans lack a credit file, making it difficult for them to obtain traditional loans and credit cards, a new report finds.

description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel barely met the legal deadline to form a new government on Wednesday night and will start his fourth term with the slimmest of parliamentary majorities, made up of right-leaning and religious parties.

title: Life Among the Leopards
description: In the ancient hills of Jawai in northwest India, locals and big cats have peacefully coexisted for centuries like nowhere else in the world.

title: Listen: Regulating Drone Strikes
description: After President Obama apologized for the killing of two hostages in a January drone strike, a New York Times editorial called on the White House to provide a fuller accounting of what it knows about the number of civilians killed by the drone-based counterterrorism campaign. Andrew Rosenthal, the Timess editorial page editor, expands on that argument in the podcast below. Drones are just a weapon, he explains. The issue here is extraterritorial targeted assassination.

title: Port Authority Police Union Sues Over Searches of Officers Cellphones
description: An internal investigation by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey led to the dismissal in November of nine probationary police officers and the suspension of three others for their conduct at a graduation party at a bar in Hoboken, N.J.

description: The Aman Spa at the Connaught hotel in London, part of the Maybourne Hotel Group, is such a proponent of the benefits of meditation that it is opening its doors to the public for the first time with free 20-minute classes every weekday.

description: BALTIMORE  Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake called on Wednesday for the Justice Department to conduct a civil rights investigation of the citys Police Department to determine whether officers have engaged in unconstitutional patterns of abuse or discrimination.

description: Notes from the patients visit.

description: The patients lab results.

description: The patients test results.

title: Alexionto Buy Synageva BioPharma in $8.4 Billion Deal
description: Alexion Pharmaceuticals became one of the most valuable companies in the biotechnology industry on the strength of a single drug that treats two extremely rare diseases. Its secret: charging about $500,000 a year for the drug for each patient and scouring the planet for every potential patient. Now, the company hopes to repeat this process with a new drug.

description: An Afghan judge on Wednesday sentenced four men to death for the mob killing of Farkhunda, a 27-year-old woman who was beaten and set on fire after being falsely accused of burning a Quran in Kabul.

description: WASHINGTON  Janet Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, said Wednesday that stock prices were quite high, stronger language than she had used previously.

description: Lincoln Center will once again host its Out of Doors series of free music and dance performances, over three weeks this summer, starting its 45th season with the Muscle Shoals All Stars on July 22 and concluding on Aug. 9 with a show by Lyle Lovett and His Large Band.

description: The jury in the Etan Patz murder trial on Wednesday finished a 16th day of weighing evidence without reaching a verdict, making the panels deliberations one of the longest in the last three decades in New York City.

title: Shooting Clouds Life as Both Muslim and Texan
description: GARLAND, Tex.  When Muslim leaders in the Dallas area learned in February that a provocative blogger had rented space to exhibit caricatures of the Prophet Muhammad, they decided to ignore her.

title: Familiar Swing to Security Over Privacy After Attacks in France
description: PARIS  For two years after the revelations by Edward J. Snowden, Europe was awash in talk about American excesses in mass surveillance, objecting to how the National Security Agency swept up emails and phone conversations  even of political leaders like Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany  in an American electronic net that seemed to envelop the Continent.

title: A Look Inside the 2015 Venice Biennale
description: Much of the art world has descended upon Venice for the Biennale, which opens to the public this weekend.

title: Hunting for Hidden Treasure, and Summer Lessons With Brain Chase
description: When Christine and John Engler heard about a new online summer learning program called Brain Chase last spring, they decided it was worth a try. I always look for something academic for them to do in the summer, said Ms. Engler of her sons, Jack, 10, and Grayson, 8. Its usually a workbook or work sheets from the school, and a theres always a lot of nagging.

title: Classical Playlist: Beethoven, Haydn, Steve Reich and More
description: BEETHOVEN, HAYDN, MOZART: SongsMark Padmore, tenor; Kristian Bezuidenhout, fortepiano(Harmonia Mundi) Dont assume that the British tenor Mark Padmore is an opera lightweight from the ethereal sound and almost choirboy purity of his voice. In the right role, like Captain Vere in Brittens Billy Budd, he can sing with penetrating intensity. And hes a riveting actor. Still, his is an intimate tenor voice, ideally suited to the Evangelist in Bachs St. Matthew Passion, and, as this new recording again demonstrates, the lieder repertory. Joined by the vibrant fortepianist Kristian Bezuidenhout, Mr. Padmore sings songs by Haydn, Mozarts seldom-heard Masonic Cantata, and a diverse selection of Beethoven songs, including the composers only cycle, the great An die ferne Geliebte. This is eloquent lieder singing driven by astute and sensitive attention to the texts. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: My Man in Japan
description: For those bored with the one we have, there is a whole other Internet out there. And people ready to help you shop it.

Jeb Bush is doing better than he was before, but Republicans also like Marco Rubio and Mike Huckabee, who dont seem like they have much a chance of actually winning the nomination.

title: For Breech Births, C-Sections May Be the Safest Choice
description: For babies in the breech position, cesarean delivery may be a safer choice than vaginal birth.

title: SALT Conference Draws Hedge Fund Stars to Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS  At the Bellagios high-roller Villa Priv No. 6 Tuesday night, hedge fund celebrities including Leon Cooperman and John A. Paulson sipped Krug Champagne and exchanged conversation about the government, the economy and the health care system.

title: Ancient Copy of Ten Commandments Has First Showing in Israel
description: A 2,000-year-old copy of the Ten Commandments  the oldest known complete version  has gone on display for the first time in Israel. It is part of an exhibition at the Israel Museum in Jerusalem dedicated to pivotal objects in human history, from prehistory to the present.

title: Would Salesforce Make Sense for Microsoft?
description: Would Microsoft really want to own Salesforce.com?

title: Pressure Mounts on Merkel to Explain German Role in N.S.A. Espionage
description: BERLIN  Tensions between Germany and the United States over intelligence cooperation intensified on Wednesday, amid a domestic controversy swirling around Chancellor Angela Merkel and her allies over the scope and oversight of Germanys role in European spying.

title: New York Times Company Names Dorothea Herrey to Executive Post
description: The New York Times Company announced on Wednesday that it had named Dorothea Herrey the senior vice president of NYT Live, the companys conference and live events unit.

title: With Imports Banned, Russian Cheese Fills the Need for Brie
description: GOLOVKOVO-MARINO, Russia  The creamy goat cheese produced at Koza Nostra, a 12-acre farm in this village 75 miles north of Moscow, had largely been a labor of love. The farm had been losing more than $5,000 a month.

title: First Draft Focus: Elton John Has a Simple Message for Congress
description: Elton John, testifying before a Senate Appropriations subcommittee, on the need for global health programs.

title: Lydia Leonard Talks About Wolf Hall
description: At the end of every performance of Wolf Hall, the actress Lydia Leonard rushes downstairs to get her corset unlaced. If theres a knot, it takes 30 seconds longer, and it feels like an eternity, she said.

title: 36 Hours in San Luis Obispo, Calif.
description: Wine, California cuisine and the great outdoors await visitors to bucolic San Luis Obispo County.

title: 36 Hours in San Luis Obispo
