description: Updated to include a link to Justin Gilliss article on the skeptics/deniers question.

title: Jeb Bush Plans to Spend More Time in Iowa
description: Former Gov. Jeb Bush will have the chance to correct his polling problems in Iowa with a trip to the state next week.

title: Kerry Welcomes Yemen Cease-Fire Proposal
description: Secretary of State John Kerry said a five-day cease-fire with Saudi Arabia would be a humanitarian pause, allowing aid to millions of civilians in need.

title: Steven Boyer and Alex Sharp on Broadways Pain and Pleasure
description: Steven Boyer has a broken finger. Alex Sharp has a hairline fracture in his elbow. Their bodies are bruised; their voices strained. And every day, they come back for more.

title: Brian dArcy James, Ready for the Tony Awards and Everything Else
description: Three days after receiving a Tony nomination for his leading role in Something Rotten!, the proudly puerile Broadway musical set in Elizabethan times, Brian dArcy James was enjoying a bit of preshow sustenance at an upscale Manhattan restaurant.

title: Relax, Mom, Shell Find Her Way
description: Months ago, my teenage daughter made plans to attend a three-day music festival with her best friends, who are twins. Later, the twins submitted a picture of themselves to a festival contest and won a V.I.P. upgrade (special seating and backstage passes), leaving my daughter in the cold. She is now considering not going. I mentioned this to the twins mother, who suggested that my daughter find other friends to go with. But my daughter isnt comfortable with that. Dont the twins have an obligation to her?

title: 1965:  Liuzzo Trial Jury Deadlocked
description: HAYNEVILLE, Ala.  A young Ku Klux Klansmans murder trial in the slaying of a white woman civil rights demonstrator ended in a mistrial today with a jury deadlocked, 10-2, for conviction. The jury of white men was discharged when it reported its inability to reach a verdict at the end of a five-day trial. The hung jury left undecided the fate of 21-year old Collie Leroy Wilkins in the March 25 shooting of Mrs. Viola Liuzzo, 39, a Detroit mother of five. A state prosecutor said no decision will be made on whether to retry the defendant until the next court term, in September.  New York Herald Tribune, European edition, May 8, 1965

title: Long Lines of Mourners Pay Tribute to Officer Brian Moore
description: BETHPAGE, N.Y.  The word wake comes in part from the Old English wacian, which means to stay awake or keep watch. At the wake on Thursday for Officer Brian Moore, a steady stream of mourners kept watch over the body of a young man who had kept watch over New York City.

title: Buried Treasures at Raclette
description: The chef at Raclette stood by the table, holding a great half wheel of warmed cheese that had started to blister and bubble along its exposed diameter. He tilted it, pressed a long knife to the top and scraped down. The cheese seemed to shrug, the melted surface giving way like the side of a mountain coming undone.

title: Charles Isherwood: The Tony Nominations Should Be ...
description: Charles Isherwood makes his Tony Award choices. For the Should Have Been Nominated category, the Timess critics were allowed to expand the potential nominees to Off Broadway productions, which are ineligible for the Tonys. But they didnt consider Hamilton, which is moving to Broadway.

title: Impounded Cargo Ship in Strait of Hormuz Is Released by Iran
description: A Maersk Line cargo vessel impounded at gunpoint more than a week ago by Irans naval patrol boats in the Strait of Hormuz was released on Thursday after talks between the shipper and the Iranian authorities.

title: David Lettermans Top Ten On-Air Moments
description: With less than two weeks to go until the final episode of Late Show With David Letterman, Steve ODonnell, Lettermans head writer from 1983 to 1992, shares his favorite moments from the hosts more than 6,000 hours of late-night programming.

title: A Close-Up View of a Courbet Painting Under Restoration
description: PARIS  Its showtime for an enormous oil painting by Gustave Courbet that has become the star of reality entertainment in the Muse dOrsay here.

title: Suno Soaks Up Sunshine and Southern Charm in Charleston
description: Erin Beatty and Max Osterweis share snapshots of their trip to South Carolina, where they debuted an exclusive collection for the Hampden boutique there.

title: Polands World War II Ceremonies Lose Some Edge as Tensions With Russia Ebb
description: GDANSK, Poland  When they were announced several months ago, the ceremonies to commemorate the end of World War II here on Thursday were widely seen as a rebuke to President Vladimir V. Putins plan to stage a military extravaganza in Moscow to honor the 70th anniversary.

title: 2 Workers Killed When Backyard Fuel Tank Explodes in Westchester County
description: HASTINGS-ON-HUDSON, N.Y.  Two workers were killed on Thursday when a fuel tank exploded at a home in Westchester County, the authorities said.

title: Hey, Who Plays the Cello? The Impact of an Unexpected Role Model
description: The party was well underway when a guest noticed the instrument case in a corner. Hey, who plays the cello? he asked.

title: France Opens Criminal Inquiry Into Charges of Abuse by Peacekeepers in Africa
description: PARIS  Judges in France will formally investigate allegations that French troops sexually abused children during peacekeeping operations in the Central African Republic, the Paris prosecutors office said on Thursday.

title: Diane Paulus to Direct a Musical for Second Stage
description: The Tony-winning director Diane Paulus, who is having a challenging spring on Broadway after three consecutive triumphs, will try her hand Off Broadway next season, bringing a new musical about American aid workers to Second Stage Theater.

title: Trailer: Apu Trilogy Restoration
description: A preview of the restoration of Satyajit Rays Apu Trilogy.

title: An Educated Guess at the Patriots Punishment
description: The results of a nearly four-month investigation stated that it is more probable than not that New England Patriots personnel intentionally deflated footballs to gain an advantage during Januarys A.F.C. championship game. Commissioner Roger Goodell said Troy Vincent, the leagues executive vice president for football operations, and his group would consider what steps to take in light of the report, both with respect to possible disciplinary action and to any changes in protocols. In 2007, the league fined the Patriots $250,000 and Coach Bill Belichick $500,000 and ordered the team to forfeit a first-round pick after a Patriots staff member was discovered to have videotaped signals used by Jets coaches. (Responses, which were emailed to the N.F.L. reporter Ken Belson, were edited.)

title: Greece Will Make Next Debt Payment, Varoufakis Says
description: BRUSSELS  Greeces finance minister said on Thursday that the country would make its next major loan repayment to the International Monetary Fund on time, but there were few signs of an immediate breakthrough in a long-running stalemate between the government in Athens and its international creditors.

title: Rockets Reserves Repay Trust in Game 2; Clippers Lack of It Is Costly
description: HOUSTON  It was only Game 2 of their Western Conference semifinal series with the Los Angeles Clippers, but it was impossible for the Houston Rockets to avoid the sense that the situation was getting dire for them on Wednesday night. James Harden had just picked up his fourth foul early in the third quarter, and Coach Kevin McHale weighed his options.

title: Boutique Investment Bank Expands With Two Hires
description: The boutique investment bank Dean Bradley Osborne plans to announce on Thursday that it has hired two veteran deal makers in the technology sector, as the three-year-old firm continues to expand.

title: Facebook Use Polarizing? Site Begs to Differ
description: For years, political scientists and social theorists have fretted about the Internets potential to flatten and polarize democratic discourse.

title: Measles May Increase Susceptibility to Other Infections
description: Heres another reason to get a measles shot: Measles vaccination not only protects against measles, but reduces childhood deaths from other infections as well, a new study has found.

title: Inquiry to Examine Racial Bias in the San Francisco Police
description: First came disclosures of racist and homophobic text messages exchanged by officers of the San Francisco Police Department. That was followed by the discovery that sheriffs deputies had been gambling on forced fighting matches between inmates at a city jail.

title: French Nuclear Model Falters
description: PARIS  For decades, France has been a living laboratory for atomic energy, getting nearly three-quarters of its electricity from nuclear power  a higher proportion by far than in any other country.

title: France Went All Out for Nuclear Energy
description: PARIS  Along with jet planes and fast trains, nuclear power has been a showpiece of French technology, carefully nurtured by the government of a country eager to stand among the worlds industrial leaders but lacking in fossil-fuel resources.

title: Anti-Aging Measures for Disneys Animation Cels
description: PROTECTING ANIMATION CELS

title: Martin OMalley Hires Political Director Before Likely Run
description: Martin OMalley, the former Democratic governor of Maryland, is moving to solidify his team for his all-but-certain 2016 presidential campaign, bringing on a former aide to President Obama as his national political director.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 10 P.M. (NBC) TOM BROKAW: A LUCKY LIFE INTERRUPTED In conversations with his wife, children and medical team, Mr. Brokaw recounts his diagnosis of multiple myeloma in 2013, his treatment and, finally, his remission in this Dateline NBC special. He also investigates the effect that cancer has on the American health care system and discusses his coming book, A Lucky Life Interrupted: A Memoir of Hope. It never occurred to me that I was going to die, he says. Thats unrealistic in some ways.

title: Sam Smith to Be Sidelined by Surgery
description: Sam Smith, the British singer whose rich tenor helped him win four Grammys in February, will have surgery on his hemorrhaged vocal cords, he announced Thursday, forcing him to cancel a handful of tour dates around the world.

title: British Sovereign Risk, 2010
description: Its election day in Britain, and God knows what will happen. But a lot of the campaign has revolved around the question of what was really going on in the spring of 2010. Cameron/Osborne want everyone to believe that Britain was in crisis, and was saved only by austerity. Is that really how it was?

title: Chris Rock to Direct Amy Schumer Special
description: Its not only a jury of 12 angry men that has ruled in favor of Amy Schumer this week: on Thursday, HBO said it had signed up this stand-up and actress to star in her first comedy special for the cable network, to be directed by Chris Rock, a man who knows his way around a stand-up stage.

title: At Danziger Gallery, a Pair of Artists United by Playing With Abstraction
description: An exhibition brings together Enoc Perezs Cut Shapes and Inge Moraths Masquerades, made half a century apart.

title: N.S.A. Ruling Divides Republican Candidates
description: The Republican candidates for president lined up on different sides of the debate over whether the nations intelligence agencies should be allowed to collect data about Americans after a court ruled Thursday that the National Security Agency had acted outside the law.

title: A Reporters Conscience: Troubled by Young Migrants Plight
description: On May 5, the reporter David D. Kirkpatrick wrote the second of two articles about young African migrants caught in an international trafficking scheme. Here is an in-depth look at his experience in Libyan camps where African children are detained.

title: Trucking Company Shows Facebook Road to Future
description: The future may be emanating from Silicon Valley, but its an old-fashioned trucking company offering todays investors a glimpse of whats to come.

title: Louis Vuittons Party in the Desert
description: Louis Vuitton takes the 2016 Cruise collection to Palm Springs.

title: California Dreaming With Louis Vuitton
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif.  Unless you had been a fixture of Palm Springs society 30 or so years ago, invited to Bob Hopes annual do that followed the Bob Hope Classic, its likely you had never been to the John Lautner architectural masterpiece that sits in the desert like a spacecraft descended from Mars. The Bob and Dolores Hope Estate, as Hopes former home is now known, is a volcano-shaped curiosity, with a visorlike brim jutting out toward the mountains and an oculus that streams in blue sky like an unblinking eye or a James Turrell installation.

title: Blackstone Said to Raise $17 Billion for Buyout Fund
description: Investors are betting that flush times lie ahead for private equity.

title: In Deflation Case, Seeking a Penalty That Restores Credibility
description: It is one thing to be beaten fair and square. It is quite another to lose and then discover you were cheated.

title: Living With Cancer: Becoming a Caregiver
description: The vigilant man who has taken care of me for five years of cancer treatment slipped on a step three days ago. It was like seeing an eagle shot down. He had to have the tendon in his left knee repaired. Hunched on a chair in our kitchen, he glares at me like a wild thing trapped.

title: Suno Soaks Up Sunshine and Southern Charm in Charleston
description: Sunos designers, Erin Beatty and Max Osterweis, made a trip down to Charleston, S.C., to introduce a capsule collection they created exclusively for the Hampden boutique  a Southern oasis stocked with Clare V. handbags, Rebecca Taylor jumpsuits and Alexander Wang sandals. While in town with friends Kate Foley, a stylist, the blogger Blair Eadie, and Elizabeth and Kathryn Fortunato (the twin designers known as Lizzie Fortunato, who created custom jewelry to accompany the Suno x Hampden looks),the duo soaked up plenty of sunshine and enjoyed many a meal al fresco. In the above slideshow, they share snapshots of their adventures in the city often revered as one of Americas best.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Saint Laurent
description: Bertrand Bonello, the director of Saint Laurent, discusses a sequence from the film featuring Gaspard Ulliel and Valeria Bruni Tedeschi.

title: What the Latest N.S.A. Phone Ruling Means
description: The National Security Agencys mass collection of Americans phone records was deemed illegal by a federal appeals court.

title: The Highs and Lows
description: The most expensive neighborhoods in Brooklyn and the least expensive in Manhattan.

title: 7 Travel Inventions Id Love to See (But Probably Never Will)
description: As anyone who has, say, tried to cross the Atlantic in a canoe can attest, technology has made travel easier. (Sometimes too easy  do you really need an app, like TripAdvisors, that points an arrow in the direction of the Louvre?) But at other times, I find myself wishing for inventions that do not yet exist  and, I admit, may never come to be. In other words, current technological constraints may make these unlikely in the near future, but Ive also included some next-best options. Share your own invention ideas, or if you know of an existing device that could solve my problems, share that as well.

title: Review: A 60s View of Warhols Soup Cans, at MoMA
description: In 1962, at the Ferus Gallery in Los Angeles, Andy Warhol had his first solo painting exhibition. It consisted of 32 canvases, each bearing the image of a Campbells soup can rendered as if by a grocery store sign painter. Except for red letters spelling the name of a different variety on each label  Tomato, Minestrone, etc.  they appear nearly identical.

title: Tony Awards: Getting to Know You
description: Portraits of Tony Award-nominated actors.

title: Review: Spring Masters at the Park Avenue Armory
description: Curing art-fair fatigue by creating a new art fair seems counterintuitive. But that is what the organizers of Spring Masters have done  or at least tried to do by renaming and retooling the former Spring Show NYC. The premise of Spring Masters, now in its second year, is that art fairs are wearisome because they are homogeneous, overemphasizing contemporary art and not conveying how collectors actually cohabitate with their objects.

title: Verbatim: Chris Christie Defends Tom Brady
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, in an interview with IJ Review on Thursday in New Hampshire, defended Tom Brady, the quarterback for the New England Patriots, after the N.F.L. found that it is more probable than not that he knew footballs had been improperly deflated in Januarys A.F.C. championship game.

title: Review: The Story of O(OO) at David Lewis Gallery
description: The title of this provocatively puzzling exhibition refers to the erotic French novel The Story of O, by Pauline Rage, and to a recent movement in philosophy called Object Oriented Ontology, or OOO. (Backers of OOO put real things rather than perceptions or mental representations at the center of the study of existence.) Here, works by six artists are arranged on and around a diagram on the floor resembling a hopscotch court. Its from a chart devised by Graham Harman, one of OOOs leading proponents, that has to do with how we know reality.

title: Jackson Pollocks Mural Makes a Rare Trip to the Venice Biennale
description: VENICE  Jackson Pollocks Mural: Energy Made Visible at the Peggy Guggenheim Collection here is a small show built around a leviathan. Mural is the 20-foot-wide breakthrough painting that resulted in 1943 when Guggenheim commissioned Pollock to make a painting for a wall in her New York townhouse. And because she gave the work to the University of Iowa Museum of Art in 1948, it has been seen elsewhere infrequently, which makes it one of the least familiar landmarks of 20th-century painting.

title: Weekend Entertainments From the Archives of The New York Times
description: 101 YEARS AGO

title: Shelf, iPad, Bed Table: Reading, April 2015
description: How can you rely on someones opinion of a book if you dont know what that person reads, and what else she likes?

title: The Mystery Behind an Eye That Changed Color
description: How can a viral infection change the color of a persons eye? Months after Dr. Ian Crozier thought he had recovered from Ebola, he was stunned to find himself developing intense eye pain and fading vision. The inside of his left eye was still occupied territory, full of live, replicating virus. And one morning during this siege, he looked in the mirror and saw that his iris had changed from blue to green.

title: After Nearly Claiming His Life, Ebola Lurked in a Doctors Eye
description: ATLANTA  When Dr. Ian Crozier was released from Emory University Hospital in October after a long, brutal fight with Ebola that nearly ended his life, his medical team thought he was cured. But less than two months later, he was back at the hospital with fading sight, intense pain and soaring pressure in his left eye.

title: Rhapsodies in Blues
description: Tony Award nominees for best lighting design used a lot of indigo and steel.

title: Latest Updates: British Election 2015
Review: Instant Composers Pool Orchestra Plays at Roulette
description: The story of the Instant Composers Pool, a squirrelly, interrogative, original group of improvisers based in Amsterdam, began in the late 1960s. By a generous definition, the 10-piece ICP Orchestra, which assumed its present shape and sound in the 1980s, may be one of the longest-running entities active in jazz, if you choose to call what it does jazz.

title: How to Buy Art: A Beginners Cheat Sheet
description: You probably arent the one who shelled out $66.3 million for that late van Gogh on Tuesday night at Sothebys. And the stratosphere of next weeks art auctions at Sothebys and Christies, with works by Picasso and Giacometti poised to set records, is most likely out of your league too. Still, there are more earthbound ways to get into the art-buying game  at auctions, art fairs, end-of-year student shows and some big open-studio events. The next four weeks present art-buying opportunities galore in New York, with bargains for anyone willing to stray from the beaten path and stay alert. The hunt and its thrills do not have to lead to a giant price tag if you keep a few tips in mind.

title: Omar Khadr, Former Guantnamo Detainee, Is Released on Bail in Canada
description: OTTAWA  Despite a vigorous protest from the Canadian government, a court in Alberta released Omar Khadr, a former child soldier in Afghanistan, on bail Thursday while he appeals his conviction by an American military tribunal.

title: T. Boone Pickens, With Cash, Backs Jeb Bush
description: LAS VEGAS  The oil tycoon T. Boone Pickens is backing former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida for president, saying Thursday that he had donated $100,000 to help give Mr. Bush a leg up in the 2016 election.

title: Review: Santu Mofokeng, A Metaphorical Biography
description: Our art galleries often give us what our museums should but dont, as is the case with this small yet chronologically comprehensive survey of work by the South African photographer Santu Mofokeng. Born in Johannesburg in 1956, Mr. Mofokeng produced some of the great pictures of the apartheid years, but his images were different from many others of the time. His interest was less in a photojournalistic documenting of battles between South African blacks and the repressive government, than in recording the dynamics of another front line: daily life in black communities.

title: Obama Chooses Nike Headquarters to Make His Pitch on Trade
description: WASHINGTON  During years of debate about the costs and benefits of trade, few businesses came to symbolize the dark side of international commerce more than Nike, the multibillion-dollar apparel giant with armies of low-paid factory workers in Asia stitching together Air Jordans.

title: The Visual Influence of China  on Pinterest
description: The Costume Institutes new China: Through the Looking Glass exhibition, which opened to the public today (and made for an interesting red carpet at Monday nights Met Gala), examines Chinas influence on fashion over the years. Tracing such a visual thread from ancient artisans to the runway is something Charlotte di Carcaci does for each isssue of T with her In the Air column, which has explored the influence of everything from gardens and fairy tales to Latin glamour and marble.

title: Pictures of the Day: Britain, Burundi and Elsewhere
description: Burundi, Nepal and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Going Beyond Brunch for Mothers Day
description: Mothers Day is this weekend. If that comes as a surprise, its already too late to make brunch reservations.

title: Drugmaker Sues F.D.A. Over Right to Discuss Off-Label Uses
description: Drugmakers have long argued they should have the right to talk to doctors about unapproved uses for their products, as long as they are being truthful. And in some cases, courts have agreed. But the federal government still frowns on the practice and, in recent years, has fined drug companies billions of dollars for talking to doctors about so-called off-label uses for their medications.

title: Review: A Curious Blindness at Wallach Art Gallery
description: If, as it is sometimes said, we live in a postracial era, why are reports about race and racial conflict in the news every day? This is more or less the question asked by three students in the critical and curatorial studies program at Columbia University  Vivian Chui, Tara Kuruvilla and Doris Zhao  in a cogent group exhibition called A Curious Blindness. The show brings together 18 young artists focusing on the functional fantasies that revolve around race and the purported colorblindness it engenders.

title: Studio Visit | Judith Bernstein
description: The feminist artist wakes up with T at her home and studio of 50 years in New York Citys Chinatown on the eve of her solo show.

title: Hardy Country
description: A tour of Dorset on Englands south coast, which the writer called Wessex in his novels.

title: In the Studio With a Cat-Loving, Genitalia-Painting, 72-Year-Old Artist
description: The artist Judith Bernstein has been a trailblazer for more than half a century. In 1964, she was one of just a handful of women in Yales M.F.A. program; but rather than let the boys intimidate her, she befriended them. When pals like the playwrights John Guare and Kenneth Brown secreted her into the mens room so she could see the graffiti there, she treated the experiences as material, and based her first major series of works  Vietnam War protest paintings emblazoned with lewd language  on them. In the decades since, her work has been unapologetically feminist, sexual, sometimes profane, often vividly colorful  and incontestably influential forgenerations of younger female artists. In the final stages of preparation for Voyeur, a new solo show, the exuberant artist invited T into her Chinatown studio.

title: Review: In 5 Flights Up, a Marriage of Morgan Freeman and Diane Keaton
description: If every longtime couple were as contentedly happy and healthy as the pair played by Morgan Freeman and Diane Keaton in 5 Flights Up, aging side-by-side with a devoted partner would be something to look forward to.

title: Fitbit Files to Go Public
description: Betting that fitness is more than a passing trend, Fitbit is planning to leap into the public markets.

title: Saint Laurent (With Movie Trailer): Bertrand Bonello Narrates a Scene
description: A woman undergoes a style and attitude tranformation in this scene from Saint Laurent, Bertrand Bonellos look at the light and dark sides of the French designer Yves Saint Laurent. It stars Gaspard Ulliel in the title role, and Valeria Bruni Tedeschi as one of his clients.

title: Security to Be Beefed Up at the White House to Deter Fence Jumpers
description: A White House moat will have to wait, but new security measures are on the way.

title: A New Look at Works Banned by the Catholic Church
description: The artist Ileana Florescu submerged books underwater to explore the concept of destruction as it relates to the censorship and preservation of ideas.

title: Review: Zorba! Starring John Turturro
description: Those of us allergic to human juggernauts admiringly described as life forces have reason to fear the 1968 musical Zorba!, which has been resurrected by the Encores! series of musicals in concert. (Uh oh, I just used two exclamation points in one sentence, usually a sure sign theres a life force in the vicinity.)

title: Review: Saint Laurent, Beautiful People, High Fashion and Career at Its Pinnacle
description: Like an E! channel reality show or an Instagram feed from the Met Gala, Bertrand Bonellos Saint Laurent beckons with the promise of an inside look at the hectic and mysterious world of fashion. Shepherding you past security with a flash of a V.I.P. all-access pass, it confers instant insider status made even more alluring by the element of time travel.

title: Venice, Your Roots Are Showing
description: Its no secret that curators have a penchant for trees. Whether standing tall or forced into unnatural postures, a tree is on its own a kind of figure and en masse a component of a landscape. And in our ecologically strained times, trees are also urgent reminders of what a mess weve gotten ourselves into  plus a symbol of hope for greener days ahead. Arboreal uprooting is by no means a rarity in the contemporary art world, and it seems to have reached a critical mass at this years Venice Biennale, opening to the public May 9, where three of the most prominent pavilions in the Giardini are tree-centric.

title: Uber Joins the Bidding for Here, Nokias Digital Mapping Service
description: Uber is best known for allowing people to book a taxi through its smartphone application. But the fast-growing company has far broader ambitions.

title: Cornell Sues Peis Firm Over Museum Expansion Design
description: The firm founded by the Pritzker Prize-winning architect I.M. Pei committed architectural malpractice in submitting inherently flawed and materially defective designs for the expansion of Cornell Universitys Johnson Museum of Art, the school has charged in a lawsuit.

title: Jay Z and Beyonc Want to Put You in a Vegan State of Mind
description: As revolutions go, the one Beyonc and Jay Z are planning  to make the world go vegan  got off to a start somewhat more subdued than Queen Beys sheer Met Gala gown.

title: U.S. and European Scientists Sign Cooperation Pact
description: Laying the groundwork for what they said would be a new era of scientific cooperation, leaders of European and American particle physics initiatives signed an agreement at a White House ceremony on Thursday to share the spoils of their research in the coming decades.

title: Pop & Rock Listings for May 8-14
description: For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Museum & Gallery Listings for May 8-14
description: Museums and galleries are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of recent art shows: nytimes.com/art. A searchable guide to these and many other art shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Pictures of the Day  May 7, 2015
description: Photos from Burundi, Nepal, Britain and Russia.

title: Classical & Opera Listings for May 8-14
description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Dance Listings for May 8-14
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: At Danziger Gallery, a Pair of Artists United by Playing With Abstraction
description: If Hugh Hefner and Alexander Calder had a child, this is what it would look like, says the artist Enoc Perez of his Cut Shapes series. Currently on display at Danziger Gallery, the photo collages emerged from his paintings of nudes that he deemed not up to par. I had a lot in storage and I thought, What do I do with these?' he says. So, I started to add abstractions, like little Calders, and each turned out to be a better painting  and to play with censorship, plenty of which Perez has encountered on Instagram. (You have no idea how many posts of mine have been taken down because they dont meet the community standards, he says.) He then decided to pull pictures of women from their social media accounts and apply the same principle, both an organic extension of his practice and a response to the age of digital sharing. And, Perez continues, I like covering certain parts because peoples imaginations complete the job.

title: Review: The Love Object by Edna OBrien
description: In Philip Pullmans His Dark Materials trilogy, each human has a daemon, an animal that is a visible manifestation of his or her soul. It goes where you go.

title: Cuomo Pays Tribute to Fallen Officer
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York attended a wake for Police Officer Brian Moore in Bethpage, N.Y., on Thursday. Officer Moore died from a gunshot wound he received on Saturday in Queens.

title: Movie Listings for May 8-14
description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. Full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Theater Listings for May 8-14
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Britain Votes in Election
description: The nation faced the likelihood that there would be no outright winner in the British general election on Thursday.

title: Comedy Listings for May 8-14
description: For news about comedy, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Jazz Listings for May 8-14
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: The Illegal Phone-Data Sweeps
description: There is a lot to praise in the powerful ruling issued by a three-judge federal appeals panel in New York on Thursday, which held that the governments vast, continuing and, until recently, secret sweep of Americans phone records is illegal.

title: The Fate of the Iran Deal in Congress
description: The best thing that can be said about the 98-1 Senate vote approving Iran-related legislation on Thursday was that it did not make a flawed bill any worse.

title: Review: The Seven Five, a Documentary About a Corrupt New York Cop
description: The documentary The Seven Five giddily revisits the true-crime deeds of Michael Dowd, a former New York police officer who was arrested in 1992 with a stash of cocaine on him. As the ringleader of a crew of dirty cops stationed at the 75th Precinct in East New York, he padded his income by stealing money, guns and drugs from dealers. He eventually graduated to working for drug rings, one of which put him on retainer so he could provide information about narcotic operations. The Seven Five has been called the cop version of GoodFellas, which may explain why Sony has plans to produce a fictional remake. Heres hoping that version uses a better moral compass.

title: Spare Times for May 8-14
description: Museums and Sites

title: Review: Marjani Forts Latest Work, on Urban Plagues
description: Marjani Forts being Here.../this time begins on the sidewalk outside of Gibney Dance: Agnes Varis Performing Arts Center, on a block of Chambers Street bordering City Hall Park. As spectators gathered there on Wednesday, a woman in a wool coat and sneakers came gesticulating toward us, the courthouse as her backdrop. A vagrant evangelical, she preached about His glory and shouted at confused pedestrians  a convincing display of what New Yorkers habitually dismiss as crazy. Only her gauzy white veil, metallic body paint and a hovering cameraman gave her away as a performer.

title: Spare Times for Children for May 8-14
description: Spring Fling

title: How Jonathan Steinberg Made Good on a Second Chance
description: From his earliest days as a 20-something chief executive, Jonathan L. Steinberg had a weekly lunch with his father, Saul, the corporate raider whose brazen tactics and lavish displays of wealth came to define Wall Street in the 1980s.

title: Review: In Hot Pursuit, Sofia Vergara and Reese Witherspoon on the Run
description: Hot Pursuit is an on-the-run buddy comedy starring Sofia Vergara as the wife of a criminal and Reese Witherspoon (also credited among the films producers) as a San Antonio police officer. Thrown together by improbable (though entirely conventional) circumstances, the two women head across Texas, mocking and humiliating each other on the way to mutual appreciation.

title: Spotify Seeking Video Deals With Media Companies
description: Spotify made its name in digital media by appealing to peoples ears. Now it is going after their eyes, too.

title: Review: 1001 Grams, by the Norwegian Filmmaker Bent Hamer, Mixes Levity and Gravity
description: The Norwegian filmmaker Bent Hamer is notable for his deadpan visual wit and his interest in odd jobs. Factotum, his 2005 English-language feature starring Matt Dillon, followed its down-and-out protagonist (drawn from the writing of Charles Bukowski) through a series of unlikely employments. None were quite as peculiar as the work undertaken by the researchers in Kitchen Stories, who perched in lifeguard chairs in middle-class kitchens in the 1950s to observe the habits of housewives. The title character in OHorten had the relatively conventional profession of railway conductor but compensated with personal eccentricity.

title: Photographs of Everyday African-American Pride in Queens
description: A photographer goes back to St. Albans, a Queens neighborhood that has been a proud middle-class African-American enclave.

title: Review: In The D Train, Jack Black and James Marsden in a Steamy Bromance
description: In most movie bromances, sexual desire skitters at the edge of the story, quivering like a man-child in a cathouse. The dudes in these movies tend to observe a ritualistic narrative proximity (they get close, but not too close) thats echoed in the physical protocols of the typical bro-hug. In these familiar ceremonial interactions, the bros lean in toward each other for some upper-body contact even as they simultaneously maintain scrupulous, observable genital distance. Once contact is made, the bro-huggers exchange two or three hearty back slaps and then uncouple. In the comedy The D Train, theres no such retreat  only sweet, sweaty surrender.

title: Past Losses Echo as Long Island Grieves for a Fallen Officer
description: SEAFORD, N.Y.  This is a place where the pews are filled with police officers.

title: This Weeks Movies | May 8, 2015
description: The New York Times film critics review The D Train, Hot Pursuit and 5 Flights Up.

title: More Women Find Room for Babies and Advanced Degrees
description: The share of highly educated women who are childless into their mid-40s has fallen significantly over the last two decades, according to a new Pew Research Center analysis of data from the Census Bureau.

title: Dispute Over Witnesses Interrupts Boston Marathon Trial
description: BOSTON  With the trial of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the convicted Boston Marathon bomber, nearing its denouement, court was adjourned abruptly Thursday as lawyers argued over the final witnesses who would testify on Mr. Tsarnaevs behalf.

title: Review: At St. Ignatius Loyola, Bachs Mass in All Its Elements
description: On a more modest scale, K. Scott Warren, the artistic director of Sacred Music in a Sacred Space and director of music ministries at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola on Park Avenue, may feel the way Christoph von Dohnanyi did when he became music director of the Cleveland Orchestra in 1984. We give a great concert, Mr. Dohnanyi would say, and George Szell gets a great review.

title: Ambivalence Prevails at PEN Festival Prayer Session
description: The literary world can seem like a very secular place. But on Wednesday night, a dozen writers from around the world gathered onstage at a New York University auditorium to send some heartfelt words toward the heavens  or somewhere vaguely in that direction.

title: Blue Bell Knew About Listeria Issues, F.D.A. Says
description: Blue Bell Creameries, the popular regional ice cream chain that recalled all of its products last month, knew that listeria was present in one of its factories as early as 2013, according to documents released by the Food and Drug Administration on Thursday.

title: Movie Review: The D Train
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews The D Train.

title: Worlds Largest Steel Maker Loses $700 Million in Quarter
description: ArcelorMittal, the worlds largest steel maker, on Thursday lowered profit expectations for the year and said it had lost $700 million in the first quarter as a recovery in Europe failed to offset a sharp drop in prices for iron ore and steel. The company also said its earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization, which is a more closely watched metric than net income in the industry, had fallen to $1.4 billion for the quarter. Earnings were $1.8 billion in the same period a year earlier. We faced a number of headwinds, Lakshmi Mittal, the companys chief executive, said. The company, based in Luxembourg, cut the lower end of its guidance range for that pretax measure of earnings to $6 billion from $6.5 billion. Revenue for the first quarter was $17.1 billion, compared with $19.8 billion in the same period a year earlier.

title: Movie Review: 5 Flights Up
description: The Times critic Stephen Holden reviews 5 Flights Up.

title: Dean Skelos, Albany Senate Leader, Takes Leave of Absence From Law Firm
description: With his grip on power in Albany slipping, Dean G. Skelos, the State Senate majority leader, who was recently arrested in a federal corruption case, is taking a leave of absence from the Long Island law firm where he has worked for two decades, the firm said on Thursday.

title: Siemens to Cut 4,500 Jobs, Half of Them in Germany
description: Siemens, the German industrial giant, said on Thursday that it would cut 4,500 jobs as a slump in oil prices has eroded its sales of equipment to the energy industry. The cuts bring the number of layoffs this year to almost 12,000 out of a global work force of 340,000, or a reduction of 3.5 percent. Half of the cuts will be in Germany. From January to March, sales rose 8 percent to 18 billion, but the gain was because of the weaker euro.

title: Movie Review: Hot Pursuit
description: The Times critic A. O. Scott reviews Hot Pursuit.

title: A New Labor Contract at the Expanding Cincinnati Orchestra
description: The orchestra world is all too familiar with vicious cycles of mounting deficits, dwindling audiences, difficulty raising money and cuts. But at the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra, things are moving happily in the opposite direction: think crescendo, not diminuendo.

title: Regarding Report, Tom Brady Says, I Will Address It
description: A day after a report commissioned by the N.F.L. indicated that it was more probable than not that quarterback Tom Brady was at least generally aware of Patriots personnel deflating footballs to gain an advantage, Brady appeared at a previously scheduled event at Salem State University in Salem, Mass.

title: With U.S. Eyes on Iran, North Koreas Nuclear Arsenal Expanded
description: SEOUL, South Korea  While the Obama administration spent the past two years getting within striking distance of a deal to delay Irans race for a nuclear bomb, North Korea went on an atomic spending spree: an expansion officials here fear Washington has little hope of stopping.

title: Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase Agree to Erase Debts From Credit Reports After Bankruptcies
description: Two of the nations biggest banks will finally put to rest the zombies of consumer debt  bills that are still alive on credit reports although legally eliminated in bankruptcy  potentially providing relief to more than a million Americans.

title: Bank of Americas Relief for Mortgage Borrowers Is Questioned
description: There was plenty of fanfare last August when Bank of America agreed to a record $16.7 billion settlement with the Justice Department over dubious mortgage practices. Prosecutors crowed about the deal, which required the bank to provide $7 billion of consumer relief  including such things as loan modifications  over the ensuing four years.

title: Riot Erupts in Irans Kurdish Capital Over Womans Death
description: TEHRAN  Furious over the unexplained death of a chambermaid, ethnic Kurds in an Iranian provincial capital rioted on Thursday, apparently setting the fire that roared through the hotel where she had worked. Police officers used tear gas to disperse the crowds, according to news accounts, witnesses, and images posted on social media.

title: Review: Preggoland. Its a Nice Place to Visit. Sort Of.
description: Preggoland, a mild comedy about a fake pregnancy, has some rewards, though you have to be prepared to give it a chance. The central character, Ruth, initially comes across as irritating. By the end, though, the actress who plays her, Sonja Bennett, has made her likably irritating.

title: Slushy Ice Is Springtime Hazard, Even as Arena Crews Sweat to Keep Cool Air In
description: WASHINGTON  Before Jay Beagle took the ice for the Capitals in Game 3 against the Rangers on Monday, he stepped on a scale and noted his weight, to use later as a reference point.

title: Review: In Piku, Amitabh Bachchan Plays a Dad to Deepika Padukone
description: Piku, an offbeat Hindi comedy, would have you contemplate the intestines and mortality of one Bhashkor Banerji and the actor who plays him, Amitabh Bachchan. Bhashkors life and conversation may revolve around his constipation and fussy hypochondria, but theres no mistaking the scene-stealing energy that Mr. Bachchan, Indias erstwhile Angry Young Man, musters for his new role of Cranky Old Man.

title: Top Qaeda Figure Dies in Yemen Drone Strike
description: WASHINGTON  An American drone strike in a southern port city of Yemen last month killed a senior operative of the Qaeda branch in that country who had recently emerged as a public face of the group, it announced on Thursday.

title: Review: Playing It Cool, with Chris Evans
description: You know how awkward it is when you date a man and he wont stop talking in voice-over? Allow me to introduce the hero of Playing It Cool, a struggling writer named Me (Chris Evans, insufferable) whose incessant narration  for audiences, if not for his luckless love interest  is inescapable.

title: Armenia Official Criticizes Turkey for Genocide Denial
description: Armenias foreign minister criticized Turkey on Thursday over its angry responses to what he called the growing and irreversible trend of global acknowledgments that the killings of ethnic Armenians by Ottoman Turks 100 years ago was a genocide.

title: Review: In Maggie, Arnold Schwarzenegger Faces Zombies
description: Zombies, Arnold Schwarzenegger and a certain Terrence Malick je ne sais quoi  what could go wrong? More or less everything in this low-budget head-scratcher and periodic knee-slapper. A bearded Mr. Schwarzenegger plays Wade Vogel, a strenuously humble American farmer who, not long after the movie opens, retrieves his 16-year-old daughter, Maggie (Abigail Breslin), from a world crammed with artfully uglified, zomboid victims of a ghastly virus. Cars burn, fields burn and every so often  as when Wade gasses up his truck  one of these hungry zombies goes on the attack.

title: For Patriots, the Bizarre Has Long Been the Norm
description: The Gillette Stadium crowd was in full throat at the A.F.C. championship game in January, stoked to mock and tease the opposition by the teams rascally leader, Bill Belichick, who stood on the sideline peering from beneath both a hoodie and a windbreaker against a driving rain.

title: Review: Intrepido Follows an Italian From Job to Job
description: Intrepido: A Lonely Hero, set in Milan, in these times, opens on a day when rain falls on old snow. The protagonist, Antonio Pane (Antonio Albanese), takes short-term jobs, filling in for different people. He works at a construction site, in costume at a mall, in a kitchen and as a tram driver. No occupation holds his interest for long: When he delivers pizzas to a sewing factory, he shows off his facility with one of the machines.

title: F.B.I. Says It Sent Warning on One Gunman in Attack at Texas Gathering
description: WASHINGTON  Three hours before two gunmen opened fire outside a Prophet Muhammad cartoon contest in Garland, Tex., the F.B.I. sent a bulletin to the Garland police warning them that one of the men might show up at the event, the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, said Thursday.

title: Review: The 100-Year-Old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared
description: The film genre that might be called Old People Behaving Hilariously gets an appealing new entry with The 100-Year-Old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared, a sometimes daffy, often droll Swedish movie. Among other things, this film dares to ask the controversial question: Can a cadaver dog distinguish between a body thats dead and one that is merely triple-digit old?

title: U.S. Trains Syrian Rebels in Jordan to Fight ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  After months of planning and delays, American Special Operations troops have started training a small group of Syrian rebels in Jordan, with the goal of creating a politically moderate force with the fighting prowess to take on the seasoned and well-armed extremists of the Islamic State, senior Pentagon officials said Thursday.

title: At Murder Trial for James Holmes, Conflicting Views of the Colorado Student
description: CENTENNIAL, Colo.  He is like a cipher in the courtroom, swiveling lightly in his chair, his expression placid. He almost never turns to glance at his parents just behind him, or at the families of the 12 people he killed and 70 he wounded in a shooting rampage inside a Colorado movie theater.

title: India: Border Dispute With Bangladesh Nears an End
description: Parliament unanimously passed a bill on Thursday for a constitutional amendment that paves the way for a resolution of a decades-old boundary dispute with Bangladesh by exchanging pockets of land near the border and ultimately allowing thousands of people to choose their citizenship. More than 160 enclaves exist in either India or Bangladesh near the border that are encircled by the other nations territory. The situation is rooted in centuries-old peace treaties and the partition of India and Pakistan in 1947. East Pakistan became Bangladesh in 1971. Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India called the passage of the bill a historic milestone, and Bangladeshs envoy to India, Syed Muazzem Ali, called it a historic and landmark day. The bill must be passed by at least half the state legislatures before the boundary agreement can be put into effect.

title: Guy Carawan Dies at 87; Taught a Generation to Overcome, in Song
description: On an April night in 1960, Guy Carawan stood before a group of black students in Raleigh, N.C., and sang a little-known folk song. With that single stroke, he created an anthem that would echo into history, sung at the Selma-to-Montgomery marches of 1965, in apartheid-era South Africa, in international demonstrations in support of the Tiananmen Square protesters, at the dismantled Berlin Wall and beyond.

title: France: Claims of Abuse by Troops Prompt an Inquiry
description: French judges will formally investigate allegations that French troops sexually abused children during peacekeeping operations in the Central African Republic, the Paris prosecutors office said Thursday. Prosecutors opened a preliminary investigation in July after a confidential United Nations report on the allegations was brought to the attention of the French authorities, but the case publicly surfaced last week after a report in The Guardian. According to the prosecutors statement, the United Nations report contains testimony by six children aged 9 to 13. Four of them said they had been abused by French soldiers and two others said they had witnessed the abuse, which is said to have occurred at a camp at the Mpoko airport, in the capital, Bangui, between December 2013 and last June. The airport was guarded by French troops who were sent to the Central African Republic in 2013 to quell a sectarian conflict.

title: Review: Noble, the Crusade of a Childrens Rights Activist
description: A feisty, passionate performance by the Irish actress Deirdre OKane gives the inspirational biopic Noble a serrated edge of defiance and gumption. Its subject, Christina Noble, is an Irish childrens rights activist and writer, who traveled to Ho Chi Minh City in 1989 and established a foundation that has set up more than 100 projects in Vietnam and Mongolia that provide protection, education and health care for more than 700,000 children and their families.

title: Justice Department Will Investigate Baltimore Police Practices
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department will investigate whether the Baltimore Police Department engaged in a pattern of unconstitutional policing, law enforcement officials said on Thursday, a day after the mayor asked for an inquiry.

title: Review: In Bravetown, a Bad Boy Redeems Himself Through D.J. Magic
description: This town is good for nothing but turning out future soldiers, says Mary (Kherington Payne), the glum captain of a North Dakota high school dance team in the excruciating Bravetown, an unwieldy hybrid of high school dance competition movie and shameless flag-waver.

title: Capitals Stars Are Sharing Spotlight With Rookies During Postseason Run
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  When the Washington Capitals selected the Russian winger Alex Ovechkin as the No. 1 overall pick in the 2004 draft, it was a consolation prize for having played miserable hockey.

title: Obama Administration Urges Fast Action on New Hudson River Rail Tunnels
description: Elected officials usually have to go to Washington and beg for federal support to build huge transportation projects. On Thursday, on a high floor of the tallest building in New York City, that dynamic was on display in reverse.

title: Spieth Gets Lesson on Intricacies of Course at Sawgrass
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla.  Jordan Spieth did not look at T.P.C. Sawgrass and see the danger lurking around every moss-laden oak. As one might expect of someone with four victories in his last 12 stroke-play starts dating to last years Australian Open, Spieth saw fairways as wide as meadows and holes the size of Frisbees.

title: Forbidden Films Exhumes Nazi Poison From the Movie Vaults
description: The Third Reich was not only a totalitarian state but also a total multimedia regime. Seven decades after its fiery collapse, the embers remain  including some 1,200 feature films produced under Joseph Goebbelss ministry of propaganda. Are they historical evidence, incitements to murder, fascist pornography, evergreen entertainments, toxic waste or pass kitsch? All of the above?

title: Fox Hunt Leader of Old
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Man, this was a tough one for me. Theres nothing like a puzzle like this one by Ian Livengood to highlight what you dont know.

title: Review: In Cool Hand Luke, the Ultimate Escape
description: Its not every man who can flee a chain gang while shackled in two sets of leg irons, but Luke Jackson isnt just anyone. A hero, an outlaw and an iconoclast, immortalized by Paul Newman in the 1967 film based on the Donn Pearce novel, Luke has returned to us courtesy of the Godlight Theater Company at 59E59 Theaters.

title: Louis Nuez, Champion of Puerto Ricans, Dies at 87
description: Louis Nuez, a champion of educational and economic opportunity for Puerto Ricans for more than three decades, died on April 30 at his home in Rockville, Md. He was 83.

title: Dianne White Clatto, Weathercaster Who Broke a Color Barrier, Dies at 76
description: Twelve years before Al Roker started as a weather anchor for a CBS affiliate in Syracuse, Dianne White Clatto made broadcasting history in St. Louis. In 1962, according to industry colleagues, she became the first full-time black television weathercaster in the country.

title: Disney Names Marketer to Run Consumer Products Division
description: LOS ANGELES  The Walt Disney Companys top theme park marketer will take over its fast-growing consumer products division, an appointment that fills an important vacancy and brings a woman into the entertainment conglomerates most senior ranks.

title: Mayor de Blasios Latest Budget Wont Pay for More Police Officers
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio on Thursday outlined a $78.3 billion budget  an increase of more than 4 percent from the spending plan adopted last June  putting forth a series of proposals intended to reduce income inequality but rebuffing requests from the City Council and his own police commissioner to add officers to the force.

title: Homeland Security Chief Hears Skepticism on Effort to Identify Extremists
description: The timing could not have been more appropriate, the Homeland Security secretary, Jeh Johnson, remarked, for him to hold a day of preplanned meetings with Muslim, interfaith and civil rights community leaders in New York on Thursday.

title: Paternity Case for a New Jersey Mother of Twins Bears Unexpected Results: Two Fathers
description: A mother of twins was applying for public assistance in Passaic County, N.J., when she made the seemingly uncontroversial claim that one man was responsible for her progeny.

title: American Will Pursue Tenniss Top Global Post
description: David Haggerty, the former United States Tennis Association president who helped lead the effort to build a roof at Arthur Ashe Stadium and a new national training center in Orlando, Fla., will run for president of the sports global governing body, the International Tennis Federation.

title: Rodriguez Passes Mays but Still Doesnt Collect
description: The person who first seemed to recognize that Alex Rodriguez had hit his 661st career home run Thursday night was Adam Jones, the Baltimore Orioles center fielder, who took a few steps toward the wall in left-center and then stopped, as if he knew his chase was futile, knew the ball was gone.

title: Not Nothing
description: Achieving dewiness  skin that glistens with moisture or glows with its own good health  is more complicated than it looks.

title: Life Among the Leopards
description: In the ancient hills of Jawai in northwest India, locals and big cats have peacefully coexisted for centuries like nowhere else in the world. As safarigoers arrive to experience the unique environment, can the harmony last?

title: Word of the Day | coiffure
description: coiffure  \kw-fyur\  noun and verb

title: Seattle Storm Express Concern After Libertys Hiring of Isiah Thomas
description: Two days after Isiah Thomas was named the president of the Liberty and given part ownership of the W.N.B.A. team, the Seattle Storm issued a statement expressing concern over the development and implying that they might vote not to approve Thomass ownership stake.

title: Whats on TV Friday
description: 7:10 P.M. (HBO Signature) BELLE (2014) The biracial daughter (Gugu Mbatha-Raw) of a British Navy captain (Matthew Goode) struggles to transcend the problems of living as a black woman in slave-trading England after being raised in privilege by her aristocratic uncle and aunt (Tom Wilkinson and Emily Watson), and alongside her white cousin (Sarah Gadon). This biopic about Dido Elizabeth Belle (1761-1804), directed by Amma Asante and written by Misan Sagay, chronicles the difficult love life of Belle, an educated beauty  including a dashing suitor, John Davinier (Sam Reid), as well as several not-so-charming ones. The movie also covers Belles uncle, the Lord Chief Justice, who must decide on a case involving a slave ship on which more than 130 Africans were massacred for an insurance payment. The movie plays with the historical record for dramatic effect, as is often the case when the past is disinterred for entertainment, and its realism at times groans under the weight of too many passionate speeches, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. Yet the weave of the personal and the political finally proves as irresistible as it is moving, partly because it has been drawn from extraordinary life.

title: Corrections: May 8, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: My usual morning route has become a big adventure for me. Now, in my taxi we discuss paintings and artworks.

title: David Cameron and Conservatives Get Majority in British Election
description: LONDON  Prime Minister David Cameron and his Conservatives won a resounding victory in the British general election, with complete results on Friday showing that the party had secured an overall majority in Parliament.

title: Photographs of Everyday African-American Pride in Queens
description: The pizza shop on Farmers Boulevard where Elias Williams and his friends hung out as teenagers seemingly has a new owner every year. His longtime barbershop spun off a convenience store to help pay the rising rent. And some of his childhood friends and their families are gone, their houses dark, empty and financially under water.

title: Conservative Party Wins Surprising Victory in Britains General Election
description: Prime Minister David Cameron and his party emerged victorious, with partial results showing that the party will at a minimum come close to winning an overall majority in Parliament.

title: The Growing Generational Divide
description: BEREA, Ky.  I WAS always with older folks when I was very young. They called me Little Man and told me I was an old soul. I worked in the garden with my grandparents, learned how to count money with Old Man Hoskins at the local store, and eavesdropped on the tales of my ancient neighbors. But it was the stories of my fierce aunt, Sis, that were my favorite.

title: Mothers and Presidents
description: Americans are embarrassed. Over the last 35 years there have only been two elections without a Bush or Clinton on the national ticket. Next year both names could rest atop the ballot. In one poll voters saw this as a bad thing by a ratio of 8 to 1.

title: Dissension at the Federal Election Commission
description: To the Editor:

title: Hate Speech: The Legal Issues and the Consequences
description: To the Editor:

title: Triumph of the Unthinking
description: Words, wrote John Maynard Keynes, ought to be a little wild, for they are the assault of thoughts on the unthinking. Ive always loved that quote, and have tried to apply it to my own writing. But I have to admit that in the long slump that followed the 2008 financial crisis  a slump that we had both the tools and the knowledge to end quickly, but didnt  the unthinking were quite successful in fending off unwelcome thoughts.

title: The New SAT: Will It Be Better?
Dont Rehab La Guardia Airport. Close It.
description: LAST week, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey put off, yet again, deciding between two proposals for a nearly $4 billion project to rehabilitate the dilapidated Central Terminal Building at La Guardia Airport. Disdain about the disrepair, crowds and grubbiness at La Guardia is so pervasive that Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has likened La Guardia to an experience in a third world country.

title: Measure Californias Water
description: Californias water board voted Tuesday to impose new rules that would reduce the states urban water use by 25 percent, as mandated by Gov. Jerry Brown at the beginning of April. By requiring towns and cities to cut back, the state expects to save about 1.3 million acre-feet of water over the next nine months. Rationing in urban areas will be tiered. Cities and towns that have already been conserving water will not have to cut as much as areas that have not.

title: Tracking New Yorks Roots in Slavery
description: Of all the commodities traded over time on Wall Street, the one that goes discreetly unmentioned in historical markers is human beings  the anxious throngs of kidnapped slaves that the New York City government routinely rented and auctioned off across half a century at the end of Wall Street at the East River.

title: New York Citys Week in Pictures: May 8
description: Photographs from the past week in New York City and the region include images from nail salons, a vigil for Nepal earthquake victims and a protest over the death of Freddie Gray in Baltimore.

title: 6 Qs About the News | The Chauvet Caves Hyperreal Wonders, Replicated
description: In The Chauvet Caves Hyperreal Wonders, Replicated, Alissa J. Rubin writes about the opening of a replica of a prehistoric cave.

title: Test Yourself | Kickin It Old School With Kickstarter
description: Below, several paragraphs from the May 5 article De La Souls Kickstarter Campaign Raises $600,874.

title: Monsanto, in Bid for Syngenta, Reaches for a Business It Left Behind
description: Over the last two decades Monsanto has cast off its century-long history as a chemical company and refashioned itself as an agricultural life sciences company, led by its genetically engineered seeds.

title: U.S. Economy Added 223,000 Jobs in April; Unemployment Rate at 5.4%
description: The American job market rebounded in April, the government said on Friday, easing fears that the economy was on the brink of another extended slowdown after a bleak winter stall. But the growth in jobs failed to translate, once again, into any significant improvement in pay.

title: Priced Out of Brooklyn? Try Manhattan
description: Five years ago, Eric Kabakoff and Christina Lewandowski bought a one-bedroom in a new condominium in Gowanus, Brooklyn, with the idea of moving to a two-bedroom in the same building after a while. But two years ago, when they were outbid on two apartments there, the couple realized their $750,000 budget was not going to be enough.

title: Five Manhattan Alternatives to Pricey Brooklyn Neighborhoods
description: Priced out of Brooklyn? Manhattan may be a better value.

title: Brooklyns Most Expensive Listings
description: More and more Brooklyn sellers are listing their homes with Manhattan-size prices. So far, the highest price paid was $12.5 million in 2012 for an 1839 house in Brooklyn Heights where Truman Capote once lived. Here are the five most expensive residential listings in Brooklyn as of May 7:

title: Insurance Doesnt Eliminate Risk for Top College Athletes Who Forgo Draft
description: A year ago, Cedric Ogbuehi had good reason to think that he would be signing a contract in the neighborhood of $20 million  the result of being a top-five N.F.L. draft pick.

title: Single Motherhood, in Decline Over All, Rises for Women 35 and Older
description: Single parenthood was on a mysterious and alarming rise, becoming a huge problem, according to a 2013 article in the Atlantic. The lawyer defending same-sex marriage bans before the Supreme Court last month argued that out-of-wedlock births were growing rapidly.

title: Capital Becomes Favorite Target of Those Looking to Rule It
description: WASHINGTON  His voice exuding disgust, Jeb Bush could have been describing a blistering rash.

title: State Legislatures Put Up Flurry of Roadblocks to Abortion
description: MIAMI  Oklahomas governor this week approved a law extending to 72 hours the mandatory waiting period before a woman can have an abortion. Here in Florida, lawmakers enacted a 24-hour waiting period that requires two separate appointments  one for an ultrasound and information about fetal development and another for the actual procedure.

title: How Hard Is It for Teenagers in Your Community to Get a Job?
description: Statistics show that across the country, fewer young people are working than during previous decades. The dismal job picture has even been called a Great Depression for teens.

title: How the British Papers Reported the Election Results
description: As a solid victory emerged for the Conservatives in the British general election, newspaper front pages showed the surprise news that David Cameron appeared all but certain to remain prime minister, while tabloids reported the results with less subtlety.

title: El Peligro de los Productos Para Uas
description: Los ingredientes que hacen a los productos para uas tan eficientes - duraderos, de secado rpido y de colores brillantes - tambin ocasionan problemas de salud. Los rituales en los salones, como aplicar y remover esmalte y esculpir uas artificiales, crean una micro atmsfera de polvos y qumicos cuyo efecto a largo plazo se desconoce. Aqu lo que se sabe:

title: A Minnesota Quartet, Tuned to Temperatures from the Equator to the Arctic, Performs Global Warming
description: The University of Minnesotas environmental magazine Ensia has posted on the latest effort by a cello-playing undergraduate, Daniel Crawford, and the geographerScott St. George to create musical compositions reflecting aspects of global climate change. (See my coverage of a 2013 composition by Crawford here.)

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties include co-ops in Chelsea and the East Village, and a house in Bushwick.

title: Tell-Tale Signs of the Modern-Day Yuppie
description: Of all the family-newspaper-appropriate socioeconomic slurs, one that was ubiquitous in the 1980s and 90s is slowly on its way out in this millennium: yuppie.

title: Ask Well: Is 99 Degrees a Fever?
description: Question:

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks homes include a six-bedroom in Tenafly, N.J., and a four-bedroom in Rye, N.Y.

title: Venenos que embellecen las uas
description: Cada vez que un cliente abra la puerta de vidrio del saln en Ridgewood, Queens, donde Nancy Otavalo trabajaba, un alegre coro resonaba de todas las manicuristas: Elige un color!

title: New York Today: The Price of a Mothers Day Pedicure
description: Good morning on this balmy Friday.

title: Perfect Nails, Poisoned Workers
description: Each time a customer pulled open the glass door at the nail shop in Ridgewood, Queens, where Nancy Otavalo worked, a cheerful chorus would ring out from where she sat with her fellow manicurists against the wall: Pick a color!

title: Obama Scolds Democrats on Trade Pact Stance
description: BEAVERTON, Ore.  President Obama on Friday lashed out at critics within his own party as he accused fellow Democrats of deliberately distorting the potential impact of the sweeping new trade agreement he is negotiating with Asia and standing in the way of a modern competitive economy.

title: Water Flowing From Toilet to Tap May Be Hard to Swallow
description: FOUNTAIN VALLEY, Calif.  Water spilled out of a spigot, sparklingly clear, into a plastic cup. Just 45 minutes earlier, it was effluent, piped over from Orange Countys wastewater treatment plant next door. At a specialized plant, it then went through several stages of purification that left it cleaner than anything that flows out of a home faucet or comes in a brand-name bottle.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Takata Expects Return to Profit Despite Facing Airbag Lawsuits
description: TOKYO  Takata, the Japanese auto supplier embroiled in a crisis over dangerously faulty airbags, said on Friday that it had put the worst of the financial damage behind it, even as it faces lawsuits and mounting pressure from United States regulators.

title: Mom: The Designated Worrier
description: THERES a story my daughter loves to hear me tell: The day after I came home from the hospital with her big brother, my first child, I was seized by the certainty that I was about to die. I sobbed; I asked my husband: But who will keep him in socks? Wholl make sure hes wearing his little socks?

title: Outside
description: In a culture overrun by sound bites and clichs, poems can reinvigorate language that has become too familiar. In this poem, I am struck first by the music, the way its cadence carries forward what seems a meditation on the variations on a phrase, out of. But the poem takes an elegiac turn in the wordplay of the final line, becoming no longer general but startlingly particular. Poem selected by Natasha Trethewey.

title: Re: Walking New York
description: For the April 26 cover of the magazines special issue, Walking New York, the French artist JR took a portrait of Elmar Aliyev, a 20-year-old waiter from Azerbaijan, walking down the street. He then enlarged it to 150 feet tall, pasted it to a pedestrian plaza in front of the Flatiron Building and photographed it from a helicopter. People walked on him all day, JR wrote on his Facebook page, and no one really noticed.

title: How to Fake a British Accent
description: To sound like a Brit, youll need a flexible tongue tip, and for that you must exercise, says Barbara Berkery, a dialect and voice coach currently tutoring Geoffrey Rush on the Queensland set of the fifth Pirates of the Caribbean film.

title: Letter of Recommendation: X Minus One
description: I cant fall asleep in silence. Eyes closed, earplugs in, I consume free audio as if it were Ambien. For years I burned through podcasts, before moving on to off-hours international talk shows. I drowsed through introductory university lectures. I discovered that there are at least 8,000 public-domain audiobooks available online, narrated by volunteers. I cant say for sure how many I started, but I know exactly how many I finished (none). It was a couple thousand nights into this habit that I ended up on X Minus One, a 1955 NBC radio anthology about time, space, war, apocalypse and the future: a 60-year-old exercise in figuring out how things might be today. It was, for my ritual, perfect.

title: Rangers Are Often at Their Best When Facing Elimination
description: The Rangers, the N.H.L.s best team in the regular season, enter Fridays Game 5 of their second-round series against the Washington Capitals trailing by three games to one. But the Rangers have been in this position many times in the past three seasons and have excelled when on the brink.

title: Under the Waves
description: When I was 17, I was dismasted in the Baltic. For years, thats how I told the story, to make a joke of it.

title: Fringe Festival
description: In 2008, Mike Huckabee ran for president as a likable chucklehead who had lost 100 pounds. And you can, too! Now hes running for president as a grievanceburdened theocrat who has lost his mind. In the interim, he lent his name to infomercials hawking a dubious diabetes treatment of cinnamon and some other concoction, putting the Huckster in Huckabee.

title: Rekindling Human Contact in the Digital Age
description: How does it feel to enter a bar and see a line of patrons immersed in their devices, thumb-typing away? Or to step into a subway car where half of the passengers are oblivious to one another, staring down into their phones? Even photographs of scenes like these evoke feelings of alienation. When Sherry Turkle, a psychologist who directs the M.I.T. Initiative on Technology and Self, examined the effects of digital technology on our lives, she gave her book the title Alone Together.

title: Confederates in the Jungle
description: The Fourth of July celebration has all the hallmarks of a scene from Gone with the Wind, or a county fair in the most unreconstructed corners of Mississippi or Alabama. The men, dressed in Confederate gray shell jackets, yellow-trimmed frock coats, kepis and plumed black slouch hats, cross the dance floor to select their partners, elegant young women in colorful hoop-skirted ball gowns. Arm in arm, they step to the rhythms of ancient dances, as the fiddle and banjo strike up the old-time strains of Dixies Land, The Yellow Rose of Texas, The Virginia Reel and Cumberland Gap.

title: Where Would the Kardashians Be Without Kris Jenner?
description: Kris Jenner slowly descended one side of the curving double staircase in her home in Hidden Hills, Calif., like some sort of grande dame, like Elizabeth Taylor in a White Diamonds commercial, only dressed head to toe in black: Balmain blazer, Rag & Bone jeans and Chanel ankle boots. When she reached the foyer, she greeted the former N Sync member Lance Bass, kissing him on both cheeks, and then said hello to Tom, who was ... Basss assistant? His producer? Everyone there was an assistant and everyone was a producer. Whatever Toms official job title was, his actual name was Bob, and he corrected Kris, who smiled and explained that they really were the same name. A production assistant in surgical shoe coverings handed out microphones, and people wired themselves up through the bottoms of their shirts while Kris invited them into the kitchen for coffeecake.

title: As Russia Remembers War in Europe, Guest of Honor Is From China
description: BEIJING  When Russia celebrates the 70th anniversary of the defeat of the Nazis on Saturday, the most prominent leader standing with President Vladimir V. Putin to review a military parade will not be from the United States or Britain, Russias wartime allies.

title: Today in Politics: Jeb Bush Heads to Liberty University to Court a Wary Crowd
description: Good Friday morning from Washington. President Obama is in Oregon talking trade, and the Republicans prepare to gather in South Carolina to continue honing their attack plans. Jeb Bush, however, is heading toVirginia, trying to smooth a recent trouble spot among grass-roots evangelicals.

title: Ideas for E.L.L.s | Celebrating the End of the School Year
description: Images from a 2013 City Room post showing New York City teachers at the end of a school day.

title: How Russians Lost the War
description: ZURICH  My father went to war as a volunteer at age 18. He was a submariner in the Baltic Sea.

title: Pakistan Helicopter Crash Kills 2 Ambassadors
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  An international tour of a scenic corner of northern Pakistan ended in tragedy on Friday, when a Pakistani military helicopter carrying foreign diplomats went down in a fiery crash that killed seven people aboard, including the ambassadors from Norway and the Philippines.

title: Morning Agenda: 2 Banks Agree to Erase Zombie Debts
description: 2 BANKS AGREE TO ERASE ZOMBIE DEBTS  | Some of the nations biggest banks have come under fire for keeping debts alive on credit reports even when they were discharged in bankruptcy, essentially forcing borrowers to make payments on bills that they do not legally owe, as Jessica Silver-Greenberg of DealBook reported last year. Relief may finally be at hand for the consumers whose discharged debts have kept them from getting jobs or renting apartments, now that Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase have agreed to update borrowers credit reports within the next three months to reflect that the debts were extinguished, Ms. Silver-Greenberg reports in DealBook.

title: Video Reviews of The D Train, Hot Pursuit and 5 Flights Up
description: In this weeks video, Times critics share their thoughts on The D Train, Hot Pursuit and 5 Flights Up. See all of this weeks reviews.

title: Whats On This Week Around The World
description: Vienna

title: British Elections Other Losers: Pollsters
description: LONDON  The Labour leader Ed Miliband may have stumbled badly in the British election, but there was another big loser on Thursday night: the pollsters who were far off the mark and failed to see the outright majority won by Prime Minister David Cameron and his Conservative Party.

title: Rand Paul Shores Up Super PACs and Ad Producers
description: Rand Pauls nascent campaign is coming into focus, and so is the shape of the super PAC supporting the Kentucky senator and 2016 presidential hopeful.

title: Giving the Poor Easy Access to Healthy Food Doesnt Mean Theyll Buy It
description: In 2010, the Morrisania section of the Bronx was what is commonly called a food desert: The low-income neighborhood in New Yorks least-healthy county had no nearby grocery store, and few places where its residents could easily buy fresh food.

title: Miller Theater Season to Offer Present and Past, With an Eye to the Future
description: The coming season of Miller Theater at Columbia University will showcase the present with its Composer Portraits series focusing on contemporary music, the past with early-music concerts and the future with a new holiday program aimed at children and families that it hopes to make an annual tradition.

title: U.S. Urges Greece to Reject Russian Energy Project
