description: UNITED NATIONS  The uproar over allegations of child sexual abuse by French soldiers in Central African Republic spread on Friday, as the United Nations top human rights official accused France of delays in investigating its troops, the United States pressed for an inquiry, and the United Nations faced new scrutiny over the accountability of peacekeepers who exploit civilians they are sent to protect.

title: White House Moves to Fix 2 Key Consumer Complaints About Health Care Law
description: WASHINGTON  The White House is moving to address two of the most common consumer complaints about the sale of health insurance under the Affordable Care Act: that doctor directories are inaccurate, and that patients are hit with unexpected bills for costs not covered by insurance.

title: The Police Car Provides a Home on the Job, and a False Sense of Safety
description: The white van matched the description of a vehicle involved in a number of recent robberies, so the two police officers followed, pulling the van over in St. Albans, Queens, that morning.

title: Dillon Gee Is Out, Noah Syndergaard Is Up, and David Wright Has a Setback
description: The Mets pitching has been superb so far in the still-young season, and after six weeks, the team has a comfortable lead in the National League East. But its resurgence has been Metsian: Every time the team seems to be playing well, with momentum going in its direction, bad news follows.

title: Visa and Visa Europe Are Said to Consider Reunification
description: Visa is in early discussions to reunite with its former European unit, bringing together two businesses that have operated separately for eight years, a person briefed on the matter said on Friday.

title: A Wartime Anniversary for Planes and Memories
description: WASHINGTON  The headline act in Washingtonon Fridaywas the array of dozens of fighter planes and bombers from World War II that buzzed past the citys monuments to mark the 70th anniversary of the Allied victory in Europe.

title: W.H.O. Urges More Care in Naming Diseases
description: No more animal names like swine flu, monkeypox and mad cow. Avoid place names like Spanish flu, Rift Valley fever, West Nile virus, Lyme disease and Ebola (a river in the Democratic Republic of Congo).

title: Kurdish Leader Agrees to Accept Arms on U.S. Terms in Fight Against ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  The politically charged debate over whether the United States should directly arm Kurdish fighters in their battle against the Islamic State appeared to have been eased on Friday when Massoud Barzani, the president of Iraqs Kurdish autonomous region, said he was prepared to accept weapons delivery whatever way the administration chooses.

title: Georgia: Transgender Inmate to Be Transferred
description: The Department of Corrections on Friday gave Ashley Diamond, a transgender inmate and prison rape victim, what a federal judge refused to grant her in April: a transfer to a medium-security prison. The department, which previously maintained that Ms. Diamond was properly placed at Georgia State Prison, transferred her to Jack T Rutledge State Prison after she was touched on the face by another inmate during a group activity and then received a sexually explicit and threatening note from another inmate at a religious service. Ms. Diamond, who has sued corrections officials, charging that they have failed to protect her, had asked the federal judge to order the state to transfer her; he had declined to second-guess state authorities. Ms. Diamond, a transgender woman and nonviolent offender, has been housed primarily in mens maximum-security prisons; her prior stay at Rutledge was the only time during her incarceration that she was not sexually victimized, her lawsuit said.

title: A Syracuse Lacrosse Team Transformed a Sport, Clung to a Disputed Title and Lost a Trophy
description: The banner still hangs defiantly inside the Carrier Dome, recognizing what many in lacrosse contend was the greatest college team ever.

title: Confessions of a Major League T-Ball Coach
description: It was an honor, during the off-season, to have been interviewed for a job as a big-league manager of the Tampa Bay Rays. I wasnt chosen to run their show, so I elected to develop my managerial chops another way. And while I wont have the luxury of having the Rays star third baseman, Evan Longoria, in my lineup, who knows? I may have the future Evan Longoria.

title: Kevin Na Leaves Yips Behind to Take Share of Lead at Players Championship
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla.  From his perch in the television tower, David Duval believed he could see inside Tiger Woodss head on Thursday at the Players Championship. It looks like hes thinking about every position through the entire golf swing, said Duval, who twice supplanted Woods at No. 1 in 1999 for a total of 15 weeks. That has handcuffed him both physically and between the ears.

title: Frustrated Jury in Etan Patz Trial, but No Rancor for the Holdout
description: Three weeks ago, seven men and five women entered a windowless room in a courthouse in Lower Manhattan to decide the fate of Pedro Hernandez, who had confessed to killing 6-year-old Etan Patz decades earlier. After a long trial, they easily dispatched what could have been a vexing issue standing between them and a guilty verdict: the absence of a body.

title: One Constant forAdam Skelos in a Life of Stumbles: His Powerful Father
description: Adam Skelos jumped from high school to high school, touching down at three in three years. As an employee, he frequently changed jobs and displayed a variable degree of commitment to his work: At least one employer  the re-election campaign of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg  stopped paying him because he stopped showing up for work.

title: Alex Rodriguez Sets Sights on 3,000 Hits, and a Spot BesideDerek Jeter
description: With No. 661 in the rearview, and the next home run milestone  Babe Ruths 714  well out of reach for the foreseeable future, the next historical marker in Alex Rodriguezs career is 3,000 hits.

title: Bryce Petty Is Latest to Board Jets Quarterback Carousel
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Turnovers ultimately led to the demise of Mark Sanchez as Jets quarterback. He committed 26 in 2011  throwing 18 interceptions and losing eight fumbles  before being guilty of the same numbers in the same fashion the following season.

title: Maurice Flanagan, 86, Dies; Made Dubai a Hub With Emirates Airline
description: Maurice Flanagan, a founding manager of Emirates, the airline that put Dubai on the global map, died on Thursday at his home in London. He was 86.

title: Ex-Police Chief in Mexico Known for Crackdowns Is Shot
description: MEXICO CITY  The former chief of police in Tijuana and Ciudad Jurez, two border cities that once ranked among the most violent in Mexico but calmed under his tenure, was shot and seriously wound Friday in an attack in Juarez that appeared to be carried out by hit men, the authorities said.

title: When Humans Declared War on Fish
description: ON Friday we humans observed V-E Day, the end to one part of a global catastrophe that cost the planet at least 60 million lives. But if we were fish, we would have marked the day differently  as the beginning of a campaign of violence against our taxonomic classes, one that has resulted in trillions of casualties.

title: Too Many People in Jail? Abolish Bail
description: CHICAGO  HOW can we reduce the enormous populations of our countrys local jails?

title: The Battle for DuPont
description: Though the DuPont Company has been trying to persuade me otherwise, I feel safe in saying that Trian Fund Management is one of the better shareholder activists around. Led by Nelson Peltz, 72, it takes stakes in good companies that, in its view, are struggling operationally. It then seeks board representation, from which vantage point it examines the company from top to bottom and presses the rest of the board to make changes that will raise the stock price.

title: A Moment to Fix New Yorks Housing Laws
description: What a rare opportunity New York has been given, now that the federal prosecutor Preet Bharara has delivered two ferocious kicks to the anthill of Albany, leaving politicians and deal makers dazed and blinking in the light.

title: Surgeons Closing Line
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Ill tell you exactly what sold me on this puzzle by Kristian House. It was the DOCTOR WHO/BIDET crossing. My day is always made by a reference to the DOCTOR, and the crossing clue for BIDET (Johns accompanier) is just fabulous.

title: The Alamo and Walmart
description: Have you noticed that Utah doesnt seem to be worried about a military takeover?

title: Hillary Clinton and the Super Trough
description: Just weeks after her ringing call to get unaccountable money out of politics, Hillary Rodham Clinton is reversing course and joining the super PAC sweepstakes for unlimited donations from big check writers.

title: More Assaults on Fair Pay
description: Lawmakers trying to repeal laws that ensure fair pay for workers on publicly financed projects should recall what happened to President George W. Bush. Shortly after Hurricane Katrina hit in 2005, he suspended the law that required contractors to pay the locally prevailing wage on federally financed construction projects. At the time, a truck driver in New Orleans typically made around $9 an hour; an electrician, about $14. Apparently that seemed like too much.

title: Rookie Andrew Robustelli Brings Familiar Name to Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  When Andrew Robustelli walked into the Giants headquarters and training complex last month, he saw something very familiar.

title: Obama, Visiting South Dakota, Checks Off 50th State
description: WATERTOWN, S.D.  President Obama checked the final state off his to-do list with pomp and circumstance on Friday as he delivered the commencement address at a community college here, just a bit off the beaten track.

title: Catholic Women: A Progress Report
description: To the Editor:

title: Defending the Emergency Room
description: To the Editor:

title: A New Slogan for Texas
description: To the Editor:

title: Helping Fast-Food Workers
description: To the Editor:

title: Take Andrew Jackson Off the $20 Bill
description: To the Editor:

title: Government Arrogance on Surveillance
description: To the Editor:

title: Judge Holds Officers Actions in Fatal Shooting Immune, Except for Final Bullet
description: The chaos that surrounded the 2009 death of Mauricio Jaquez, an emotionally disturbed man, in his Bronx apartment, was undisputed: He had threatened his family, and then stabbed with a knife at police officers who had responded, the authorities said. The officers used a Taser and rubber bullets, before shooting him five times with live ammunition, court records show.

title: Recalling Police Officer at His Funeral
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York and Police Commissioner William J. Bratton spoke at the funeral of Officer Brian Moore, who was fatally shot last Saturday.

title: Defeat for Matt Harvey, but Not All Is Lost: His Favorite Hockey Team Survives
description: PHILADELPHIA  Matt Harvey had not exactly had a good day at work. He felt off. He struggled stringing together what would normally be typical pitch sequences. He made two critical outs at the plate. He took his first loss in six starts this season. And the Rangers, his favorite hockey team, were heading to overtime in an elimination playoff game.

title: Craving a Goal, the Rangers Get Two to Beat the Capitals
description: All the Rangers needed was one goal, or else. They had scored twice in their previous nine periods, befuddled by a goaltender stopping pucks like nobody else in these playoffs. They needed it to extend the game, the series, their season.

title: Australian Teenager Is Accused of Planning Terrorist Attack
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The police on Saturday charged a teenager with planning a terrorist attack after officers found three improvised explosive devices in his home in a suburb of Melbourne.

title: Andrew Miller Notches 13th Save as Yankees Beat Orioles
description: Since the opening week of the season, Manager Joe Girardi had never acknowledged what was growing more apparent game by game  that Andrew Miller, not Dellin Betances, was the Yankees closer.

title: North Korea Says It Test-Fired Missile From Submarine
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea said Saturday that it had successfully test-fired a ballistic missile from a submarine.

title: Derrick Roses Buzzer-Beater Gives Bulls a Pivotal Win Over the Cavaliers
description: CHICAGO  As a sustained, deafening roar filled the United Center late Friday night, Derrick Rose jogged the length of the court to the Chicago Bulls bench, did a 180-degree leap into the arms of Joakim Noah and rested in his teammates embrace for a moment, a blank expression on his face.

title: Uber Fund-Raising Points to $50 Billion Valuation
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Uber is fund-raising again.

title: Rangers Let Henrik Lundqvist Stay on the Ice to Add to His Uncanny Record
description: Rangers goalie Henrik Lundqvist has been through playoff elimination games so often these last four years, he can probably visualize them in his sleep.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 2 P.M. (FX) WANDERLUST (2012) Jennifer Aniston and Paul Rudd star as Linda and George, out-of-work Manhattanites unable to sell their microloft in the West Village. Then they stumble onto Elysium, an intentional community in rural Georgia, where good vibrations  and not a little smoke  fill the air. Established decades earlier by Carvin (Alan Alda), now in a wheelchair and battling memory loss, and his hippie friends, the commune is home to a touchy-feely guitar-strumming collage led by Seth (Justin Theroux), a creepy Lothario; and a novelist and nudist (Joe Lo Truglio) who wears the occasional sanitary pouch (like a hairnet, but lower) when hes crushing grapes for homemade wine. Part of what gives this movie unexpected resonance is that Linda and George have joined only somewhat voluntarily, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times about this mostly funny comedy from David Wain. Like other Americans seeking simplicity and maybe a chicken coop out back, they want off the road, at least for a while. Theres something touching about this desire, though Mr. Wain doesnt let Linda and George fly their freak flags for long.

title: Corrections: May 9, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: This man did it. He said it. How many times does a man have to confess before someone believes him?

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Accused of Spying for China, Until She Wasnt
description: On Monday, Oct. 20, 2014, Sherry Chen drove, as usual, to her office at the National Weather Service in Wilmington, Ohio, where she forecast flood threats along the Ohio River. She was a bit jet-lagged, having returned a few days earlier from a visit to China. But as she headed to her desk, she says, she had no reason to think it was anything other than an ordinary day. Then her boss summoned her.

title: Legal Marijuana Faces Another Federal Hurdle: Taxes
description: DENVER  Money was pouring into Bruce Nassaus five Colorado marijuana shops when his accountant called with the bad news: The 2014 tax season was approaching, and Mr. Nassau could not rely on the galaxy of deductions that other businesses use to reduce their tax bills. He was going to owe the Internal Revenue Service a small fortune.

title: Liberia Is Declared Free of Ebola, but Officials Sound Note of Caution
description: The World Health Organization declared Liberia free of Ebola on Saturday, making it the first of the three hardest-hit West African countries to bring a formal end to the epidemic.

title: After Wresting Tikrit From ISIS, Iraqis Face Sectarian and Tribal Tensions
description: ALAM, Iraq  The area around the Iraqi city of Tikrit is a panorama of blight, littered with the remnants of battle against the Islamic State: burned-out cars and empty mortar casings, roads made jagged from bombs. At one checkpoint, a militiaman sits with his laptop. At another, there is a pink folder on a table. Inside each are thousands of names of people suspected of being militant fighters or collaborators.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took viewers from Central Park to a remote village in Nepal, where a mother mourned the death of her son.

title: Indonesia President,Joko Widodo, Pardons Prisoners in Papua Province
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The leader of Indonesia on Saturday pardoned five political prisoners in Papua Province as part of an effort to address human rights abuses in the countrys restive eastern region.

title: Harry Trumans Extreme Home Makeover
description: If you walked into the White House today, you might think you were entering the mansion whose construction began in the 1790s under the supervision of President George Washington. But in fact, except for the four exterior walls, todays presidential residence is almost entirely a 1952 imitation of the original.

title: When Doormen Refuse Deliveries
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Joel Peterson of JetBlue on Listening Without an Agenda
description: This interview with Joel Peterson, chairman of JetBlue Airways and founder of Peterson Partners, an investment firm, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword Puzzle
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  You have to give Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon credit for at least one thing (actually, we should give them credit for a lot of things, but stay with me here): They really know how to hit the puzzle sweet spot. I dont think I have ever done a Cox/Rathvon puzzle that I havent thoroughly enjoyed.

title: Thieves Stole Her Money, but Not Her Debit Card
description: The Haggler fears debit cards. They have a direct line to your bank account, which means that a fraudster could drain your savings in a busy afternoon. You would find out only after you visited an A.T.M. and it snickered when you tried to withdraw $20.

title: The Sweet Science of Syrup
description: Paul Weyant, 30, is a tree tapper for Crown Maple, based in Dover Plains, N.Y.

title: The Plagiarism Jitters
description: A few years ago, I went out for a night at the opera, right after approving a book review I had written that would soon be sent to the printer, posted on the Internet and generally released into the world.

title: Veterans Battle for Jobs on the Home Front
description: Recently, in the midst of an effort to persuade store managers to hire veterans, I talked to a human resources executive at a major retail chain. She told me she wanted to do the right thing and hire veterans, but added that she was also concerned by reports that many had returned home with post-traumatic stress disorder and other problems. She worried that a veteran could possibly pose a threat to customers and other employees.

title: Billionaire Lifts Marco Rubio, Politically and Personally
description: MIAMI  One day in the State Capitol in Tallahassee, Marco Rubio, the young speaker of the House, strayed from the legislative proceedings to single out a lanky, silver-haired man seated in the balcony: a billionaire auto dealer named Norman Braman.

title: Egyptian Court Upholds Mubarak Verdict
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian court on Saturday reconfirmed a corruption conviction of former President Hosni Mubarak amid signals from the authorities that he may soon be released.

title: An App That Helps Drivers Earn the Most From Their Trips
description: When Steve Smith began driving for Uber and Lyft several months ago, he concentrated on picking up passengers near his Walnut Creek neighborhood in the San Francisco Bay Area.

title: Clip From La Sylphide
description: Sterling Hyltin and Joaquin De Luz of New York City Ballet in August Bournonvilles La Sylphide, staged by Peter Martins.

title: Liberia Conquers Ebola, but Faces a Crisis of Faith
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  It decimated hospitals, schools, families, fortunes and, for many, even their faith.

title: Fees on Mutual Funds Fall. Thank Yourself.
description: Wall Street is reaping mounting revenue from mutual funds and exchange-traded funds, yet investors are paying lower fees.

title: Be Direct and Low-Key to Defuse Discord at the Office
description: Unpleasant though it may be, conflict in the workplace is inevitable. In fact, its often necessary to get things done. But why is some conflict healthy and constructive, while other disagreements escalate out of control?

title: Pitcher Serves His Country, Then Aids Cardinals
description: ST. LOUIS  Mitch Harris was 29 years old when he threw his first pitch in a major league game. It was two weeks ago in Milwaukee, and he was stepping into an emergency. The St. Louis Cardinals had just lost their best pitcher, Adam Wainwright, to an Achilles injury that would end his season.

title: Scott Walker Woos South Carolina G.O.P. With Tough Talk on Terror
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin told Republicans gathered here how the last time he was in town he swung by the local Harley-Davidson shop and picked up a T-Shirt  and before taking the stage, he even tweeted a picture of himself in the shirt.

title: Bobby Jindal Offers Rare Praise for Hillary Clinton
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  With Mothers Day following the Freedom Summit here in South Carolina, Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana was able to compliment Hillary Rodham Clinton during a news conference.

title: Appeal to Dwindling Core Proves Costly for Labour Party in Britain
description: LONDON  The Labour Partys defeat in Thursdays British elections was its poorest performance in nearly 30 years.

title: Jeb Bush Defends Religious Freedom at Liberty University
description: Jeb Bush delivered a forceful defense of religious freedom from a secular government during a speech at an evangelical university on Saturday, deploring the rise of coercive federal power under President Obama that he said was seeking to impose progressive dogma on the countrys faithful.

title: British Actors Broadway Run Includes Soccer and Baseball
description: This was not a true day off  the three actors had to perform in a matinee in a couple of hours a few blocks away at the Gerald Schoenfeld Theater. But it was a holiday for Michael Elwyn, Rufus Wright and Geoffrey Beevers to sit at the bar of Hurleys Saloon on a recent Sunday morning to watch their beloved Premier League football.

title: Reader Tips on Finding a Partner Using Indian Marriage Sites
description: India now has more than 1,500 matchmaking sites, giving parents  and potential brides and grooms  thousands of choices to help arrange modern marriages while allowing families to adhere to longstanding traditions regarding caste and religion.

title: Maryland Women, in Big Ten, Find Exposure for Their Lacrosse Dominance
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J.  At a morning shootaround on May 1, several hours before her top-ranked team was set to play Ohio State in the semifinals of the inaugural Big Ten womens lacrosse championship, Maryland Coach Cathy Reese chatted with Kara Lentz, a Big Ten Network broadcaster. Lentz said she would interview Reese that night at halftime if Maryland were ahead or if the game were tied.

title: Lost in Translation (Personal and Trivial)
description: My office excavations have now dug down to a primitive early level in my history, containing various translations of my first trade book, The Age of Diminished Expectations. The Italians, it seems, wanted to put a Hannibal Lecter spin on it:

title: See Death as a Triumph, Not a Failure
description: EIGHT years ago, my sister-in-law suddenly died. Soon after, I began research on a book about attitudes toward death in the Victorian period. The more I learned about the practices of the past, the more I regretted not having known about them earlier, when my bereavement began. I found psychological  and even philosophical  reasons to prefer the Victorian celebration of death.

title: Despite DNA, the Rapist Got Away
description: ROBBINS, Ill.  NATASHA, 14, had just gotten off the school bus after ninth-grade basketball practice one evening and was walking home on a quiet street beside a creek. When she heard footsteps behind her, she thought it was one of her classmates.

title: Whats the Point of a Professor?
description: ATLANTA  IN the coming weeks, two million Americans will earn a bachelors degree and either join the work force or head to graduate school. They will be joyous that day, and they will remember fondly the schools they attended. But as this unique chapter of life closes and they reflect on campus events, one primary part of higher education will fall low on the ladder of meaningful contacts: the professors.

title: Invite Some Germs to Dinner
description: WITH the recent recalls of millions of gallons of ice cream as well as several tons of hummus, pine nuts, frozen vegetables and various meat products, you might think the American food supply is an unholy mess. Its not. Its arguably the safest in the world.

title: The Roots of Poverty
description: Readers react to a column by David Brooks about the barriers to social mobility.

title: How Hillary Is Winning
description: AS fleetly as Hillary Clinton vacuums up the money, she piles up the paradoxes.

title: Beyond the Iran Nuclear Deal
description: President Obamas meeting with Arab leaders this week is an opportunity to reassure the deeply skeptical Gulf states that Americas engagement and probable nuclear deal with Iran is not a threat but an opportunity for regional stability.

title: The Suicide of Britain
description: FOR much of European history, empire was the normal political arrangement: Large, polyglot, multiethnic and eventually multireligious, with a monarch on top and a jostling confederation underneath.

title: How Racism Doomed Baltimore
description: The Baltimore riots threw a spotlight on the poverty and isolation of the African-American community where the unrest began last month. The problems were underscored on Friday when the Justice Department, in response to Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blakes request, started an investigation of the Police Department, which has an egregious history of brutality and misconduct.

title: John Urschel
description: John Urschel is an offensive lineman for the Baltimore Ravens as well as a mathematician who has had his research published in peer-reviewed academic journals in his free time.

title: The Real Problem With Americas Inner Cities
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  THE recent unrest in Baltimore raises complex and confounding questions, and in response many people have attempted to define the problem solely in terms of insurgent American racism and violent police behavior.

title: Russia Marks Victory Day
description: The Victory Day parade marks the 70th anniversary since the capitulation of Nazi Germany.

title: Goalie Finds Perspective After Losing Track of a Shot in a Title-Game Loss
description: BOSTON  The locker room door at TD Garden had just closed, and goalie Matt OConnor, after his final game at Boston University, rose to address his devastated teammates.

title: Rift Forms in Germany Over Asylum
description: TUTZING, Germany  A bronze statue of St. Joseph, bending protectively over the Holy Family, stands at the center of a bubbling fountain outside the St. Joseph Church in this Bavarian village.

title: Vows | Ever After, Ever After
description: When some mothers realized cancer might rob them of a long life, they decided to take their daughters wedding dress shopping.

title: Verbatim: Marco Rubio on Terrorists
description: Senator Marco Rubio, quoting from the movie Taken during a speech Saturday at the South Carolina Freedom Summit Hosted by Citizens United, on his strategy to combat terrorists.

title: Verbatim: Ted Cruz on the Garland, Tex., Attacks
description: Senator Ted Cruz, speaking about last weeks attacks in Garland, Tex., during a speech Saturday at the South Carolina Freedom Summit in Greenville.

title: Denise McCluggage, Auto Racing Pacesetter, Dies at 88
description: Denise McCluggage, a trailblazing auto racer and journalist who shattered stereotypes about women as professional drivers, died on Wednesday in Santa Fe, N.M., where she had lived since the late 1970s. She was 88.

title: Monsoons Near, Nepal Focuses on Sanitation to Stem Illness After Quake
description: PAUWATHOK, Nepal  After years of intense effort, officials here in rural Sindhupalchok district had persuaded almost all of the nearly 61,000 households to each build a toilet. Then the earthquake struck, destroying most houses  and the very toilets that could have helped stave off the diseases that can run rampant after natural disasters.

title: Scientists Praise Contributions of Two Dutch Explorers Who Perished on Arctic Sea Ice
description: Ten days ago, the grinding slow-motion rivers of floating sea ice flowing around Canadas Arctic archipelago claimed the lives of Marc Cornelissen and Philip de Roo, seasoned Dutch polar trekkers combining an adventurous spirit with environmental activism and citizen science.

title: Rafael Nadal Reaches Madrid Open Final, Gaining Momentum on Clay
description: MADRID  Rafael Nadal is putting his wobbly clay-court season back on track at the Madrid Open as he prepares his bid to win a 10th French Open title.

title: Rangers Desperate Playoff Moments Feel Familiar, as Does Their Relief
description: Still wearing his goaltenders pads, Henrik Lundqvist leaned back in his locker, exhausted and soaked with perspiration as he replenished himself with fluids.

title: Battle Tested, Ukraine Troops Now Get U.S. Basic Training
description: YAVORIV, Ukraine  The exercise, one of the most fundamental in the military handbook, came off without a hitch. A soldier carrying a length of rope and a grappling hook ran to within 20 feet or so of a coil of concertina wire and stopped.

title: Reliable Fill-In Sputters, Along With Yankees Offense
description: Even with the Yankees in first place in their division, Manager Joe Girardi understands that his ball club must be handled delicately, given the advanced age of some of his players, the inexperience of others, and the teams relievers, who have been overworked early in the season.

title: In the Jury Room, 18 Days of Debate and Disagreement End in a Frustrating Mistrial
description: It was just before1 p.m.on Fridaywhen 11 jurors who were part of one of the longest deliberations in recent years gave up any hope of swaying the 12th person on the panel.

title: Jameis Winston Files Countersuit Against Accuser
description: Jameis Winston has filed counterclaims against the woman who accused him of rape, responding to her lawsuit Friday in federal court in Orlando, Fla., by denying the accusations she lodged last month and accusing her of defaming him and attempting to hinder his career.

title: Obama Calls Elizabeth Warren Absolutely Wrong on Trade Deal
description: WASHINGTON  Escalating the fight with his own liberal base, President Obama, in an interview posted online on Saturday, took on Senator Elizabeth Warren, a champion of the left, by suggesting that she was motivated by politics in her battle against his proposed Pacific trade accord.

title: Happily Fitting Into the (Cheese) Mold
description: There are plenty of ways to get to know Valley Shepherd Creamery, the dairy farm Eran Wajswol established in Long Valley in 2003 to make his sheep, goat and cows milk cheeses.

title: The Cost of Issuing Free Throws
description: The parade to the foul line was nearly endless during Game 2 of the Western Conference semifinal series on Wednesday. Between a strategic attempt by the Los Angeles Clippers to send the Houston Rockets Dwight Howard to the line as often as possible and James Hardens uncanny ability to draw fouls, it was hard to find the action between the free-throw attempts.

title: True to Spanish Tradition, Despite Its Name
description: The small plate trend started on Long Island over a decade ago, when the Spanish tradition of tapas came into vogue. Nowadays, restaurants are calling their small plates tapas no matter the provenance of the cuisine. Viaggio Tapas, despite its name (Italian for journey), is a true Spanish tapas restaurant.

title: Family History on a Plate
description: Bob Solano was 10 years old when he started working at the Lincoln Lounge, the restaurant his parents owned in Mount Vernon. His job then was to sort the beer bottles.

title: A Roast, Long-Tested, and Other Reinventions
description: Central Connecticut chicken lovers have been smiling since midwinter, when the husband-and-wife team of K. C. and Jaime Ward opened Rooster Company in the center of Newington. The Wards worked together for years at Bricco in West Hartford, and in conceptualizing a restaurant of their own, they decided to base it on a favorite culinary mainstay. I bought a small rotisserie, Mr. Ward said with a laugh, and practiced for six months in our kitchen. Now he has graduated to a 21-bird Alto-Shaam model, which he uses to prepare his organic free-range rotisserie chickens.

title: Review: Elevada at Yale Rep Is a Sitcom of a Play
description: Meet Ramona and Khalil, your opposites-attract romcom pairing for the night. Before getting together for drinks, they peruse each others online profile. Shes bubbly and quirky; hes nerdy and sweet. After a bumpy start to their first date, they reach the cute zone, with twists that give their potential coupling something play-worthy to overcome. But because theyre in the hands of Sheila Callaghan, a prolific and whimsically theatrical writer, you can expect something more adventurous than what this first scene appears to offer.

title: Nice and Naughty, Across State Lines
description: Seven cultural institutions in Connecticut and New York are hosting seven coordinated shows in the months ahead, each addressing one of the seven deadly sins. In addition, a film series is planned.

title: Ciencia With Other Subjects for Latino Children on the East End
description: As the president of the Childrens Museum of the East End, Stephen Long has gotten occasional ribbing by fellow museum professionals from outside the region.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Dolans Stewardship Taints Knicks

title: Seven Museums, Each Offering a Deadly Sin
description: In one of her poems, Emily Dickinson called sin a distinguished precipice. With a coming group of art exhibitions, museumgoers can stand on that precipice and look all the way down.

title: Ben Carson on God, Country, and His Ailing Mom
description: GREENSVILLE, S.C.  Ben Carson, appearing at the South Carolina Freedom Summit here on Saturday, used his first major appearance alongside his rivals since he formally entered the Republican presidential field to focus on economic and fiscal issues, while imbuing his remarks with repeated references to God and faith  and demonstrating the sort of thoughtful, studied way of speaking that he acquired as a neurosurgeon.

title: 1935 Poem
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Its always impressive when a constructor can not only build a puzzle but also fit an entire poem inside. Thats exactly what Jacob Stulberg has done today, although I needed help seeing it.

title: Suspects in Freddie Gray Case: A Portrait of Baltimore Police in Miniature
description: BALTIMORE  The first police officer Freddie Gray encountered on the morning he sustained a fatal spinal cord injury was Lt. Brian Rice, a seasoned 41-year-old white law enforcement officer who, several years earlier, had his guns confiscated by deputies who took him to a hospital after a worried ex-girlfriend expressed alarm about his well-being.

title: Transformer Burns at Indian Point; Cuomo Cites Potential Environmental Risks
description: A transformer failure occurred at the Indian Point nuclear power plant in Buchanan, N.Y., on Saturday, sending plumes of black smoke into the air and raising concerns that the foam used to extinguish the flames could pose an environmental hazard.

title: A Ziegfeld Club Lingers On
description: The club, founded in 1936, has outlasted the women it was formed to help. It is ready for an encore.

title: Kenan Evren, 97, Dies; After Coup, Led Turkey With Iron Hand
description: Gen. Kenan Evren, who led a military coup in Turkey and then imposed the harshest repression in his countrys history, leading to his trial and conviction more than 30 years later, died on Saturday in a military hospital in Ankara. He was 97.

title: Mets Top Pitching Prospect Noah Syndergaard Lands, With Time to Get Acquainted
description: PHILADELPHIA  He arrived, found his locker and slipped on his uniform, the one with the last name stretched tightly across his shoulders and around his number like a horseshoe. The clubhouse was quiet, but Noah Syndergaard was early, eager to begin his big-league career as soon as possible.

title: Republican Hopefuls Push a Muscular Foreign Policy
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  A group of Republican presidential hopefuls gathered here Saturday to advocate a more muscular foreign policy and to criticize the man they hope to succeed for what they described as a weak and misguided approach to international affairs.

title: Want to Honor Mothers Day? Take a Selfie.
description: I do not have anyone to buy a Mothers Day gift for, but let me make a suggestion for those who do  get a selfie with your mom. It will be worth far more than any knickknack or bauble you could ever buy her or yourself.

title: Medals and Memories for Jewish Veterans From Russia
description: Leonid Rozenberg sat on his walker, his wrists draped over its aluminum arms and his suit lapels dripping with war medals, as a crush of Russians of all ages jostled to get closer. Some offered red carnations, which he slipped into spaces in the frame of the walker. Others carried cameras, or pointed at his gold-and-silver chest, trying to elicit a story.

title: Contenders Crowd Lead in Deep Field at the Players Championship
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla.  If the talent pool in mens golf were any deeper, the winners each week would be speared by frogmen. A day after Jordan Spieth, the 21-year-old Masters champion, bowed out of the Players Championship, Justin Thomas, 22, moved into contention with a 10-birdie performance at the Stadium Course at TPC Sawgrass.

title: Playing Through Pain Can Be Selfless, as Well as Senseless
description: I watched Friday as delirious Chicago Bulls fans celebrated after Derrick Rose banked in a 3-point shot with no time left to give his team a 99-96 victory and a 2-1 series lead over the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: Campus Debates on Israel Drive a Wedge Between Jews and Minorities
description: LOS ANGELES  The debates can stretch from dusk to dawn, punctuated by tearful speeches and forceful shouting matches, with accusations of racism, colonialism and anti-Semitism. At dozens of college campuses across the country, student government councils are embracing resolutions calling on their administrations to divest from companies that enable what they see as Israels mistreatment of Palestinians.

title: Outlander Recap: Boogie Woogie Road Trip
description: Season 1, Episode 14: The Search

title: Derrick Rose Is Making Strides in His Return to Form
description: CHICAGO  For a player known for long, sweeping drives to the basket, Derrick Rose has shown a notable ability to navigate a path of small and incremental steps.

title: Scott Walker Offers Few Details on Planned Israel Trip
description: Gov. Scott Walker, Republican of Wisconsin, has been reserved about commenting on his coming trip to Israel. He has called it a listening tour, saying, we wanted to make it an educational focus, not just a media trip.

title: Rare Homer by Juan Lagares Leads Mets to Win Over the Phillies
description: PHILADELPHIA  A backhand stop at short, a quick turn at second and an impressive stretch by first baseman Lucas Duda enabled the Mets to turn a clutch double play in the eighth inning Saturday night and preserve a narrow 3-2 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies at Citizens Bank Park.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Catch up on the weeks top stories.

title: Englands Coach Fired for a Second Time
description: Peter Moores was fired as coach of the England team by the England and Wales Cricket Board, and the former captain Andrew Strauss was given the new role of director of cricket. Moores has lost the job of England coach on two occasions, having initially been fired from the post in 2009 after a conflict with Kevin Pietersen, who was then the captain. Mooress second spell in charge, which came after he replaced Andy Flower following the teams 5-0 thrashing in the Ashes in Australia in 2014, lasted just over a year.

title: Transformer Burns at Indian Point; Cuomo Cites Potential Environmental Risks
description: A transformer fire at the Indian Point nuclear power plant in Buchanan, N.Y. sent plumes of black smoke into the air on Saturday and raised concerns that the foam used to extinguish the flames could pose an environmental hazard.

title: Meghan Zimmerman, Michael Stuart
description: Meghan Elizabeth Zimmerman and Michael Joseph Stuart were married Saturday at the Country Club of York in York, Pa. The Rev. Hayley Vay, a Lutheran minister, officiated.

title: Julia Erickson and Aaron Ingley
description: Julia Elizabeth Erickson and Aaron Harlin Ingley are to be married Sunday evening at Sodo Park, an event space in Seattle. James G. Kontos, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, is to officiate.

title: Lauren Allen, Zachary Yost
description: Lauren Michelle Allen and Zachary Matthew Yost were married Saturday evening at Pine Hollow Country Club in East Norwich, N.Y. Rabbi Aaron Bergman officiated at a ceremony led by Michael Brooks, the former executive director of the University of Michigan Hillel.

title: Lowena Tam and Raymond Lee
description: Lowena Hai Yan Tam, a daughter of Hai Yan Lu Tam and Siu Hung Tam of Philadelphia, was married Saturday to Raymond Lee, the son of Pei Lu Yang and Douglas Lee of New York. Lewis Chang, a friend of the groom who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the grooms parents home.

title: Alexandra Rosencrans, Nathaniel Abrams
description: Alexandra Gail Rosencrans, a daughter of Charles A. Rosencrans of Washington and the late Cynthia J. Rosencrans, was married Saturday evening to Nathaniel Brave Abrams, a son of Ginny S. Edlavitch of Washington and Michael D. Abrams of Washington. Rabbi Gary Sherman officiated at the St. Regis Bal Harbour Resort in Bal Harbour, Fla.

title: Leslie Ackerman, Anthony Diaz
description: Leslie Ellen Ackerman and Anthony Diaz are to be married Sunday at Battery Gardens in Manhattan. Raphael Rosenblatt, a cousin of the bride who was ordained as a Universal Life minister for the occasion, is to officiate.

title: Nicole Nemeth, Nirav Seth
description: Dr. Nicole Lea Nemeth and Nirav Subodh Seth were married Saturday at the Buena Vista Estate in New Castle, Del. Pandit Vinod Ravel, a Hindu priest, officiated.

title: Kimberly Peyser, Gregory Barry
description: Kimberly Alyssa Peyser and Gregory Collin Barry were married Saturday evening at the Hotel Monaco in Washington. The ceremony was led by James A. Peyser, an uncle of the bride, who received authorization from the District of Columbia as a temporary officiant.

title: Amy Rosenberg, Alexander Bavifard
description: Amy Lauren Rosenberg and Alexander Aidon Bavifard were married Saturday at the Round Hill Mansion, a party space in Washingtonville, N.Y. Lauren Miller, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Kathleen Singer, Francesco Leuthold
description: Kathleen Claire Singer and Francesco Alfred Leuthold were married Saturday at St. Mary Star of the Sea Church in Longboat Key, Fla. Msgr. Gerard Finegan, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: A Camping Invitation Turned the Tide
description: Sally Logan Gibson, the daughter of Sarah B. McConnell and Robert R. Gibson of Charlottesville, Va., was married Saturday evening to Ali Nouri, a son of Afagh Kamali and Mohsen Nouri of Portland, Ore. The brides father, who received permission to officiate by the Circuit Court of the City of Charlottesville, led the ceremony at Ash Lawn-Highland, the former residence of President James Monroe in Charlottesville. Nilou Nouri, the sister of the groom and a minister with American Marriage Ministries, took part in the ceremony, which included the reading of Persian and American vows.

title: Karen Silberg, David Richman
description: Karen Shira Silberg and David Philip Richman are to be married Sunday evening at the National Museum of Women in the Arts in Washington. Rabbi Jessica Minnen is to officiate.

title: Taraneh Nazem and Ali Kouros
description: Dr. Taraneh Gharib Nazem, the daughter of Susie Gharib and Fereydoun Nazem of New York, was married Saturday evening to Ali Kouros, the son of Avid Kouros and Saeed Kouros of Tehran. William J. Corbett, who retired as the acting village justice of Floral Park, N.Y., officiated at the New York Public Library, where the brides father presided over a traditional Persian ceremony in which he offered marital advice and read Persian poetry.

title: Mara Harwel, Jasper Frank
description: Mara Elliott Harwel, the daughter of Janet K. Welch and George W. Hare of East Lansing, Mich., was married Saturday to Jasper Lowy Frank, a son of Patricia F. Lowy and Daniel H. Frank of New York. Mayme Hostetter, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister, officiated in the Peristyle, a neoclassical pavilion in City Park in New Orleans.

title: Sometimes, a Little Lie Helps
description: Lauren Elizabeth Freeman and Peter Macy Milligan were married Saturday by the Rev. Jason D. Harris at Central Presbyterian Church in New York.

title: Leah Hoffheimer, Daniel Broder
description: Leah Friedman Hoffheimer and Daniel Scott Broder were married Saturday at the Valley at Frutig Farms in Ann Arbor, Mich. Rabbi Ilana G. Baden officiated.

title: Brooke Grossman, Michael Mure
description: Brooke Samantha Grossman and Michael Joseph Mure were married Saturday at the Hatch Interdenominational Chapel at Mount Sinai Hospital in New York. The Rev. Enid Kessler of the New Seminary Church officiated, with Rabbi Stuart Paris taking part.

title: Richmond Ellis II and Thomas Jayne
description: Richmond Bryant Ellis II and Thomas Gordon Jayne were married Saturday by the Rev. Stephen Gerth, an Episcopal priest, at the Church of St. Mary the Virgin in New York.

title: Eliza Wright, David Rappaport
description: Elizabeth Risher Wright, the daughter of Sallie S. Wright and Robert P. Wright of Houston, was married Saturday to David Geoffrey Rappaport, a son of Margaret F. Rappaport of Ann Arbor, Mich., and Paul M. Rappaport of Bloomfield Hills, Mich. Thomas R. Phillips, a retired chief justice of the Texas Supreme Court who is a law partner of the brides father, officiated at the home of the brides maternal aunt and uncle, Elizabeth and Stuart Smith, in Waco, Tex.

title: Zoe Hirsch and Brian Zaro
description: Zoe Lynn Hirsch, a daughter of Jane B. Hirsch and Stuart B. Hirsch of Clifton, N.J., was married Saturday evening to Brian Eric Zaro, a son of Keri Zaro and Stuart D. Zaro of Armonk, N.Y. Rabbi David Greenberg officiated at the Palm House at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

title: Lauren Ostling, Benjamin Pensak
description: Dr. Lauren Rose Ostling and Benjamin Henry Pensak were married Thursday at the Mauna Kea Beach Hotel in Waimea on the Island of Hawaii. The grooms father, Dr. Myles L. Pensak, became a Universal Life minister to officiate.

title: Sarah Gleich, Seth Lynn III
description: Sarah Beth Gleich and Seth McCormick Lynn III were married Friday by Rabbi Sarah Tasman at the United States Naval Academy Miller Chapel in Annapolis, Md.

title: Lindsay Scott, Wells Winfrey
description: Lindsay Winfield Scott and Wells Millar Winfrey were married Saturday evening at Stella Plantation, a working plantation and event space in Braithwaite, La. The Rev. Steve Trahan, an Assemblies of God minister, officiated.

title: Meghan Curtiss, Benjamin Webb
description: Meghan Duff Curtiss and Benjamin Goodall Webb were married Saturday at Carlouel Yacht Club in Clearwater Beach, Fla. The Rev. Ronnie Norman, an uncle of the groom and a Church of Christ minister, officiated.

title: Julie Stein, Adam Freelander
description: Julie Iris Stein and Adam Nathan Freelander were married Saturday. Rabbi Todd Markley officiated at Cedar Lakes Estate in Port Jervis, N.Y.

title: Whitney Valins and Terence Tan
description: Dr. Whitney Elizabeth Valins and Terence Perez Tan were married Monday at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Edwina Townes, a staff member of the New York City clerks office, officiated.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: You cant just label this something racial. When you have three African-American officers involved, youve got to say: Wait a minute, is there a system in place in which they dont want to tell on each other? Has it become a routine?

title: 4 Arrested After 2 Mississippi Police Officers Are Killed During Traffic Stop
description: Law enforcement officials in Mississippi said Sunday that they had arrested four people after the fatal shooting of two police officers in Hattiesburg, and that two of the suspects had been charged with capital murder.

title: Whats on TV Sunday
description: 3 P.M. (FX Movie Channel) THE GIRL WITH THE DRAGON TATTOO (2011) Daniel Craig stars as a Swedish journalist hired by an industrialist (Christopher Plummer) to investigate the disappearance of his niece 40 years earlier in this adaptation of the Stieg Larsson novel, directed by David Fincher. Rooney Mara, above, in an Oscar-nominated performance, is Lisbeth Salander, the vulnerable yet ruthlessly competent computer hacker who helps him solve the mystery. She is a marvelous pop-culture character, stranger and more complex than the average superhero and more intriguing than the usual boy wizards and vampire brides, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. It has been her fate, unfortunately, to make her furious, uninspiring way through a series of plodding and ungainly stories. And despite the slick intensity of Mr. Finchers style, his movie is not immune to the same lumbering proceduralism, Mr. Scott said.

title: Corrections: May 10, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: An Obama Plan to Stop Foreign Hackers Has Mixed Results
description: Two years ago, the Obama administration announced a new strategy to curb online espionage.

title: Obamas Pacific Trade Push Faces a Senate Vote This Week
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas most aggressive and sustained legislative push since the Affordable Care Act faces a crucial first test this week when a divided Senate considers a bill that would grant him accelerated power to complete a massive trade accord with 11 nations across the Pacific Rim.

title: Houthi Rebels Agree to 5-Day Cease-Fire in Yemen
description: SANA, Yemen  Houthi rebels here said on Sunday that they had agreed to a five-day cease-fire proposed by Saudi Arabia that would allow humanitarian relief supplies to be delivered to the country, according to statements carried by a Houthi news agency.

title: China Cuts Rates to Halt a Slide in Its Economy
description: SHANGHAI  Hoping to shore up a weakening economy, China said on Sunday that it would cut benchmark interest rates for the third time in five months.

title: 1915: Italy Stands Ready to Enter the Great War
description: MILAN  Despatches from Rome state that Italys neutrality is inexorably nearing the end. The Agenzia Nazionale says that the last term set by Italy for Austrias reply expires to-morrow [May 11] at midday. If by that time Austria fails to reply, or the reply is different from what Italy desires, negotiations will be considered as broken off.

title: 4 Countries Ground Military Transport Planes After Crash
description: PARIS  Four of the five countries that operate the Airbus A400M military transport plane said on Sunday that they were temporarily grounding their fleets after a fatal crash during a test flight near the southern Spanish city of Seville.

title: Street Artists and a Bottled Water Company Clash Over a Hashtag
description: On its journey from outlaw roots to mainstream acceptance, graffiti has gone from quickly drawn tags inside subway cars to elaborate murals adorning entire sides of buildings. Street art has spread globally, giving color and attitude to urban enclaves, and following a long tradition of urban cool going mainstream, it has been embraced by marketers to promote everything from music and clothing to political causes and charities.

title: Doctors Group Recounts Migrant Rescue as E.U. Plans Crackdown on Smuggling Rings
description: UNITED NATIONS  Loaded with life jackets, medics and search-and-rescue teams, the ship sailed from port in Malta early last Thursday morning in search of migrants stranded at sea.

title: Chelsea Handler on the State of Late Night
description: Ms. Handler is the former host of Chelsea Lately, which aired on E! The questions and answers below have been edited and condensed.

title: Seth Meyers on the State of Late Night
description: Mr. Meyers is the host of Late Night With Seth Meyers on NBC. The questions and answers below have been edited and condensed.

title: Venice Biennale Awards Announced
description: VENICE  The envelopes have been opened and the lions held happily aloft. An international jury for the 56th Venice Biennale awarded the Golden Lion for best artist in the fair to Adrian Piper, an American artist living and working in Berlin, whose work has turned a shrewd conceptual eye for more than four decades on questions of race, gender and belonging.

title: James Corden on the State of Late Night
description: Mr. Corden is the host of the Late Late Show With James Corden on CBS. The questions and answers below have been edited and condensed.

title: Encores! Season Will Feature Sondheim and 1776
description: Do I Hear a Waltz?, a musical by Richard Rodgers and Stephen Sondheim, which played 220 performances on Broadway in 1965 and hasnt been seen in a major New York production since, is coming back  for a long weekend, at least. The show, a romance set in Venice, with a book by Arthur Laurents based on his play The Time of the Cuckoo, will close out the 2015-16 Encores! season at City Center.

title: Jimmy Kimmel on the State of Late Night
description: Mr. Kimmel is the host of Jimmy Kimmel Live! on ABC. The questions and answers below have been edited and condensed.

title: The Evolution of Late Night
description: David Lettermans departure is in some ways the end of an era in late night television. A look back at the evolution of the format.

title: As Letterman Moves On, Late-Night Success Is Unmoored From TV
description: It was a typical week for late-night television: On NBCs Tonight show, the host Jimmy Fallon played a catchphrase guessing game with the Modern Family star Sofia Vergara, and re-enacted the music video for the 1990 rock ballad More Than Words.

title: Cuomos Push to Raise Wages Lifts Spirits of New Yorks Fast-Food Workers
description: The fast-food workers converged on Union Square in Manhattan last week, chanting and cheering and celebrating a man who some had viewed as a reluctant champion of their cause: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York.

title: 1940: Germany Invades Low Countries and Luxembourg
description: A French newsreel from 1940 showing German troops entering Belgium, Luxembourg and the Netherlands. (Ina.fr)

title: Avengers: Age of Ultron Still Tops at Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES In the olden days of movie marketing, extravagant ad campaigns could solve anything. Terrible movie? No matter. Just throw open the promotional flood gates and a sizeable crowd reliably turned up on opening weekend.

title: Whos Your Broadway Crush?
description: Helen Mirren, Bradley Cooper, Patricia Clarkson and other Tony Award nominees reveal their crushes of the stage.

title: Ral Castro Meets With Pope Francis at Vatican
description: ROME  President Ral Castro of Cuba visited Pope Francis at the Vatican on Sunday, praising the Argentine pontiff for helping to broker last years diplomatic breakthrough between Cuba and the United States while declaring that Francis had inspired him to consider returning to the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Mike Huckabee Defends Endorsement of Diabetes Product
description: Mike Huckabee, the Republican presidential candidate, defended his endorsement of a dubious diabetes remedy on Sunday, telling an interviewer that if thats the worst thing somebody can say to me then Im going to be a heck of a good president.

title: Networks Fret as Ad Dollars Flow to Digital Media
description: Beginning Monday, television networks will roll out the red carpet for marketers during the annual bazaar known as the upfronts, trying to lure them into committing tens of billions of ad dollars for the coming TV season. If things go well, the networks will sell as much as 75 percent of their advertising time in the negotiations that follow a week of flashy presentations and star-studded parties.

title: 2 Shot, One Fatally, After Fight Outside Inwood Nightclub, Police Say
description: As the nightclub closed in Upper Manhattan early Sunday morning, an argument broke out among a group of patrons, as it sometimes does. But this time, tensions escalated, and shots were fired, leaving one man dead and another hospitalized.

title: Nico Rosberg Holds On for Victory in the Spanish Grand Prix
description: Barcelona  The Spanish Grand Prix on Sunday was a throwback to the kind of classic races that Formula One has almost always had at the track in Montmelo, just outside Barcelona: There was little action and little overtaking; the entire race was about strategy, like a game of chess.

title: Friendships Arising From Boston Marathon Horror Offer Solace
description: BOSTON  Survivors of the Boston Marathon bombings have squeezed into the courtroom on days of great interest, listening to graphic descriptions of their pain while the man who caused it has sat impassively at the defense table. Some have made it their mission to be here as much as they can. Others pay attention only occasionally, while some prefer to ignore the debate over whether the defendant, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, should be put to death for the 2013 attack.

title: Elizabeth Wilson, Tony Winner With a Foot in Hollywood, Dies at 94
description: Elizabeth Wilson, an actress who distinguished herself onstage, on television and in films like The Graduate and 9 to 5 in supporting roles that were often meaty but rarely glamorous, died on Saturday in New Haven. She was 94.

title: Rand Paul Plays Down Comments on Military Exercise After Mockery
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky has been mocked by liberal pundits who accused him of fanning conspiracy theories about a military exercise along the Texas border, an event that some on the far right believe is a covert effort to impose martial law.

title: Uber Funding Talks Highlight the Speedy Pace of Investments
description: Uber raised a total of more than $2 billion from investors in June and December last year  and is now back for another round. The anonymous messaging start-up Yik Yak collected $73.5 million in three financing rounds in seven months, and Zenefits, a human resources start-up, raised more than $580 million in less than two years, with the latest deal done last week.

title: Pop Cube
description: Scenes from the event at BRIC House in Brooklyn.

title: Levine Conducts First Double Bill At Met Opera Since 2005
description: It wasnt long ago that it seemed that James Levine might never conduct a Metropolitan Opera performance again. After suffering a serious spinal injury, Mr. Levine was sidelined for two full seasons starting in 2011; a brilliant and exhaustive career seemed to be in its twilight.

title: Retailers Results, Board Vote at DuPont and Shareholder Meetings
description: Here are some of the top business stories to pay attention to in the coming week.

title: Michael Pineda Pitches Like an Ace in Dominating the Orioles
description: Early Sunday, Manager Joe Girardi acknowledged that Michael Pinedas starts were becoming special occasions, befitting a clubs ace pitcher.

title: The Artful Lodgers
description: A rustic, family-run inn once favored by the likes of Picasso and Matisse, La Colombe dOr in Provence still offers simple country pleasures  albeit amidst some of the worlds most iconic masterworks, casually bestowed by its famous guests.

title: Review: LUV: American-Style, a Rennie Harris Dance Work
description: As kids and adults settled into their seats at the New Victory Theater on Saturday, rock anthems by Bon Jovi and Guns N Roses set the mood. At the same time, projected text informed the audience about the disproportionate incarceration rates of African-American youth. A police officer jokingly arrested an audience member for using his cellphone, and then a hip-hop dance show began.

title: Eurozone Ministers to Meet Again on Greek Debt
description: BRUSSELS  Finance ministers from eurozone countries were scheduled to meet here on Monday as Greece drew perilously close to running out of money and defaulting on its debt. Still, the likelihood of an imminent deal with the leftist government in Athens continued to look remote.

title: Review: PC Music and Sophie in a High-Concept Extravaganza at BRIC House
description: Pop means a lot of conflicting things to the label and Internet phenomenon PC Music and to the D.J. and producer Sophie, who shared a high-concept extravaganza at BRIC House in Brooklyn on Friday night as part of the Red Bull Music Academy Festival.

title: Review: Thought Crimes: The Case of the Cannibal Cop on HBO
description: Hes not a cannibal, the accused mans mother says. He never ate anyone. Isnt that the true definition of a cannibal, is someone that eats human meat?

title: Review: A Peter Eotvos Premiere and Schubert at the New York Philharmonic
description: It takes gumption for a composer to write a one-act opera intending it to be paired with Bluebeards Castle, Bartoks chilling one-act masterpiece.

title: Mets Beat Phillies, Buoyed by Fringes of the Roster
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Mets called up catcher Johnny Monell as the backup to the backup early last week, and not surprisingly, he sat. He waited. He made his team debut Saturday, grounded into a double play and cursed his fate, unsure of when another opportunity might be tossed to him.

title: I.M.F. and Central Bank Loom Large Over Greeces Debt Talks
description: Greek leaders have fought fiercely in recent months with politicians from other European countries over relief on Greeces vast debt load.

title: NJPAC Announces New Season
description: The Frank Sinatra Centennial train rolls along. The New Jersey Performing Arts Center announced its 2015-16 lineup of more than 120 performances Sunday, including several tributes to Sinatra, who was born in New Jersey in 1915.

title: Review: Carolyn Montgomery-Forant, Back on the Cabaret Stage With Stories and Laughter
description: Carolyn Montgomery-Forant, a singer, songwriter and humorist who recently returned to the cabaret stage after an extended sabbatical, has the gift of gab. When this smart, complicated storyteller sings, you dont pay attention to the notes as much as you follow the performances conversational flow. Although she has a reasonably strong singing voice, what captures your attention is the clarity and gusto with which she puts her personal stamp on lyrics, whether her own or someone elses.

title: Review: Bach, Revisited Series Features Ensemble Signal
description: With its Bach, Revisited series, the Miller Theater at Columbia University says it seeks to prompt a dialogue between contemporary composers and this Baroque master. But recently that conversation has been faltering. Writing in The New York Times, of a concert pairing Bach with the composer Michael Gordon, the critic James R. Oestreich had trouble making out any connection. How, he asked, did the Bach half relate to the Gordon half?

title: Shakespeare & Company Caught in Its Own Drama
description: LENOX, Mass.  The trees are finally budding in the Berkshires, and the summer houses, both theatrical and residential, are beginning to stir.

title: Saudi Arabia Says King Wont Attend Meetings in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  Saudi Arabia announced on Sunday that its new monarch, King Salman, would not be attending meetings at the White House with President Obama or a summit gathering at Camp David this week, in an apparent signal of its continued displeasure with the administration over United States relations with Iran, its rising regional adversary.

title: Jane the Virgin Ends a Strong First Season
description: It is possible to be a pregnant virgin. That was the starting joke of the CWs Jane the Virgin. The first season will end on Monday, having delivered another miracle: A TV show that taps into the oldest stereotypes about Hispanic-Americans and turns them upside down.

title: French Fare for New York City Ballet
description: Scenes from New York City Ballets all-Balanchine quadruple bill.

title: In Talks With Merkel, Putin Calls for Improving Relations With Europe
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin used a visit on Sunday by the German chancellor, Angela Merkel, to call for a return to normal relations with Europe, brushing aside the widespread boycott by Western leaders of the huge Victory Day parade on Red Square a day earlier.

title: Venice Biennale Pavilions for Iraq, Ukraine and Syria Reflect Strife at Home
description: VENICE  When Mosul, Iraqs second-largest city, fell to the Islamic State in June, members of the Ruya Foundation, an Iraqi nonprofit that set up the countrys pavilion at the last Venice Biennale, considered scrapping all plans for this years exhibition. With all this carnage and death and rape, how could you even think of culture? said Tamara Chalabi, chairwoman of the foundation.

title: Review: David Gates Delivers More Havoc in A Hand Reached Down to Guide Me
description: Malice and goodness duke it out in the dark hearts of David Gatess characters. The malice comes in endless varieties  conscious, buried, self-destructive, jealous, spiteful, sexual, snobbish, druggie, fiendish and breathtakingly awful, to name only a few. The goodness is more limited. It might as well be. This writer, critic and teacher, whose books until now have included only two scalding novels, Jernigan (1991) and Preston Falls (1998), and one short story collection, The Wonders of the Invisible World (1999), rarely gives it a fighting chance.

title: Chinas Anti-Corruption Campaign
description: Sniffing out the tigers and flies.

title: A Baltimore Neighborhood, Wary and Healing, Prepares for Preakness Day
description: BALTIMORE  Soon after Candy Thomas moved into a rowhouse one block from Pimlico Race Course a few weeks ago, a neighbor asked her if she was ready for Preakness Stakes weekend.

title: Review: Major Barbara at Brave New World Repertory in Brooklyn
description: There is no Salvation Army center in Brooklyn Heights, but this month you can hear a few of its soldiers beating drums and banging tambourines at the First Unitarian Church on Pierrepont Street. The Brave New World Repertory Theater, dedicated to performing new and classic plays in Brooklyn, has recruited the chapel to stage George Bernard Shaws Major Barbara, about a Salvation Army officer (Grace Rao) and her munitions-manufacturer father (David Frutkoff).

title: Review: Serving 4 Helpings of Balanchine, With Thunderbolts and Tornadoes
description: Why dont we see George Balanchines exquisite pas de deux Sonatine more often at New York City Ballet? Choreographed in 1975 to Ravels three-movement solo piano piece of that name, its an intricate, spellbinding vehicle for sensitive dancers. Although Balanchine originally made it for Violette Verdy and Jean-Pierre Bonnefoux as the opening of his Ravel festival, he soon revived it for Patricia McBride and Mikhail Baryshnikov (1979, for City Ballets European tour) and later for the radically dissimilar Suzanne Farrell and Peter Martins.

title: Internet Image File
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  The last time we saw Joe DiPietro, he was cutting up by slicing through a set of theme answers, but today, hes putting ALL OF himself into his first Monday puzzle.

title: Cartoon Network Upbeat as Ad Season Begins
description: LOS ANGELES  Few television companies will have a better story to tell advertisers during this weeks upfront presentations than Cartoon Network. According to Nielsen, ratings have climbed 16 percent over last year among children 2 to 11 even as its rival Nickelodeon has fallen 31 percent.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of May 11
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: LeBron James Stuns Bulls, and Boo Birds, With Shot at the Buzzer
description: CHICAGO  The boos rumbled through United Center when LeBron James was introduced on Sunday afternoon, and they reverberated again whenever he sized up a defender or backed him down, whenever he dribbled the ball up the court or held it for longer than a split second.

title: Sky Pods Whisk Riders Through Skyline
description: The new elevators at 1 World Trade Center feature an animation that makes riders feel like they are flying around the buildings of the Financial District.

title: Elevators Descent at Trade Center Will Offer a Virtual Aerial View

title: A Backstage Golf Guru Unclutters His Mind to Take a Shot at the U.S. Open
description: Dominic Scaglione Jr., who plays Frankie Valli in the Broadway musical Jersey Boys, sometimes stops and asks for a tip from his teacher before going onstage to sing Sherry or Big Girls Dont Cry.

title: Patriots Fans Around Boston Stand by Tom Brady
description: BOSTON  James Michael Curley, the four-term mayor of Boston in the last century, once won election to public office while in prison for fraud. If Bostonians could forgive that transgression to support their political hero, then surely the mysterious loss of air pressure from a few footballs will not alter their support of their favorite sports hero.

title: A Chasm Divides David Cameron and Nicola Sturgeon, Leaders of a Kingdom Still United
description: GLASGOW, Scotland  He just won an unexpected majority in Britain; she won a landslide in Scotland. He has promised a continuation of budgetary austerity; she wants to put an end to welfare cuts. He wants to keep Britains family of nations together; she wants Scotland to break away.
