description: Jeb Bush on Tuesday sought to arrest a chorus of criticism from Democrats and some conservatives after he told an interviewer that, knowing what history has since shown about intelligence failures, he still would have authorized the 2003 invasion of Iraq.

title: Prosecutor in Cannibal Cop Case Asks Appeals Court to Reinstate Conviction
description: A prosecutor asked a federal appeals panel on Tuesday to reinstate the kidnapping conspiracy conviction of Gilberto Valle, a former New York police officer who had been accused of plotting online to abduct, torture, kill and eat women.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: You told me that you believed in me, and that was the day I decided to dedicate my childhood to jazz.

title: Capitals Ward Seeks Another Signature Moment in the Postseason
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  In Game 7 of the 2012 Eastern Conference quarterfinals, Washington Capitals forward Joel Ward took a backhanded swing at a loose puck and sent it tumbling past Boston Bruins goalie Tim Thomas in overtime. With that goal, the Bruins, the defending Stanley Cup champions, were eliminated from the postseason, and Ward entered the annals of postseason heroes.

title: Crew Change on International Space Station Is Delayed
description: Following the failed launch of a Russian resupply rocket, NASA and its space agency partners decided on Tuesday to delay three astronauts return from the International Space Station, according to officials.

title: This Summer, Brooklyn Bazaar Heads to the Bathhouse at Jacob Riis Park
description: Over the last few years, Rockaway Beach in Queens has become a haven for foodies and hipsters in search of tacos, lobster rolls and surf. But to the west along the Rockaway Peninsula, the giant Art Deco bathhouse at Jacob Riis Park, a National Park Service property, stood all but abandoned. Renovation work that began in the 1990s stalled, and then came a one-two punch of Tropical Storm Irene and Hurricane Sandy.

title: Group Supporting de Blasios Agenda Is Said to Draw Interest of Ethics Panel
description: A political group run by close allies of Mayor Bill de Blasio has attracted the interest of a New York State ethics panel, which is concerned that the group could be violating lobbying rules, according to two people familiar with the inquiry.

title: Seattle Port Votes to Delay Drilling Rigs on the Way to Alaska
description: SEATTLE  The Port of Seattles board voted Tuesday to ask that the arrival of Shells Arctic drilling rigs be delayed, bowing to a wave of public pressure by protesters and city officials over the companys plans to drill this summer off the coast of Alaska and use Puget Sound as a home port.

title: Amtrak Train Derails in Philadelphia, Killing at Least 5 and Injuring Dozens
description: PHILADELPHIA  At least five people were killed and dozens more were injured when an Amtrak train carrying 243 people derailed here on Tuesday, shutting down service in the Northeast region, the authorities said.

title: Campaign for One New York Memo
description: A letter from the Campaign for One New York, which was created by Mayor Bill de Blasios consultants to raise money and attention for his political agenda.

title: Camp Taji Incident Report Declassified After 12 Years
description: The Iraq Survey Group said that in 2003, more than 20 American soldiers at Iraqs Camp Taji were exposed to a carcinogen and poisonous chemical.

title: SharpshootingLeBron James Goes All Out as Cavaliers Top Bulls
description: CLEVELAND  The perfectionist in LeBron James had frowned on the inefficient way he played in the first four games of the Eastern Conference semifinals, the way he dominated the ball, shoveled up contested shots and committed a multitude of turnovers. The pragmatist in James, though, knew the misses and miscues were a necessary byproduct of putting a beat-up team on his back.

title: Regrets? Yankees Have a Few in Defeat
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  When the Yankees have played well, and even when they have not, they have generally played with veterans poise. They have rarely been ruffled or made to look as if they were anything other than calm and in control while rolling up the best record in the American League six weeks into the season.

title: Noah Syndergaards Mets Debut Has Smooth Start and Bumpy End
description: CHICAGO  In his major league debut Tuesday night, Noah Syndergaard faced the Chicago Cubs, a team that not long ago was considered a possible trade destination for him.

title: Amtrak Train Derails in Philadelphia
description: Amtrak Train 188 crashed in Philadelphia.

title: North Korea Said to Execute a Top Official, With an Antiaircraft Gun
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The second-highest officer in North Koreas military was recently executed as a traitor for showing disrespect for the nations leader, Kim Jong-un, South Korean intelligence officials told lawmakers here Wednesday.

title: At Frieze, Artists Trash Is Collectors Treasure
description: We probably should have just done what was expected of us and sold standard contemporary art to support Bidoun, but we tend to be at a bit of a right angle to convention, says the Bidoun senior editor Negar Azimi of the project conceived by the publishing and nonprofit curatorial outfit when it was offered a complimentary booth at Frieze New York this year. Can you imagine saying no to a Wade Guyton work and taking his shoes instead? Azimi, and Bidouns creative director Babak Radboy, had long been fascinated with the culture of collecting  often at great expense  disposable celebrity ephemera. Babak has trolled around the Internet looking at the sales of such oddball items as the Justin Bieber hairball, Marilyn Monroes chest X-ray, Britney Spears pregnancy test or Kurt Cobains credit card, Azimi says. All fascinating and occasionally terrifying.

title: Collared, Sleeved and Oh-So-70s
description: Polo shirts get the retro treatment this summer with graphic prints, close fits and nostalgic colors.

title: What Chrissy Teigen Thinks She Looks Like: Kid Rock
description: In this new series for T, notables from the worlds of fashion, art, design and entertainment illustrate their responses to a brief questionnaire, revealing their favorite things, darkest secrets  and how they see themselves and the world around them.

title: Private Jet Travel Takes Off
description: Private-jet travel has long been synonymous with luxury, but in recent years its become something else: big business. The post-Sept. 11 security apparatus and the rise of the one percent have made flying private an increasingly attractive option. First came NetJets, which expanded the clientele beyond plane-owning plutocrats to those interested in part-time shares. Now, on-demand and membership-based apps like JetSmarter, BlackJet and Beacon have proliferated, driving the per-person price of private flights closer to that of commercial first class and making hailing a Learjet as easy as ordering up an Uber. Here, an inside look at one of travels fastest growing sectors.

title: A Rothko Tops Sothebys Contemporary Art Auction
description: It was a hard act to follow. Just one day after Christies raised $705.9 million from its experimental auction of cherry-picked 20th-century masterworks, Sothebys responded with a mainstream evening sale on Tuesday that aimed to remind the art world that there is more than one auction house in New York.

title: Word of the Day | palette
description: palette  \pa-lt\  noun

title: Facebook Begins Testing Instant Articles From News Publishers
description: MENLO PARK, Calif.  Facebooks long-rumored plan to directly host articles from news organizations will start on Wednesday, concluding months of delicate negotiations between the Internet giant and publishers that covet its huge audience but fear its growing power.

title: Voters in Arkansas Tourist Town Uphold Anti-Discrimination Law
description: Residents in the small Arkansas tourist town Eureka Springs voted Tuesday to uphold an ordinance to prevent discrimination based on sexual orientation or gender identity, rejecting an argument by opponents that the measure could harm tourism and force churches to host same-sex weddings and receptions.

title: Disunion: A Call for Your Questions
description: Submit your questions for a virtual Civil War panel discussion featuring Disunions contributors and friends.

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 1:20 A.M. (Starz) BLUE JASMINE (2013) Cate Blanchett, above with Peter Sarsgaard, won an Oscar for her role as Jasmine French, a Park Avenue matron fallen on hard times after her husband, Hal (Alec Baldwin), lands in prison for bilking his clients, leaving her with little more than her pearls, Chanel jacket, Herms bag and Louis Vuitton luggage. Destitute, in a manner of speaking, Jasmine flies first-class to San Francisco to begin life anew with her sister, Ginger (Sally Hawkins), whose scrappy existence and brutish men Jasmine can barely stomach without self-medicating with vodka and Xanax. Then she meets a diplomatic type (Mr. Sarsgaard) with an appreciation for her decorating talents and designer threads and starts to see light at the end of her dark tunnel. With intimations of Ruth Madoff and Blanche DuBois, this shattered woman is brilliantly brought to quivering life by Ms. Blanchett, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times, in Woody Allens most sustained, satisfying and resonant film since Match Point.

title: South Korean Reservist Goes on Shooting Rampage Before Killing Himself
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A South Korean Army reservist shot and killed a fellow soldier and wounded three others at a firing range on Wednesday before committing suicide, a Defense Ministry spokesman said.

title: Editors Note: May 13, 2015
description: NATIONAL

title: Twice-Shot Prey
description: Take an antelope, a wild boar, a caribou, a hippopotamus and a bear. Such a menagerie might sound like the setup for a riddle, but Pierre Abensur portrays this unlikely herd alongside the hunters who took them down.

title: Death Penalty for Bomber?
description: To the Editor:

title: Great In-Flight Reads
description: To the Editor:

title: Stand Your Ground Laws
description: To the Editor:

title: Transporting Oil by Train
description: To the Editor:

title: Water Use in Portola Valley, Calif.
description: To the Editor:

title: The Bitter Backdrop to 2016
description: Already the polling for the presidential race is feverish, with new findings daily. Which Republican is leading in New Hampshire? How do voters feel, at any evanescent moment, about Hillary Clinton?

title: Moores Law Turns 50
description: SAN FRANCISCO  On April 19, 1965, just over 50 years ago, Gordon Moore, then the head of research for Fairchild Semiconductor and later one of the co-founders of Intel, was asked by Electronics Magazine to submit an article predicting what was going to happen to integrated circuits, the heart of computing, in the next 10 years. Studying the trend hed seen in the previous few years, Moore predicted that every year wed double the number of transistors that could fit on a single chip of silicon so youd get twice as much computing power for only slightly more money. When that came true, in 1975, he modified his prediction to a doubling roughly every two years. Moores Law has essentially held up ever since  and, despite the skeptics, keeps chugging along, making it probably the most remarkable example ever of sustained exponential growth of a technology.

title: La Guardia Airport: Fix It or Shut It?
The Rohingya Refugees, Adrift
description: Thousands of people, both Muslim Rohingyas fleeing persecution in Myanmar and Bangladeshis seeking jobs in Malaysia, have been abandoned at sea recently in Southeast Asia by smugglers fearing arrest as Thailand cracks down on human traffickers. At least 8,000 people are in peril, yet the Southeast Asian nations off whose shores they drift have been reluctant to save them.

title: Overkill on a C.I.A. Leak Case
description: Would America really be safer if Jeffrey Sterling had been sentenced to more than 20 years in prison?

title: Let Our Cities Move
description: EVERY day, millions of Americans rely on a remarkable network of roads, bridges, subways, trains and buses to connect us to work, school and opportunity. But our transportation system, once the envy of the world, is in jeopardy.

title: Test Yourself | A Vacation for 6,000
description: Below are several paragraphs from the May 11 article Chinese Billionaire Takes Over 6,000 Employees on a Trip to France.

title: Deutsche Telekoms Earnings Beat Expections
description: LONDON  Deutsche Telekom of Germany, Europes largest carrier by revenue, on Wednesday reported an 11 percent increase in its pretax profit, as a weak euro and the companys United States operations bolstered its first-quarter earnings.

title: Amtrak Train Derailed Going 106 M.P.H. on Sharp Curve; at Least 7 Killed
description: PHILADELPHIA  An engineer jammed on the emergency brakes just seconds before Tuesdays fatal Amtrak derailment, but the train  traveling at 106 miles an hour, more than twice the speed limit  slowed only slightly, federal authorities said, before hurtling off its tracks, killing at least seven people and injuring more than 200.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Joey Alexander, an 11-Year-Old Jazz Sensation, Who Hardly Clears the Pianos Sightlines
description: In Joey Alexander, an 11-Year-Old Jazz Sensation, Who Hardly Clears the Pianos Sightlines, Nate Chinen writes about jazzs latest media star.

title: East Brunswick, N.J.: Community Gardens, Parks and Highways
description: Despite the cool spring weather, Elora Gupta and her family were trying to get a jump on preparing their plot in East Brunswicks community garden on a recent Sunday afternoon. While Ms. Guptas husband, Samir, leveled the soil, she sorted through the cucumber, tomato and squash seedlings and their son, Shayan, 15, unspooled the community hose.

title: Frances Tiafoe, a Rising U.S. Tennis Player, Shakes Things Up On and Off the Court
description: At 17, Frances Tiafoe, one of the most eagerly anticipated new arrivals for American tennis, has shown up on the doorstep of one of the sports biggest stages far ahead of schedule.

title: The $179 Million Picasso That Explains Global Inequality
description: We dont yet know who agreed to pay $179.4 million for a Picasso in an auction Monday night  or where the money came from, or what motivated that person or persons to spend more than anyone has before for a single piece of art at auction.

title: Mixing Cuisines, Mexicue Moves Beyond the Food Truck
description: When David Schillace told his friends and family in 2010 that he planned to quit his six-figure-salary job in sales and marketing, cash in his 401(k) retirement plan and start a new career selling a blend of Mexican and barbecue food out of a truck on the streets of Manhattan, there was stunned silence. Then came the tears.

title: Michael Heizers Big Work and Long View
description: GARDEN VALLEY, NEV.  One breezy spring day last month, I drove back here to see Michael Heizer at his desert ranch, a compound bordered by cottonwoods and alfalfa. If youve even been in a field of alfalfa with the meadowlarks and the rabbits and the kingbirds, he said, well, thats a God moment. You havent lived until then. Its what has kept me alive.

title: House Approves Revised Measure Banning Most Abortions After 20 Weeks
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Wednesday voted to ban most abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy, approving a revised version of a bill that Republican leaders had abruptly pulled in January amid objections from some of their own members.

title: A Connecticut Exhibit Highlights the Murals of Hans Hofmann
description: GREENWICH, Conn.  There are several ways to appreciate the work of Hans Hofmann, an exuberant Abstract Expressionist who influenced generations of artists.

title: Do Your Friends on Social Media All Have the Same Political Opinions You Do?
description: Do most of your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat and other social media friends seem to have the same basic beliefs about politics, religion and other ideological topics as you do? How can you tell?

title: Karachi Attack Kills Over 40 on Bus Carrying Members of Shiite Sect
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  At least 43 people were killed when unidentified gunmen opened fire on a bus in the Pakistani port city of Karachi early Wednesday, police officials said. The gunmen escaped.

title: Goebbels: A Biography, by Peter Longerich
description: The historical landscape is littered with the wreckage of regimes, many of them defeated after long and bloody struggles, but there is nothing in modern European history quite like the destructive fury with which Hitlers Thousand-Year Reich came to an end. Long after any hope of victory had been extinguished, the governments supporters kept on fighting, killing not only their enemies, both real and imagined, but also many of their fellow countrymen whose commitment to the cause seemed to waver. And finally they began to kill themselves. Among the scores of Germans who committed suicide in Nazi Germanys final hours were Dr. Joseph Goebbels, minister of propaganda and, since July 1944, Reich Plenipotentiary for Total War, and his wife, Magda. Before ending their own lives, they murdered their six children, five girls and a boy; the oldest, Helga, was 12, the youngest, Heide, 4.

title: Waterloo
description: WENT THE DAY WELL?

title: How Facebooks News Feed Will Change on Mobile
description: As my colleague Ravi Somaiya and I reported on Wednesday, Facebook is finally taking the wraps off its instant articles project. The social network will begin hosting some news stories directly on its service, with the intention of serving them up quickly to iPhone users with multimedia enhancements that are not available on the web version of Facebook.

title: A 2-Minute Walk May Counter the Harms of Sitting
description: With evidence mounting that sitting for long stretches of time is unhealthy, many of us naturally wonder how best to respond. Should we stand up, or is merely standing insufficient? Must we also stroll or jog or do jumping jacks?

title: Eurozone Economy Improves, but Finland and Greece Stumble
description: PARIS  The eurozone economy grew modestly in the first quarter, an official report showed on Wednesday, as a surprisingly strong showing in France helped to compensate for a slowdown in Germany.

title: Nicola Sturgeon, Cloaked in a New Mantle of Power
description: The big winner of last weeks election in Britain was unquestionably David Cameron, whose upset majority took pollsters completely by surprise. But running a close second was Nicola Sturgeon, the first minister of Scotland and the leader of the Scottish National Party.

title: In a Mothers Library, Bound in Spirit and in Print
description: In late March, a few days after my mother died from cancer, I sat in a cold living room in the north of England with my two sisters as a lawyer read my mothers last will and testament.

title: Latest Updates: Amtrak Derailment in Philadelphia
Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: A Life in Motion, Stopped Cold
description: PARK CITY, Utah  It was just the top of a mountain, but to Las Souza, poised on her skis a little more than a year ago at the start of the breathtaking run known as Double Jack, it felt like the most thrilling place on earth.

title: New York Today: Down to the Wire for the Rangers
description: Good morning on this clement Wednesday.

title: Toyota and Nissan Recall 6.5 Million More Vehicles Over Takata Airbags
description: For months, the problem of defective airbags made by the Japanese supplier Takata has festered in the auto industry as recalls have mounted and automakers have searched for the reason that the airbags can explode violently, sending pieces of metal into the cabin.

title: Into the Wild
description: I once ate a picnic in a canoe floating down a river. We were in the Prigord, and had expected the French families in boats alongside us to retrieve carefully made lunches from baskets at midday. But all had brought potato chips and sodas or beer instead. They watched us, benevolently jealous, as we laid out chilled artichokes and mayonnaise, Bayonne ham, tiny walnut-studded sausages, Cabecou cheese, figs, little tumblers and a bottle of ros in the canoes deep middle. The Dordogne is a slow river, but it was intoxicating to eat with such nave pomp amid the burbles of small eddies and chirping birds, mingling those two basic impulses of human life: the wild and the tame.

title: The Other Side of the Mountain
description: After an attempt to return to Olympic glory ended in paralysis, Las Souza rebuilds her life one movement at a time.

title: Search for Missing Malaysia Airlines Jet Uncovers Shipwrecks Remnants
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Search crews looking for a Malaysia Airlines jet believed to have crashed in the southern Indian Ocean have found the remnants of a shipwreck  including an anchor and possibly a ships bell  resting on the seabed almost two and a half miles down.

title: Alison Bechdel Misses Feeling Special
description: Youve been very well known for a long time among lesbians for your comic strip, Dykes to Watch Out For. Now a musical adaptation of your graphic novel-memoir Fun Home just opened on Broadway, and last year you won a MacArthur genius grant. How does it feel to become suddenly mainstream? Im so glad it didnt happen when I was younger, because then it would have been all downhill.

title: No Justice, No ... Anything
description: In public appearances and classes this semester, Ive talked about eating better and improving the food system in ways that would enable more of us to do so. Thats a discussion about food.

title: In Cambodia, Along the Path to Something Profound
description: I tiptoed across the wood planks of a wobbly orange boat heading from the riverside town Kampot to the Gulf of Thailand. I burned my bare feet on the shiny outdoor tiles surrounding a Buddhist stupa at Udong, the old capital of Cambodia. Across the country, at the 11th-century ruins of Phnom Banan, I spelunked through deep, damp caverns steeped in legends of magic and superstition. All the way, I followed a Frenchman named Henri. For 16 years and more than 20 trips, he has led me through the heart of this beautiful but knotty country.

title: Can I Change My Name to Avoid Discrimination?
description: Is it ethical to modify my name on a job application to prevent unconscious bias? For instance, if my name were Samantha, I could apply as Sam, or if my name were Jose, I could apply as Joe, to prevent discrimination based on gender or assumed ethnicity. If it is ethical, up to which point may I modify? A.R., LONDON

title: Wisconsin Protesters Vow to Stage Walkout Over Decision Not to Charge Officer
description: Protesters in Madison, Wis., who have been demanding that a police officer face charges in the fatal shooting of an unarmed biracial man during a scuffle vowed to walk out of jobs, schools and businesses on Wednesday, a day after the Dane County district attorney said the officer would not face prosecution.

title: Today in Politics: Trade Measure Is Likely to Make a Quick Return
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington. Senate Democrats pushed back on Tuesday against President Obamas trade agenda, but the legislation may soon get another look. Hillary Rodham Clintons allies start a new super PAC, and Jeb Bush addresses the fallout from his comments on the Iraq war. But this morning, officials are assessing a deadly train crash in Philadelphia.

title: Syrian Film Collective Pulls Out of Venice Biennale
description: Abounaddara, an underground Syrian filmmakers collective participating in the 2015 Venice Biennale and honored with a special mention from the jury on Saturday, confirmed early on Wednesday that it was pulling out of the Biennale and giving back the honor because of an act of censorship.

title: Morning Agenda: Mobile Tech Key to AOL-Verizon Merger
description: MOBILE TECH KEY TO AOL-VERIZON MERGER | AOL has long been derided as an Internet dinosaur, offering dial-up service even as the rest of the world switched to high-speed broadband, but Verizons interest in acquiring AOL can be summed up in one word: mobile, Farhad Manjoo writes in the State of the Art column. Verizons $4.4 billion purchase of AOL is just the latest corporate reaction to a staggering shift in the way people across the globe get their news and entertainment, he writes.

title: G.O.P. Seeks Strategy for Debates Amid Expanding Candidate List
description: WASHINGTON  Republican leaders, searching for a fair-minded but strategically wise way to conduct the presidential primary debates, are grappling with how to manage White House contenders in a sprawling field that mixes proven politicians with provocateurs and reflects an increasingly fractious party.

title: North Korea Fires Artillery Shells Into Sea Near Disputed Border
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea fired dozens of artillery shells into waters near the disputed western sea border with South Korea on Wednesday, the South Korean military said.

title: The Path to Something Profound
description: Exploring the ruins of Angkor Wat and other parts of Cambodia, in the footsteps of the 19th-century explorer and naturalist Henri Mouhot.

title: Shining a Light on Gay-Straight Marriages in China
description: Zhang Beichuan, a medical researcher at the Affiliated Hospital of Qingdao University, collects stories about some of the millions of Chinese heterosexuals who are married to homosexuals. Most of these tales involve deception, and sometimes violence and sexually transmitted diseases. But in an email interview this week, Mr. Zhang wondered whether the deception, and the emotional and physical suffering it brings, might  slowly  be diminishing.

title: With Animals, David Dastmalchian Uses His Past to Rewrite His Future
description: Early in the gritty drama Animals, a couple named Jude and Bobbie, who live in a car in Chicago, steal CDs from a record shop and sell them for cash to buy heroin. Then they head to a diner to shoot it up in adjacent bathrooms. The movie, written by David Dastmalchian, who lost nearly 50 pounds to play Jude, is fiction, but some of its scenarios came from a time when he was an addict himself.

title: One Year Later, 11 Questions for Dean Baquet
description: Talk about a tumultuous 12 months.

title: Live Nation Hires Banker as Its Chief Strategy Officer
description: After drawing on Jordan Zacharys advice for several of its deals, Live Nation Entertainment plans to bring the media banker in house.

title: Nepal School System Left Shattered in Aftermath of Quake
description: CHAUTARA, Nepal  The concrete walls of the high school here shattered like a mirror, leaving a latticework of fissures that crisscross every wall and pillar.

title: Disunion Panel: A Call for Your Questions
description: In 2011, we held a panel discussion featuring an all-star cast of Disunion contributors and friends: David Blight, Ken Burns, Adam Goodheart and Jamie Malanowski.

title: Creep, Version 2.0
description: Dear Diary:

title: With Tesla Entering Market, Hopes for Home Batteries Grow
description: Christian Kasberger, a telecommunications engineer in the Austrian town of Waizenkirchen, wanted to reduce his familys dependence on fossil fuels that help power the electrical grid. So last year he put a battery system in his garage, to store the energy produced by solar panels on his rooftop.

title: Danaher to Acquire Pall for $13.6 Billion and Split Into Two
description: The conglomerate Danaher Corporation said on Wednesday that it would acquire the Pall Corporation, a water filtration systems company, for $13.6 billion in cash and split itself into two publicly traded companies.

title: Burundi General Claims to Oust President Pierre Nkurunziza
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  An army general in Burundi announced on Wednesday that the military had ousted President Pierre Nkurunziza, setting off celebrations in the streets among protesters who had been trying to block the presidents bid for another term.

title: $850,000 Homes in Phoenix, Alaska and New Jersey
description: ANCHORAGE, ALASKA

title: Ana Navarro, Working Hard to Stay in Jeb Bushs Orbit
description: Ana Navarro, a television pundit, Twitter commentator and dial-a-zinger, is often identified as a confidante of Jeb Bush. While people close to Mr. Bush in Florida politics question that status, there is no questioning that she has worked hard to stay in his orbit.

title: Going Places: Franois Roche and Pierre Huyghes Train to Nowhere
description: Performance art might be a thrill, but the new frontier in ultra-exclusive ephemeral happenings transports the viewer  quite literally.

title: Nelson Peltzs Slate Fails to Win DuPont Board Seats
description: A stalwart of corporate America scored a victory against shareholder activism on Wednesday as DuPont defeated a corporate governance challenge by the billionaire Nelson Peltz.

title: Persian Gulf Breach With U.S. Creates Opportunities for France
description: PARIS  The French have been ideally positioned to take advantage of the growing rift in recent weeks between the Arab monarchies of the Persian Gulf and the United States. Representatives of those monarchies met with President Obama on Wednesday to discuss their differences and especially their worries over a proposed nuclear deal with Iran.

title: Britain Trims Growth Forecast, but Signals Hope on Consumer Prices
description: LONDON  The Bank of England expects British consumer prices, which have been stuck at a zero-percent inflation rate for two months, to pick up by the end of the year, as the economy gathers steam.

title: A Sharp Spike in Honeybee Deaths Deepens a Worrisome Trend
description: A prolonged and mysterious die-off of the nations honeybees, a trend worrisome both to beekeepers and to farmers who depend on the insects to pollinate their crops, apparently worsened last year.

title: Daily Report: Facebook to Start Testing Instant Articles
description: Facebooks long-rumored plan to directly host articles from news organizations will start on Wednesday, concluding months of delicate negotiations between the Internet giant and publishers that covet its huge audience but fear its growing power, Vindu Goel and Ravi Somaiya report.

title: A Four-Bedroom Villa Near Rodney Bay With Sea Views
description: The house, in the gated enclave of Mount du Cap, has a pool and is close to beaches, sports and other activities.

title: Real Estate in St. Lucia
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM VILLA WITH SEA VIEWS NEAR RODNEY BAY

title: When Doctors Help a Patient Die
description: The patient was terminally ill. He had decided to end his life under his states death with dignity law, and his doctor prescribed the medication he would use to do it. But his death was unexpectedly delayed because he drank a large soda before taking the medication  an ordinarily lethal dose  and it apparently interfered with the drugs absorption. Ive been told that patients who want to die are now warned not to drink carbonated beverages before or after taking the medication.

title: Macys Falls Short in 1st-Quarter Earnings
description: Bad weather, port congestion and lower spending by tourists because of a stronger dollar all weighed on Macys first-quarter earnings, as profit and sales fell short of expectations.

title: Witnesses on Amtrak Derailment
description: Witnesses described the scene after a New York-bound Amtrak train derailed and overturned late Tuesday in Philadelphia, leaving some passengers dead.

title: 1965: Mrs. Kennedy Stars at Palace
description: LONDON  Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy today made her first public appearance in London since the assassination of her husband  and stole the show from the famed Irish Guards band. Strolling with her two children, Caroline, 7, and John, 4, plus her sister, Princess Radziwill, and the princesss two children and a pair of dogs, Mrs. Kennedy headed an eye-catching party. Outside Buckingham Palace, she halted to catch the changing of the guard when the crowd recognized her. A palace official hurried out and escorted her inside the palace gates. The Irish Guards band filled the air with music as they marched, but the crowds eyes were not on the colorful guardsmen today.  New York Herald Tribune, European edition, May 14, 1965

title: Designing in Milan
description: Giampiero Bodino, who established his own high jewelry line in 2013, sees clients and works at the Villa Mozart, a 1930s mansion.

title: British Flash Crash Trader to Appeal Bail Terms
description: LONDON  Navinder Singh Sarao, the British trader accused of helping cause the stock market flash crash in 2010, will appear in the High Court in London next week to appeal the terms of his bail. Mr. Sarao, 36, has been in jail since he was arrested on April 21.

title: A Woman of Style
description: Terry de Gunzburg, creator of the By Terry makeup and beauty lines, has a jewelry collection that includes diamonds and enameled cherry brooches.

title: Reveling in the 70s
description: Julie de Libran, the artistic director at Sonia Rykiel, sees herself as definitely a 70s girl.

title: The Glittering World of Navajo Jewelry
description: An exhibition at the Smithsonians National Museum of the American Indian in New York showcases the work of the Yazzie family of New Mexico.

title: Sheri Fink and Joshua Horwitz Are Among PEN Award Winners
description: The PEN American Center on Wednesday announced the winners of several of its 2015 PEN Literary Awards.

title: Lively Morgue Tumblr 512  517
description: Lively Morgue Tumblr 512  517

title: Its a Mans World
description: The London jeweler Stephen Webster introduced his male jewelry line 17 years ago and has been growing it ever since.

title: Colors of the Rainbow
description: In Hong Kong, some designers go beyond green jade in creating new jewelry.

title: Police Shoot Hammer-Wielding Man Sought in 4 Manhattan Attacks
description: For two days, beat officers across New York City were on the lookout for a man believed to be the person who had swung a hammer, apparently at random, at the heads of park-goers and others around Manhattan.

title: My Enemy, My Brother
description: In this short documentary, two survivors of a brutal war in the Middle East meet again years later under astonishing circumstances.

title: Out of N.H.L. Playoffs, Sidney Crosby Joins World Championships Chase
description: When the Pittsburgh Penguins were eliminated from the Stanley Cup playoffs in the first round by the Rangers, the season ended for their captain and star, Sidney Crosby.

title: Boston Jury Begins to Consider Sentence for Marathon Bomber
description: BOSTON  After 10 weeks of testimony and more than 150 witnesses, the jury of seven women and five men began the task Wednesday of deciding whether to sentence Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the convicted Boston Marathon bomber, to life in prison without parole or to death.

title: My Enemy, My Brother
description: When I first met Zahed Haftlang and Najah Aboud in Vancouver back in 2012, they seemed like any other Middle Eastern immigrants settling into new lives: Zahed was working as a mechanic, while Najah ran a small furniture moving company. But when I sat down with them over cups of mint tea, their story moved me to tears. Ive been helping them tell it ever since.

title: Chess Grandmaster Fabiano Caruana Switches Nationality and Will Play for U.S.
description: Fabiano Caruana, the No. 3 chess player in the world, who has represented Italy for the last 10 years, is switching federations to play for the United States. The United States Chess Federation announced Caruanas move Tuesday in a statement on its website.

title: Witness Describes Karachi Bus Attack
description: Naeem Adil Sheikh described what he saw at the scene of an attack on Wednesday by gunmen on a bus carrying Shiite Muslims in Karachi, Pakistan.

title: Protests in Burundi Against President
description: Protesters clashed with the police in Burundis capital, Bujumbura, on Wednesday during a demonstration against the presidents bid for a third term amid conflicting reports of his dismissal.

title: Jamie Drake Picks His Favorite Rooms from Four Decades of the Kips Bay Show House
description: The annual event, which tasks prominent decorators with creating dream spaces for a Manhattan home, turns 43 this year.

title: From Guns to Jewelry
description: One cold evening this winter, on the fifth floor of an unremarkable building on West 46th Street, Louis Onty, owner of City Casting, was pouring molten metal into the wax molds his company had created for the jewelry line Liberty United.

title: Vatican to Recognize Palestinian State in New Treaty
description: JERUSALEM  The Vatican announced Wednesday that it would soon sign a treaty that includes recognition of the state of Palestine, lending significant symbolic weight to an intensifying Palestinian push for international support for sovereignty that bypasses the paralyzed negotiations with Israel.

title: Elie Top: Creating His Own Jewelry Line
description: PARIS  In January, Elie Top, best known as the jewelry designer for Lanvin, introduced Maison Elie Top and its first collection, Mcaniques Clestes.

title: Reading Is Fundamental Combats Summer Slide
description: Some of my favorite childhood memories dont spring from my own childhood at all; they are borrowed from the pages of books. I waited for spring with Frog and Toad, helped deliver Grandmothers kiss to Little Bear, and walked to school along the beach in Provincetown on The Day the Whale Came to My Town. I had a lovely childhood on its own, but when amended by the tales on my bookshelf, it was all the more rich, filled with mystery, adventure and most important, learning.

title: Breast-Feeding May Cut Breast Cancer Recurrence Risk
description: A new report suggests that breast-feeding, which has been associated with a reduced breast cancer risk, may have another benefit. In mothers who later develop breast cancer, breast-feeding may reduce the risk of cancer recurrence.

title: European Officials on Migrants Proposal
description: Officials from the European Commission and the European Union on Wednesday discussed a proposal to take in thousands of migrants across Europe over the next two years.

title: Marco Rubio to Outline His Approach to Foreign Policy
description: The Obama Doctrine is a slightly saltier version of Dont Do Stupid Stuff. The Bush Doctrine argued for preventive strikes in the interest of self-defense and national security.

title: Chris Christie Buys the Iraq Line
description: While Jeb Bush was fumbling around with the question of whether he would have authorized the invasion of Iraq, Chris Christie (the governor of New Jersey who is either thinking about running for president or using that idea to pump up his public image and raise money) did not have that problem.

title: E.U. Proposes Quota System to Address Migration Crisis
description: BRUSSELS  After months of criticism that it had been too slow and timid in addressing the flood of migrants heading toward its southern shores, the European Union authorities moved on Wednesday to spread the burden of the crisis among member states.

title: Police Shoot Man Linked to Hammer Attacks
description: The police said the man, shot near 37th Street and Eighth Avenue, might be the person they have been trying to identify as a suspect in several hammer attacks this week near Union Square.

title: In an Upper East Side Brownstone, A Century of Italian Art
description: The curator Francesco Bonami organized The Great Wonderful, an exhibition and auction, with Phillips.

title: Officer Shoots Man in Midtown Manhattan
description: A man was shot by the police on Wednesday morning in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Turquoise: A Complicated Stone
description: Popularized by Turkish traders, embraced by Native Americans and now mined extensively by the Chinese, turquoise varies so widely in color and form that many American Indians say no two stones are alike.

title: When Kids Fly
description: Young extreme-sports athletes risk life and limb when they play.

title: Jamie Drake Picks His Favorite Rooms From Four Decades of the Kips Bay Show House
description: Since its inception in 1973, the Kips Bay Decorator Show House, which tasks prominent designers with creating dream rooms for a Manhattan home, has been a yearly tradition beloved in the design community  and in the local one (the Show House benefits the Kips Bay Boys & Girls Club). The rooms included have run the gamut from the ruffled and romantic to sci-fi Blade Runner futurist visions  but are always showstopping. The interior designer Jamie Drake has been to nearly every Show House; this year, hes a Vice Chair for the event. To celebrate the opening of the 43rd annual edition tomorrow, Drake took a spin down memory lane  with some help from Steven Stolmans book 40 Years of Fabulous: The Kips Bay Decorator Show House  to share with T some of his favorite rooms from the Show Houses history (including one of the five hes contributed so far).

title: No. 1 Public Enemy of Criminal Justice Reform: The Election
description: For the first time in decades, a consensus is building behind reform of the criminal justice system. But will the 2016 election get in the way?

title: Jennifer Lopez Plans Run of Las Vegas Shows
description: Las Vegas is stocking up on divas.

title: Iraq War Remains a Quagmire That Republicans Hope to Avoid
description: Twelve years since the United States invaded Iraq, the war remains a quagmire for Republicans who have an eye on the presidency.

title: Frontline Getting a Change in Leadership
description: Frontline, the PBS documentary series, is getting a leadership change for the first time in its 32-year history. The founding executive producer, David Fanning, is stepping down at the end of the month, and Raney Aronson, the colleague he has been grooming for several years, will take over.

title: Museum Director at Hermitage Hopes for Thaw in Relations With West
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  When the British Museum lent one of the sculptures known as the Elgin marbles to the State Hermitage Museum here last year, the move angered Greece, which wants the sculptures back, and set off a spirited debate about restitution. But it was also a diplomatic coup by one man: Mikhail Piotrovsky, director of the Hermitage and a skilled cultural ambassador.

title: Tuck Everlasting Coming to Broadway in 2016
description: Tuck Everlasting is Broadway-bound.

title: Classical Playlist: Carlos Kalmar, Alexander Lingas and More
description: SPIRIT OF THE AMERICAN RANGE': Piston, Antheil and CoplandCarlos Kalmar, conductor; Oregon Symphony(Pentatone)When the Oregon Symphony made its acclaimed Carnegie Hall debut in 2011, this impressive ensemble won many admirers among New York concertgoers and critics. That the orchestra continues to thrive under Carlos Kalmar, its dynamic Uruguayan music director, is clear from this exciting recording, taken from live performances at its home hall. Pistons charming, inventive Suite from The Incredible Flutist, a ballet, receives a supple, colorful performance. Antheils A Jazz Symphony (the 1955 version), a piece that can sound slick for all its raucous energy, emerges here as a savvy, audacious score. Best of all is an urgent, superbly played account of Coplands Third Symphony. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: 36 Hours in Medelln, Colombia
description: Colombias second city is fast shedding its controversial reputation. With infrastructure projects that are bringing architecturally exciting libraries and parks to impoverished neighborhoods, and creative methods of transportation, Medelln is one of the most progressive cities in Latin America. Its situation  set in the Aburr Valley, surrounded by green mountains  is ideal, its weather springlike year-round, and its people outgoing and proud of their city. A wave of construction is going on in most neighborhoods, which are bedecked with posters proclaiming the governments dedication to innovation and education. After years as the center of Pablo Escobars drug operation and decades of related violence, the city of eternal spring is looking to the future.

title: 36 Hours in Medelln
description: The citys situation  set in the Aburr Valley, surrounded by green mountains  is ideal, its weather springlike year-round, and its people outgoing and proud of their city.

title: 36 Hours in Medelln
description: Explore street view, find things to do in Medelln.

title: Cannes Film Festival Opens With Standing Tall
description: CANNES, France  In the film that opens the 68thCannes International Film festival today, Catherine Deneuve plays a French judge who must rule on the fate of a sometimes violent juvenile delinquent. The jurors for the festival competition this year seem to be taking a softer approach.

title: Jorge Posada Says Alex Rodriguez Doesnt Belong in Hall of Fame
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Alex Rodriguezs return from a yearlong suspension for using performance-enhancing drugs has gone swimmingly.

title: Amtrak Passengers Recall A Crazy Shake, Then Metal Tearing, and Chaos
description: Jeremy Wladis was well settled into an evening train home from Washington on Tuesday, a commute he does at least once a week, his tablet, his smartphone, a notebook and pen arrayed in front of him to work.

title: The Flick, a Pulitzer Winner, Retakes the Stage
description: When Annie Bakers play The Flick won the Pulitzer Prize last year, my surprise almost equaled my delight. This smart, subtle, delicately moving drama about the relationships among three low-wage workers at a grimy New England movie theater hardly seemed like the kind of play the Pulitzer judges would honor. Unless, of course, they happened to see it and were caught up in the rapt spell it casts  more than three hours that, no, dont fly by. (As life doesnt, really, until it does.)

title: Stalled Trade Bill Highlights Chasm Between Obama and Congressional Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  It took only a few minutes for President Obama to become a Republican talking point.

title: McConnell, Siding With Obama on Trade Deal, Describes Unlikely Alliance
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Mitch McConnell, Republican of Kentucky, dryly described his alliance with President Obama over an extensive trade deal as an out-of-body experience.

title: Fighting for History
description: And, Im on the ground in England, jet-lagged but maybe ready to resume blogging. For today, just a quick thought inspired by two seemingly unrelated comments.

title: Verbatim: For Biden, Amtrak Is Like Family
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., who has made the trip from Wilmington, Del., to Washington weekly throughout much of his career, discussing the train derailment overnight in Philadelphia.

title: Unvarnished Series on Nail Salon Workers: Readers Respond ()
description: Bronxville   There is no free lunch. NYT-

title: Collared, Sleeved and Oh-So-Seventies
description: Polo shirts get the retro treatment this summer with graphic prints, close fits and nostalgic colors.

title: Officials on Philadelphia Train Crash
description: The Philadelphia mayor, the Amtrak chairman and a member of the National Transportation Safety Board discussed the investigation into Tuesday nights train derailment.

title: 1940: Rome Press Attacks Allies
description: ROME  Anti-Allied sentiment was whipped up today in official circles, the press and posters. British institutions, as well as the French Embassy, in Rome were guarded to prevent possible demonstrations following the posting of anti-British signs and the dropping by an airplane of 20,000 anti-British leaflets. Groups of students gathered in the Corso Umberto, Romes main street, but the police dispersed them. The British Consulate advised British travelers to leave Italy.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, May 14, 1940

title: Amiri Barakas Play About W. E. B. Du Bois, via Woodie King Jr.
description: Even a relentlessly adventurous producer and director like Woodie King Jr. was bound to reach a breaking point when it came to Amiri Baraka.

title: A New Marriott App Connects Guests With Hotels
description: Marriott Hotels, the Bethesda, Md.-based brand part of Marriott International, wants to make the interaction between its guests and staff easier and faster with a new addition on its mobile app thats launching Wednesday. Called Mobile Request, the feature is available to members of Marriott Rewards, the loyalty program for which enrollment is free, and lets them start getting in touch with their property through their cellphones up to 72 hours before they check in.

title: In an Upper East Side Brownstone, a Century of Italian Art
description: Although interest in contemporary art has boomed to epic proportions in recent years  most recently with the record-setting spring evening auctions this week, where a Picasso painting went for $179 million at Christies on Monday night  the Italian curator Francesco Bonami takes issue with the disproportionate lack of attention his own compatriots receive, especially in the United States. A lot of Italian artists have been overlooked by the critics, and also overlooked by the market, Bonami says. Consider the exhibition and auction hes just curated with Phillips, The Great Wonderful: 100 Years of Italian Art, to be something of a corrective measure, then  an attempt to get Italian artists the attention they deserve.

title: Prohibido (Forbidden)
description: Aaron Velasquez Meja, a prisoner at Reclusorio Sur in Mexico City, performing in a national singing competition for prisons in Mexico.

title: Reflections on Our Sixth Annual Found Poetry Challenge
description: From race in America and the California drought to the Apple Watch and Brooklyns Morbid Anatomy Museum, student-poets posting to our Sixth Annual Found Poem Challenge found inspiration in a huge range of Times articles.

title: Italian Nurse Who Worked in Sierra Leone Tests Positive for Ebola
description: ROME  An Italian nurse who returned from Sierra Leone last week was flown to an infectious diseases hospital in Rome on Wednesday after he tested positive for the Ebola virus a day before.

title: Finland, Once a Eurozone Point of Pride, Is Now Faltering
description: What a comedown.

title: With Amtrak Link Unavailable, Travel Plans Come Apart
description: For thousands of people on Wednesday morning, a routine commute between New York and Washington became a mad scramble for a ride after the derailment of an Amtrak train on Tuesday shut down the rail link in Philadelphia.

title: David Cameron Seeks New Powers to Combat Extremism in Britain
description: LONDON  Stoking the debate over the balance between security and civil liberties, Prime Minister David Cameron pledged on Wednesday to seek broad new police powers to combat the radicalization of Muslims in Britain and to end what he termed passive tolerance of extremism.

title: CBS Says CSI Will End Next Season
description: CBS will cancel one of its longest-running and popular shows, CSI, next season after a two-hour series finale in late September.

title: Witness Describes Manhattan Shooting
description: A man who was working in a store at 37th Street and Eighth Avenue on Wednesday described the scene as police officers shot a man suspected of attacking strangers with a hammer.

title: Martin OMalley Holds Firm Against Trade Deals
description: Former Gov. Martin OMalley of Maryland is making a swing through New Hampshire as he mulls running for president, and he did not hold back from sharing his opposition to a proposed trade deal that Hillary Rodham Clinton has yet to take a clear position about.

title: The Real But Overstated Decline of American Christianity
description: The new Pew survey on religious affiliation in America, released and much discussed around the internet yesterday, paints a portrait of institutional Christianity in retreat, and the continuing rise of what we call the nones people attached to no organized religion as a major constituency in American life. The pace of both trends is striking: As Notre Dames David Campbell, quoted in this Daily Caller piece,points out, given how quickly the non-affiliated population rose in the late 1990s and early 2000s you might have expected a slowing or a leveling off, but instead the trendline is still steep, from 16 percent none in 2007 to 23 percent today (and about 35 percent none among Millennials). Meanwhile identification with every major branch of Christianity is down in percentage terms, and only evangelical Christianity is seeing its absolute numbers still increase; the black Protestant churches are holding steady, but in Pews numbers Catholicism seems to have joined the Protestant Mainline in a kind of demographic freefall.

title: Before the Renovation: A Glimpse Into The Timess Newsroom in Washington
description: Andrew Siddons is the office manager in The Timess Washington bureau.

title: Private Letters of Prince Charles Released After Long Court Battle
description: LONDON  Private letters from Prince Charles to British ministers that were released Wednesday after a decade-long court battle show the heir to the throne to be polite, persistent and knowledgeable about topics such as the survival of the albatross and the Patagonian toothfish and the state of organic agriculture.

title: After Lobbying by Obama, Senate Agrees to Vote on Trade Bill After All
description: WASHINGTON  Senate leaders, after personal intercessions by President Obama, reached an agreement Wednesday on a path to grant the president accelerated power to complete a sweeping trade accord ringing the Pacific Ocean  just a day after fellow Democrats had blocked him.

title: Amtrak Train Derails in Philadelphia
description: Amtrak Train 188 crashed in Philadelphia.

title: App Smart | Track Your Cycling Data
description: While your eyes are on the road, phone apps like Strava and Road Bike keep track of your cycling data.

title: Settlements in Foreign Exchange and Interest Rate Cases
description: Citing chat room messages replete with typos, jargon and vulgarities, regulators have fined big banks, accusing them of conspiring to manipulate the foreign currency markets and global interest rates.

title: Mumford & Sons Is No. 1
description: The band Mumford & Sons scored its second No. 1 on the Billboard album chart this week, with Wilder Mind, its latest release, selling 231,000 copies, according to Nielsen.

title: House Committee Meets on Rail Safety
description: Representatives Jeff Denham and Bill Shuster urged rail safety reform on Wednesday in a Transportation Committee meeting the day after a deadly Amtrak derailment in Philadelphia.

title: Defense Secretary Nominates New Army and Navy Chiefs
description: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter on Wednesday recommended Gen. Mark Milley, the head of Army Forces Command at Fort Bragg, N.C., to be the next Army chief of staff, and Adm. John Richardson, head of the Navys nuclear program, to be the next chief of naval operations, a senior administration official said.

title: Ferdinand Pich, No-Show at Porsche Meeting, Still Casts Long Shadow
description: STUTTGART, Germany  Anyone hoping that the Porsche shareholders meeting on Wednesday would turn into an episode of Family Feud: Billionaire Edition, would have been disappointed. The Porsche clans most controversial member, Ferdinand Pich, did not show up.

title: Mimi ODonnell Seeks Solace in Theater After Philip Seymour Hoffmans Death
description: She told herself she wouldnt make a big decision for a year.

title: Video Feature: Apps for Cyclists Offer Everything but the Flat-Tire Kit
description: Cyclists have been saying it for ages: Two wheels are better than four, for the health of the rider and the environment alike. And with cyclings popularity on the rise, numerous apps have appeared to support the activity.

title: William D. Smith Dies at 79; Business Reporter Who Joined Oil Industry
description: William D. Smith, a former business reporter for The New York Times who covered the oil industry then worked for it as a media relations specialist for Exxon during the Exxon Valdez oil spill in 1989, died on May 2 in Park Ridge, N.J. He was 79.

title: No. 2 Leader of ISIS Killed in U.S.-Led Airstrike, Iraq Says
description: BAGHDAD  The Iraqi government said Wednesday that the second-in-command of the Islamic State had been killed in an airstrike carried out by the American-led coalition in northern Iraq, a claim American officials said they could not confirm.

title: President Meant No Offense in Calling Elizabeth Warren by Her First Name, White House Says
description: The White House said Wednesday that President Obama had meant no offense in calling Senator Elizabeth Warren by her first name in an interview, adding that if anyone was owed an apology, it was him.

title: Canadian Aboriginal Group Rejects $1 Billion Fee for Natural Gas Project
description: OTTAWA  A small aboriginal community in British Columbia has rejected a $1 billion payment for a natural gas project, the latest setback for the Canadian energy industrys effort to bolster exports.

title: A Party Stop on the Global Art Crawl
description: W magazine celebrates its Art issue at Ian Schragers New York Edition hotel.

title: Tips for Healthy and Sustainable Hiking
description: To many outdoor enthusiasts the mountains and forests are waking with life again and trails beckon. With the days of summer in plain sight, recalling the cold and snow of winter would be a cruel exercise. But hitting the trail often means entering a place where the effects of winter can be seen well into spring.

title: Obama Is Said to Choose Chuck Rosenberg as Next D.E.A. Director
description: WASHINGTON  Chuck Rosenberg, a senior F.B.I. official and former United States attorney, has been chosen by President Obama to be the interim director of the Drug Enforcement Administration, according to law enforcement officials.

title: At N.F.L. Games, Patriotism Can Get Deflated, Too
description: What price patriotism? During N.F.L. football games, giant scoreboard tableaux of military personnel watching in noble close-up are a familiar, stirring sight. But it turns out some of these patriotic moments, far from a charitable offering by football owners, have been paid for by the Pentagon and National Guard as a Hometown Hero recruitment drive.

title: Amtrak Crash and Americas Declining Construction Spending
description: Investigators into the Amtrak crash in Philadelphia are focusing on excess speed, but there is a related issue: the overall condition of Amtrak and the nations infrastructure. One of the reasons that American trains should not travel 100 miles an hour in many places is that the state of our rail system  like the state of our bridges, highways and airports  is not good.

title: Footage of Shooting in Manhattan
description: An assailant pulled out a hammer and chased an officer on Eighth Avenue at 37th Street. He was shot by another officer.

title: Danahers Breakup Plan Eases Sting of Big Acquisition
description: The breakup plan of Danahers chief executive, Tom Joyce, takes the sting out of his expensive bid for Pall. The $60 billion dentures-to-lasers conglomerate is not cutting enough costs to justify the $13.6 billion its offering for the filter maker. But his surprise decision to voluntarily split Danaher in two dangles the prospect of better value for shareholders. The trick is to deliver.

title: Exploring Easier Ways to Save More and Cut Risk
description: Your retirement portfolio may be bigger than you realize. At least it would be if all your resources  your salary and home and not just the 401(k) plan at work  were enlisted to accumulate enough wealth to satisfy your needs and wants in old age, some financial advisers say.

title: Why Stocks Belong in a Retirement Portfolio
description: For years, the trope in retirement planning was to reduce the stock holdings in your portfolio and add bonds as you neared or entered retirement. That advice is being challenged.

title: Bankruptcy Can Help Seniors Protect Assets
description: After work started to dry up and creditors began calling, George Maxey, 66, a retired nursery owner and plant consultant in Orlando, Fla., wanted his financial peace and quiet back. With his income dwindling, though, Mr. Maxey saw that the debt hole he was digging was only getting deeper, with no end in sight. So he declared Chapter 7 bankruptcy, which liquidates some assets to repay creditors.

title: Turning to Social Media in Times of Need
description: Frank Vardeman was about to undergo knee surgery in January when, as he recalled, his legs suddenly turned to wet noodles that could no longer support him. Tests revealed that the culprit was a large growth entangled in his spinal cord, compressing the nerves that control lower parts of his body. It took two neurosurgeries at a Chicago hospital to remove the mass and 44 days of rehab before Mr. Vardeman, 62, could return to his home in Chesterton, Ind.

title: For the Love of Animals
description: Linda and Gary Childs go almost everywhere with their little girl.

title: In Cleveland, Young and Old Keep Tempo of Life
description: CLEVELAND  Janet Hall grimaces as she hits an off note on her violin, one of the few heard here at Judson Manors Friday afternoon recital, held in the chandeliered ballroom settings of the first-floor lounge of this residence for older people.

title: Deciding When to Trim Sails to Stay on Water
description: Michael Sears has been sailing for 60 years, since he was 5 years old, and has owned boats for half that time. Today he has a 36-foot Beneteau First 36s7 sloop and a smaller Sunfish racing dinghy.

title: Setting Records at 80
description: In April, Bill Dodson, 80, competed in the National 100K Championship in Madison, Wis. He finished about 15 hours later to set a national mark for his age group.

title: Why Older Runners Are Ultrarunners
description: How far will an aging ultradistance runner go?

title: Guiding Wealthy Retirees on Health Expenses
description: Death and disease dont discriminate, and that has many high-net-worth retirees worried. They realize fate could determine the quality of their retirement more than their lifetime of planning.

title: Senator Thomas Carper Got Off Train Minutes Before Crash
description: Senator Thomas R. Carper takes the train home to Delaware nearly every day, looking forward to a good nights rest in his own bed before returning to Washington in the morning. So he was home watching the news on Tuesday night when he heard that an Amtrak train had derailed about 30 minutes after he gotten off in Wilmington.

title: Losing Our Religion: So What Do We Teach Our Children?
description: Do you still practice the faith you grew up with? More and more young adults now identify as nonreligious, with no affiliation to any religion, according to a  large new survey by the Pew Research Center.

title: Lurid & Cute, a Novel by Adam Thirlwell
description: I wish confessions did not ever need to happen. Confessions, it seemed to me, were a total illness of our time. So says the narrator of Adam Thirlwells entertaining and exhausting new novel, Lurid & Cute.

title: Obama Hosts Saudi Princes
description: President Obama met Crown Prince Mohammed bin Nayef and Deputy Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia on Wednesday, a day before the Gulf Cooperation Council summit meeting.

title: All White Options for Summer
description: Cleanse your palette with these all white options.

title: Kabul Hotel Attacked by Gunmen, Leaving 5 Dead
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An attack on a central Kabul hotel late Wednesday by several gunmen left five people dead, including an American, raising the specter of targeted attacks in the capital even as violence has surged elsewhere in Afghanistan.

title: David Lynchs Paris Party Club Spends the Summer in the Country
description: Silencio, the pluridisciplinary members-only culture club and labyrinthine party hub in Paris conceived by David Lynch, will migrate its creative community to the Maison de lAiguebrun for the summer. Nestled in Bonnieux, in the Luberon region in the south of France, the house was the property of iconic film director Agns Varda, and has since been handed down to her daughter, Rosalie Varda-Demy, a costume designer and art director (whose father was equally iconic film director Jacques Demy). The idea for opening her personal estate to Silencio came about when Varda-Demy met the clubs directors, Arnaud Frisch and Antoine Caton, at their pop-up in Cannes for the annual Film Festival  for which Varda-Demy has worked for 14 years, doing dcor and organizing official dinners.

title: Krosnick to Depart Juilliard String Quartet
description: The Juilliard String Quartet, one of American chamber musics most hallowed institutions, will get its first new cellist in over 40 years. Joseph W. Polisi, the Juilliard Schools president, announced Tuesday that Joel Krosnick, a quartet member since 1974, would leave the group at the end of the 2015-16 season, its 70th.

title: Review: American Ballet Theater Recalls the Wide Range of Its Early Years
description: American Ballet Theater is celebrating its 75th anniversary by presenting a half-dozen one-act ballets from its first decade. Having opened its season at the Metropolitan Opera House on Monday with three selections, the company followed up on Tuesday with the remainder. This second grouping of three underscored the marvelous range that Ballet Theater offered during those early years: traditional and modern, pure-form and narrative, European and American. It showed the durability of great choreography, even in less than ideal performances.

title: Ciscos Profit and Sales Beat Wall Street Forecasts
description: Cisco Systems delivered gains in quarterly profit and sales on Wednesday that slightly surpassed Wall Streets expectations.

title: Review: Hubbard Street Dance Chicago Nods to Balanchine
description: Hubbard Street Dance Chicago is a confusing company though its easy to see why talented dancers flock to it. They want to perform, and if this group has anything, its an abundance of contemporary repertory. Its identity is harder to pin down.

title: College Student to Jeb Bush: Your Brother Created ISIS
description: RENO, Nev.  Your brother created ISIS, the young woman told Jeb Bush. And with that, Ivy Ziedrich, a 19-year-old college student, created the kind of confrontational moment here on Wednesday morning that presidential candidates dread.

title: American Ballet Theater: A History, a PBS Documentary, Is a Love Letter to a Dance Form
description: A point shoe descends in slow motion, aiming its tip like a dagger as it hits the center of a spotlight. The voice of Jennifer Homans, author of Apollos Angels: A History of Ballet, gently, almost coaxingly, speaks about the ritual the art form requires, starting with the ballet positions a dancer works through each morning. She says of the daily practice, Its a kind of freedom.

title: A Party Crawl in the Name of Art
description: A perfect art crawl score might have started last week at the Venice Biennale opening in Italy, followed by the Brant Foundation Art Study Center last Sunday in Greenwich, Conn., the art auctions in New York this week, and the Frieze New York art fair running through Sunday.

title: Chinas Superrich: The Bling Dynasty
description: Forget old money. Chinas fabulously wealthy are playing catch-up, learning how to acquire  and use  the trappings of the good life.

title: O Outro Lado da Montanha
description: Depois de uma tentativa de retorno  glria olmpica ter acabado em paralisia, Las Souza reconstri a sua vida com um movimento de cada vez.

title: A Home for Pets When Their Owners Are Gone
description: Now that Jim Swaim is in his 60s, he and his wife are asking a very modern question about mortality: Who will care for our pets when we are gone?

title: Joseph Abboud Provides a Guiding Hand for the Suit Averse
description: It was the summer of, I think, 1997. Had to be. One year before, I had spent those hot weeks in a cold office overlooking Boston Harbor, crunching numbers for a management consulting firm but mostly doing the crossword for as long as I could get away with it.

title: Verbatim: Marco Rubio, Ral Castro and the Church
description: Senator Marco Rubio at the Council of Foreign Relations, responding to the news that President Ral Castro of Cuba was considering returning to the Roman Catholic Church because of the influence of Pope Francis.

title: Sally Mann on Her History, Frame by Frame
description: The photographer Sally Mann describes her pictures as silver poems of tone and undertow, and they have always seemed designed to stop the passage of things that can barely be slowed: youth, memory, seasons, light, even decay. When she began her first attempt at a piece of sustained writing, Hold Still, her memoir published this week by Little Brown, she said she realized with great relief that she had followed the same impulse in her nonphotographic life, letting nary a scrap of paper escape her archival clutches.

title: Kayak Suspect Said She Felt Good Fianc Would Die, Prosecutors Say
description: Prosecutors at a bail hearing in Orange County, N.Y., on Wednesday said that Angelika Graswald, the woman accused of intentionally drowning her fianc in the Hudson River last month, had told the police that she tampered with his kayak and had said it felt good knowing he was going to die.

title: Study Asks if Carrot or Stick Can Better Help Smokers Quit
description: WASHINGTON  What would make a smoker more likely to quit, a big reward for succeeding or a little penalty for failing? That is what researchers wanted to know when they assigned a large group of CVS employees, their relatives and friends to different smoking cessation programs.

title: The Artist Rob Pruitt: Paradox on a Pedestal
description: The twice-yearly opening at the Brant Foundation Art Study Center, a private museum in Greenwich, Conn., founded by the newsprint magnate Peter M. Brant, never fails to draw a fashionable art crowd.

title: At Nail Salons, Questioning a Beauty Rite
description: Last weekend, all weekend, Kate McKean, 36, struggled with her guilt.

title: Clifford Rosss Wave Mechanics
description: This year, May 14 marks the beginning of summer  that is, the summer of Clifford Ross. This Thursday at Ryan Lee Gallery, the noble and light-footed nephew of the late Helen Frankenthaler will showcase two series of silver gelatin photographs from the late 90s in The Abstract Edge, beginning with his Grain Series, perhaps the most abstract and spare photographic works in Ross expansive but underappreciated catalogue. Evoking the minimal but potent energy of an Ad Reinhardt painting, the photographs display tone and emulsion only, embodying the pure essence of a tumultuous swell while simultaneously dissembling the photographic process. The second and edgier half, the Wave Series, presents only the whisper of a wave crest and is deeply indebted to Richard Serra. My aunt created a masterpiece at age 23. Im on the flip side of that, says a relaxed Ross in his West Village studio. She had to live down staggering success. For me, it was a gradual climb to things that were better or more meaningful.

title: Pictures of the Day: Burundi and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Burundi, Nepal, Afghanistan and the United States.

title: May 13, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Burundi, Nepal, Afghanistan and the United States.

title: Uber Lures Top Google Executive and Shifts David Plouffes Duties
description: Continuing its quest for top Silicon Valley talent, Uber said on Wednesday that it had hired Rachel Whetstone, Googles longtime head of communications, to be its senior vice president for policy and communications.

title: Chief of New York City Marathon Has Goal for All: Great Time, Fast or Otherwise
description: Peter Ciaccia, the new race director of the New York City Marathon, may not know his marathon time (3:15? 3:30?), but he knows how to give a party. Now he will have to determine the existential course of the worlds biggest marathon: Should it be more race or more social event?

title: A Film Explores Curaaos Effort to Become a Caribbean Haven for Coral
description: After months of reporting and planning, a frenetic week of filming in March, and many long nights in the editing suite, 10 Pace University communication students, with guidance from Prof. Maria Luskay and me, have completed Curaaos Coral Challenge  Reviving the Rain Forests of the Sea.

title: Watch Trailers for CBSs New Dramas and Comedies
description: This week, in the annual tradition known as the upfronts, TV networks make presentations to advertisers in which they unveil previews of new fall shows.

title: Singing to Be Heard, Behind Bars in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY  On a wide stage in front of hundreds of people, two salsa singers danced in synchronized steps, belting out a catchy melody accompanied by trumpets, percussion and propulsive Latin montuno chords from an electronic keyboard. The musicians, like the crowd, wore mismatching beige uniforms, and no women were anywhere to be seen.

title: House Votes to End N.S.A.s Bulk Phone Data Collection
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Wednesday overwhelmingly approved legislation to end the federal governments bulk collection of phone records, exerting enormous pressure on Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the Senate majority leader, who insists that dragnet sweeps continue in defiance of many of those in his Republican Party.

title: Kendrick Bangs Kellogg: A Retrospective
description: Beyond the Joshua Tree House, a selection of some of Kelloggs largest works, from California to Japan.

title: With Tie at Real Madrid, Juventus Bars Door to All-Spanish Champions League Final
description: MADRID  Imagine a mob of people, thousands of them, standing outside an old wooden door. First the members of the pack take turns banging on the door. Then the banging turns to kicking. And then the kicking turns to pounding, as body after body rams ahead only to return with little more than an aching shoulder.

title: In the DuPont Boardroom Battle, Sizing Up Who Won and Lost
description: The battle between DuPont and Trian was too close to call before Wednesday, with DuPont winning a contest that lasted far too long. In deal-making, though, winning a proxy contest may not be the triumphant victory that one thinks it could be. For future shareholder activist battles, there are lessons in the way DuPont and Trian both won and lost.

title: Review: With One Cut, One Life, Ed Pincus and Lucia Small Document His Illness
description: The intensity of life lived in the shadow of a terminal illness is the subject of One Cut, One Life, a portrait of the seminal documentarian Ed Pincus in his final years. Filmed by Mr. Pincus and his longtime collaborator Lucia Small, this extremely personal and moving documentary has several layers.

title: Shopping Events and Sales Happening This Week in New York
description: Art everywhere. Dover Street Market has curated a lineup of installations around Frieze New York that includes an IDEA Books Collier Schorr mini-shop consisting of five special prints, rare vintage books and other printed matter. There is also a mise en scene created by the designer Craig Green and the photographer Nick Knight that involves kites and a preview of the gender-neutral mens wear masters fall collection. At 160 Lexington Avenue.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: For N.F.L. Stars and Celebrities, Theres No Off-Season
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  On the windowless second floor of the Pink Taco restaurant and bar on Sunset Boulevard, behind an unmarked gray door, a dozen N.F.L. players were warming up for a two-hour workout, attempting to speedwalk with thick blue elastic bands binding their ankles together.

title: Jeb Bush Declares His Candidacy  Prematurely
description: RENO, Nev.  Whoops!

title: American Pharoah Draws No. 1 Post in Eight-Horse Preakness Field
description: BALTIMORE  It is a compact field of eight horses for the 140th running of the Preakness Stakes, but perhaps it is the deepest group to contest the second jewel of the Triple Crown in nearly two decades, with the top three finishers in a hard-fought Kentucky Derby entered.

title: Columbia Examines Its Long-Ago Links to Slavery
description: Daniel D. Tompkins, the sixth vice president of the United States, has long gazed impassively from an oil portrait hanging in the residence of the president of Columbia University, his alma mater. But on a recent afternoon, he might have been tempted to smile a bit.

title: From Korea, Sheet Masks for Fresh Faces
description: The idea of sheet masks, one of the latest Korean beauty crazes to arrive on these shores, is pretty attractive. Rather than spend hundreds on a professional facial, you wash your face at home, slap on an individually packaged mask (essentially hydrogel, paper, cotton or fiber cutouts doused in beautifying solutions), wait 20 minutes and call it a day. In Seoul entire shops are devoted solely to them.

title: A Promise of Beauty in a Bottle
description: The first time Jenelle Manzi went to CAP Beauty, a natural boutique that opened in the West Village in February, she found a whole section dedicated to beauty products meant to be ingested.

title: Six Gadgets to Take on a Road Trip
description: Stuck in a car for days? Bring along navigation aids, headphones, broadband access, video and music storage  even access to a remote camera to check on your home.

title: Narendra Modi and Xi Jinping Aim to Shelve Rifts Amid Economic Courtship
description: NEW DELHI  The days before Narendra Modi left for China, his first visit as Indias prime minister, brought pinprick reminders of the geopolitical rifts dividing the two countries, even while they court each other for an economic charge.

title: White House and Labor Advocates Praise Move by Facebook for Higher Wages
description: Labor groups and the White House on Wednesday praised Facebooks plan to require its contractors to pay workers at least $15 an hour and offer paid time off.

title: A Makeup Cream for 40 Winks (Wink-Wink)
description: Heres a product that seems tailor-made for dating app hookups: a beauty balm you can sleep in, from the Korean label Dr. Jart. Skin-care gurus will be apoplectic at sleeping in makeup, but the innovation is slick: The tube of Dr. Jart+ BB Night Beauty Balm ($38) dispenses little white spheres suspended in a clear gel; on contact, they break open and disperse a self-adjusting tinted pigment. Sci-fi stuff. On a recent date night with my husband, the gel produced a flattering velvety sheer finish. Though not enough coverage to replace a proper foundation, it was surprisingly transfer-resistant. After a roll around the sack (O.K., just testing clean pillowcases), the cream stayed put, even when layered with moisturizers. Another date night, here we come!

title: Grip Strength May Predict Heart Attacks and Strokes
description: Grip strength may be a good predictor of the risk for cardiovascular disease.
