description: All 50 states could become wind energy producers, according to an Energy Department report released Tuesday, once the next generation of larger, taller turbines in development hits the market.

title: Dr. David Sackett, Who Proved Aspirin Helps Prevent Heart Attacks, Dies at 80
description: Dr. David Sackett, whose clinical trials proved the value of taking aspirin in preventing heart attacks and strokes, and who helped pioneer the use of exacting statistical data in treating patients, died on May 13 in Markdale, Ontario. He was 80.

title: Takata Airbag Recalls Huge Scale Could Delay Repairs
description: WASHINGTON  As auto safety officials here announced what they called the most complex consumer safety recall in U.S. history, they also said it could take years to complete, leaving the fate of everyday drivers unclear.

title: Review: Tuesdays at Tescos, With Simon Callow, on a Transgender Womans Travail
description: Pauline knows that youre looking at her. People always do. Her response is to look right back  hard  until you drop or soften your gaze. You better. Pauline is determined to make you feel more embarrassed by the fact of her existence than she is.

title: Review: The Way We Get By After a One-Night Stand
description: Anyone whos ever woken up in a strange apartment with an unexpected bedmate and a deathly hangover will appreciate the brute fear that pervades the first moments of The Way We Get By, a slight but spirited new play by Neil LaBute, which opened on Tuesday night at Second Stage Theater.

title: Notepad Holders of Old
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  After I finished solving this puzzle by Jacob Stulberg, I tried to think of my own set of choo-choo train entries. Thats what Ive decided to call this sort of theme, where words or names that are spelled the same are linked to each other to form a sort of sentence, much like the cars of a locomotive. For all I know, there is a far more sophisticated name for this sort of thing, but Ive been hanging out with some friends small children lately, so choo-choo train it is.

title: Britain: 9 Arrested in Jewel Heist
description: Nine British men believed to have pulled off a daring heist in Londons diamond district over the Easter weekend were arrested Tuesday in raids in London and Kent by more than 200 police officers. The suspects were questioned in a London police station. Dressed in fluorescent vests and hard hats, the thieves climbed down an elevator shaft and drilled through concrete walls that were six feet thick, later making off with the contents of 72 safe deposit boxes.

title: Public Housing Residents Wary of Mayor de Blasios Plan
description: Rosalie Washington has taken a day off from work to wait for repairmen who never came. She has gotten up at 4 a.m. to heat water for a bath because she did not have reliable hot water for a shower.

title: 2 Rikers Inmates Accuse Guard of Repeated Rapes
description: Two women who said they had repeatedly been raped by the same correction officer at Rikers Island sued him and New York City on Tuesday, accusing the city of indifference to a pervasive culture of rape and sexual abuse of female inmates in the city jail.

title: North Korea: Ban Ki-moon Visit Suddenly Canceled by Pyongyang
description: The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, said on Wednesday that North Korea had suddenly withdrawn its approval for him to enter the isolated country to visit an industrial park that South Korea jointly operates with the North. Mr. Ban, a South Korean, had planned to visit the industrial complex in the North Korean border town of Kaesong, north of the South Korean capital, Seoul, on Thursday. The factory park is the only major symbol of cooperation between the two Koreas. Mr. Ban had said that his visit there would help promote peace on the divided Korean Peninsula. The trip would have made Mr. Ban the third United Nations secretary general to visit the North. No explanation was given for this last-minute change, Mr. Ban told a forum in Seoul.

title: Fastball Deserts Jon Niese as Mets Lose to Cardinals
description: It was game No. 40 for the Mets, approximately the quarter-mile post of a long baseball season in which the team hopes to contend all the way to the end.

title: Even Cleanshaven Faces Cannot Help Yankees Stop Their Slide
description: WASHINGTON  The Yankees arrived at Nationals Park on Tuesday feeling refreshed after a much-needed day off and appearing somewhat youthful.

title: May I Lie to My Husband to Get Him to See a Doctor?
description: The Ethicists consider when its worth taking away a loved ones autonomy.

title: The Worlds First All-Brass Restaurant
description: Two years ago, the Indian film producer Varun Talreja walked into Londons Serafino restaurant under the guise of booking a dinner party. The owners brother looked at me up and down, and he said, You want to buy the place, dont you? Talreja recalls. I still dont know how he figured me out because it wasnt on the market yet, but he said to come back tomorrow. Fast forward to next week, when Talreja and Inaki Aizpitarte, the Basque chef-owner of Pariss Le Chateaubriand, will reopen the former Mayfair cafe and trattoria as Le Chabanais, an all-day bistro serving lush seasonal fare amidst the clamor and glimmer of a patinated brass dining room.

title: A British Sculptor Prepares for Her Bergdorf Goodman Debut
description: Kathy Dalwood lets T inside her studio in northwest London, where her impressive plaster busts come to life (from flea market finds).

title: Nicolas Winding Refn, Vinyl Curator
description: Vinyl says a lot about you as a person, says the director Nicolas Winding Refn. When you go to somebodys house, and look around, you very quickly can tell what a person is like based on their music. Considering the painstakingly curated sounds in Refns films, from the grinding guitars of Peter Peter & Peter Kyeds Valhalla Rising score to the analog synths of Cliff Martinezs soundtracks for Drive and Only God Forgives, its no surprise that Refn is a self-identified vinyl fetishist. Now, the art-house favorite is taking his love of the LP a step further and curating an ongoing series of soundtracks in partnership with the Los Angeles-based record label Milan Records. We thought, why dont we create our own high-end vinyl collection, says the Danish filmmaker, who describes wanting to highlight the exoticness of the medium. Its not so much the music by itself; its the whole design, its the feel, its the weight  its like seeing the movie in front of you.

title: China Is Investing Billions in the U.S. Despite Tensions Between the Governments
description: HONG KONG  As China increasingly flexes its financial muscle, the countrys companies are spreading their wealth broadly across the United States instead of chasing major lawmakers or causes.

title: Why Insurance Doesnt Always Prevent Giant Medical Bills
description: Health insurance is supposed to help you pay for your health care, but its also supposed to protect you from financial ruin. A large new survey finds that, for nearly a quarter of insured adults, insurance has provided flimsy protection against huge medical bills.

title: Word of the Day | thematic
description: thematic  \thi-ma-tik\  adjective

title: Rockets Surge and Resurge, but Warriors Hold On
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Like all sports franchises of a certain vintage, the Golden State Warriors like to think they have a proud history. Their practice gym in downtown Oakland is nostalgically lined with former logos and photographs of former players.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 1 A.M. (FX Movie Channel) THE TREE OF LIFE (2011) Jack OBrien (Sean Penn), a middle-aged architect haunted by the death of his younger brother years earlier in the 1960s, tries to reconcile his complicated relationship with his father (Brad Pitt) while contemplating human existence  the origin of the universe, the development of life on earth, the end of time  in this drama from Terrence Malick. Jessica Chastain plays Jacks mother, whose grief, with that of her husband, cast a shadow of tragedy over everything that will follow in this nonlinear film. Hunter McCracken, a first-time actor, is Jack as a boy growing up in Texas. The sheer beauty of this film is almost overwhelming, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times, but as with other works of religiously minded art, its aesthetic glories are tethered to a humble and exalted purpose, which is to shine the light of the sacred on secular reality. The movie, which won the top prize at the Cannes Film Festival, received Oscar nominations for best picture, best director and best cinematography, for Emmanuel Lubezki.

title: Tampa Bay Takes Extreme Measures to Ensure Home-Ice Advantage
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Jarno Rodenberg and his fiance, Lenne Kovasild, drove more than four hours from Miami to watch their beloved Rangers play the Tampa Bay Lightning in Game 3 of the Eastern Conference finals. They sat in Section 314, two rows from the top of Amalie Arena, but neither lamented their view from high above because the trip almost did not happen.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: He said, Just make sure if you fail, you did what you wanted to do. I took that to heart. I said, O.K., then thats what Im going to do.

title: Corrections: May 20, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Conservatives and Keynes
description: Tony Yates asks, Why cant we all get along? Lamenting another really bad, obviously political defense of austerity, he declares that

title: UBS to Pay Over $500 Million in Fines for Manipulating Currencies and Libor
description: LONDON  The Swiss bank UBS said on Wednesday that it would pay more than $500 million in fines to the authorities in the United States for its role in the manipulation of currency markets and benchmark interest rates.

title: Looking at Appalachia Anew
description: The mere mention of some places in America evoke images that are powerful, instantly recognizable  and stereotyped. Brought to public awareness through photographs of poverty, despair or violence decades ago, some of these places cannot shake off their stubborn notoriety, despite the passage of time and progress. And in some cases, their past misfortune gives ample fodder for cruel, and clueless, jokes.

title: Joint Statement on the Asian Migrant Crisis
description: A statement issued by the foreign ministers of Malaysia, Indonesia and Thailand on the thousands of migrants from Myanmar and Bangladesh who have been stranded at sea.

title: Title Insurance Reform
description: To the Editor:

title: Gender Bias in Hollywood: How Movies Are Seen
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Abortions After 20 Weeks Should Not Be Banned
In Alberta, Oil, Cowboys  and Liberalism?
description: EDMONTON, Alberta  WHEN I moved from Houston to Edmonton, Alberta, in 2008, I was told to prepare for a soft landing, politically speaking. Alberta was supposed to be just like the Lone Star State: a place full of backslapping good ol boys in cowboy hats, riding high on the hog of oil money.

title: Platinum Pay in Ivory Towers
description: Gregory Fenves recently got a big promotion, from provost to president of the University of Texas at Austin. A raise came with it. Instead of his current base of about $425,000, he was offered $1 million.

title: Moving to End Housing Segregation
description: To the Editor:

title: Hillary, Jeb, Facebook and Disorder
description: For a presidential campaign that has started so early, its striking how little most of the candidates want to engage with major issues of the day, let alone the future. Hillary Clinton wont take a clear stand on two big issues she helped to negotiate as secretary of state: the free-trade deal with Pacific nations and the nuclear deal with Iran. Jeb Bushs campaign seems stuck on whether he is or is not his brothers keeper. Marco Rubio was for comprehensive immigration reform before he was against it. While Senators Rand Paul and Bernie Sanders are motivated by clear ideologies, the others, so far, evince much more compelling ambitions to be president than compelling reasons for why they should be.

title: Protect Vulnerable Home Buyers
description: The lawmakers and corporate allies working to undo protections for buyers of manufactured homes arent giving up, even as their phony arguments are unmasked. Last month, the House passed a bill to weaken new rules against predatory lending in the sale of manufactured homes. This week, the Senate Banking Committee is on track to pass a bill that includes a similar measure.

title: China Buys Into Multiple Warheads
description: After exercising restraint in its nuclear weapons program for decades, China has made the poor choice of upgrading its arsenal in a way that raises concerns about its intentions, introduces new uncertainty in Asia and could add more fuel to a regional arms race.

title: How Glasses Can Change Childrens Lives
description: To the Editor:

title: A Rising Tide of Bogus Degrees
description: It is hard to believe that the Pakistani government was unaware of a major scam orchestrated by Axact, a software company based in Karachi that operates a global network of fake online schools that sell bogus diplomas. But ignorant or not, the government, which raided Axacts offices on Tuesday, had little choice but to act after a report by Declan Walsh in The Times disclosed clear connections between Axact and at least 370 education websites, many of which claimed to represent online universities and high schools based in the United States. The scam had existed for years and reaped many millions of dollars.

title: Why Robots Will Always Need Us
description: HUMAN BEINGS are ashamed to have been born instead of made, wrote the philosopher Gnther Anders in 1956. Our shame has only deepened as our machines have grown more adept.

title: Altices Deal to Buy Suddenlink May Be Prelude to Pursuit of Time Warner Cable
description: LONDON  With its $9.1 billion acquisition of Suddenlink Communications on Wednesday, the European company Altice established a small foothold in the United States cable market, gaining control of a distributor with only 1.5 million subscribers in 17 states.

title: Test Yourself | The Pleasures of Picnics
description: Below are several paragraphs from the May 13 article Into the Wild.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Increasingly Visible, Transgender Americans Defy Stereotypes
description: Part of the Opinion sections Transgender Today series, in Increasingly Visible, Transgender Americans Defy Stereotypes, Ernesto Londoo summarizes the history of transgender visibility in American society.

title: Youd Have to Be Insane Not to Conduct Some Soul-Searching
description: During the months following the November 2014 midterm elections, several House Democrats convened a series of secret meetings to plot the future of their partys leadership.

title: Latvian Region Has Distinct Identity, and Allure for Russia
description: REZEKNE, Latvia  On a continent of fractured loyalties, a kaleidoscope of separatist passions extending from Scotland to eastern Ukraine, Piters Locs, the 70-year-old champion of an obscure and, at least officially, nonexistent language, has a particularly esoteric cause.

title: Dwayne Johnson, Star of San Andreas, Is Solid. Solid as a ...
description: BURLINGTON, Mass.  Dwayne Johnson, better known until recently as the Rock, is a touch-y guy. A hand on the shoulder, a guiding elbow tap  moving across a studio here for his next movie, he used his 6-foot-4 frame as a form of leadership. Not that youd be likely to miss him otherwise.

title: Interior of Soldiers and Sailors Monument Remains a Hidden Jewel
description: As they have since Memorial Day 1902, hundreds of people are expected to gather in Manhattan next Monday at the Soldiers and Sailors Monument in Riverside Park to honor the war dead.

title: Should Teenagers Think Twice Before Downing Energy Drinks?
description: Energy drinks are big business. In fact, the industry had $12.5 billion in sales in 2012. While the biggest drink companies, such as Red Bull and Monster, agreed to stop marketing to the under-12 set because of concerns about adverse health effects, the drinks are still widely used by teenagers.

title: Low U.S. Rail Spending Leads to Poor Safety, Experts Say
description: PARIS  Across Europe and East Asia, hundreds of millions of train passengers a year are routinely whisked, at speeds that often exceed 200 miles an hour, over extensive rail networks that, for many, present a more reliable and affordable long-distance alternative than even air travel.

title: A Finance Minister Fit for a Greek Tragedy?
description: Yanis Varoufakis knows when he will go. Im not going to humiliate myself, and Im not going to become compromised in terms of principles and in terms of logic, he told me in early May. The Greek finance minister had just returned to Athens from a hopscotch tour of European capitals, during which he warned his fellow European leaders that they faced a Continental crisis: If they didnt lend money to his ailing country soon, Greece might end up forced to leave the eurozone. And yet Greece wouldnt accept many of the conditions they were demanding in return. He sounded angry. Ill be damned if I will accept another package of economic policies that perpetuate this same crisis. This is not what I was elected for. He would resign, he said, rather than push the Greek people deeper into economic despair: Its not good for Europe, and its not good for Greece.

title: Couples Kayak Trip on Hudson Included Mistakes, Experts Say
description: On an unseasonably warm Sunday afternoon in mid-April, Angelika Graswald and her fianc, Vincent Viafore, departed in their kayaks from Plum Point Park on the western shore of the Hudson River. As they paddled, they took in a vista that includes Breakneck Ridge on the east, Storm King Mountain on the west and a particularly wide expanse of the river in between. Their destination was Bannerman Island, a dollop of land holding the ruins of a castle.

title: Jackson Heights, Queens: Diverse and Evolving
description: Call it the Brooklyn breaking point, when the cool factor of Kings County is not enough to compensate for a less-than-ideal living situation.

title: The Rocks, by Peter Nichols
description: Peter Nicholss second novel, The Rocks, seems on the face of things to be an irresistibly sunny beach book. Most of it is set in the brightly lit Mediterranean, amid old olive groves and sexual intrigue, music and wine and beautiful women. But this sparkling surface glides and washes over quite a bit of disturbing darkness: A teenage girls virginity is casually taken by a drunken middle-aged layabout; a teenage boy loses his virginity to a 70-year-old woman; those ancient olive groves are decimated by a secret betrayal. None of this depravity reverberates over the course of the novel; it all happens and, just as quickly, is past.

title: England and Other Stories, by Graham Swift
description: Ah, England. The ancestral dream. Democracy and the royals. Tea instead of coffee. Public schools actually private and vice versa. Wit trumping manners, wit trumping all. The stiff upper lip, the stuffed shirt, the punters, the twits, the prats, the genteel poverty, the bed-sits and the below stairs, the drinks parties, the pubs, the absence of a work ethic, the suspicion of all things foreign and the empire coming all the way home to roost. My grandfather was London born and bred. Every Sunday after services at the Episcopal church he closed himself in the kitchen of his Missouri home to fry up a plate of kippers. Dont forget your English education, he wrote to my father, who did forget. He couldnt bear kippers.

title: Ava of Ex Machina Is Just Sci-Fi (for Now)
description: Are technology companies running too fast into the future and creating things that could potentially wreak havoc on humankind?

title: Mad Men Fashion? Lets Move On
description: And so, farewell to Mad Men. Farewell to the blogs and fan sites that tracked the story line (and more important, the outfits) of each episode.

title: Lack of Exercise Can Disrupt the Bodys Rhythms
description: Exercise may affect how and when we move, even when we arent exercising, according to a fascinating new study in mice. The findings suggest that, by influencing our built-in body clocks, exercise may help our bodies to recognize the optimal times we should be moving, and when we should be still.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Obama Recasts Climate Change as a Peril With Far-Reaching Effects
description: NEW LONDON, Conn.  President Obama used a commencement address on Wednesday at the Coast Guard Academy to cast his push for urgent action to combat climate change as a national security imperative, saying that the warming of the planet poses an immediate risk to the United States.

title: The Bionic Man
description: Les Baugh lost his arms as a teenager. Engineers at Johns Hopkins are trying to give them back, but better. Mr. Baugh is testing a robotic prosthetic that he can control with his mind.

title: Prosthetic Limbs, Controlled by Thought
description: This is the third episode in a Bits video series, called Robotica, examining how robots are poised to change the way we do business and conduct our daily lives.

title: New York Today: Saying Goodbye to Dave
description: Good morning on this bright Wednesday.

title: Im With Stupid
description: Via FT Alphaville, James Montier has an interesting piece castigating economists for their interest rate idolatry, their belief that central bank-set interest rates matter a lot for the economy and that therefore it is useful, at least conceptually, to think about the natural rate of interest that would lead the economy to full employment. There is no evidence that interest rates matter in that way, he says, and economists who talk about natural rates are simply engaged in groupthink.

title: Director of Climate Change Group Looks to Hong Kong for Museum Ideas
description: It happened in the blink of an eye. The waters around Manhattan rose more than three feet. Low-lying areas along the Hudson and East Rivers were swamped. It was Hurricane Sandy all over again, but this time, the high water was here to stay, and it would only continue to rise.

title: Israel Cancels Project Barring Palestinians From Some Buses to the West Bank
description: JERUSALEM  The government of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday abruptly shelved a pilot project that prohibited Palestinians from riding home to the West Bank on the same buses as Israelis headed to Jewish settlements.

title: Indonesia and Malaysia Agree to Care for Stranded Migrants
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesia and Malaysia agreed on Wednesday to take in thousands of migrants stranded at sea until they can be sent home or resettled in a third country, in the first official action by Southeast Asian nations to try to resolve a crisis well into its second week.

title: How to Roll a Joint
description: After he sold his cable-television firm for $18 million in 1999, Bruce Nassau was a wealthy man looking for a new industry. He wanted to invest in a product with broad consumer appeal. Eventually, he settled on marijuana. Im an old guy in this business, says Nassau, 62, the chief executive of Tru Cannabis, a company with five marijuana dispensaries in the Denver area and plans to expand within Colorado and to four other states. Last year, the companys sales reached $10 million.

title: Every Last Bit
description: Whats this? I asked on my first visit to Seki, an unassuming izakaya  a Japanese bar with food  in a quiet corner of Washington. The menu was typically simple, listing sashimi, fried octopus, grilled eel, tempura, pickles, skewered chicken hearts and monkfish livers. And something Id never seen before: ara yaki.

title: A Look at Smithsonian Journeys First Edition
description: Victoria Pope, the editor in chief of the new Smithsonian Journeys magazine, said she wants to give readers a visual and literary experience. I spent a lot of time talking to the people who run the [Smithsonian] tours and listening to their anecdotal stories about what people on their tours are the most interested in, she said. I feel like I have the perfect focus group in these people.

title: May I Lie to My Husband to Get Him to See a Doctor?
description: I believe my 86-year-old spouse is in the early stages of dementia. He wont see a doctor. I asked for some advice in an online caretakers forum, and a couple of people told me to tell my spouse some lie about why hes going to the doctor and then have the doctor give him a cognitive test. I think it would be unethical to ever trick someone into doing something, but if he is slipping into this disease, he may be doing all he can to protect himself from knowing it. Is it ethical to lie to someone in order to help him? NAME WITHHELD

title: Today in Politics: Jeb Bush Seeks a Shifted Focus in New Hampshire
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky has a plan to clear the legislative logjam and where one of the few Republicans not running for president discusses those who are. Among the likely candidates is Jeb Bush, who is visiting New Hampshire hoping for a salve for a tough week.

title: Q. and A.: Luo Yufeng, a.k.a. Sister Feng, on Life as a Manicurist in New York
description: When a New York Times investigation into the exploitation of Asian migrants working as manicurists in New York was published on the newspapers Chinese-language site recently, many readers in China asked on social media: What does Sister Feng think?

title: Takatas Airbag Recall a Result of Converging Forces
description: TOKYO  Just two weeks ago, the Japanese auto supplier Takata suggested the worst was over, as it continued to resist acknowledging any defects with its airbags.

title: Morning Agenda: UBS Fined $545 Million in Rigging Cases
description: UBS FINED $545 MILLION IN CURRENCY AND LIBOR RIGGING CASES | UBS said on Wednesday that it would pay more than $500 million in fines to authorities in the United States for its role in rigging the price of foreign currencies and benchmark interest rates,  Chad Bray writes in The New York Times. UBS said it would plead guilty to a criminal charge of wire fraud for its prior conduct over the manipulation of London interbank offered rate, or Libor, after the Justice Department revoked a 2012 nonprosecution agreement. The bank will also pay a $203 million fine and accept a three-year term of probation.

title: Finding Order, Out of Sequence
description: My fathers grave lay unmarked for over a year. I made many decisions about his affairs, but thinking about his grave marker was paralyzing. What should be written on his headstone? How could I possibly choose one phrase to capture his entire life? Was Wausau red or Missouri red a better granite color? How did I spell his Hebrew name? My choices would be etched in stone.

title: The Benefits and Pressures of Being a Young Genius
Classical Music This Week: Malkki, Brahms and the New Whitney
description: Good morning, music fans!

title: Newt Gingrich Weighs In on 2016 Crop and Why Hes Not in It
description: Republicans rarely have nice things to say about President Obama. Especially those who once wanted to take his job.

title: Does a Hillary Clinton Listicle Belong in Times Campaign Coverage?
description: Like many readers of news in the digital age, I like a good listicle from time to time  a candy bar to balance out the broccoli. (I even wrote one myself not long ago.)

title: Parents Dont Notice Extra Pounds on Overweight Children
description: Despite growing awareness about childhood obesity, parents actually seem to be getting less aware of their own childs weight problem.

title: Michelle Obamas Vigorous Exercise Routine Is Not a Stretch
description: Michelle Obama is serious about her workouts. Just ask President Obama, who issued a good-natured challenge to his wife last week as part of her #GimmeFive campaign on healthy living, and on Tuesday night got a gritty response from a first lady clad in black spandex, running shoes and boxing gloves.

title: Odd and Odder
description: Dear Diary:

title: No Reduced Bail for Flash Crash Trader
description: LONDON  A London judge on Wednesday denied an appeal by Navinder Singh Sarao, the futures trader accused of playing a major role in causing the flash crash of 2010, to reduce his bail after the United States government froze his assets worldwide.

title: Chinese Fleets Illegally Fish in West African Waters, Greenpeace Says
description: BEIJING  Chinese fishing fleets, driven by plummeting catches close to home, are flocking to distant West African waters, where they engage in ecologically ruinous bottom trawling, subterfuge and other illegal activities that threaten marine resources in a region already under pressure from overfishing, according to a report issued on Wednesday by Greenpeace.

title: $650,000 Homes in California, Florida and Montana
description: THE SEA RANCH, CALIF.

title: Barbra Streisand Memoir Coming in 2017
description: Barbra Streisand, the singer, actor, director and graduate of Erasmus Hall High School in Brooklyn, will publish a memoir in 2017. Viking on Wednesday announced it had bought the book, which will cover Ms. Streisands entire life and career.

title: Kering Becomes Luxurys Activist
description: Anyone else notice that Kering, the Paris-based luxury group that owns Gucci, Bottega Veneta, Yves Saint Laurent and Stella McCartney (among other brands), is suddenly everywhere?

title: Target, Posting a Profit, Hopes for Calmer Seas
description: After a string of costly missteps, Target, one of the nations largest retailers, indicated on Wednesday that it might finally be on more solid footing.

title: House Hunting in ... Nicaragua
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM CLIFFTOP HOUSE ON THE PACIFIC COAST

title: David Mamet Plays Revived by the Atlantic Theater Company
description: In 1985, there was no bigger playwright than David Mamet. The year before, he won a Pulitzer for Glengarry Glen Ross, and he followed that by helping to start an Off Broadway theater, the Atlantic. That same year, Lincoln Center presented the New York premiere of a pairing of short works by Mr. Mamet, The Shawl and Prairie du Chien. His theatrical reputation has fallen since then, with a string of mediocre (Race) to worse (The Anarchist) new works over the past decade.

title: On the Runway Moving
description: Thank you for visiting On the Runway. This blogs daily features, including fashion and industry news, can now be found at the On the Runway page, as well as at the Styles home page.

title: A Tech Boom Aimed at the Few, Instead of the World
description: The tech industry used to think big. As early as 1977, when personal computers were expensive and impractical mystery boxes with no apparent utility or business prospects, the young Bill Gates and Paul Allen were already working toward a future in which we would see a computer on every desk and in every home. And in the late 1990s, when it was far from clear that they would ever make a penny from their unusual search engine, the audacious founders of Google were planning to organize every bit of data on the planet  and make it available to everyone, free.

title: Daily Report: U.S. Accuses Six Chinese Citizens of Stealing Tech Data
description: The Obama administration on Tuesday announced the arrest of a Chinese professor and the indictment of five other Chinese citizens in what it contended was a decade-long scheme to steal microelectronics designs from American companies on behalf of the Chinese government, David E. Sanger and Nicole Perlroth report.

title: American Ballet Theater Turns 75
description: The ballet company hosted its diamond jubilee spring gala at Lincoln Center.

title: Survey Finds Americans Dont Trust Government and Companies to Protect Privacy
description: Americans highly value the privacy of their personal information and communications, but they have little faith that the government and private companies will actually protect their data, according to a report to be published Wednesday by the Pew Research Center.

title: The Price of Knowing a Big N.B.A. Secret? Two Hours of Your Freedom
description: What is it like to know something that millions of other people want to know, but to have no way of telling anyone? I found out on Tuesday night as one of the news media witnesses to the N.B.A. draft lottery.

title: Rigging of Foreign Exchange Market Makes Felons of Top Banks
description: For the worlds biggest banks, what seemed like the perfect business turned out to be the perfect breeding ground for crime.

title: ISIS Fighters Seize Control of Syrian City of Palmyra, and Ancient Ruins
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Islamic State militants swept into the historic desert city of Palmyra in central Syria on Wednesday, and by evening were in control of it, residents and the Syrian state news media said, a victory that gives them another strategically important prize five days after the group seized the Iraqi city of Ramadi.

title: Zayat Sells American Pharoahs Breeding Rights
description: Ahmed Zayat, who owns the Kentucky Derby and Preakness Stakes winner American Pharoah, said Tuesday that he had sold the colts breeding rights.

title: Critics Say Jindal Order on Same-Sex Marriage Is Motivated by 2016 Campaign Bid
description: NEW ORLEANS  Given speculation about an imminent presidential run, more than a few in Louisiana were quick to dismiss as political calculation Gov. Bobby Jindals decision Tuesday to issue an executive order that he said would protect those who do not support same-sex marriage.

title: PartnerRe Willing to Discuss Improved Takeover Bid From Exor
description: LONDON  The reinsurer PartnerRe said on Wednesday that its board was willing to engage in discussions with the Italian investment company Exor to see if it would improve an unsolicited $6.8 billion takeover offer.

title: North Korea Claims It Has Built Small Nuclear Warheads
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea said on Wednesday that it had already built nuclear weapons small enough to be carried by missiles, even as a senior American general questioned the countrys recent claim that it had successfully tested a submarine-launched ballistic missile.

title: Hillary Clinton Hires Lorella Praeli, a Dreamer, to Connect With Latinos
description: While campaigning for Democrats during last falls midterm campaign, Hillary Rodham Clinton was interrupted during several speeches by young Latino activists, who call themselves Dreamers, pressing her to take a stance on an overhaul of the immigration system.

title: The Kings of Chinese Comedy
description: Scenes from the countrys burgeoning stand-up scene.

title: Nepalese Officials Set Two-Story Limit on Height of New Buildings After Quakes
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  Nepalese officials this week announced a temporary, two-story height limit on new buildings, even as post-earthquake rebuilding projects are breaking ground.

title: Irans Supreme Leader Rules Out Broad Nuclear Inspections
description: TEHRAN  Irans supreme leader on Wednesday ruled out allowing international inspectors to interview Iranian nuclear scientists as part of any potential deal on its nuclear program, and reiterated that the country would not allow the inspection of military sites.

title: N.B.A. Draft 2015: Teams With Top Five Picks Have Decisions to Make
description: The Minnesota Timberwolves have the market cornered on No. 1 picks.

title: Super PAC Backing Hillary Clinton Sees Staff Overhaul
description: An official with the group Emilys List will be joining the super PAC backing Hillary Rodham Clintons presidential campaign, officials said Wednesday  part of a shake-up over the last month as the outside group prepares to raise millions of dollars in unlimited contributions.

title: Health Workers and Patients Under Threat in 17 Countries, Report Finds
description: Geneva  Health workers, patients and medical facilities have come under attack in 17 countries since the start of 2014, a coalition of 24 nongovernmental organizations said in a report released Wednesday that urged a greater international effort to protect health services.

title: Instagram Highlights
description: Snapshots from Stephen Shores account, which has amassed 41.1K followers to date.

title: A Start-Up That Makes Loans Based on Loyalty When Banks Will Not
description: To the residents of Ypsilanti, Mich., Beezys Cafe looks like a thriving business. The six-year-old restaurant and coffeehouse draws crowds for breakfast and lunch, employs 16 people, has a trail of glowing Yelp reviews for its hippy vibe and super friendly staff, and recently extended its hours to serve dinner on Fridays and Saturdays.

title: Criminal Complaint Against Polos and Glover
description: The charges filed against David Polos and Glen Glover, two longtime employees of the Drug Enforcement Administration, include lying about their work at the Twins Plus Go-Go Lounge club in South Hackensack, N.J.

title: Unlike You, Your Facebook Account Can Be Immortal
description: On Facebook

title: 2 D.E.A. Workers Are Accused of Secretly Running Strip Club
description: The Twins Plus Go-Go Lounge in South Hackensack, N.J., had all of the accouterments: dancers in various states of undress, bouncers, bartenders and private stalls for lap dances.

title: Insane Things Ted Cruz Says: The Left Obsessed With Sex
description: Is someone projecting? Just a little?

title: Classical Playlist: Teodor Currentzis, Bach and Per Bloland
description: RAMEAU: The Sound of Light Nadine Koutcher, soprano; Alexei Svetov, bass; Teodor Currentzis, conductor; MusicAeterna(Sony) The Greek conductor Teodor Currentzis and MusicAeterna, the orchestra and chamber choir he founded in the remote Siberian city of Perm, burst onto the scene last year with a sharply idiosyncratic recording of Mozarts Le Nozze di Figaro. Here he brings the same electrifying energy to instrumental selections and vocal scenes from Rameaus operas. If there is a hint of narcissism in the way Mr. Currentzis bends tempos to his will and ratchets up extreme dynamics theres also no doubt as to the exhilarating, shock-and-awe vitality of these performances. (Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim)

title: Lupita Nyongos Stylist Shares Snapshots of Their Trip to Cannes
description: For her first Opening Night Ceremony appearance at a Cannes Film Festival, the actress and her stylist, Micaela Erlanger, turned to Gucci. Here, in her own words, Erlanger recalls the experience.

title: Reader Idea | Learning Arithmetic With Number Puzzles
description: As we wind down the school year heading into Memorial Day weekend, were publishing three new great Reader Ideas sharing how teachers recommend using The Times for teaching and learning. We begin with an idea from Tim McNamara, a math specialist and retired teacher, who recommends using KenKen puzzles on The Timess Crosswords & Games pages as a fun way to practice arithmetic skills.

title: Chelsea Clinton to Publish Her First Book
description: Bill and Hillary Rodham Clinton have made a cottage industry out of writing books. Now their daughter, Chelsea, will try her hand at it.

title: 36 Hours in Bilbao
description: Explore street view, find things to do in Bilbao.

title: Tunisia Museum Attack Suspect Arrested in Italy
description: ROME  The Italian police said Wednesday they had arrested a 22-year old Moroccan man on suspicion of involvement in the March attack on the National Bardo Museum in Tunisia that killed 21 tourists and a police officer. The man had arrived in Italy aboard a migrant boat a month before the attack, a Milan police official said..

title: 36 Hours in Bilbao
description: Beyond Bilbaos Guggenheim museum, theres much to explore, from Michelin-star restaurants and medieval streets, to a bar run by a world-class mixologist.

title: How a Childhood Vaccine Reduces Risk of a Cancer
description: Young children are routinely vaccinated against Haemophilus influenzae Type B, or HiB, a bacterium that can cause meningitis and other serious problems. But the HiB vaccine has an added benefit: It reduces the risk for acute lymphoblastic leukemia, or ALL, the most common childhood cancer, and now scientists know why.

title: 36 Hours in Bilbao, Spain
description: Bilbao, in the heart of the Basque Country in northern Spain, was put on the American radar in 1997 by the opening of the Guggenheim, the scaly titanium-clad museum that made its architect, Frank Gehry, a household name.

title: Altices Deal for Suddenlink Is a Foray Into John Malones Backyard
description: The French cable king Patrick Drahi is showing controlled ambition by extending his multibillion-dollar telecom empire to the United States.

title: Chinese Scientists Indicted by U.S. Are Seen as Stars at Home
description: BEIJING  Several of the six Chinese scientists who were charged with economic espionage by the United States this week are young stars in their fields, and any government ties they have are rooted in their work with a university vying to be a major force in microchip engineering and sales, according to online documents and an interview with a colleague.

title: Camp David Neighbors Fight Historic Designation to Keep Out Scientology-Backed Center
description: THURMONT, Md.  Off a winding road in the Catoctin Mountains, rustic cabins with names like Dogwood and Birch border a stream where local lore has it that Herbert Hoover and Dwight D. Eisenhower once fished. The sprawling property, known as Trout Run, was used in the series The West Wing as a stand-in for Camp David, the presidential retreat just seven miles away.

title: Yankees FaceJacoby Ellsburys Downside: His Injuries
description: WASHINGTON  When the Yankees signed Jacoby Ellsbury to a seven-year, $153 million contract before last season, they were paying to steal away from Boston a dynamic leadoff man who had helped the Red Sox win two World Series and once finished as the runner-up in voting for a Most Valuable Player Award.

title: Opt Out Becomes Anti-Test Rallying Cry in New York State
description: BOICEVILLE, N.Y.  It started with a speech in the fall, to parents who had gathered in the auditorium to learn what to expect during the nascent school year.

title: A Director Casts a Woman to Play Him in the Tale of His Life
description: CANNES, France  My Mother, the latest film by the Italian director Nanni Moretti, tells the story of a film director trying to hold things together on the set while her mother, a retired high school teacher, is dying in a hospital in Rome. The film springs from reality. Mr. Morettis mother was a beloved teacher of Latin and Greek at one of Romes leading public high schools, and she died in 2010, when he was making We Have a Pope.

title: Bookshelf: Music Makers
description: New picture books include The ABC Animal Orchestra and Drum Dream Girl.

title: Shot in the Name of Art
description: This short documentary celebrates the late conceptual artist Chris Burdens landmark work Shoot, in which a friend shot him in the arm.

title: Shot in the Name of Art
description: What does it take to get shot in the name of art? For the late conceptual artist Chris Burden, who did just that, it required courage, vision and an excellent triggerman. One willing to accept the risk that if he missed his target by inches, art could morph into homicide.

title: Benjamin Lawsky, Sheriff of Wall Street, Is Taking Off His Badge
description: It has been a grim few years for the banks that Benjamin M. Lawsky regulates. He threatened to pull their licenses, fined them hundreds of millions of dollars and forced dozens of their employees to resign.

title: Key Cases for the Sheriff of Wall Street
description: Benjamin M. Lawkys four-year tenure as New Yorks overseer of banking and insurance shook up the sleepy world of financial regulation in New York.

title: Republicans Continue to Lurch Right on Immigration
description: Staring at startling exit polls after a beating by President Obama in 2012, Republicans vowed they were finally ready to do something about immigration reform or risk further alienating Hispanic voters.

title: Nebraska Legislature, in Bipartisan Vote, Bans Death Penalty
description: The Nebraska Legislature on Wednesday voted, 32 to 15, to abolish the death penalty, setting up a final showdown between a bipartisan coalition that supported the bill and the Republican governor, who has promised to veto it. No conservative state has banned the death penalty since North Dakota did so in 1973.

title: Stone Tools From Kenya Are Oldest Yet Discovered
description: One morning in July 2011, while exploring arid badlands near the western shore of Lake Turkana in Kenya, a team of archaeologists took a wrong turn and made a big discovery about early human technology: Our hominin ancestors were making stone tools 3.3 million years ago, some 700,000 years earlier than previously thought.

title: 1940: Hitler Demand Brings Tension
description: Newsreel footage of Swedish military exercises in January 1940. britishpathe.com.

title: 1965: Pakistani Jet Crashes; 121 Die
description: CAIRO  One hundred and twenty-one persons were killed today [May 20] when a Pakistan International Airlines plane crashed as it approached here. Six persons, seriously injured, survived. Shortly before the crash, the pilot of the four-jet Boeing 720-B airliner, which was inaugurating a new route from Karachi to London via Dhahran, Cairo and Geneva, reported to the Cairo control tower that he was having trouble with his wing flaps. Five minutes later, a ball of fire lit up the sky as the plane plowed into a sandhill six miles south of the airport.  New York Herald Tribune, European edition, May 21, 1965

title: At Nobel Peace Center Museum, a Fence Makes a Statement About Migrant Crisis
description: OSLO  After a construction site opened next door to the Nobel Peace Center, the museum for the Nobel Peace Prize here, the museum directors decided their side of the fence should send a message.

title: A Suite of Spring Childrens Stories  Without Words
description: Wordless books have enormous potential to encourage collaborative storytelling with children, says Cristin Stickles, the childrens and YA buyer for McNally Jackson Books. You can have a different story every time with just one book. These three new titles from around the world, filled with nothing but beautiful illustrations, invite adults to exercise their imaginations  or simply delight in the imagery alone.

title: Retraction Sought in Study on Views of Gay Marriage
description: The senior author of a widely covered study suggesting that gay political canvassers could change conservative voters views on same-sex marriage has asked that the report be retracted because his fellow author failed to produce the raw data. The study appeared in December in the journal Science, and numerous media outlets, including The New York Times, published articles on the findings.

title: N.A.S.L. Will Add Miami Team in 2016, Beating David Beckham Onto Field
description: The North American Soccer League, which has had Major League Soccer encroach on several of its markets and even poach one of its teams, fired a shot of its own Wednesday by reaching an agreement to field a team in Miami.

title: Minecraft Stars on YouTube Share Secrets to Their Celebrity
description: Minecraft is one of the most successful video games in the world, with more than 100 million registered users. YouTube is the top video site in the world, with a billion unique visitors a month.

title: In Kentucky, Republican Primary Yields Disarray
description: WASHINGTON  When Matt Bevin, a wealthy Louisville businessman and Tea Party favorite, tried to unseat Mitch McConnell, the Senate Republican leader, in the Kentucky primary last year, Mr. McConnell vowed to crush them everywhere  meaning the Tea Party and Mr. Bevin. He did.

title: Little Penguins Move Into the Bronx Zoo
description: Whats more irresistible than a penguin? An extremely small penguin, you say?

title: Despite Knicks Lottery Misfortune, Opportunity May Still Knock
description: With all the obligatory talk of draft lottery conspiracies and good-luck charms, Larry Bird was asked if he had anything in his pocket to heighten his Indiana Pacers chances of a mathematical miracle in the N.B.A.s annual game show production Tuesday night.

title: In Osama bin Laden Library: Illuminati and Bob Woodward
description: WASHINGTON  To join Al Qaeda in Osama bin Ladens day, prospective recruits had to take an arduous and risky journey to the networks haven in the mountains of northwestern Pakistan, the heartland of global Islamist militancy.

title: Male Java Sparrow Adds a Beat to Its Song
description: Male Java sparrows are songbirds  and, scientists reported on Wednesday, natural percussionists.

title: Fun Home and Something Rotten! Plan to Tour
description: The producers of Fun Home, a much-praised new musical with an emotional punch and, now, packed houses, said Wednesday that they would take the production on tour next year.

title: Malaysian Official Discusses Migrant Aid
description: The foreign minister of Malaysia, Anifah Aman, said Wednesday that his country would provide humanitarian assistance to 7,000 migrants still at sea.

title: The View From the Top of 1 World Trade
description: The observatory at 1 World Trade Center opens to the public on May 29.

title: Early Views From New World Trade Center Observatory
description: With a step-right-up showmanship that does credit to the memory of P. T. Barnum, Legends Hospitality lifted the curtain a bit higher this week on its three-level, $32-a-head observatory near the top of 1 World Trade Center.

title: Fed Minutes Show Policy Makers Lean Toward a Rate Rise After June
description: WASHINGTON  Economic weakness in the early months of the year has persuaded most Federal Reserve officials that June is probably too soon to start raising the Feds benchmark interest rate. But they are not planning to wait much longer.

title: Woman Arrested in Attempted Kidnapping of Boy in Central Park
description: The police have arrested a woman who is accused of trying to take a 2-year-old boy sitting on a swing in Central Park last week, before she was stopped by the childs nanny, the authorities said on Wednesday.

title: House Sends Human Trafficking Bill to Presidents Desk
description: The House overwhelmingly approved the Senates much debated human trafficking bill on Tuesday, sending legislation that stalled in the Senate for six weeks to President Obamas desk with little fanfare.

title: Khamenei Refuses to Allow Interviews
description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, the supreme leader of Iran, said Wednesday that his country would not allow its nuclear scientists to be interviewed or its military sites inspected.

title: Fashion Ads on Instagram For Arts Sake
description: Collagists are garnering acclaim and thousands of followers by lampooning luxury.

title: Make the Kids Make Dinner. Its Good for Them.
description: Chores: Something to look forward to!

title: Packing Heat in Texas After the Waco Shootout
description: The Harleys and guns in Wacos biker gang shootout Sunday barely had time to cool before the Texas legislature nonchalantly moved ahead with a measure to legalize the open carrying of handguns in public. This bill does not have anything to do with what went on yesterday, State Senator Joan Huffman, a Houston Republican, insisted Monday before the state affairs committee approved the measure for floor debate, where it is expected to receive final passage.

title: Michael Caine on Elderly Roles and Why He Snubbed Cannes After Alfie
description: CANNES, France  Paolo Sorrentinos Youth, having its premiere at the Cannes Film Festival on Wednesday night, stars Michael Caine as Fred Ballinger, an aging composer on vacation at a Swiss resort. Asked at a news conference Wednesday how it felt to be getting older and asked to play aging characters, Mr. Caine cut to the point. The only alternative to playing elderly people is playing dead people, the 82-year-old actor said. So I picked elderly people.

title: The Dad Bod, Quantified
description: The Internet has burned this month with commentary about womens alleged new interest in the soft, doughy dad bod.

title: Soccer-Style Goal Doesnt Count, but Blackhawks Keep Their Heads Up
description: If Andrew Shaw were a soccer player, his headed goal Tuesday night in an extra period would not have been unusual. It also would have counted.

title: Review: Emerson String Quartet Caps Banner Season With Works of Mixed Emotions
description: Records! According to the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Centers co-artistic director Wu Han, who gave a characteristically effusive welcome before the societys season-ending performance by the Emerson String Quartet at Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday, this has been a banner year for the society. Attendance? Record! Number of concerts? Record! Number of weeks with a radio broadcast? Record!

title: Taking Stand Against Spying, Rand Paul Stages Senate Filibuster
description: Just how long can Rand Paul talk?

title: Video: Your Favorite David Letterman Memories
description: David Letterman brings his 33-year career in late night to a close on Wednesday, and the tributes have been flowing in for weeks.

title: Video Feature: As California Thirsts, These Apps Help Save Water
description: CALIFORNIAS drought is a powerful reminder of the vulnerability and precious nature of our water resources. To become more responsible with water usage and waste, a few apps can help people learn about and reduce their water consumption.

title: App Smart | Track Your Water Usage
description: Many people are looking for ways to keep track of their water consumption. New apps like Vizsafe, Drip Detective and Dropcountr can help you save water and save money.

title: A Preview of David Guttenfelders Photos From North Korea
description: David Guttenfelder, an American photojournalist, is spending a week in the reclusive nation of North Korea on assignment for The New York Times. The Times will feature a selection of his work in the weeks ahead. In the meantime, Mr. Guttenfelder will post images to his Instagram feed of daily life in the capital, Pyongyang, and elsewhere in North Korea.

title: Liu Xiaobo Is Locked Up in China, and Locked Out of the Translation of a Paul Auster Novel
description: The works of the New York writer Paul Auster often hinge on ominous disappearances, and his novel Sunset Park has passages about the secretive detention of the Chinese dissident-writer Liu Xiaobo in 2008 and the efforts of the PEN American Center, a writers advocacy group, to secure his release.

title: Inside Kathy Dalwoods Studio
description: On the eve of her Bergdorf Goodman debut, the British sculptor shares her process with T.

title: Study Links Dolphin Deaths to Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill
description: Lung and adrenal lesions found in dead bottlenose dolphins stranded along the Gulf of Mexico between June 2010 and December 2012 are consistent with the types of damage that marine mammals sustain from exposure to petroleum products after an oil spill, according to a new study published on Wednesday by researchers from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

title: Guilty Pleas and Heavy Fines Seem to Be Cost of Business for Wall St.
description: WASHINGTON  Even as five big banks plead guilty to felonies and paying out billions of dollars, the question remains whether top executives will shrug off the penalties as just an average cost of doing business.

title: Stephen Shore Loves Instagram (and Thinks Warhol Would Have, Too)
description: From Ryan Trecartins Vimeo-art to David Hockneys iPad paintings, visual thinkers are often the first to embrace and experiment with new technology. Its no surprise then that Stephen Shore, the American wunderkind who led color photographys art vanguard in the 70s, should have adopted the social medium of Instagram with such boyish enthusiasm. So fervent is the 67-year-olds interest, that for this past year he has been shooting on the picture-sharing site almost exclusively  a practice he describes as taking fun seriously. This weekend, together with Jennifer Higgie (the editor of the art magazine Frieze), Shore takes part in a talk about Instagram at Photo London, a brand-new photographic fair in the British capital that starts tomorrow at Somerset House.

title: Jeb Bush on His Lineage: Get Over It
description: PORTSMOUTH, N.H.  Before a question was even asked at a round-table event here, Jeb Bush delivered blunt advice to those who view his last name as a burden: Get over it.

title: A New Grove at Versailles
description: The recently opened Water Theater Grove is the first new permanent commission at the Chteau de Versailles since the era of Louis XVI.

title: A One-Bird Band
description: By hitting its beak against a hard surface, a male Java sparrow adds a percussive accompaniment to its singing.

title: Click of a Sparrow
description: A male Java sparrow produces a click sound by hitting its beak against a hard surface.

title: A $15 Minimum Wage Bombshell in Los Angeles
description: There are many ways to look at the minimum wage increase in Los Angeles from the current $9 an hour to $15 by 2020  some hopeful, some cautionary, all good.

title: Dont Assume That You Know Your Monthly Spending and Income
description: Most people have a pretty good idea how much money they make each month, and at least a rough idea of how much they spend.

title: Attorney General Announces Bank Fines
description: Attorney General Loretta E. Lynch said that four of the worlds largest banks would pay more than $2.5 billion after pleading guilty to manipulating foreign exchange rate markets.

title: (Dis)Honesty  The Truth About Lies Examines How Falsehoods Sprout
description: The reality is, says Dan Ariely, a Duke University professor, we all have the potential of being bad.

title: Up to 1.1 Million Customers Could be Affected in Data Breach at Insurer CareFirst
description: CareFirst, a Blue Cross Blue Shield plan, on Wednesday became the third major health insurer in the United States to disclose this year that hackers had breached its computer systems and potentially compromised some customer information.

title: Depression Tied to Increased Risk of Parkinsons Disease
description: Depression is associated with an increased risk for Parkinsons disease, a new study reports, and the more severe the depression, the higher the risk.

title: A Summer Weight Bomber Jacket Defines a New Label  and Its Owner
description: When George McCracken was designing what would become the first release under his new M-82 label  a lightweight, zip-front shirt jacket, available now  he had a very clear customer in mind: himself. I wanted a uniform that I could wear all the time, especially in the summer, he says. You walk out of the door and its so hot in New York, but you cant just wear jeans and a t-shirt to work. You have to wear some layer over it. Its always a puzzle.

title: Pictures of the Day: Indonesia, Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Romania, Nepal, Indonesia and More  Pictures of the Day

title: May 20, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Indonesia, Syria, Nepal and Burundi.

title: The Ones Who Walk Away From Westeros
description: I was trying to find something original to say about the Mad Men finale, but the debate over this weeks episode of Game of Thrones has turnedout to be more interesting than the mysteries of Don Draper. It even roped in a United States Senator, Claire McCaskill, who announced her intention to give up watching Thrones after Sundays show concluded with (spoiler, spoiler, spoiler, SPOILER) the wedding-night rape of Sansa Stark, the often-menaced daughter of the shows most heroic and beleaguered family, at the hands of the most sadistic and loathsome member of the shows dramatis personae, Ramsay Bolton.

title: Frida Kahlo: Art, Garden, Life
description: A look at a new exhibition at the New York Botanical Garden.

title: Cubanacn Imagines When Che and Fidel Compared Golf Swings
description: HAVANA  A tenor sang the role of Fidel Castro. Che Guevara was a baritone. As the outdoor opera rehearsal got underway here, they were playing a round of golf, wielding comically outsize clubs and singing about Eisenhower, Kennedy and their swings.

title: Ignoring the Penalty for Not Buying Health Insurance
description: Obamacares big stick doesnt seem to be scaring many people into buying health insurance.

title: Spotify Is Expanding to Include Video and Predictive Playlists
description: Spotify now wants to help you jog, watch videos and catch up on podcasts, all in addition to listening to music  a move that will put the company into competition with Apple, YouTube and other technology outlets.

title: Pitch Perfect 2 Soundtrack Tops Album Chart
description: In the latest weekend box office, the singing ladies of Pitch Perfect 2 clobbered a classic guy movie, Mad Max: Fury Road. That pattern has now repeated itself in music, as Pitch Perfect 2 becomes the latest soundtrack to top the album chart, beating out Mumford & Sons and David Guetta.

title: Archivists Find Fragments of an Unfinished Orson Welles Autobiography
description: LOS ANGELES  Yet another unfinished work by Orson Welles, that master of the incomplete, is about to surface.

title: At home with Gail Albert Halaban
description: In Chelsea with the photographer ahead of her latest opening.

title: Blue Mascaras With Broad Appeal
description: High-end makeup brands are reviving the color.

title: Boko Harams Calculated Campaign of Sexual Violence
description: We have been hearing for some time about Boko Harams brutal treatment of women and girls in northeast Nigeria, where the Islamist group is waging war against the central government. Nothing demonstrated the extremists depravity more clearly than the 2014 abduction from the village of Chibok of nearly 300 schoolgirls, most of whom are still missing. Until now.

title: Los Angeles Is Becoming Paris Amid the Palms
description: Los Angeles  High in the hills above Palm Springs, Calif., two hours and change outside Los Angeles in a straight-shot drive, a French fashion designer was rhapsodizing about California culture and California archetypes, the land and the scene, the Palm Springs desert and the saucer-shaped house where hed staged his latest collection. Under his direction, Louis Vuitton had rented, at what can only be assumed to be fabulous expense, the John Lautner-designed Bob and Dolores Hope estate and flew in some 500 guests from around the world.

title: Fox News Seeks to Limit First Presidential Debate to 10 Republicans
description: The sprawling field of Republican presidential hopefuls will be abruptly winnowed down to as few as 10  at least for debating purposes  when the first presidential debate is held in early August, Fox News, the debate sponsor, said Wednesday.

title: For the American Ballet Theaters 75th, Black-Tie Guests
description: On Monday night around the fountain at Lincoln Center, two kinds of gowns flooded the plaza in a whirling mass: purple choir gowns, worn by graduating students of New York University, and pricey designer gowns, worn by patrons of the American Ballet Theater, arriving at the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: Chechen Leader Scolds WhatsApp Users for Spreading Rumors About Officials Wedding
description: Chechnyas Instagram-addicted leader, Ramzan A. Kadyrov, sternly advised Chechen men to bar their wives from using another popular messaging service, WhatsApp, in a lecture broadcast this week on state television.

title: Hammer Attack Suspect Is Arraigned From Hospital Bed
description: A man who the authorities say attacked several people with a hammer at random in New York City and was later shot by the police was arraigned from his hospital bed on multiple assault charges on Wednesday, appearing before a judge via a video link.

title: Leaving Orbit, a Pensive Ode to Closing of a Frontier
description: In May 1961, President John F. Kennedy said in a speech to Congress: I believe that this nation should commit itself to achieving the goal, before this decade is out, of landing a man on the moon and returning him safely to the Earth. Space, he declared the next year, is the new ocean, and I believe the United States must sail on it and be in a position second to none.

title: At the Cannes Film Festival, Some Gems Midway Through
description: CANNES, France  Midway through the 68th Cannes Film Festival, and the critics are restless. There have been good and great movies, and even triumphs; almost tout le monde has gone over the moon for Carol, Todd Hayness exquisitely directed and acted drama about women in love in 1950s America, starring the well-matched Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara. Yet as the disappointments roll out, including The Sea of Trees, Gus Van Sants hostilely received male weepie with Matthew McConaughey, the jeers and chatter have deemed the main competition  that roster of high-profile, star-crammed titles eligible for the Palme dOr  the weakest in years.

title: Rough Chic Adds a Glow to Start-Ups
Big Money, Phony Diplomas: Reporters Notebook
description: The article started with a question: Just how was Axact, a company that billed itself as Pakistans biggest software firm but seemed to have few products, making its money?

title: How to Say Butterfly in Other Languages
description: Listen to Holly Tooker, a conservatory guide at the American Museum of Natural History, say the word butterfly in a few of her favorite languages.

title: Marina Abramovic Institute Apologizes to Jay Z, and to Abramovic
description: Following a dispute that veered uncomfortably close to performance art, Jay Z and Marina Abramovic have settled their beef.

title: Review: International Contemporary Ensemble and Others Play in Brooklyn
description: Id never seen a cellist play with two bows simultaneously until Tuesday evening. But John Zorns music, always jam-packed, has seemingly grown so teeming that a single one just doesnt suffice.

title: Going Upscale at Up & Up, on Macdougal Street
description: Back in the 1950s, few places were hipper than Macdougal Street, the birthplace of the Beats, coffeehouse culture and Bob Dylan. But for some time now, it has been overrun by touristy bars, late-night food stands and raucous students. The Up & Up, an upscale cocktail lounge, opened there in the winter with the hopes of bringing some vintage cachet back. With top-notch drinks, midcentury style and a low-key crowd, it is an island of sanity amid the frat party roiling just past its discreet door.

title: Review: Ufomammut Slowly Glides From Riff to Riff, at Saint Vitus
description: Ufomammut is a slow and sure Italian band, a power trio playing a loud, cumbersome and fairly well-trod kind of metal. Hardly any solos here: low-frequency doom riffs and psychedelic oscillations, bass and guitar traveling along more or less the same simple lines, the short drum fills positioned behind the beat in more or less the same way, over and over and over, until each song heaves into a new section.

title: Prosecutors in George Washington Bridge Case Seek to Seal Evidence
description: Federal prosecutors who have brought charges against two former aides to Gov. Chris Christie in the George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal are seeking to seal the evidence collected during their 16-month investigation, saying they want to shield public officials and others not charged in the case from potentially embarrassing disclosures.

title: For an Octopus, Seeing the Light Doesnt Require Eyes
description: Octopuses, squid and cuttlefish  a group of mollusks known as cephalopods  are the oceans champions of camouflage.

title: Early Lessons in Ethnic Stereotypes in China
description: How do you teach children Chinese characters? Mnemonics help.

title: How to Manage High Medical Bills
description: Just because you have health insurance doesnt necessarily mean you can afford all your medical bills, especially if you have a high deductible. So sometimes, it pays to negotiate.

title: Inside Out, Pixars New Movie From Pete Docter, Goes Inside the Mind
description: EMERYVILLE, CALIF.  John Lasseter, a notepad in hand, settled into his seat in a dimly lit screening room at Pixar headquarters here in July 2012. Mr. Lasseter, Pixars chief creative officer, was there to evaluate progress on Inside Out, a new film set inside an 11-year-old girls mind. Had the filmmaking team cracked the unusual concept?

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Digital Skills: D.I.Y. Manicures and Pedicures
description: Whether or not youre grappling with guilt after reading recent articles in The New York Times on labor practices and working conditions at nail salons, knowing how to do your own manicure and pedicure is a useful skill.

title: Prosecutors Request to Seal Materials in Bridge Case
description: Federal prosecutors in the George Washington Bridge scandal are seeking to seal the evidence collected during their 16-month investigation.

title: Review: The Japanese Dog, a Family Reunion in Romania
description: On the surface, the brooding, cynical dramas that have come to represent the standard of Romanian cinema  The Death of Mr. Lazarescu, 4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days have little in common with the humane family portraits of the great Japanese filmmaker Yasujiro Ozu (Tokyo Story). But both types of movies are uncommonly attentive to the passage of time and show an interest in the ways people are obligated to act toward one another.

title: Italy Confirms Arrest of Bardo Suspect
description: Bruno Megale, the chief antiterrorism investigator in Milan, said Wednesday that a suspect in the March attack on the Bardo Museum in Tunisia, Abdelmajid Touil, was arrested Tuesday night in Milan.

title: Review: Othello Is Performed by the American Ballet Theater
description: At the climax of Tuesdays curtain calls for the three-act ballet Othello, Marcelo Gomes, who had danced the title role, came running onto the stage in a triumphant arc from the rear wings to greet the audience, pausing only  fleetingly, courteously  to greet his Desdemona, Julie Kent. Many in American Ballet Theaters audience at the Metropolitan Opera House rose and cheered; the warm and generous ardor with which he ran, arms outstretched, made this a great moment.

title: Syrian Minister on Preserving Palmyra
description: Muhammad al-Shaar, the Syrian interior minister, said that the government, in cooperation with the armed forces, was trying to protect antiquities in Palmyra from the Islamic State.

title: Hit the Beach With Hats, Swimwear and More
description: With Memorial Day upon us (hallelujah!), lets kick off summer with a playful bang. Here are some options.

title: Rescuing Nepals Relics
description: Since the April earthquake, teams have braved landslides and aftershocks to document the damage to Nepals antiquities as well as begin efforts to secure and restore them.

title: Blue Mascara: Lovelier the Second Time Around
description: Blue mascara may bring to mind big hair and shoulder pads, but a surprising number of high-end makeup brands are offering new takes on this potentially polarizing product, many in nuanced shades that, arguably, have a broader appeal than in the past.

title: Reviving Japans Dreaded and Beloved Ghosts
description: Tanuki, the badger-like, shape-shifting creatures of Japanese lore, are a rascally, impetuous bunch. In one tale, a tanuki playfully transforms into a steam train but then gets flattened by a real train coming from the opposite direction. In another, a tanuki kills an old woman and makes soup out of her, then takes her form and feeds the soup to her husband.

title: E.U.s Migrant Plan Strikes Many as Another Barrier
description: UNITED NATIONS  A ship is stranded at sea. The faces of passengers stare out from the portholes. Three countries refuse to let them come ashore.

title: Hundreds of Weapons, and Counting, Recovered After Waco Melee
description: WACO, Tex.  The bikers involved in the biggest and bloodiest clash of motorcycle gangs in recent decades brought an astonishing arsenal to the Twin Peaks restaurant in south Waco on Sunday, the police said Wednesday. Investigators have recovered more than 300 weapons in and around the restaurant, Sgt. Patrick Swanton of the Waco Police Department said.

title: Shopping Events and Sales Happening This Week in New York
description: The French luxury loafer brand Galet will embark on the Tour de Galet, a mobile retail pop-up housed in a 1940s Citren H-Van that will visit locations in the Hamptons and Montauk beginning Memorial Day weekend and continuing throughout the summer. The first stop is the mens boutique Mr. Q, where youll find whimsical patterned slip-on shoes with playful motifs like crabs and beach balls or lobsters and Popsicles ($225). At 44 Quogue Street, Quogue, N.Y.

title: Cameron to Propose Stricter Immigration Rules in Britain
description: LONDON  Amid rising concern across Europe over immigration, Prime Minister David Cameron will unveil a plan on Thursday that seeks to cut the numbers of migrants coming to Britain and make it harder for foreigners to work here illegally.

title: After Glitches in Test, Law Graduates Who Took Bar Exam Offered a Small Consolation
description: Last summer, law school graduates racked up some of the lowest scores in nearly a decade on the all-important bar exam. As the test takers and several law school deans viewed it, the poor results were not the fault of the graduates. Rather, it was a computer glitch that prevented them from uploading their completed exams on the first day of the multiday test.

title: Severe Mental Illness Found to Drop in Young, Defying Perceptions
description: The rate of severe mental illness among children and adolescents has dropped substantially in the past generation, researchers reported Wednesday, in an analysis that defies public perceptions of trends in youngsters mental health.

title: Construction Company Admits to Defrauding New York Clients
description: The construction companys plum New York projects included redoing the seats at the Brooklyn Academy of Musics Harvey Theater, building a charter school in Red Hook, and remaking, from brick and glass, the Fiterman Hall at the Borough of Manhattan Community College after it was damaged in the Sept. 11 attacks.

title: The Giants Will Beatty Is Sidelined With a Muscle Tear
description: For the last two years, with top draft picks and high-priced free-agent signings, the Giants worked desperately to rebuild an offensive line that had once been a team strength. The process suffered from injuries to aging bodies and outright failure during two disastrous seasons, but when the college draft ended earlier this month, the Giants offensive line finally appeared to have legitimate promise.

title: Brooklyn and Queens to Gain Views of July 4th Fireworks
description: The mayor sent forth a groaner about a dynamite celebration. A state senator quoted Katy Perry. The Brooklyn borough president aimed higher.

title: Roger Goodell Says Patriots Decision to Accept Punishment Is Not Tied to Tom Bradys Appeal
description: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell insisted on Wednesday that the New England Patriots owner, Robert K. Kraft, had decided on his own not to appeal the N.F.L.s punishment for underinflated footballs and rejected the notion that it was part of a deal to eventually reduce the four-game suspension of Tom Brady.

title: Cellphone of Amtrak Engineer to Be Studied
description: Investigators scrutinizing crucial moments before the fatal Amtrak train derailment last week in Philadelphia said Wednesday that they had taken the engineers cellphone to determine whether he made calls or sent text messages while driving the train.

title: Bruce Lundvall, Who Revived Blue Note Jazz Label, Dies at 79
description: Bruce Lundvall, a record executive whose 25-year run at the helm of Blue Note, preceded by top positions at CBS and Elektra, made him one of the most influential figures behind the scenes in recent jazz history, died on Tuesday in Ridgewood, N.J. He was 79.

title: The Best Latin American Photography
description: Mauricio Lima took top honors in Pictures of the Year Latin America, which highlights work done around the world by photographers from Latin America.

title: Amid Talk of Dutch Masters, Malcolm Rogers Looks Beyond Boston
description: At a luncheon Tuesday to discuss coming exhibitions at the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, Malcolm Rogers, who will step down as the museums director at the end of July, said in conversation that he had been considered for a position at a leading British museum but decided not to pursue the opportunity.

title: Export-Import Bank Near Showdown in Congress
description: WASHINGTON  In 2013, the impoverished African nation Cameroon teamed with General Electric and the Environmental Chemical Corporation, which is based in Burlingame, Calif., to begin work on a $668 million drinking water project for its thirsty capital, financed with loan guarantees from the Export-Import Bank of the United States.

title: Doctors Among Dozens Held in Raids Against Illegal Sales of Prescription Drugs
description: Seven doctors and 41 others in four Southern states were arrested Wednesday in raids by Drug Enforcement Administration agents, officials said, part of what the agency called its largest operation against illegal trafficking of prescription drugs. The raids came after a 15-month investigation by the agency, which focused on the illegal sale and distribution of painkillers including oxycodone and hydrocodone and the tranquilizer Xanax.

title: Chechen Leaders Advice on Women: Lock Them In
description: MOSCOW  Ramzan A. Kadyrov, the pugnacious president of the southern Republic of Chechnya and a close ally of President Vladimir V. Putin, finally had enough Wednesday of social media users mocking him relentlessly for seeming to push polygamy.

title: Concern About Palmyras Ancient Riches
description: It was once one of the most important cultural centers of the ancient world, a desert hub along the caravan route that in the first and second centuries served as a crossroads for Greek, Roman and Persian cultures.

title: Amid Butterflies, a Bit of a Lingua Franca at the Natural History Museum
description: On a recent Sunday, Holly Tooker stood by the transparent wall inside the Butterfly Conservatory, at the American Museum of Natural History. It was, as always, 81 degrees with 78 percent humidity, and it had been a busy morning. Nearby, a giant Danainae butterfly perched on a flowering Ixora plant; its black-veined transparent wings suggested a piece of Victorian jewelry. Ms. Tooker wore her auburn hair in an asymmetric pixie cut, and a button on the lanyard of her museum ID tag read: ICH SPRECHE DEUTSCH.

title: For Drivers, Confusion Reigns in Takata Airbag Recall
description: When millions of Americans woke up Wednesday morning to go to work, many asked themselves a simple question: Is my car safe to drive?

title: U.S. to Send Rockets to Iraq for ISIS Fight
