description: WASHINGTON  The United States is rushing 1,000 antitank rockets to the Iraqi military to help combat the massive suicide vehicle bombs that Islamic State militants used in capturing the provincial capital of Ramadi, a first step as the Obama administration weighs a range of difficult options to help its beleaguered ally.

title: Concussion Lawsuits Rankle School Groups
description: CHICAGO  Alex Pierscionek, a hearing-impaired freshman, went out for his high school football team in 2010. He had never played organized football, but he was pushing 6 feet tall, weighed more than 250 pounds and made the freshman squad at suburban Chicagos South Elgin High School as a defensive lineman. His new teammates gave him a nickname: Tank. Football became everything to me, he said.

title: Burundi: Legislative Elections Delayed
description: President Pierre Nkurunziza announced on Wednesday that parliamentary and local elections scheduled for May 26 would be postponed until June 5. But the delay may not affect the protests against Mr. Nkurunzizas decision to seek a third term. It is a unilateral decision, and it may be rejected because it was not based on the consensus of all political parties and partners, said Simeon Barumwete, a professor at the University of Burundi. On Wednesday, a soldier who was part of a group of troops trying to prevent clashes between protesters and the police was shot and killed by a police officer, witnesses said. At least 20 people have been killed in recent weeks, and more than 50,000 people have fled the country.

title: Tourist From Spain Is Killed by Bus in Manhattan
description: A 68-year-old woman visiting New York City from Spain was killed on Wednesday when a charter bus struck her as she tried to cross a street in Upper Manhattan, the police said.

title: Same-Sex Marriage and the Irish Catholic Church
Jeb Bush Opens Up About Mother-in-Laws Alzheimers
description: BEDFORD, N.H.  At an event in Portsmouth, N.H. on Wednesday, Jeb Bush raised his hand, acknowledging that he too had a loved one with Alzheimers disease.

title: Yemen: Houthi Leader Is Open to Talks
description: The leader of the Houthi rebel movement said in a televised speech on Wednesday that he was willing to conduct negotiations in a neutral country to end Yemens nearly two-month-old armed conflict. The comments by the leader, Abdel-Malik al-Houthi, suggested that the Houthis might take part in talks, sponsored by the United Nations, that were announced Wednesday and scheduled to be held in Geneva on May 28. The talks would be the first between Yemens warring parties since late March, when a military coalition led by Saudi Arabia began an air offensive to drive the Houthis from territory they had captured. The pace of the fighting has accelerated since Sunday, when a brief cease-fire arranged to deliver relief supplies expired and the Saudi-led coalition resumed airstrikes. More than 1,800 people have been killed since mid-March, and more than half a million Yemenis have been displaced, according to the United Nations.

title: Puffy, Feathered Sticking Point of a $612 Billion House Bill
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Bruce Westerman, an Arkansas Republican, spoke for many Americans this week when he conceded during a House hearing that he had never laid eyes on a sage grouse. Had he seen one, he surmised, he would have thought a bobwhite quail got friendly with a Dominecker hen.

title: Review: Macbeth, Accelerated, at Public Theater
description: Theres very little creeping in the Public Theaters Mobile Shakespeare Unit production of Macbeth. And the pace the director Edward Torres sets isnt exactly petty. Part of a project dedicated to bringing Shakespeare to underserved audiences, this sped-up and slimmed-down tragedy toured prisons, shelters and community centers before bundling its witches and thanes back to Lafayette Street.

title: Review: Permission and Spankings at the Lucille Lortel Theater
description: The sex farce has all but disappeared from the contemporary stage, and those of you mourning its demise (Hello out there?) may want to check out Permission, the new play by Robert Askins, author of the darkly subversive Hand to God, now on Broadway. In Mr. Askinss sex comedy with a twist  or rather a kink  two God-loving young couples discover corporal punishment as a way of spicing up their sex lives, or alleviating the tensions in their marriages, or a little of both.

title: Metaphor For Fun
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  We get a lot of mail about The New York Times Crossword and central to some of these lighthearted missives is the message, How dare you?

title: Climate Change Is a Threat, Obama Says
description: As part of his commencement address at the Coast Guard Academy on Wednesday, the president described climate change as a serious threat to global security.

title: Mayor de Blasio Is Said to Pick Longtime Friend as Press Secretary
description: Karen Hinton, a veteran communications consultant and a longtime friend of Mayor Bill de Blasio, is expected to become his press secretary as early as next month, according to two people familiar with the matter.

title: France Says Troops Killed Qaeda Commander in Mali
description: On Nov. 2, 2013, two French journalists were grabbed in the troubled northern Malian town of Kidal. Hours later, their bodies were found on a dirt track, lying near their kidnappers car, which had a broken steering wheel.

title: Missouri: Michael Brown Memorial Is Removed for Road Work
description: A makeshift memorial to Michael Brown in the middle of a Ferguson street was removed to allow paving, and a permanent tribute will be installed, city officials said Wednesday. The collection of stuffed animals, written messages and other items accumulated on Canfield Drive since Mr. Brown was fatally shot by a Ferguson police officer last August. Wednesday would have been Mr. Browns 19th birthday, and his father, Michael Brown Sr., said at a news conference with Ferguson officials that the time had come for the memorial to move. Mayor James Knowles III said the local chapter of the Urban League would temporarily store items from the memorial. Mr. Knowles said crews would begin repaving Canfield this week.

title: Florida: Judge Faces Suspension Over Threat to Public Defender
description: A judicial review panel recommended a four-month suspension for Judge John C. Murphy of Brevard County, who was caught on video last year berating and threatening to assault a public defender. The six-member Florida Judicial Qualifications Commission, in findings released Wednesday, unanimously found Judge Murphy guilty of violating various judicial canons, including being dignified and courteous to litigants, jurors, witnesses, lawyers, and others. The panel also recommended a fine of up to $50,000, a public reprimand and Judge Murphys continued participation in a mental health therapy program. He is accused of hitting a former assistant public defender, Andrew Weinstock, outside a courtroom last June after they exchanged words over whether Mr. Weinstocks client could have a speedy trial. The Florida Supreme Court will decide on the final punishment. It often adopts the panels recommendations. In video and audio recorded inside the courtroom, Judge Murphy is heard expressing frustration at Mr. Weinstock after he announced his intention not to waive the speedy trial right of his client. You know, if I had a rock, I would throw it at you right now, the judge said at one point. (AP)

title: ExcerptsFrom Bin Ladens Papers
description: Here are excerpts from documents seized from the compound in Pakistan where Osama bin Laden was killed.

title: Owner of American Pharoah Is Fighting Lawsuit Amid Triple Crown Bid
description: While American Pharoah has been winning six of his seven races and making his way to a historic bid next month for thoroughbred racings Triple Crown, his owner, Ahmed Zayat, has been contesting a federal lawsuit brought by a felon that alleges Mr. Zayat has failed to pay a $2 million debt he ran up betting via a website in Costa Rica.

title: Foul Fly Ball Lands With Thud, as Do Yankees
description: WASHINGTON  For 18 seasons, Carlos Beltran has played baseball with a casual grace that sometimes makes a difficult game look effortless. When Beltran was stroking home runs, running the bases or gliding across the outfield to steal away hits, he looked to have a gift that others did not.

title: Inquiry Finds Misconduct by a Top Surgeon, Paolo Macchiarini
description: An investigation in Sweden into a surgeon who is a pioneer in the field of regenerative medicine has found that he committed scientific misconduct by omitting or falsifying information about the conditions of three patients in medical journals.

title: Lightning Stun Rangers in Overtime to Take Series Lead
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The sixth and final shot that eluded Henrik Lundqvist on Wednesday night, the shot that nudged his team a little closer toward oblivion, whistled toward him from between the circles. Lundqvist had saved faster shots and heavier shots and closer shots  a breakaway, just a minute earlier  but this puck he just could not track, and he did not even see it as it sailed past him.

title: No Charges for 15 Students in Sex Case
description: LOS ANGELES  County prosecutors announced Wednesday that they would not bring charges against 15 Venice High School students arrested in March on sex-related accusations involving two underage girls, saying there was insufficient evidence.

title: Rough Night for Bartolo Colon, and the Rest of the Mets
description: Dan Warthen, the Mets pitching coach, stayed in the dugout as the first signs of trouble came for Bartolo Colon. St. Louiss leadoff batter, Kolten Wong, lined a single into center, and the Cardinals kept making solid contact, but Colon has a history of working out of these situations.

title: Matthew Weiner on the Coke Ad and the Meaning of Mad Men
description: Here is audio and video of the Matthew Weiner talk at the New York Public Library.

title: David Letterman, Ending an Era, Goes for Laughs Instead of Tears
description: There were jokes cracked and tributes paid. There were retrospectives and reminiscences, and a rock band that played at maximum volume. There was, of course, one last Top 10 list, delivered by a parade of celebrity guests.

title: A Photographer Used to Looking Out Looks Into Her Space
description: Pointing to the large panes that line the street-side wall of her Chelsea home and studio, the photographer Gail Albert Halaban explains the provenance of her celebrated Out My Window series. When my daughter was little, I used to feed her late at night while looking out, and on her first birthday, the shop across the street sent me balloons and flowers, but Id never met them. Theyd seen us the entire year and they noticed that people were over and having cake, so it must be a birthday party. It totally inspired the project.

title: Hong Hao Photographs Things (Well, Everything)
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: April Bloomfields Secrets for Prepping Vegetables
description: April Bloomfield, who once admitted to T that culinary school was a mere backup plan, believes that seasonal, veggie-centric recipes can and should be as fulfilling as meat-driven dishes. Its the subject of her newest cookbook, A Girl and Her Greens ($35, Ecco), in which she shares recipes and tips for preparing, as the cover promises, hearty meals from the garden. In the above video, the chef  and co-owner of the Spotted Pig, Breslin Bar & Dining Room, John Dory Oyster Bar and Salvation Taco in New York; and Tosca Cafe in San Francisco  reveals simple steps to prep portobello mushrooms, Brussels sprouts and artichokes before cooking them. And to show off your new skills, a recipe from her book follows.

title: Pop-Up Dining Down in New Orleans
description: By serving exceptional food in unexpected locations, the supper club scene steals the culinary spotlight in the Big Easy.

title: Epix Joining the World of Scripted TV With Two Original Series
description: There were 352 original, scripted television series last year on broadcast, cable and streaming services. None were televised on Epix, the premium television network known for its selection of movies.

title: Bidding Farewell to a Marquee Name
description: Brian Hawkins and Kathleen Kennedy of Folly Beach, S.C., before the final taping of the Late Show With David Letterman in Manhattan on Wednesday.

title: Word of the Day | nexus
description: nexus  \nek-ss\  noun

title: Cavaliers, Behind Great Guy J.R. Smith, Grab Lead Over Hawks
description: ATLANTA  After the Cleveland Cavaliers obtained J. R. Smith from the Knicks in a three-team trade in early January, Smith, a gifted but capricious guard, accompanied his new coach, David Blatt, to dinner.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 8 P.M. (NBC) RED NOSE DAY This British Comic Relief fund-raising campaign  created by the charity worker Jane Tewson and the director Richard Curtis (Love Actually, Notting Hill), and first broadcast on Christmas Day 1985 from a refugee camp in Sudan  crosses the ocean. In this three-hour event Will Ferrell, Jennifer Hudson, Jack Black, John Krasinski, Emily Blunt, Gwyneth Paltrow, Christina Aguilera, John Legend and Sam Smith, present comedy, music and videos produced by Funny or Die on behalf of 12 nonprofit organizations aiding poor children in the United States and abroad.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Who should we contact in case you become a martyr?

title: Editors Note: May 21, 2015
description: An article on Dec. 12, 2014, reported on a study published by the journal Science that said gay political canvassers could change conservative voters views on gay marriage by having a brief face-to-face discussion about the issue. The editor in chief of the journal said on Wednesday that the senior author of the study had now asked that the report be retracted because of the failure of his fellow author to produce data supporting the findings. An article about the latest developments is on Page A16.

title: Osama Bin Ladens Bookshelf Reflects His Fixation on West
description: Among the books, periodicals and letters found in Osama bin Ladens hide-out in Pakistan was a copy of the former C.I.A. officer Michael Scheuers 2004 book, Imperial Hubris: Why the West Is Losing the War on Terror, which describes the founder of Al Qaeda as the most respected, loved, romantic, charismatic and perhaps able figure in the last 150 years of Islamic history.

title: Q. and A.: Liu Heung Shing on the New Shanghai Center of Photography
description: The Hong Kong-born photographer Liu Heung Shing has long been known for documenting China and pursuing media ventures from a perch in Beijing. For many years, he lived in a restored courtyard home near the Forbidden City and the leadership enclave of Zhongnanhai.

title: The Best Latin American Photography
description: Mauricio Lima of Brazil has been named Photographer of the Year in the third Pictures of the Year Latin America contest. Daniele Volpe who is based in Guatemala was awarded second place and Alejandro Cegarra of Venezuela took third in the same category, while Daniel Rodriguez of Portugal was awarded an honorable mention.

title: Openness on Trade Deal
description: To the Editor:

title: A Candidate Like David Cameron?
description: To the Editor:

title: Good Night, David Letterman
description: To the Editor:

title: Children of the Japanese-American Internment
description: To the Editor:

title: Tubman Versus Jackson
description: Lets discuss putting a picture of a woman on the $20 bill. But, first: How many of you remember Ivy Baker Priest?

title: Of Bikers and Thugs
description: On Sunday, there was a deadly biker gang fight and massacre in Waco, Tex. Nine people were killed, and 18 others were injured.

title: Revisiting the Roots of the Iraq War
New Blood-Donor Policy, Same Gay Stigma
description: LAST week, the Food and Drug Administration released highly anticipated draft recommendations that would allow gay men to donate blood after one year of celibacy. While an improvement from the current, highly criticized lifetime ban, the new policy, which was announced in December, still caters to fear and stigma rather than science. It should be reconsidered.

title: The High Cost of Dirty Fuels
description: A new report from the International Monetary Fund makes a compelling case for why countries should end subsidies for fossil fuels: It would save millions of lives.

title: The Power of Hope Is Real
description: An awkward truth for bleeding hearts like myself is that there has never been much rigorous evidence that outside aid can sustainably lift people out of poverty.

title: What to Make of the Topsy-Turvy Bond Market
description: If you happen to trade bonds for a living, it is entirely understandable if you are feeling a little anxious these days.

title: Test Yourself | The Solitude of N.H.L. Goalies
description: Below are several paragraphs from the May 20 article N.H.L. Goalies Need Their Alone Time, er, Stretching Routines.

title: Telecom Italia Plans I.P.O. of Wireless Tower Unit
description: LONDON  Telecom Italia said on Thursday that it planned to sell up to 40 percent of its wireless telecommunications tower unit, Infrastrutture Wireless Italiane, in an initial public offering in Milan.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Monkeys Provide Clues to How Tool Use Developed
description: In Monkeys Provide Clues to How Tool Use Developed, James Gorman writes about new research on how primates use tools.

title: Europcar Seeks Regulators Approval for I.P.O. in Paris
description: LONDON  The French rental car provider Europcar said on Thursday that it had filed for permission from French regulators for an initial public offering on Euronext in Paris.

title: Moldova Eyes Russias Embrace as Flirtation With Europe Fades
description: CHISINAU, Moldova  Daniela Morari, a Foreign Ministry official who has been traveling her country trying to nudge Moldovans toward the European Union, has heard it all. People are worried that if you join the E.U., everyone becomes gay and that Brussels bureaucrats wont let you keep animals around your houses, an alarming prospect in a largely rural country.

title: U.S. and Cuba Extend Talks on Reopening Embassies
description: Despite a wave of optimism, United States and Cuban negotiators meeting in Washington on Thursday could not reach an accord on re-establishing long-fractured diplomatic ties but agreed to keep talking on Friday.

title: In Frida Kahlo: Art, Garden, Life, Nature Melds With the Artist Herself
description: THE first Frida moment occurs right off the bat in Frida Kahlo: Art, Garden, Life at the New York Botanical Garden.

title: Harlem, Because Convenience Counts
description: Two years ago, objecting to a large pending rent increase for their one-bedroom TriBeCa apartment, Marianne and Erik Jansen moved to Dumbo, Brooklyn. For a one-bedroom in a former factory building, they paid $3,900 a month, slightly less than their TriBeCa rent would have been.

title: How Good Are You at Saying Goodbye?
description: As David Letterman signs off as host of Late Show, his entire team that has been working together behind the scenes for decades will also be saying goodbye. Have you ever had to leave a team, friends or family members?

title: A Meeting, Seeking a Truce
description: After Armoni Sexton was killed in a drive-by shooting, community members and members of rival gangs within Paterson, N.J., gathered to discuss the longstanding tribal dispute in the city.

title: Too Late for a Basketball Prodigy, Paterson Seeks a Truce
description: PATERSON, N.J.  The combatants agreed to meet in a law office, in one of those ancient brick mills that cast shadows of Patersons flourishing past over its hard streets. This beef between up the hill and down the hill had to end, now that another child had died of gunfire. A basketball prodigy. A boy.

title: Eurozone Economy Continues to Grow Modestly, Survey Finds
description: PARIS  The eurozone economy continues to expand at a modest pace, a survey of businesses showed on Thursday, though an apparent slowdown in Germany raised concerns about the strength of the recovery.

title: Making Hay While the Sun Shines
description: Update: Im reminded that How the Light Gets In is at Hay, but not part of the Hay Festival proper.

title: Nobody Cares About the Deficit
description: Sitting here in the UK, where everyone continues to believe that budget deficits are the central issue despite overwhelming evidence to the contrary, its refreshing to look home once in a while and contemplate the utter collapse of the deficit-scold agenda.

title: Do No Harm, by Henry Marsh
description: My closest friend from medical school is a neurosurgeon, and I recently attended the wedding of his daughter. I was seated at a table with his associates when the conversation turned to our respective careers. I asked why they had chosen neurosurgery. A young member of the group said: When you enter the brain, youre seeing the soul. Its amazing. A senior neurosurgeon shook his head and disagreed. Its psychiatrists who see the soul  not us. Later I posed the question to my friend. The brain is the organ of cognition, perception, consciousness. When you operate, the stakes couldnt be higher. Not even for cardiac surgery? The heart is just a muscle, he replied.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: New York Today: Dont Get Stuck
description: Good morning on this perfectly fine Thursday.

title: Can China Take a Joke?
description: Three, two, one, applause! The audience in the Beijing studio cheered as excitedly as anyone could be expected to cheer for an empty stage. They had gathered on a January evening last year for a taping of Is It True?  a show broadcast on the Chinese state-run network CCTV2 and hosted by the comedian Joe Wong. Before Wong came out to tell jokes, the director, an energetic young man in white-framed glasses and a puffy vest, wanted to record the audience members reaction. Dont be too quiet, he advised them. This is a lively program.

title: Restaurant Report: Cantina 32
description: There are two rules to follow when dining at Cantina 32, a bistro on Portos popular pedestrian street, Rua das Flores: do not refuse the bread, and order the cheesecake.

title: The Blue Dress
description: Long after my mother died, I found photographs of her with my father that Id never seen, taken when she was only 21. Though I recognized her, there was something in her face unfamiliar to me. Looking at the pictures, I felt as I do reading this poem: the melancholy of knowing, as they could not have known then, all that was to come in their lives, each photograph an elegy for their past selves.

title: Death in the Browser Tab
description: There you are watching another death on video. In the course of ordinary life  at lunch or in bed, in a car or in the park  you are suddenly plunged into someone elses crisis, someone elses horror. It arrives, absurdly, in the midst of banal things. That is how, late one afternoon in April, I watched Walter Scott die. The footage of his death, taken by a passer-by, had just been published online on the front page of The New York Times. I watched it, sitting at my desk in Brooklyn, and was stunned by it.

title: The Presidio in San Francisco Presents a Fresh Face
description: The Army turned over the Presidio in San Francisco, the guardian of the Golden Gate, to the National Park Service in 1994. But many visitors today (and even longtime city-dwellers) arent familiar with the former military posts status as a national park, or the fact that it hosts San Franciscos only overnight campground, set in a high shady grove at the edge of the Pacific, or that it has 24 miles of public trails zigzagging through a fragrant 300-acre forest of eucalyptus, cypress and pine.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Uni-ball Signo UM-151
description: Writers are supposed to have some mystical bond with their pens. With solemn gravity, in places like Paris Review interviews, they are asked what they write with, as if their pen strokes were what readers ultimately consumed. At times, I feel as if I should have some weighty, burnished fountain pen that, as that ad for some luxury product goes, I dont own but merely look after for the next generation. But as a left-hander with world-historically abysmal handwriting  in college, college, I once had to read an essay out loud to an indulgent professor from my exam blue book  I have never managed much affection for manual writing instruments.

title: Hotel Review: The Dean
description: Doubles from $109.

title: A Closer Look at Hillary Clintons Emails on Benghazi
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton last year provided the State Department with 55,000 pages of emails that she said were related to her work as secretary of state, all from the personal account she exclusively used while leading the department.

title: Frantic Message as Palmyra, Syria, Fell: Were Finished
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian Army soldier had long served in Palmyra, but he was on leave when he heard that Islamic State militants had attacked a village northeast of the desert city, killing dozens of his comrades. He sent frantic text messages, trying to reach them. No one answered.

title: First Batch of Hillary Clinton Emails Captures Concerns Over Libya
description: WASHINGTON  The State Department is expected to release the first batch of emails from Hillary Rodham Clintons private email address in the coming days.

title: Libya-Related Messages From Hillary Clintons Personal Email Account
description: The documents, obtained by The New York Times and presented here, represent about a third of the roughly 850 pages of emails from Hillary Rodham Clintons personal email account that have been turned over to the special House committee investigating the 2012 attacks in Benghazi.

title: Today in Politics: Another Senate Cliffhanger as Holiday Approaches
description: Good Thursday morning from Washington. On the campaign trail, Republicans gather in Oklahoma City; Hillary Rodham Clinton has joined the legions of job seekers on LinkedIn; and Jeb Bush shares a tender moment in New Hampshire. But the focus is on the continued drama on Capitol Hill as a legislative knot has yet to untangle itself.

title: Hillary Clinton Posts Business Bona Fides on LinkedIn
description: Running for president is essentially an exceptionally long job interview. So, on Thursday morning, Hillary Rodham Clinton joined LinkedIn, the social network intended to help people expand their professional network, and, occasionally, get a job.

title: Morning Agenda: Heavy Fines for Foreign Exchange Collusion
description: HEAVY FINES FOR FOREIGN EXCHANGE COLLUSION | At big banks, foreign exchange trading seemed like the ideal business  relatively low risk for solid revenues. But what seemed like the perfect business turned out to be the perfect breeding ground for crime, Michael Corkery and Ben Protess write in DealBook. Citigroup, JPMorgan Chase, Barclays and Royal Bank of Scotland pleaded guilty to a series of federal crimes over a scheme to manipulate the value of the worlds currencies, the Justice Department said Wednesday. A fifth bank, UBS, was also accused of foreign currency manipulation but was not criminally charged because it had alerted the Justice Department to possible misconduct. However, the accusations cost the bank an earlier nonprosecution agreement related to the manipulation of the London Interbank Offered Rate, or Libor.

title: Review: David Letterman Says Goodbye, With Self-Mockery and a Little Mush
description: You know what Im going to devote the rest of my life to? David Letterman said on his last night as the host of the Late Show on CBS. Social media.

title: During Tony Awards Season, Power Is in Their Hands
description: The 844 Tony voters are a varied, and quite busy, lot. Get to know six of them.

title: Review: Tomorrowland, Brad Birds Lesson in Optimism
description: My son briefly had a youth baseball coach whose way of inspiring his demoralized players was to stand at the dugout entrance screaming at them to have fun. Tomorrowland, Brad Birds energetic new film, a shiny live-action spectacle from Disney, reminds me of that guy. There is nothing casual or whimsical about this movies celebration of imagination, optimism and joy. On the contrary: Its a determined and didactic argument in favor of all those things, and an angry indictment of everyone who opposes them.

title: Secrets, the C.I.A. and The New York Times
description: Since 9/11, the United States war on terror has become the overarching news story of our time.

title: Food Companies Fear Bird Flu May Cause Egg Shortages
description: With avian flu devastating a significant portion of the nations egg-laying hens, major food companies and restaurant chains are bracing for shortages and scouting the country to find alternative supply sources.

title: Review: On Taylor Swifts 1989 Tour, the Underdog Emerges as Cool Kid
description: BOSSIER CITY, La.  Toward the end of Taylor Swifts concert at the CenturyLink Center here on Wednesday night, she strapped on an electric guitar for the first time of the night and began playing some tart riffs while singing hungry little fillips. She was setting the stage for We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together, the 2012 song that became her first No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 and helped turn her inexorably away from country and toward pop megastardom.

title: CVS Health Agrees to Buy Omnicare in $12.7 Billion Deal
description: As the American population gets older, pharmacies and other health care providers are increasingly positioning themselves to capitalize and serve the needs of this demographic. This group often needs drugs for chronic conditions like diabetes and heart disease, as well as lifesaving medications for sudden conditions like infections or pneumonia.

title: Oil Again Fouling California Coast Near Site of Historic Spill
description: GOLETA, Calif.  Refugio State Beach is one of the treasures of the California coast, a little-known curve of beach in the hills that on weekends like this one  Memorial Day  would be sprinkled with people who made their way up from Santa Barbara, about 20 miles down the Pacific Coast.

title: Tariffs Versus Currencies
description: While its not remotely in the same league as the execrable Daley op-ed, the CEA report in support of TPP is, as Josh Bivens notes, an odd document. Its not wrong, or not mostly wrong  I dont even share all of Bivenss complaints. Its just off-topic; at best, its a celebration of the results of all the trade liberalization that has taken place since the 1930s, and tells us nothing about policy when trade barriers are already very low, and trade agreements are actually about investment and intellectual property.

title: A Call for a Doctor
description: Dear Diary:

title: Highlights From David Lettermans Last Late Show
description: After a presidential montage proclaiming that our long national nightmare is over, David Letterman closed out a 33-year run in late-night television on Wednesday night.

title: This Time, Senate Votes to Advance Trade Pact
description: WASHINGTON  A flurry of last-minute deal-making on the Senate floor Thursday rescued President Obamas ambitious trade agenda from defeat, advancing legislation that would empower the president to complete a sweeping, 12-nation Pacific trade accord.

title: Heads of Deutsche Bank Try to Assuage Shareholders
description: Top executives of Deutsche Bank tried to reassure increasingly restive shareholders on Thursday that they were making progress on cutting costs, delivering more consistent profits and avoiding legal problems that have cost Germanys largest bank billions of euros in fines and settlements.

title: Next Wave at BAM: New Season to Include Binoche, Whelan, Soto and Kentridge
description: Juliette Binoche will play the title role in Antigone in a production that premiered at the Grand Thtre de Luxembourg. Wendy Whelan and Jock Soto will dance in the world premiere of a new dance-chamber opera inspired by a Noh drama, Hagoromo. And the Debussy String Quartet will play Shostakovich while Australian acrobats perform tricks all around them.

title: Decoding the Cult Designs of Phoebe English
description: Since the launch of her eponymous label in 2011, Phoebe English has spun a series of darkly compelling womenswear collections in tenderly draped silhouettes and hand-woven textiles. Now, the mind-boggling methods and concepts behind her cult creations are the subject of a dedicated exhibition at Londons NOW Gallery in Floating, Falling, Drowning, Flying  An Introspective of Process. I like to think of it as a sneak peek behind the scenes of creating my pieces, says English, whos based in London. Its been an exposing, nostalgic and wonderful experience.

title: Lumber Liquidators Chief Robert Lynch Resigns
description: Lumber Liquidators, under scrutiny for months as it faces accusations that it sold products with dangerous levels of formaldehyde, said on Thursday that its chief executive had left the company.

title: Another Spying Scandal in Germany Adds to Political Crisis for Merkel
description: BERLIN  Eleven years ago, as the Iraq war raged, the National Security Agency quietly turned over to its German counterpart a sprawling electronic spying station in Bavaria. The transfer came with a deal: In consultation with the Americans, German spies would continue operating the station to intercept communications in Europe and the Middle East and share what they picked up.

title: Daily Report: Minecraft Reality Shows, on YouTube
description: Minecraft is one of the most successful video games in the world, with more than 100 million registered users. YouTube is the top video site in the world, with a billion unique visitors a month, writes Nick Wingfield.

title: Mike Huckabee Opts Out of Iowa Straw Poll Ritual
description: The Iowa Straw Poll is poised to be a slimmed-down affair this year, now that two leading Republicans have opted out of participating in the caucus state ritual.

title: Hundreds of Volunteers, Armed With Fliers, Tell Nail Salon Workers of Their Rights
description: Hundreds of volunteers fanned out across New York on Thursday morning as part of an outreach campaign for nail salon workers organized by city officials, with the goal of reaching thousands of manicurists by days end and educating them about their rights and how to protect their health.

title: Two Same-Sex Marriage Studies, Two Debunkings
description: Everything youve read about same-sex marriage is wrong.

title: How ISIS Expands
description: The Islamic State aims to build a broad colonial empire across many countries.

title: Hillary Clintons Speeches Often Well Received Despite the Price
description: Critics of Hillary Rodham Clinton have been deriding the steep fees that she commands on the corporate speaking circuit, and even though the former secretary of state speaks publicly for free these days, the big companies that paid hundreds of thousands of dollars to hear her talk say she was worth the money.

title: 1915: Italys Troops Massing for War
description: LONDON  The Italian Senate this afternoon [May 21] unanimously ratified the bill which Signor Salandra presented to the Chamber yesterday, which is tantamount to a declaration of war. Everybody inside the building was shouting Evviva Italia! except two men in prominent positions, one Principe di Camporeale, and Signor Cefaly, an intimate of the Villa Malta. From the public galleries came shouts of Shame! but the prince and his colleague took no notice. The Senators agreed unanimously to grant Signor Salandras request that a commission of eighteen members be appointed to examine the bill passed by the Chamber.  The New York Herald, European Edition, May 22, 1915

title: Throwback Thursday | Thirty-Three Years With David Letterman
description: David Letterman hosted his 6,028th and final late-night show on May 20th, ending as he started, Times television critic Alessandra Stanley notes, with the irreverence, self-mockery and mischief that made him such an iconoclastic talk-show host.

title: Documenting My Patients Next of Kin
description: What if a patient dies and nobody is there to mourn? Is it like a tree falling soundlessly in the forest?

title: Conference Finalists Are Dotted With Knicks Castoffs
description: A sharpshooting 3-point specialist, a defensive stopper, a 7-foot starter, a veteran steal artist, a feisty starting forward and a solid backup. It sounds like the elements of a pretty good Knicks playoff team.

title: Making Computer Science More Inviting: A Look at What Works
description: When Sonja Khan started college, shed never thought of studying computer science. But when she heard from friends that the intro class was good, she decided to give it a try  and then ended up majoring in it.

title: How To | Prep Vegetables
description: The chef and cookbook author April Bloomfield invites T into her kitchen.

title: A Meeting, Seeking a Truce
description: After Armoni Sexton was killed in a drive-by shooting, community members and members of rival gangs within Paterson, N.J., gathered to discuss the longstanding tribal dispute in the city.

title: New York Council Speaker Raises Profile in Police Dispute With Mayor de Blasio
description: Mayor Bill de Blasios budget proposal made his intention clear: There would be no new money to expand the size of the New York police force.

title: Jeb Bush Faults Brother for Lack of Budget Discipline
description: CONCORD, N.H.  As Jeb Bush has faced questions over Iraq and the policies of his brother throughout recent days, he found one place where there is a policy difference between the two: curtailing spending.

title: Mystery Shrouds Movements of Suspect in Tunisia Museum Attack
description: ROME  New information about a Moroccan man arrested in Italy this week in connection with the attack at the National Bardo Museum in Tunis that killed 22 people has raised questions about his movements and the depth of his possible involvement in the March 18 assault.

title: Hewlett-Packard Sells 51% Stake in China Unit to Tsinghua University
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Hewlett-Packard announced on Thursday that it had sold a majority stake in its Chinese networking business to Tsinghua University, in a move to deal with Chinese government restrictions on foreign technology companies.

title: 1940: Save France Call by Reynaud
description: The famous watchword of the French Revolution  the cry that saved France at Valmy  was evoked by Premier Paul Reynaud yesterday [May 21] afternoon, when, addressing the Senate, he declared: Messieurs, la patrie est en danger. Making no attempt to minimize the gravity of the situation, the French Premier informed the Senators that the Germans had reached Amiens and Arras yesterday morning. If I am told that tomorrow a miracle must be produced to save France, then I believe in the miracle, because France cannot die.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, May 22, 1940

title: Summer Travel Gear Inspired by African Methods
description: The designers behind MZ Wallace, Monica Zwirner and Lucy Wallace Eustice, create simple, utilitarian accessories made from durable nylon and leather that, each season, are slightly tweaked by way of unique collaborations and the introduction of new prints (last month they partnered with Charity: Water on a line of pouches and cases to celebrate Earth Day). This month, MZ Wallace is releasing a capsule collection of summer travel gear, including a luggage tag and passport holder, in African batik-inspired patterns. The dizzying prints are also inspired by More Material, the exhibition the globally minded designer Duro Olowu curated at Salon 94 Bowery last year, for which he organized textiles, art and fashion all featuring similar motifs. Zwirner and Eustice also took notes from the Austrian artist Franz West, who used tribal wax prints for furniture coverings in the late 80s. The two patterns used in the collection of items, which also includes a tote bag, sunglasses case and wallet, drew on traditional African block printing and wax dyeing. Form meets function, indeed.

title: What to Do This Weekend
description: Looking for something to do right now?

title: British Police Find Jimmy Savile Case Has Spurred Reports of Child Sexual Abuse
description: LONDON  Jimmy Savile, the disgraced British television personality the authorities say sexually abused dozens of victims over more than two decades, died before he could be prosecuted. But new data released this week by the police suggests that revelations about his catalog of sexual misconduct have helped transform the attitudes of many victims and also led to a greater willingness to report abuse.

title: U.S. Military Wraps Up Relief Effort for Nepal Earthquake
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  United States military personnel who had been assisting earthquake relief and rescue efforts in Nepal began leaving on Thursday, the Nepalese Army said.

title: In Reversal, Myanmar Agrees to Attend Meeting on Migrant Crisis
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  After a flurry of diplomatic activity, the government of Myanmar said on Thursday that it would send representatives to a regional meeting in Bangkok next week aimed at resolving the continuing humanitarian crisis of migrants stranded at sea in Southeast Asia and addressing the larger issue of human trafficking.

title: Tomorrowland (With Movie Trailer): Brad Bird Narrates a Scene
description: In Tomorrowland, a girl gets a glimpse of a shimmering, optimistic other world. But its only a small piece of the complex puzzle this new Disney movie  directed by Brad Bird from a script by Mr. Bird, Damon Lindelof (Lost) and Jeff Jensen  lays out in its tale of the future and the ways it is being shaped. In the scene Mr. Bird is discussing, Casey Newton (Britt Robertson) is the daughter of a NASA engineer who has been helping tear down a launch site, meaning he will soon lose his job. Casey, a lover of space, sees the future she wants disappearing as well. After she is arrested for trying to sabotage the demolition, she gets out of jail and discovers an unfamiliar pin among her personal effects, one with special powers. In a recent interview, Mr. Bird discussed some of his ideas behind the sequence. Here are excerpts from the conversation.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Tomorrowland
description: Brad Bird narrates a sequence from Tomorrowland.

title: New Approach Trains Robots to Match Human Dexterity and Speed
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  In an engineering laboratory here, a robot has learned to screw the cap on a bottle, even figuring out the need to apply a subtle backward twist to find the thread before turning it the right way.

title: Despair, and Grim Acceptance, Over Killings by Brazils Police
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Eduardo de Jesus was on his doorstep in Complexo do Alemo, a vast maze here of cinder block homes, when his mother heard the loud blast of gunfire.

title: Readers Respond: On Errors, Lies and Mistakes in Iraq
description: As debate about the legitimacy of the Iraq War reopened this week, many readers argued that the war was wrong and based on falsified intelligence, even as a few wrote they are pleased that Saddam Hussein was deposed.

title: A $1,000 Day in Paris for $100
description: Experience a concierges idea of the perfect day on the town in Paris, but at a tenth of the price.

title: Family of Akai Gurley, Man Fatally Shot by Officer in Brooklyn, Sues New York City
description: The family of Akai Gurley, the unarmed man shot and killed in a Brooklyn housing-project stairwell by a police officer last year, has filed a wrongful-death lawsuit against New York City.

title: At Cannes, Director of Holocaust Film Criticizes Conventional Approach of Schindlers List
description: CANNES, France  Son of Saul, a first feature by the Hungarian director Laszlo Nemes set at Auschwitz in 1944, has generated some of the strongest reviews of any film shown in competition at this years Cannes Film Festival  but also some of the most intense controversy.

title: Unesco Chief Urges Protection of Palmyra
description: Irina Bokova, the director general of Unesco, on Thursday called for a cease-fire in and around Palmyra, the central Syrian city that fell to ISIS on Wednesday and contains important ancient ruins.

title: That Was Fast: One Lightning Line Is Ripping Up the Rangers
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Lightning Coach Jon Cooper could not contain the quip. He had just watched his top line of Tyler Johnson, Ondrej Palat and Nikita Kucherov maneuver around and through the Rangers for the second game in a row.

title: Essays About Work and Class That Caught a Colleges Eye
description: Of the 1,200 or so undergraduate admission essays that Chris Lanser reads each year at Wesleyan University, maybe 10 are about work.

title: Students and Money, in Their Own Words
description: Each year, we put out a call for college application essays about money, work and social class. This year, we picked seven  about pizza, parental sacrifice, prep school students, discrimination and deprivation.

title: Annabel La Riva | Finding My Voice
description: In her college essay, Annabel La Riva, a LaGuardia High School senior, writes about transcending class differences and finding her own voice through music. Ms. La Riva plans to attend Kenyon College.

title: Lady Loafers for Summer
description: In a slimmer shape and with feminine details, this old man classic feels like the seasons staple.

title: Azzedine Alaa Designs a New Approach to Perfume
description: Azzedine Alaa, a.k.a. my bet to design Lady Gagas wedding dress post-her Grammys appearance, doesnt do anything on anyones schedule but his own. He doesnt show during the regular ready-to-wear schedule (he doesnt even show every season), he doesnt always appear for interviews when promised, and he generally works through the night, while others are asleep.

title: Arrest Made in Washington Killings
description: WASHINGTON  On a sunny Sunday afternoon in April, Savvas Savopoulos, a wealthy iron company executive well known to this citys elite, gathered his family and friends in the backyard of his stately brick home to grill lamb on a spit and celebrate Greek Orthodox Easter. It was, one guest said, an idyllic day.

title: Readers, Apparently Fond of a Good Thrashing, Respond to the Javelina Review
description: Why do people get so excited about a pan?

title: Viewfinder: Hong Hao
description: The photographer keeps track of the items he consumes by assembling them in pictures.

title: Next Stop for Republican Hopefuls: Oklahoma City
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  Every weekend, it seems, there is another Republican presidential cattle call. This one is no different. But instead of bringing their ripest red-meat attacks and catchy one-liners to Iowa or New Hampshire again, the 2016 hopefuls are descending on this state capital.

title: Some Relics Safe, Syrian Official Says
description: The Syrian antiquities chief, Maamoun Abdulkarim, said Wednesday that while many artifacts from Palmyra had been moved to safety, the question remained how to protect the site from ISIS.

title: The Dirt on Dirt
description: My mother-in-law often gossips with me about other peoples personal difficulties. Shell say: Bob and Sue are childless because Bob is sterile. It makes me feel uncomfortable, as if Im invading these peoples privacy. When she starts to do it, I go quiet or look away to signal my discomfort. But she keeps going. Is there a more direct but civil way to let her know I dont want to hear these stories?

title: Tara Subkoffs Cannes Travel Diary
description: The designer recently visited the South of France to premiere her new film, "#Horror.

title: Yale Graduate Who Promoted CrossFit Ventures Is Arrested
description: A serial entrepreneur with a Yale undergraduate degree and a penchant for raising money for his ventures from fellow graduates is finding himself answering to authorities.

title: Danica Patrick Has Plenty of Fans. A New Sponsor? Not Yet.
description: CONCORD, N.C.  Amid the mass of Dale Earnhardt Jr. and Jeff Gordon fans at Charlotte Motor Speedway last Saturday night, with their allegiances loudly emblazoned on T-shirts and hats, this much was apparent: Danica Patrick owned the preteen girl demographic.

title: Living With Cancer: Patients on Our Own
description: I had to take my husband back to the hospital for a second operation on a torn tendon, but the pills from the cancer trial had not yet arrived. Surely doing without one or two days of the drug would not necessarily lead to a recurrence, I told myself in an effort to still rising waves of anxiety. There were more pressing matters to attend, namely righting wrongful care.

title: Bangladeshs Very Public Toilet Crisis
description: PEOPLE trapped in Dhakas notoriously gridlocked traffic have developed various coping strategies. Some take naps. Others work or catch up on social media.

title: Crpes Canaveral
description: Breton-style crepes on St. Marks Place.

title: Crpes Canaveral Spreads Itself Thin
description: On a drizzly evening, two glum young men peered into the shut window of Crpes Canaveral. Above them hung a lantern, its candle still unlit. You really want to go through this for a crepe? one asked. They tromped off around the corner, but within a minute they had slunk back to wait with the rest of us in the rain.

title: Maggie Black, Teacher to the Stars of Ballet and Modern Dance, Dies at 85
description: Maggie Black, who for decades earned renown for teaching famous ballet and modern dancers how to move in ways, as she put it, that humans werent really made to do, configuring their bodies to avoid injuries and even to heal them, died on May 11 at her home in East Hampton, N.Y. She was 85.

title: A Makeover for Brooklyn Marriott
description: Opened in 1998, the New York Marriott at the Brooklyn Bridge predated the wave of hotels that have more recently opened in the booming borough. Now, with a $43 million budget, it aims to update its appeal.

title: Schools Turn to Propane Buses as Stricter Emissions Standards Loom
description: MACON, Ga.  For many Americans, propane is that stuff from the home improvement store that fuels backyard barbecues and patio dinners. But in a growing number of cities across the country, it is what gets children to school.

title: Sexually Explicit 3-D  Film Inspires Pans and Walkouts at Cannes
description: CANNES, France  Love, a pornographic 3-D film by Gaspar No, includes scenes of penetration, mutual masturbation and a penis ejaculating in 3-D toward the audience. Nevertheless, it failed to excite critics, who roundly panned the film, or walked out of a press screening, when it was shown at the Cannes Film Festival out of competition on Thursday.

title: Members of Congress Ask for Review of Dropped Espionage Case
description: Twenty-two members of Congress have asked Attorney General Loretta E. Lynch to determine whether race played a factor in espionage-related charges brought against a Chinese-American hydrologist and are asking her to investigate whether there is a practice of targeting federal employees based on their race or national origin.

title: Family Tree of Dogs and Wolves Is Found to Split Earlier Than Thought
description: The ancestors of modern wolves and dogs split into different evolutionary lineages 27,000 to 40,000 years ago, much earlier than some other research has suggested, scientists reported Thursday.

title: Edna OBrien: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of The Love Object says Joyce staked his claim on Dublin, and it was left to Yeats, J.M. Synge and Beckett to give us the landscape of the country in all its beauty, savagery, ghostliness and loneliness.

title: Producer Speaks Out About Editing Ferrara Film
description: CANNES, France  The director Abel Ferrara made headlines in March when he publicly objected to a revised edit of Welcome to New York, his fictional take on the sexual assault case involving Dominique Strauss-Kahn and a Manhattan hotel maid.

title: Ros Wine From Provence Deserves to Live a Little
description: VENOS, France  On a visit to Chteau Ste.-Anne, a venerable family producer of naturally made Bandols near this old hilltop village, I was doing what comes so naturally in Provence: drinking a glass of ros and eating a square of pissaladire, the pizzalike flatbread whose primary toppings  onions, olives and anchovies  are as essential to the Provenal landscape as pastel skies and sun-drenched seas.

title: Maryland Drops Parallel Parking From Drivers Test
description: Maryland has announced that demonstrating the ability to parallel park will no longer be a requirement for obtaining a drivers license in that state.

title: Boy Scouts President Calls for End to Ban on Gay Leaders
description: Robert M. Gates, the president of the Boy Scouts of America and former secretary of defense, called on Thursday to end the Scouts ban on gay adult leaders, warning the groups executives that we must deal with the world as it is, not as we might wish it to be.

title: Reader Idea | Biographical Poetry About Maya Angelou
description: Maya Angelou died a year ago this month, and though we quickly created a page of teaching resources from what was available at the time, we knew that many teachers were also holding their own impromptu classroom memorials.

title: Obamas Twitter Debut, @POTUS, Attracts Hate-Filled Posts
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama sent his inaugural Twitter post from the Oval Office on Monday, the White House heralded the event with fanfare, posting a photograph of him perched on his desk tapping out his message on an iPhone.

title: Catholic Trust Looks to Brazilian Fund for Social Returns
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A Brazilian investment fund is taking to heart the Vaticans endorsement of leveraging capitalisms tools to help address inequality.

title: Officials Discuss California Oil Spill
description: We are committed to the thorough cleanup of this accident, a spokesman for the responsible company said.

title: Bryce Harper Offers Reminder of the Yankees of Old, Not of the Old Ones of Today
description: WASHINGTON  When Bryce Harper, the Washington Nationals outfielder, was ejected from Wednesdays game against the Yankees after arguing a low strike, there was no celebration in the Yankees dugout. No high-fives. No fist pumps.

title: Going Rogue and Bizarre at the Republican Debates
description: With more Republicans jumping into the presidential race by the week, the partys top leaders are growing increasingly fearful that their presidential debates, which start this summer, will be more cattle call than Lincoln-Douglas.

title: Buying Self-Confidence (and Belts) at Taekwondo
description: My 5-year-old son bounced toward me with his new trophy and his bright-white taekwondo belt that he had just received from his master. Mama, look, I did it, he said, beaming, as we embraced. We are so proud of you, my husband said as he took a turn hugging him.

title: David Letterman Finale Draws Almost 14 Million Viewers in Ratings
description: David Letterman closed out his 33 years in late-night television on Wednesday with one of the highest-rated shows of his career. The Late Show brought in 13.7 million viewers, Mr. Lettermans biggest audience since February 1994. It also beat every network show in prime time on Wednesday.

title: Drifting in Daylight and Please Touch the Art
description: A look at works in the free exhibition in Central Park.

title: Tara Subkoff Does Cannes
description: The designer Tara Subkoff, best known for co-founding Imitation of Christ, is no stranger to the film world  shes acted in dozens of films, from As Good as It Gets to The Last Days of Disco  or to ambitious, theatrical, large-scale projects. So it was a natural next step for Subkoff to try her hand at directing. Her new film, #Horror, stars Taryn Manning, Natasha Lyonne, Lydia Hearst, Stella Schnabel and Chlo Sevigny (whom Subkoff once enlisted, you may remember, as the creative director for Imitation of Christ); it tells a story of social media gone wrong and cyberbullying taken to nasty extremes. Subkoff just premiered the film at the Cannes Film Festival, where she found plenty to do  from glamorous pool time at the Hotel du Cap to a haunted-house party shehosted at Le Baron, which drew Benicio Del Toro, Michael Fassbender and Larry Gagosian. In the spirit of the film, Subkoff also organized a powerful cyberbullying protest on the Croisette, with over 70 French girls aged 12 to 16 in attendance wearing masks and carrying signs, both of which were created by Subkoffs husband, the artist Urs Fischer. The protest was shut down by French police (a sure sign, wed say, that she made an impact). Above, Subkoff shares with T a pictorial record of her Cannes adventures.

title: Tiny Life, Teeming in the Ocean
description: New findings about microbes collected from the worlds oceans provide insights into creatures directly descended from those of a billion years ago.

title: Scientists Sample the Ocean and Find Tiny Additions to the Tree of Life
description: Climate change scientists have known for years that rising temperatures affect sea creatures, from the biggest fish to the microscopic plankton at the base of the ocean food chain.

title: Obama Upgrades Tunisias Status as a U.S. Ally
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama announced Thursday that he would designate Tunisia a major American ally as he encourages the North African country in its progress toward a more democratic form of government since the Arab Spring uprisings of 2011.

title: Rand Pauls Timely Takedown of the Patriot Act
description: He may have annoyed Senate colleagues by seizing the floor for a marathon monologue on Wednesday, but Senator Rand Paul did Americans a singular service by forcing attention to the fact that their civil liberties remain at stake as Congress drifts toward a renewal of the Patriot Act that is likely to do too little to rein in government surveillance programs.

title: Where New Rules on Police and Military Gear Fall Short
description: Some police departments around the country have morphed into military combat units since 9/11, thanks to military weapons and equipment that have been freely passed onto them by the federal government. The danger this represents for police-community relations was strikingly evident last year in Ferguson, Mo., where demonstrators protesting the police shooting of Michael Brown encountered what was essentially a war machine clothed in body armor, equipped with combat weapons and perched atop armored vehicles.

title: Defending ISIS Policy, Obama Acknowledges Flaws in Effort So Far
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama denied that the United States and its allies were losing the fight against Islamic State forces in the Middle East, but he acknowledged in an interview posted online on Thursday that more should be done to help Iraqis recapture lost territory.

title: 2 Men Captured in Ukraine Admit to Being Russian Soldiers, Monitoring Group Says
description: MOSCOW  The Ukrainian governments assertion that the Russian military is fighting in eastern Ukraine was given some credence on Thursday by an independent security monitoring group.

title: Tiny Life, Teeming in the Ocean
description: New findings about microbes collected from the worlds oceans provide insights into creatures directly descended from those of a billion years ago.

title: Senators Deal Helps Advance Trade Bill
description: The fate of a free trade bill  a major economic priority for the White House, Congressional Republicans and some Senate Democrats  remained highly uncertain on Thursday morning as lawmakers huddled in tense negotiations in the well of the Senate.

title: Man Who Intervened in Manhattan Biker Assault Testifies
description: A Washington Heights man who intervened as a gang of motorcyclists was beating the driver of a sport utility vehicle testified on Thursday that he still did not know why the attackers listened to him.

title: The Assassin Director on Long Takes, Fast Edits and a Warrior in the Shadows
description: CANNES, France  The Assassin, the thrillingly beautiful martial arts film from the Taiwanese master Hou Hsiao-Hsien, traces the adventures  as well as the poses, gestures and silences  of a ninth-century Chinese female warrior.

title: A New Approach for Moving Robotic Arms With the Brain
description: More than a decade ago, Erik Sorto, 34, was paralyzed after a gunshot wound to the neck. Now, using a robotic arm that he controls with his brain, he can pick up a drink and bring it to his lips in one smooth motion.

title: The Case of the Unhappy Naked Traveler
description: On Wednesday, a US Airways passenger at Charlotte Douglas International Airport, reportedly angry at being bumped from an overbooked flight to Jamaica, stripped naked at the gate in protest.

title: Review: Wael Shawky, Cabaret Crusades at MoMA PS1
description: The most vivid depictions of a war in the Middle East arent on television news these days. Theyre in an exhibition by the Egyptian artist Wael Shawky at MoMA PS1 in Queens. The show, Cabaret Crusades, Mr. Shawkys local museum solo debut, is made up of three sequential films, each about an hour and set in the distant past, beginning in the 11th century when European armies marched eastward to claim the Holy Land. The story is one of almost unremitting violence, and the scenes of battle, torture and execution are appalling to witness, which is a surprise considering that all the actors are marionettes.

title: Washington Mayor Names Murder Suspect
description: Mayor Muriel E. Bowser of Washington, and Cathy Lanier, chief of the Metropolitan Police Department, on Thursday identified the suspect in the murder of a household of four last week.

title: Pictures of the Day: Gaza, Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Burundi, Gaza and More  Pictures of the Day

title: F.E.C. Member Says System Tilts Against Conservative Groups
description: Political tensions intensified on Thursday at the Federal Election Commission, as a Republican commissioner charged that conservative groups were the focus of agency reviews into possible impropriety far more than liberal ones.

title: Sunlight in a Bottle
description: In Tuscany and Puglia, making olive oil is a lifestyle, one threatened by bad weather and a killer bacteria.

title: May 21, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Gaza City, Turkey, Burundi and Indonesia.

title: Review: Megan Hilty Serves Up Some Sweet, Tender Bar Food
description: Behind the brass is a silk-and-lace lining. That was the happy discovery at Tuesdays opening-night of Megan Hiltys return engagement at Caf Carlyle. Ms. Hilty will long be remembered for her portrayal of Lorelei Lee three years ago in the Encores! concert production of Gentlemen Prefer Blondes, for which Ben Brantley of The New York Times credited her with wresting Lorelei from the hands of Marilyn Monroe and Carol Channing.

title: Review: Music & More Series Explores Artistic Marriages
description: TriBeCa may have become one of New Yorks most desirable neighborhoods to live and shop in, but one thing thats in short supply there is music. Outside of upscale childrens birthday parties and the annual Tribeca Film Festival carnival, live performances are rare.

title: Review: Bound and Ecsteriority4 (Part 2) Explore Confinement and Collision
description: The premise for Travelogues, a series at Abrons Arts Center, is simple and wide open: The curator Laurie Uprichard, formerly the director of Danspace Project and the Dublin Dance Festival, presents work that she has seen and admired, whether its from down the block or across the ocean.

title: Jacob deGrom Throws Gem for Mets: 25 Cardinals Up, 24 Cardinals Down
description: Of all the things that went right for Terry Collins on Thursday, including a masterpiece from Jacob deGrom and two home runs from Lucas Duda, perhaps the best thing was a base hit by the opposing team.

title: Review: Hope Gangloff at Susan Inglett Gallery
description: Hope Gangloff borrows liberally from her predecessors. Her large-scale portraits owe a huge debt to masters like Vincent van Gogh, Gustav Klimt and Egon Schiele, as well as Suzanne Valadon, Alice Neel and Sylvia Sleigh. Yet Ms. Gangloff is a shrewd assimilator, and her current show includes elements that make it one of the most topical in New York.

title: CVSs Deal for Omnicare May Signal a Slowdown in Pharmacy Mergers
description: CVS Healths $12.7 billion deal for Omnicare portends lower merger activity in the pharmacy sector. The drugstore companys purchase gives it entrance to nursing homes and expands specialty medicine distribution. But the increasingly concentrated industry is bumping up against antitrust concerns and may have to live with fewer transactions.

title: Obama Says Tunisia Will Be Non-NATO Ally
description: President Obama hosted the democratically elected president of Tunisia, Beji Caid Essebsi, and announced that the country would become a major non-NATO ally of the United States.

title: Your Contribution to the California Drought
description: The average American consumes more than 300 gallons of California water each week by eating food that was produced there.

title: Exclusive | 315 Vanderbilt Avenue, Clinton Hill
description: A former union hall that was repurposed as a home/studio/gallery for the artist Jennifer Bartlett is about to enter the market at $8.5 million.

title: When Every Day Is Memorial Day
description: Irked by how people treat Memorial Day like just another three-day weekend, Andrew Lichtenstein photographed military funerals for soldiers who died in Iraq.

title: This Years Warm Up Parties at MoMA PS1 Offer a Lot of Electronic Music
description: The weekly summer dance parties known as Warm Up, held in the courtyard at MoMA PS1 in Long Island City, Queens, will run every Saturday from June 27 to September 5, featuring live performances and D.J. sets from experimental musicians including Boys Noize, A.G. Cook of PC Music, Baauer (remember Harlem Shake?) and the English grime rapper Skepta.

title: Cool Books for Hot Summer Days
description: Summer reading rarely involves as much dj vu as it will this year. Well be reading a new Harper Lee book, Go Set a Watchman, only 55 years after the publication of To Kill a Mockingbird. Well still be looking for that next Gone Girl, the thriller fans equivalent of Ahabs great white whale. Well be hit with The Devil Wears Prada knockoffs, including one thats actually called The Knockoff and borrows just as freely from All About Eve. The Stephen King-type chiller, in which a famous writer falls prey to an obsessed fan (sound familiar?), will have been written by Stephen King. Its called Finders Keepers.

title: Video of Man Believed to Be Bike-Riding Thief Is Released
description: For the past few months, he has been making his way through the streets of Manhattan, approaching women and snatching their phones, or in some cases, their pocketbooks out of their hands. Then he leaves quickly, on a bicycle.

title: Hewlett-Packard Reports Drop in Profit and Sales
description: Hewlett-Packard, the computer and printer giant, reported continued declines in profit and sales on Thursday as it prepared to split into two companies later this year.

title: How to Improve Rail Safety
description: Americans who grow up with this countrys slow, limited and poorly maintained passenger train systems are typically stunned by the speed, comfort and punctuality of the trains that crisscross Europe and East Asia at speeds often greater than 200 miles per hour. It turns out that state-of-the art train systems abroad are also safer. A lot safer.

title: Review: Vern Blosum, Late Work
description: Each of the 11 amusing, poster-size pencil drawings in this exhibition presents a neatly rendered object accompanied by block-lettered captions. The text below the image of a fly swatter reads No Fly Zone. Obsolescence shows a sidewalk mailbox with its open lower compartment revealing an empty interior, an allusion to the triumph of email. Ideologues is illustrated by a pile of decomposing logs. Curiously, a gallery news release says these and the shows other drawings are the first works produced by Vern Blosum since 1964.

title: Theater Listings for May 22-28
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Six Baltimore Officers Indicted in Death of Freddie Gray
description: A grand jury in Baltimore has indicted six police officers on homicide and assault charges in the death of Freddie Gray, who was fatally injured last month in police custody, the citys chief prosecutor said Thursday.

title: Review: Leidy Churchman, The Meal of the Lion
description: Leidy Churchmans art comprises a range of mediums: painting, video, sculpture and installation. But painting and its infinite mutability are his main interest in this expansive solo show, his second at a New York gallery. Here, 19 canvases explore some of the subjects, styles, moods and meanings encompassed by representation, abstraction included. Materials and process receive acute attention. Most images evolved in some way from existing art, advertising or cartography, but personal imagination registers everywhere.

title: Tattoo History, Antique Typewriters and Letting Go at the Toledo Museum
Review: Van Gogh: Irises and Roses, Sheds Light on a Disappearing Red Hue
description: Art is long, but color can be brief. Thats the message conveyed by Van Gogh: Irises and Roses, a small bouquet of paintings by the beloved Dutch artist at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Occupation Fables on DVD: Le Silence de la Mer and Vice and Virtue
description: Compared with the atrocities perpetrated in World War IIs other theaters, the German occupation of France was, in the historian David Bells unsentimental characterization, a sideshow. Quentin Tarantino would never have set Inglourious Basterds in Poland; the Woody Allen characters obsession with The Sorrow and the Pity, in Annie Hall, would hardly be so funny if he were fixated on Schindlers List.

title: Comedy Listings for May 22-28
description: For news about comedy, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Things to Do on Long Island, May 24 to 30, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Review: Please Touch the Art and Drifting in Daylight, Outdoor Art at the Parks
description: With the outdoor art season upon us, two inviting and entertaining exhibitions in different New York parks opened last weekend. Organized by the nonprofit Creative Time, Drifting in Daylight: Art in Central Park, in the north end of the park, presents mostly ephemeral projects by eight artists. Works by the Danish artist Jeppe Hein are at Brooklyn Bridge Park in a display of interactive sculptures called Please Touch the Art, organized by the Public Art Fund, another nonprofit. Neither show is going to rock anyones world, but both entail spending time in nice places.

title: Movie Listings for May 22-28
description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. Full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: BAM Has a New Display of Michael Graves Murals
description: Though known primarily as an architect, Michael Graves was also an avid painter who, starting in the early 1970s, included his murals in his architecture projects.

title: Pop & Rock Listings for May 22-28
description: For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Review: The Who Celebrates 50 Years Together by Going on Tour
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  Watching Pete Townshends hands as the Who played Nassau Coliseum here on Wednesday night was a reminder of what made the band great. His hands made bold windmill arcs, scrabbled at trills, picked off single notes and scampered through bluesy squiggles. They were masterly and strategic, defining the sound and structure of each song, yet still reckless. They were exploring, even now, the way his songs are awash in clashing impulses: rebellion, isolation, anger, uncertainty, yearning, fear, lust, frustration, brawling, searching. Three of Mr. Townshends many self-questioning manifestos  I Cant Explain, The Seeker and Who Are You  started a set full of the Whos surefire material.

title: Jazz Listings for May 22-28
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Senate Democrats Press G.O.P. to Fully Fund Amtrak
description: Senate Democrats urged their Republican colleagues on Thursday to fully fund Amtrak in the wake of the accident in Philadelphia last week that killed eight passengers and injured hundreds.

title: Make Yourself Comfortable
description: Sofas and chairs that offer enough support to make sitting pain free.

title: Iron-Hulled Ship Makes a Short, but Crucial, Harbor Voyage
description: This was not one of those harbor cruises the tourists take.

title: Things to Do in Westchester, May 24 to 30, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Classical & Opera Listings for May 22-28
description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

description: To the Editor:
