title: Review: In Poltergeist, Theyre Baaack, With GPS and Flat Screens
description: The new Poltergeist might well be the scariest movie 13-or-unders have yet seen, just as the original was for their parents back in 1982. Those parents might find it an enjoyable trip down memory lane, even if they do now recognize it as largely a well-served collection of horror-movie tropes.

title: State Department Releases Hillary Clinton Emails
description: WASHINGTON  The State Department said on Friday it was releasing 296 emails that Hillary Rodham Clinton sent and received when she was secretary of state.

title: If You Want to Sing Out, He Says He Can Teach You
description: Here on one of the most crowded and noisiest stretches of Main Street in Flushing, Queens, traffic clogs the streets and throngs of Asian immigrants crowd the sidewalks.

title: A Welcome Call for Change in the Boy Scouts
description: In these days of political polarization and deep mistrust, its exciting to see someone like Bob Gates  former national security aide in the White House, former Central Intelligence chief, former Secretary of Defense, current Republican  cross the ideological dead zone on an important issue. In this case, its the long process of trying to introduce the Boy Scouts to the 21st Century.

title: An App for Solo Soccer Players
description: If you are looking forward to the Womens World Cup this summer, you may find yourself motivated to take to the pitch yourself. If so, you might consider using an app called Jogabo. Its a service that allows users to schedule soccer games, invite friends or strangers to play, and keep track of goals, assists and other statistics.

title: Gaza Strip Economy on Verge of Collapse, World Bank Says
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  Gazas war-battered economy is on the verge of collapse, dragged down by soaring unemployment rates that followed last summers war with Israel, border restrictions and government dysfunction, the World Bank says in a new report.

title: A Tribute to Oscar Robertsons High School Team, 60 Years Overdue
description: As a child growing up in Indianapolis, Oscar Robertson never attended the Indianapolis 500.

title: Art for Foods Sake at the Whitney Museums Untitled
description: Despite some evidence to the contrary  the Modern, say, at the Museum of Modern Art  the words museum restaurant have not inspired culinary ecstasy so much as images of footsore diners and tuna salad sandwiches in plastic wrap. While art and eating are both intensely sensual experiences, even in New York they only occasionally coincide. Untitled, the glassy restaurant from Danny Meyer (who not coincidentally also runs the Modern) in the recently opened Whitney Museum of American Art in Manhattans meatpacking district, is trying to establish a counter trend with an elegantly simple menu and stylish, sleek dcor. Last Wednesday, three weeks after the restaurant opened, the line to get in was not quite as long as the line for the museum, but the dining room was nonetheless packed with a lunchtime crowd that included three members of a family whose interest in a good meal actually preceded their interest in the art.

title: UEFA Appears Prepared to Allow League in Crimea
description: MOSCOW  Soccer officials in Crimea have said that European soccers governing body, UEFA, has approved the creation of a new league on the disputed peninsula, dragging UEFAs awkward position over the Ukraine crisis into prominence again and aggravating yet another political headache for international soccer authorities.

title: Shake Shacks Shares Could Hint at Overvaluation
description: A once-humble New York hot-dog stand may have just turned into the ultimate market indicator. Shake Shack, which went public in January, hit a record high share price on Thursday, implausibly raising the value of the chain, a creation of Danny Meyer, by $250 million, to $3.3 billion.

title: Dance Class: An Activity That Isnt Very Active
description: How much is your child really dancing in dance class?

title: A Pioneer Aviator, and a Park Without Its Eponym
description: Q. I recently saw a small display about a woman named Harriet Quimby, a pioneer aviator. Could you tell me more about her?

title: Hanoi Hits
description: Savoring the specialties in Hanoi and Hoi An restaurants that preserve the informality and limited menus of Vietnams beloved street stalls.

title: Obama Stresses Support for Israel, but Refuses to Paper Over Discord
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama sought to reassure American Jews that he is a fierce supporter of Israel as he visited an influential synagogue here on Friday to defend his quest for a nuclear agreement with Iran. The visit was also an attempt to mend a strained relationship with parts of the American Jewish community that dates to the start of Mr. Obamas presidency and has worsened in recent months.

title: Book Review Podcast: Shakespeare in Love
description: In The New York Times Book Review, Alan Riding reviews two new books about Shakespeares women characters and personal life: Tina Packers Women of Will: Following the Feminine in Shakespeares Plays and Chris Laoutariss Shakespeare and the Countess: The Battle That Gave Birth to the Globe. Mr. Riding writes:

title: Painting Recovered From Gurlitt Trove to Be Auctioned in London
description: A Max Liebermann oil painting that vanished for decades in the secret art hoard of Cornelius Gurlitt will get its first public viewing in June in advance of an auction for the work, which once belonged to a Jewish industrialist.

title: Free Passes to Parks for Fourth Graders
description: Next school year, fourth graders in the United States and their families will be entitled to free admission to Americas national parks, federal lands and waters.

title: A Juggernaut Lurks Early in Rafael Nadals Path at the French Open
description: PARIS  Not nice Maria, joked Toni Nadal in a French radio interview here on Friday.

title: A Full Floor at One57 for $47.78 Million
description: A full-floor aerie on the 77th floor of One57, where the citys two most expensive single-family residences were purchased recently, sold to a mystery European buyer for $47,782,186.53 and was the most expensive closed sale of the week, according to city records.

title: More Than One Attacker Is Suspected in Killings of 4 in Washington
description: Multiple attackers were involved in taking four people captive in a Washington mansion, making them produce $40,000 in cash and then killing them, an investigator said in court papers filed on Friday, hours after the only person publicly identified as a suspect was arrested.

title: A Victory for Medical Marijuana
description: Its the middle of 2015, and the United States is still fighting its old, failed, discredited war on drugs. But sometimes the battlefield fog lifts a little.

title: How Malia Mills, Swimsuit Designer, Spends Her Sundays
description: The Honolulu-born swimsuit designer Malia Mills grew up customizing crochet bikinis. When she moved to New Hampshire as a teenager, she noted a bit less freedom of expression among her peers. I went to the town pond, and I was in a crazy racy, hot pink monokini thing and my friends were chilling out in high-neck, low-leg Speedos, she recalled. It was a Bridget Joness Diary moment for me. Suiting up, she contends, should be a joyous experience, and can be so with the right-fitting piece (or pieces). She is spreading this philosophy through her 14 stores nationwide, including five in New York City and two in the Hamptons, and her website. Ms. Mills, 48, lives with her boyfriend, Christian Busch, 43, in a loftesque building in TriBeCa.

title: Hillary Clinton Takes Questions Again and Addresses Emails
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton took questions for reporters Friday for the second time in a week, commenting on the State Departments disclosure of emails related to the 2012 attack on the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya.

title: Review: In American Immersion: Clemens Gadensttter, Sonic Mortification
description: I hope no one has to understand the sensation of having his skin ripped off, the composer Clemens Gadensttter said in an onstage interview on Thursday at the Austrian Cultural Forum. He was introducing his 2012 string quartet huten (Paramyth 1), which is designed to evoke that very feeling.

title: A Mural Tour in Tulum
description: Inspired by the Wynwood Walls of Miami, a street art project that has revitalized a once dreary neighborhood, Susan Bohlken, owner of the beachfront Zamas Hotel in Tulum, Mexico, invited several muralists to the area to literally paint the town last December. The result: 14 new murals on city walls.

title: Firefighting the Old-School Way
description: This year marks the 150th anniversary of New York Citys professional Fire Department, replacing a patchwork of amateur forces that sometimes battled over turf instead of putting out blazes.

title: Tobacco Giants Sue Britain Over Rules on Plain Packaging
description: PARIS  Big Tobacco is pushing back against Europes effort to remove the marketing allure from smoking.

title: Voyage of an Iron-Hulled Ship
description: A time-lapse video of Wavertrees short journey to Staten Island for repairs. Wavertree is a 19th-century vessel and part of South Street Seaport Museums collection.

title: North Carolina Receives Notice of Allegations From N.C.A.A.
description: The University of North Carolina announced Friday that it had received a notice of allegations from the N.C.A.A. stemming from a scandal, nearly two decades long, in which the athletic department is accused of directing top athletes to phony classes.

title: Cuba and U.S. Diplomats Hold More Talks
description: Senior diplomats for the United States and Cuba, Roberta S. Jacobson and Josefina Vidal, announced the end of another round of talks on the restoration of diplomatic relations.

title: Kate Betts, Onetime Harpers Bazaar Editor, at Home
description: On a recent Sunday afternoon, Kate Betts, the onetime editor in chief of Harpers Bazaar, was sitting in her favorite armchair in the parlor of her weekend house in Sag Harbor, N.Y. I call this the concierge seat, because you can see everyone coming and going  and spy on them, said Ms. Betts, alluding to the stereotypical French concierge who is as much the resident busybody of an apartment building as its superintendent.

title: Josh Duggar Receives Support From Mike Huckabee
description: Former Gov. Mike Huckabee, the Republican from Arkansas who is running for president, has come to the defense of the former director of the conservative Family Research Councils lobbying group who resigned this week amid allegations that he had molested children.

title: A Drug Smugglers Times Square Visit (for Pleasure, Not Business)
description: Three men strolled in Times Square on a Monday afternoon in February, looking around. Nothing out of the ordinary. Then one of them pointed up, toward the top of a building on 42nd Street.

title: Jon Pessahs The Game: Inside the Secret World of Major League Baseballs Power Brokers
description: It was the most tumultuous time in baseball history. Between 1992 and 2010, a commissioner was forced out, there was a 234-day strike, home run records were completely obliterated and an entire generation of stars was tainted by steroids.

title: Review: The Future Was Looking Better in the Past, a Long-Ago Crime Reappears
description: In Chicago in 1924, two affluent and intellectually precocious teenagers named Nathan Leopold and Richard Loeb coldly murdered a 14-year-old boy named Bobby Franks. The crime and the trial spawned a media circus, novels, plays and films. On Wednesday at the Chocolate Factory in Queens, the performance artist Rebecca Patek added another work to the pile. The Leopold and Loeb case, though, is not the only subject of Ms. Pateks jumbled, hourlong The Future Was Looking Better in the Past. (The subtitle runs on for 28 more words.) The murderers and their victim are played by dancer-actors, who recite segments of actual and imagined courtroom testimony and who appear in video re-enactments and fantasies. But the same performers also portray Ms. Patek and an interviewer discussing the process and motivations behind this show. (Here, and in the program bio, Ms. Patek claims to be related to Loeb.) Threaded in alternation with these two strands is a third, given in audio with subtitles, as if from a wiretap recording. This is a scene presented as another crime, one from last year, in which Ms. Patek engages in sex acts with anonymous men.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Good News for the Nations Waterways
description: Joan Mulhern would have loved this day, had she lived to see it. Joan, who died at the age of 51 in December 2012, was a feisty Massachusetts native, passionate Red Sox fan and environmental lawyer who gravitated to the Washington office of Earthjustice, an advocacy group she served as a senior attorney while becoming an absolute terror to anyone who threatened the waters of the United States  legislators and lobbyists, passive regulators, coal companies that insisted on blasting the tops off mountains and dumping coal slag in the valleys and streams below. Her biggest cause, in which she enlisted every environmentalist, journalist and ordinary citizen she could buttonhole, was to restore the full meaning and scope of the 1972 Clean Water Act, whose protections, she believed, had been fatally weakened by the courts and by politicians in thrall to special interests  mainly developers, industrial and municipal polluters, and big farmers. Next week, barring an 11th-hour cave-in by the White House, the Environmental Protection Agency and the Army Corps of Engineers are expected to issue a firm, clear rule restoring federal protections to most (though probably not all) of the waters the Acts framers, and Joan, had hoped to protect.

title: Lets Make the Republican Debates More, Not Less, of a Circus
description: If you go out and interact with Real Everyday Americans in places like Dupont Circle, the lobby of the Des Moines Marriott and my Twitter feed, youll know that one of the biggest challenges now facing America involves figuring out how the nine scheduled Republican presidential debates can be held without running afoul of local fire marshals.

title: U.S. Drug Charges for 2 Former Wesleyan Students Linked to Overdoses
description: Federal prosecutors on Friday said that two Wesleyan University students had sold a popular club drug known as Molly on campus for more than a year before a harrowing night in February when several students were hospitalized with drug overdoses, including one who nearly died.

title: The Best-Selling Sports Books
description: Trying to decide what to read on the beach this holiday weekend? Here are the best-selling sports books in April 2015, according to The New York Times best-seller list.

title: TLC Pulls 19 Kids and Counting From Its Lineup
description: TLC has pulled the popular reality show 19 Kids and Counting from its lineup, following allegations that one of the shows stars, Josh Duggar, had previously been investigated on suspicion of molesting several minors.

title: Obama Reaffirms Commitment to Israel
description: Speaking at the Adas Israel Congregation in Washington on Friday, President Obama sought to allay fears over the Iranian nuclear deal, and reaffirm American commitment to Israel.

title: Bill Cunningham | Colors of Spring
description: Fashion and nature reflect each others beauty.

title: Why Do We Experience Awe?
description: HERES a curious fact about goose bumps. In many nonhuman mammals, goose bumps  that physiological reaction in which the muscles surrounding hair follicles contract  occur when individuals, along with other members of their species, face a threat. We humans, by contrast, can get goose bumps when we experience awe, that often-positive feeling of being in the presence of something vast that transcends our understanding of the world.

title: Review: Susanna Malkki Makes an Immediate Impression
description: Though the Finnish conductor Susanna Malkkis long-overdue debut with the New York Philharmonic on Thursday night gave me deep pleasure, the occasion also stirred up some annoyance with the Philharmonics leadership team. Where has this impressive 46-year-old artist been? How has it taken so long for the Philharmonic to invite her as a guest?

title: Online, Irish Referendum Looks One-Sided, but Conservatives Hope Vote Reveals a Silent Majority
description: I live in a rather special world, the film critic Pauline Kael observed in 1972, one month after President Richard Nixon was re-elected in a landslide. I only know one person who voted for Nixon.

title: Farmers Agree to Water Cuts in California
description: LOS ANGELES  Ever since the Gold Rush, California farmers have staked their claim to water and ferociously protected their rights to use it to irrigate the crops that have made the state the greengrocer for the nation.

title: Review: Lauren Foxs Nostalgic Tribute to Groupie Muses
description: They treated us like goddesses.

title: Ireland Votes on Same-Sex Marriage
description: Residents of Ireland reacted Friday as the country held a referendum to decide whether to legalize same-sex marriage.

title: Maureen Aboods Rose Water & Orange Blossoms Takes You to Lebanon
description: We cooks may have fallen hard for Middle Eastern cuisine, but for the most part, weve done it haphazardly, stirring disparate elements of the region into one sun-drenched, sumac-flecked, tahini-laced stew.

title: Pictures of the Day: Burundi and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Burundi, Thailand, Saudi Arabia and India.

title: Review: The Mantises Are Flipping W.3, a World of Its Own at Danspace Project
description: At first glance, the single false eyelash, conspicuously white, worn by each member of BodyStories: Teresa Fellion Dance is what distinguishes them as a tribe or species in The Mantises Are Flipping W.3. Soon, other commonalities become apparent: a contorted physicality, buckling in spasms, and highly animated faces that react to other dancers or to the dancers own limbs with astonishment and aggression.

title: Bill Cunningham |Colors of Spring
description: Fashion and nature reflect each others beauty. In early April, the young woman installing the nasturtium vines at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston wore a nasturtium-colored hat. Suddenly there was an explosion of color on clothes. Early in May back in New York, buttercups dominated a farmers market. The color showed up in fashion as well, and even on a sports car. One womans yellow dress and cellphone cover matched a park telephone. Last week, the flower market was flooded with lilies of the valley. At citywide graduations, students took off caps and gowns to reveal white lace dresses; on the street, they wore white lace dusters. One curious sight: a white dog passing a row of house painters.

title: May 22, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Burundi, Thailand, Saudi Arabia and India.

title: Political Unrest Pushes Burundi Closer to Economic Collapse
description: BUJUMBURA, Burundi  In a circular ward of the Prince Regent Charles Hospital, a facility that speaks of better days in this central African country, Armel Manirambona lay on a bed under a white blanket that covered a bullet wound in his abdomen and damage to his colon and liver.

title: Chris Christie and Jeb Bush Cite Experience in Courting Southern G.O.P.
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  Organizers of this years Southern Republican Leadership Conference were able to secure commitments from many of the leading presidential candidates, but the United States Senates schedule has disrupted carefully laid plans. Senators Marco Rubio of Florida and Ted Cruz of Texas  both highly anticipated draws here  had to remain in Washington on Friday to attend to their day jobs. The Senate, as is often the case, is up against a deadline and scrambling to move legislation before a looming recess.

title: Noteworthy Moments From Cannes
description: As the Cannes Film Festival approaches its final weekend, here are five moments worth revisiting.

title: The City That Never Stops
description: In mid-May, it seemed as if the parties were endless.

title: Russia Casts a Shadow Over European Meeting
description: RIGA, Latvia  Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain showed up hours late, but the absentee who really mattered  and haunted all discussion during a two-day meeting of leaders from Europe and former Soviet lands  was President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, who had not even been invited.

title: Young Saudis Find Freedom on Their Phones
description: Technology offers opportunity for self-expression in a country with strict social codes.

title: Gentrification Spreads an Upheaval in San Franciscos Mission District
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Luxury condominiums, organic ice cream stores, cafes that serve soy lattes and chocolate shops that offer samples from Ecuador and Madagascar are rapidly replacing 99-cent stores, bodegas and rent-controlled apartments in the Mission District, this citys working-class Latino neighborhood.

title: Charles Annenberg Weingarten, a Philanthropist With Exotic Pet Causes
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  The billionaire philanthropist Wallis Annenberg answers to the nickname  Moondoggie?

title: A Marriage of Practical Advice and a Sense of Adventure
description: Judith Sills and Randy Swartz were married April 12 at Le Chri, a French restaurant in the Philadelphia Art Alliance.v

title: Letter to Governors about the Prison Rape Elimination Act
description: A letter to governors from the U.S. Department of Justice about the Prison Rape Elimination Act, which was put in place by President George W. Bush.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: On the Red Carpet: Covering Cannes
description: CANNES  I used to cover the Vatican, so I am familiar with hierarchy. Thats useful training for Cannes. The most important film festival in the world is a highly complex ecosystem  French cultural bureaucracy meets the Hollywood caste system. Its all about access. And status anxiety. Were you invited to the party, the after-party or the after-after party, the one on a yacht?

title: A Letter From Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas
description: Mr. Abbott told the U.S. Department of Justice that he believed Texas to be in full compliance with the Prison Rape Elimination Act but that he could not certify it.

title: U.S. Spars With Texas on Ending Prison Rapes
description: In what appeared to be a reversal of his predecessors position, Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas wrote to Attorney General Loretta E. Lynch last week to assure her that his state intended to abide by national standards to prevent, detect and respond to prison rape wherever feasible.

title: A Family Drama in Three Acts
description: This is a story of redemption. But first, the fall: Last July, Kevin McEnroe, the son of the tennis legend John McEnroe and the actress Tatum ONeal, was arrested in the East Village on suspicion of buying cocaine, which later turned out to be baking soda. He was also charged with criminal possession of prescription pills.

title: The Acropolis
description: Tod Papageorges images of 1980s tourists.

title: From Mourning Comes Advice, Then Love
description: In April 2014, Randy Swartz went to sit shiva for a friend. At the time, Mr. Swartz was still in mourning for his wife, who had died five months earlier, and as he listened to Judith Sills give a eulogy for their mutual friend, Larry Teacher, a founder of the Running Press publishing house, he realized she might be able to help him in his own mourning process.

title: Fighting Pollution From Microbeads Used in Soaps and Creams
description: Stiv Wilson is not much of an exfoliator.

title: Kim K., J-Lo, Beyonc Undress for Success With the Naked Look
description: To the Billboard Music Awards a week ago, Jennifer Lopez bared most of her stomach and the undersides of her breasts in a creation by  hmm, let me look that up.

title: South Asian-American Men Balance Tradition and Modernity to Find a Bride
description: The Urdu phrase bus bohot hogiya hay sends chills down Umair Khans spine.

title: The R&B Star Akon and an Emirates Foundation Invest in a Solar Energy Work Force for Africa
description: The United Nations hosted the second Sustainable Energy for All Forum this week. The four-day set of events and announcements was aimed at fulfilling Secretary-General Ban Ki-moons creditable 2011 vision of achieving universal access to modern energy services by 2030 (along with a doubled global rate of improvement in energy efficiency and doubled share of renewable energy in the global energy mix).

title: Theater Review: First Lady Runs the Country When President Wilson Cant
description: She doesnt read newspapers, because the news dismays her. Shes never voted, because in 1915, American women dont have that right. Shes a product of finishing schools, not universities. And when she travels to Paris, she spends her time at couture houses, not museums. But the lovely, well-dressed woman we meet at the start of Joe DiPietros newest play, the final offering of Long Wharf Theaters 50th-anniversary season, manages to interest, seduce and marry the president of the United States, and then to run the country after he is incapacitated by a stroke.

title: Even With Kentucky G.O.P. Race Unsettled, a Candidate Is Confident
description: With no winner declared in Kentuckys Republican primary for governor and a machine adding up votes again, the state Republican Party is holding off announcing the keynote speaker for this months Lincoln Day Dinner, a slot reserved for the eventual winner.

title: Locally Made Cheeses Are Having a Moment in Connecticut
description: Farmers markets are set to reopen for the summer season, and tucked in among tables of just-picked corn and cartons of fresh lettuces and greens is one commodity Connecticut consumers can expect to see a great deal more of: locally made cheese.

title: A Closer Look at Stylish Gallerists
description: Chilly and label-fixated theyre not.

title: At Frieze Art Fair, Figures at an Exhibition
description: Laurie Harrison stood swanning at her booth at the Frieze Art Fair on Randalls Island the other day, her brash turnout a magnet to the swarms of photographers, street-style bloggers and self-appointed fashion watchers milling inside the bright white tent.

title: Review: Small World Pits Disney and Stravinsky in Duel of Ideas
description: What happened when Stravinskys Rite of Spring met Mickey Mouse?

title: Review: New Country, by Mark Roberts, With Dirty Jokes Aplenty
description: Two and a Half Men was often among network prime times raunchier shows during its long run, but Mark Roberts, one of the brains behind it, apparently was holding a lot back. His raucous New Country, having its premiere at the Cherry Lane Theater and featuring one especially blazing performance, is full of the kinds of lines television censors snip out. But Mr. Roberts, a principal writer for the series, also does a pretty good job of slipping in a bit of heart amid the offensiveness.

title: Review: Texas Rising, a Mini-Series on Alamo Aftermath With Dialogue to Forget
description: A lot of the heroes of the Texas Revolution died at the Alamo, including, apparently, most of the interesting ones.

title: Review: Almost Everything at the Iron Horse Pleasantville has Changed but the Name
description: The name is the same but almost everything else about the former Iron Horse Pleasantville restaurant has changed. Diners looking for the magical fare created by Philip McGrath, the past owner and chef, might be disappointed. Theres a new guy in charge with a different vision. David Barrera took over the restaurant in September 2013, closed it last January for a months renovation and reopened it in February.

title: At Cannes Film Festival, Good Sometimes Isnt Enough
description: CANNES, France  We came, we saw, we cheered and, as you may have heard, we also jeered. In other words, welcome to the latest edition of the Cannes Film Festival, which ends Sunday. For more than a week, thousands of journalists and industry insiders have swarmed into this Riviera city to sift through titles that will be coming to a theater near you or just your favorite small screen. Inside the festival headquarters, journalists have raced from screening to screening while, at the film market, business types have bought and sold movies and sometimes projects that no critic has seen nor may ever want to, like I Am Wrath, a revenge flick set to star a gun-toting John Travolta.

title: Review: Im Not the Stranger You Think I Am, Where Theater Meets Confessional
description: Theres no hiding in the dark this time, and none of the usual safety in numbers. Its just you and her  or him  eyeball to eyeball, in a closed, red space the size of a confessional. If you blush or yawn or wipe tears from your eyes, she sees it; that means, of course, that she feels it, too.

title: The Week in Political Pictures
description: Photographs from Washington and elsewhere.

title: Blending French and African Identities
description: A project looks at how young Afro-French women maneuver a cultural landscape that often marginalizes or excludes them.

title: At Restaurant Lorenas in Maplewood, a Menu Built Around Vegetables
description: Like many dishes I ate at Restaurant Lorenas, now entering its tenth year and among Open Tables top 100 restaurants in America in 2014, the warm crepe of crab and mushrooms reminded me of my early training as a critic. I was 8. My mother had a passion for fine French restaurants. The pricier the better.

title: First Draft Focus: The Week in Political Pictures
History and Safety on the Railroad
description: To the Editor:

title: Tod Papageorges Summers Amid the Ruins
description: In the summers of 1983 and 1984, Tod Papageorge, a professor of photography at the Yale University School of Art, adopted a daily ritual in Athens. He would wake up each morning at the Zafolia Hotel and walk up the hill to the Acropolis to spend the day photographing the scene around the ancient citadel, sweating in the sun.

title: Review: In The Goldilocks Zone at Mill Hill Playhouse, Seeking Mr. Just Right
description: The title of The Goldilocks Zone, a new play presented by the Passage Theater Company at the Mill Hill Playhouse in Trenton, is derived from an astronomical term that describes planets capable of sustaining life as we know it.

title: Contra Dancing Grows in Popularity on Long Island
description: On a Saturday evening in early spring, a full moon hung low over the Water Mill Community House, and as the door swung open, the sound of dueling fiddles leaked into the night. Inside, the place was packed with farmers, architects, bioengineers and contra virgins bowing to their partners and swinging their neighbors.

title: Opting Out of State Tests Based on Common Core Standards
description: To the Editor:

title: Readers of The Daily News
description: To the Editor:

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: China and the Reefs: A Weakness in the U.S. Position
description: To the Editor:

title: An Assured Voice Joins the Cattle Call
description: After meat was rationed during World War II, a big juicy steak dinner became the American ideal. Later in the 20th century, there was a slight dip in enthusiasm when cholesterol levels became the health topic du jour. Still, by the 1990s, steakhouses were again riding high. They still are: The section of Route 25A from Great Neck to East Norwich is known as Steakhouse Row.

title: Whats Behind the Collapse of Honeybee Colonies
description: To the Editor:

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Janine Gibson, Editor Who Led Team That Won Pulitzer, Leaves The Guardian
description: Janine Gibson, a senior editor at The Guardian who oversaw coverage that won the newspaper its first Pulitzer Prize but who was recently passed over when a new editor in chief was appointed, is leaving the organization.

title: Dean Potters Final Flight: One Risk Too Many
description: MADISON, N.H.  FOR all his feats of athletic daring, Dean Potter preferred to think of himself as an artist. The extreme sports stars greatest achievements, like walking a highline rigged across Upper Yosemite Falls or free-soloing a new route on Fitzroy, a 10,000-foot spike of granite in Argentina, required the sort of creative vision and self-belief that comes only from close study of the wilderness landscape, and constant practice.

title: Eiffel Tower Workers Stage a Strike to Protest Pickpockets
description: PARIS  Bands of pickpockets at the Eiffel Tower prompted workers to close the monument for much of Friday in a protest over a lack of security for both visitors and staff.

title: For One Irish Couple, Backing Gay Marriage Is a Matter of Family Values
description: Thirteen years ago Padraic Whyte did one of the hardest things he has ever had to do: He told his Roman Catholic parents living in rural Ireland that he was gay.

title: Letter From the Department of Environmental Protection
description: The department sent a letter to state officials expressing agreement with the goal of the proposed changes for governing water quality standards.

title: G.M. Inquiry Said to Find Criminal Wrongdoing
description: Justice Department investigators have identified criminal wrongdoing in General Motors failure to disclose a defect tied to at least 104 deaths, and are negotiating what is expected to be a record penalty, according to people briefed on the inquiry.

title: Walmart Pushes for Improved Animal Welfare
description: Walmart, the nations largest grocery retailer, said on Friday that it would ask its meat, seafood, poultry, deli and egg suppliers to adopt animal welfare standards that include sufficient space and easy access to food and water.

title: Whats Behind Big Science Frauds?
description: IN December, Science published a paper claiming that people could change their minds about same-sex marriage after talking for just 20 minutes with a gay person. It seemed too good to be true  and it was.

title: A Costly Tax Break for Nonpublic Schools
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo can talk passionately about improving New Yorks failing public schools, but when he made that point at churches and a yeshiva last Sunday it was, at best, disingenuous. He was there to sell his bill that would help private and parochial schools, by offering big tax credits to their donors. This energetic effort for an expensive and possibly unconstitutional bill that Mr. Cuomo has named the Parental Choice in Education Act could cost the state more than $150 million a year. That money should be used to help almost 2.7 million public school students in the state, not given to wealthy donors subsidizing mainly private or religious schools.

title: Drivers and Officials Preparing for a Slower, and Possibly Safer, Indianapolis 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The final practice session for the Indianapolis 500 was conducted Friday without incident.

title: Senate Vote Is a Victory for Obama on Trade, but a Tougher Test Awaits
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama moved closer to expanded trade negotiating power Friday night after the Senate passed hard-fought legislation that would help complete the most ambitious trade accord in a generation. The deal would link 12 nations on either side of the Pacific into a trading bloc that would encompass 40 percent of the global economy.

title: Honduras: Ex-Presidents Son Arrested
description: Fabio Porfirio Lobo, the son of a former Honduran president, appeared in Federal District Court in Manhattan on Friday on a charge of conspiring to import cocaine into the United States, the authorities said. The charge carries a maximum sentence of life in prison, said the office of Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York. Mr. Lobo had been arrested in Haiti. The defendants father, Porfirio Lobo, served as president of Honduras from 2010 to 2014. The Associated Press reported that the father, in an interview with government television, said he hoped that his son could prove his innocence. Fabio is not a child, The A.P. quoted him as saying. He is a man with a family and must answer for his actions. Manuel J. Retureta, a lawyer for Mr. Lobo, said his client would enter a plea of not guilty.

title: Pakistan Widens Inquiry Into Fake Diplomas
description: LONDON  Heavy scrutiny by investigators, politicians and the fractious Pakistani media sector has mounted over the past week for Axact, a Karachi-based software company that has made millions selling fake degrees through a sprawling empire of school websites.

title: Colombia Rebels End Truce After a Government Attack
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Colombias largest guerrilla group suspended a unilateral cease-fire on Friday, a day after an attack by government forces killed 26 rebel fighters, dealing the latest setback to peace talks aimed at ending more than 50 years of war.

title: G.O.P. Candidates Take Tougher Tone at Forum
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  There is a Republican presidential candidate forum practically every weekend these days, and the onset of the Memorial Day holiday was no different. But the White House hopefuls who descended on this conservative capital of the energy industry suggested that the nascent Republican nominating contest is shifting to a new, harder-edged phase.

title: 40 Are Killed in Gun Battle in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY  More than 40 people were killed Friday in a confrontation with members of the federal police, who have sought to tamp down an increase in crime in southwest Mexico marked by an accelerating series of violent challenges to authority.

title: Banks as Felons, or Criminality Lite
description: As of this week, Citicorp, JPMorgan Chase, Barclays and Royal Bank of Scotland are felons, having pleaded guilty on Wednesday to criminal charges of conspiring to rig the value of the worlds currencies. According to the Justice Department, the lengthy and lucrative conspiracy enabled the banks to pad their profits without regard to fairness, the law or the public good.

title: Rising Dissent and Lawsuits Pushed Scouts to Change
description: As Robert M. Gates, the president of the Boy Scouts of America, called Thursday for an end to the organizations ban on openly gay leaders, the group was already facing state civil rights investigations in New York and Colorado and the looming threat of lawsuits that the Scouts seemed almost certain to lose.

title: Drop That Gas Nozzle: New Jersey Is Full-Service Island, and Likes It
description: RAMSEY, N.J.  Perhaps no state in the nation is as defined by cars and car culture as quintessentially suburban New Jersey. The first drive-in movie theater, the sprawl of malls and highways  What exit?  and a very famous traffic jam.

title: Increasingly, Polish Voters Call for Change in Politics
description: WARSAW  Poland, always eager to close the gap with its Western neighbors, has developed yet another symptom of contemporary Europeanness: a growing chunk of voters alienated from the traditional political parties and deeply disenchanted with the countrys entire political class.

title: Two Sides Claim Victory as Syrian Troops Flee Hospital
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Scores of Syrian government soldiers and civilians besieged by insurgents for nearly a month in a hospital in northern Syria fled on Friday in a dramatic exit that both the army and its opponents promptly claimed as a victory.

title: Dark Clouds Over Turkey
description: With two weeks to go before a crucial parliamentary election in Turkey, tensions are rising and some critics of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan fear a new crackdown is starting to ensure that his Justice and Development Party wins. That kind of brute manipulation of the political process would be a serious mistake, further weakening the countrys battered democracy and tainting whatever victory might emerge.

title: Military Deaths in ISIS Operations
description: The Department of Defense has identified four American service members who have died supporting the operation to eliminate the Islamic State militant group. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Boardwalk Returns to Rockaways in Time for Beach Season
description: Ever since Hurricane Sandy battered the Rockaways  even as residents and business owners in the area restored and remade their lives with muscle, will and money  a big hole has remained in the fabric of the community.

title: As Lacrosse Rises, Its Final Four Falls Fast
description: It seemed like an odd marriage, but the more administrators analyzed it, the pairing began to make sense. Lacrosse was a booming sport, and the Big East Conference appeared poised to prosper in it. So why not bring it to Wisconsin?

title: Rush to Judgment
description: Time flies when youre having fun. Memorial Day weekend, the Fourth of July and then, the next thing you know, it will be Aug. 6, the anniversary of the bombing of Hiroshima and the date of the first Republican presidential debate.

title: U.S. Flies Over a Chinese Project at Sea, and Beijing Objects
description: WASHINGTON  The United States and China on Friday escalated their dispute over contested territory in the South China Sea, after the Chinese repeatedly ordered an American military surveillance plane to abandon flights over areas where China has been building artificial islands.

title: Marques Haynes, 89, Dies; Dribbled as a Globetrotter and Dazzled Worldwide
description: Marques Haynes, whose dazzling ball-handling skills, exhibited for more than 40 years as a member of the Harlem Globetrotters and other barnstorming black basketball teams, earned him a place in the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame and an international reputation as the worlds greatest dribbler, died on Friday in Plano, Tex. He was 89.

title: Is the Ex-Im Bank Doomed?
description: Its looking pretty grim for the Export-Import Bank of the United States.

title: Cuomo Administration Ends 90-Day Rule on Deleting State Workers Email
description: After widespread criticism, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos administration on Friday ended a policy of automatically deleting New York State employees emails after 90 days.

title: Advocates and Regulators Press for Cleaner New York City Waterways
description: The little bottles of salt water were rushed in  by subway, bus, car, bicycle and kayak  from across the city.

title: Slow and Steady
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  A lesson for those of you who are afraid to tackle the Saturday puzzle: When in mortal fear for your solving life, tackle the Downs first.

title: Honor Comes Late toscar Romero, a Martyr for the Poor
description: SAN SALVADOR  Mara de los Angeles Mena Alvarado knelt at the tomb of the slain archbishop and wept.

title: Victor Salvi, Who Played Harps and Made Them Too, Dies at 95
description: Victor Salvi, who reigned for decades as the worlds foremost maker of harps, died on May 10 in Milan. He was 95.

title: El Salvador Prepares to Celebrate Romero
description: The memory of Archbishop scar Romero, who was assassinated in 1980, still resonates in El Salvador as it prepares to celebrate his beatification.

title: Noah Syndergaard Takes a Loss, but He Will Have More Chances
description: PITTSBURGH  There were more bursts of promise, and a few more raw moments, for the right-hander Noah Syndergaard here on Friday night. The nascent steps of his three-game stay in the major leagues have whetted the appetites of the Mets and their fans for a longer look at his stuff, and Manager Terry Collins revealed on Friday that he would get his chance.

title: Cap and Gown
description: Its commencement season, so prepare to be inspired.

title: Prince Fielder Helps Rangers Overcome Yankees and Michael Pineda
description: Minutes before taking the mound, Michael Pineda walked in from the bullpen with a wide smile.

title: Same Characters, Improved Script as Rangers Crush Lightning
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The Rangers played hockey in this bizarre alternate universe Friday night, a place where Rick Nash scored two goals, Martin St. Louis added another and the most dangerous line of the Eastern Conference finals, of the entire N.H.L. playoffs, skated a full 60 minutes without registering a single point.

title: LeBron James Scores 30 as Cavaliers Hobble Past Limping Hawks
description: ATLANTA  In the last hour of his 56th birthday, Cleveland Cavaliers Coach David Blatt could think of nothing he wanted or needed. Except maybe a dictionary or a thesaurus.

title: Senate to Try Again After Bill on N.S.A. Collection of Phone Records Is Blocked
description: WASHINGTON  After vigorous debate and intense last-minute pressure by Republican leaders, the Senate on Saturday rejected legislation that would curb the federal governments bulk collection of phone records.

title: Whats On TV Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) DAWN OF THE PLANET OF THE APES (2014) A decade has passed on screen since Rise of the Planet of the Apes, and millions of people have fallen prey to a lethal virus, leaving survivors to cobble together a society in the ruins of San Francisco, where Dreyfus (Gary Oldman), the former police chief, is in charge. But across the Golden Gate Bridge in Marin County, the upright-walking chimpanzee Caesar (Andy Serkis) and his team have built their own civilization, complete with distinctive wooden architecture, domesticated horses, a sophisticated sign language and an education system overseen by the orangutan Maurice (Karin Konoval). But when the humans ask to encroach on their territory to build a hydroelectric station, the alarms are sounded  and schisms formed. Its a satisfying movie and an example  a dispiritingly rare one these days  of what mainstream Hollywood filmmaking can still achieve, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times about Matt Reevess Oscar nominee for best achievement in visual effects. That we have progressed from Rise only as far as Dawn suggests many future sequels, which may, in this case, be a source of hope as well as dread, provided that civilization doesnt collapse in the meantime.

title: Corrections: May 23, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The only way to win that argument is if you can make a legitimate argument that New Jerseyans are more flammable than other people.

title: Regimes and Regressions (Wonkish)
description: Some people have asked me about the chart in this post on interest rates and their effect: why did I truncate the time period, so as not to include the past couple of decades? I actually did explain my reasoning right there in the post (although I should know by now that careful reading is, lets say, not a universal skill), but lets revisit that anyway  and while were at it, let me talk about the broader principle involved.

title: Time Zones, Columns, and Comments (Trivial)
description: A few West Coast readers have complained to me that columns are no longer posted as early as in the past  they go up in the small hours of the East Coast morning, not 11 PM or so. There has indeed been a change in policy. But its not about you. It is, as I understand it, about the Europeans.

title: Ireland Votes to Approve Gay Marriage, Putting Country in Vanguard
description: DUBLIN  Ireland became the first nation to approve same-sex marriage by a popular vote, sweeping aside the opposition of the Roman Catholic Church in a resounding victory Saturday for the gay rights movement and placing the country at the vanguard of social change.

description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took viewers from Pyongyang, North Korea, to the observatory near the top of 1 World Trade Center.

description: On my first trip to Southeast Asia almost 30 years ago, I fell in love with street food. I was a student on a budget, staying in an area in Bangkok still famous for backpacker hotels.

description: Ireland became the first nation to approve same-sex marriage by a popular vote, sweeping aside the opposition of the Roman Catholic Church in a resounding victory Saturday for the gay rights movement.

description: CLEVELAND  A police officer who climbed onto the hood of a car after a chase in 2012 and fired repeatedly at its unarmed occupants, both of them black, was acquitted of manslaughter on Saturday by an Ohio judge.

description: This interview with Lori Senecal, global C.E.O. of the ad agency C.P.&B. and C.E.O. of the MDC Partner Network, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Hey, Driver: Hang Up the Phone, Turn Off the TV and Step on It
description: When the Haggler jumps in a taxi in New York City these days, the driver is often nattering away on a cellphone. For cabbies, this is against the law, even if they use a hands-free connection, so the nattering is usually furtive. But on two recent occasions drivers had hooked their phones, through a Bluetooth connection, to the vehicles speakers. Instead of music, the Haggler listened to a personal conversation, loud and clear.

title: Variety: Diagramless Crossword Puzzle
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  To the solvers who have written in to express your disappointment that the diagramless puzzle is now on novelty rotation: Here you go. A Diagramless crossword puzzle.

title: Watching Assumptions Walk Out the Door
description: I answered the knock at the domestic violence shelters door. A hulking young woman with dark circles under her eyes stood there. I was staying here, she said. Im here to get my stereo.

title: The Ancient Ruins Terror Cant Destroy
description: THE guard from the antiquities authority was asleep when I arrived at the Temple of Bel, deep in the Syrian desert. Not unreasonable, given that it was before visiting hours, maybe 5:30 a.m., and almost totally dark. A ribbon of purple on the horizon hinted at sunrise, and the war raging over there, in Iraq. But this was Syria, in 2005, and another day of the Assad family dictatorship was dawning in perfect order. European tourists were about to crawl over the ruins of Palmyra, and the biggest structure of all, a 2,000-year-old monument to an official god, was barely visible in front of me. O.K., the guard said, waving me inside. Go ahead. You can look.

title: N.S.A. and Other Matters Leave McConnells Senate in Disarray
description: WASHINGTON  The sleepy United States senators thought they were done voting. But then, around 1 a.m. on the Saturday before Memorial Day, Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky and presidential candidate, marched spryly to the Senate floor to let it be known that, no, he would not agree to extend the federal governments bulk collection of phone records program. Not even for one day.

title: Popes Focus on Poor Revives Scorned Theology
description: VATICAN CITY  Six months after becoming the first Latin American pontiff, Pope Francis invited an octogenarian priest from Peru for a private chat at his Vatican residence. Not listed on the popes schedule, the September 2013 meeting with the priest, Gustavo Gutirrez, soon became public  and was just as quickly interpreted as a defining shift in the Roman Catholic Church.

title: For Hitters in Baseball, Facing a Shift Can Mean an Adjustment, or Not
description: The first time a left-handed hitter steps into the batters box and sees the infield defense shifted radically toward the right side, it can be jarring. No longer is it just batter against pitcher, as it has been from nearly the first time he picked up a bat.

title: Mother and Twin Daughters Rescued in Brooklyn Fire
description: Through heavy smoke and flames, firefighters could see a woman and her twin daughters calling for help from the windows on the second floor of their Brooklyn home late on Friday night.

title: Verdict in Cleveland Police Shooting
description: A Cleveland police officer who climbed onto the hood of a car after a chase and fired repeatedly at its unarmed occupants in 2012 was acquitted of manslaughter on Saturday by an Ohio judge.

title: Pakistani Journalists Resign to Cut Ties to Axact, a Fake Diploma Company
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  Several senior journalists resigned from a developing Pakistani television network, Bol, on Saturday, in the latest fallout from a crisis engulfing the channels parent company, Axact, a software firm that profited immensely from international sales of fake diplomas.

title: Salvadorans Flock to Honor Beloved Archbishop on Path to Sainthood
description: SAN SALVADOR  Tens of thousands of people filled the streets of El Salvadors capital on Saturday to celebrate the beatification of scar Romero, an archbishop who walked with his people in poverty and was killed after denouncing it.

title: Poetry Kept My Patient Alive
description: Steve, my patient, fancied himself a poet, first and foremost. Brilliant, yet sadly bedeviled by schizoaffective disorder  a condition somewhere between schizophrenia and bipolar  he feared he would die before his gift was discovered. I think Im dying, he said every week. His poetry reflected this preoccupation. For example:

title: Pitcher Collects Wisdom to Go With All His Caps
description: Aaron Harang has pitched for so many teams, in such a short time, that the walls at his home cannot keep up.

description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

description: BRIAN BANKS was one of Americas best high school football players when, in 2002, at age 16, he was accused of rape.

title: Defending the Faith in the Middle East
description: CAMBRIDGE, England  THE last several months have brought a dramatic escalation in conflict across the Middle East, almost all of it involving tensions between Sunni and Shiite Muslims  which are in turn fueled by a power struggle between Shiite Iran and Sunni Saudi Arabia for regional supremacy.

title: Stupid Pentagon Budget Tricks
description: Presidents do not often veto defense budget bills, which annually set spending levels for the huge military structure intended to keep the country safe. But President Obama has threatened to do just that this year, and he should follow through if Congress doesnt make significant changes in the legislation now under consideration.

title: What College Applications Shouldnt Ask
description: Over the last several years, the federal government has been pushing school districts across the country to dial back disciplinary policies under which children are suspended for minor misbehavior that once would have been dealt with in a meeting with parents or though minor sanctions like detention. These zero tolerance policies make it more likely that children will drop out, and they are especially damaging to minority students, who are disproportionately subjected to suspension, expulsion or even arrest for nonviolent offenses. Now, colleges that penalize applicants for high school disciplinary records should change their policies as well.

title: Driving Uber Mad
description: WASHINGTON  ON a reporting expedition to Los Angeles recently, I realized I could stop renting cars.

title: Can the Islamic State Survive?
description: THE fall of an autocrat leads to foreign occupation and civil war. A revolutionary movement with a messianic vision capitalizes on the chaos to gain power. The revolutionaries rule through terror and the promise of utopia, and inspire copycats around the world. But other nations impose a quarantine, internal rivals regain ground, and despite initial successes the new regime seems unlikely to survive  especially once outside powers, including the United States, join the fight against it.

title: Moguls Busily Buying Campaign Clout
description: Alongside the affluent angels who back Broadway shows and the horse fanciers who invest fortunes to own a stakes winner lies a new class of American mogul  ultra-rich political donors buying a sense of power by giving unlimited money to the single-candidate super PACs that are already dominating and undermining the 2016 presidential campaign. Single-candidate super PACs are proving irresistible because they can legally accept open-ended donations while inventing elaborate fictions to pretend they are independent of a candidate, even as they plainly are not.

title: Our Pampered Wilderness
description: SEATTLE  AH, Memorial Day weekend  the traditional opening day of camping season. The smores! The smell of wood smoke! The ravenous mosquitoes and the calamine lotion and the filthy, delighted children catching desperate perch with canned corn niblets as a mountain breeze carries the smell of well-subscribed pit toilets to lumpy tent sites!

description: TORONTO  YOU cant even really see the shoes.

description: WHEN Hillary Rodham Clinton, Ted Cruz, Eric H. Holder Jr., Jeb Bush, George Soros, Marco Rubio and Charles G. Koch all agree that we must end mass incarceration, it is clear that times have changed. Not long ago, most politicians believed the only tenable stance on crime was to be tougher than the next guy.

description: Hannes Wingate is a Swedish-born artist, architect and outdoor survival-skills instructor. He is perhaps best known for his art installations that look like giant bird nests.

title: 30 Seconds With Edwin Moses: Understanding Racing Mechanics
description: Edwin Moses, 59, won gold medals in the 400-meter hurdles at the 1976 and 1984 Olympics. From 1977 to 1987, he won 122 consecutive races and set the world record four times. In 2000, he was elected the first chairman of the Laureus World Sports Academy, an international service organization designed to increase participation in sports and to promote sports as a tool for social change. Moses graduated from Morehouse College in Atlanta with a degree in physics and industrial engineering. He worked as an engineer at General Dynamics in the cruise missile program before devoting himself to sports full time. He has long been a fan of Formula One racing. Since 2000, Mercedes has been a sponsor of Laureus, giving Moses a door to the Formula One paddock. The questions and answers below have been edited and condensed.

title: Spains Many Indicted Politicians Undercut Red Line Against Graft
description: MADRID  In the campaign before regional and local elections across Spain on Sunday, Alberto Fabra, the leader of Valencia, decided he was drawing a red line under years of corruption. He would not, he pledged, allow any indicted official from his Popular Party to run again for office.

title: Hillary Clinton to Hold Fund-Raiser Hosted by Eliot Spitzers Ex-Wife
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton will hold a string of fund-raisers on June 1, including one hosted by the ex-wife of Eliot Spitzer, the former governor of New York who resigned amid scandal in 2008.

title: Helio Castroneves, Teased for Hair Dye, Has a Goal Thats No Joke
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Only one of the 33 starters in Sundays 99th running of the Indianapolis 500 has a chance to truly make history.

title: Our Man in Tehran Answers Your Questions About Iran
description: Thomas Erdbrink, the Tehran bureau chief for The New York Times, answered select readers questions about reporting in Iran; treatment of gays, lesbians and transgender people; a regional rivalry with Saudi Arabia; and the prospects for political change.

title: With Nothing Left to Prove, Jeff Gordon Will Walk Away While He Can
description: CONCORD, N.C.  On a scale of 1 to 10, the pain in Jeff Gordons back can spike as high as 7 when he gets out of bed. Most mornings, he figures it is a 5. It is never better than that.

title: Egyptian Court Acquits 17 in Case Arising From Poets Death at March
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian court on Saturday acquitted 17 witnesses who had been facing criminal charges after some of them came forward to testify about the apparent police killing of an unarmed poet and activist in January, lawyers for the defendants said.

title: A Conversation About Inequality and Atkinson
description: Tony Atkinson, in many ways the father of modern inequality research, has a terrific new book  Inequality: What Can be Done?  that is, um, about inequality and what can be done. title: Starter Is Pummeled in the Third. Again. And the Yanks Lose. Again.

title: Pressure Shifts to Ben Bishop After the Rangers Onslaught
description: TAMPA, Fla.  By most accounts, he never panics, always keeping a calm, communicative demeanor on the ice and in the Tampa Bay Lightnings dressing room. Ben Bishop had at least five reasons to break character after a 5-1 loss to the Rangers on Friday night, but as he leaned against a wall and spoke of his Game 4 debacle, he betrayed little emotion.

title: Actions Speak Louder for a Pirates Rookie
description: PITTSBURGH  Jung Ho Kang grinned late Friday night as he balanced on a motorized scooter and zipped through pockets of pedestrian traffic in the hallway outside the Pittsburgh Pirates clubhouse.

title: Gay Activists Hail Vote, 3 Decades After a Fatal Queer Bashing Hate Crime
description: DUBLIN  Many of the young voters so pivotal to the successful campaign to legalize same-sex marriage in Ireland were not even born when the countrys version of New Yorks Stonewall Riots occurred. In 1982, Declan Flynn, a 31-year-old gay man, was kicked and beaten to death with sticks by a gang of four youths in Fairview Park in Dublins north inner city.

title: Tree Project Aims to Put the Oak Back in Oakland
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  In the beginning, before stylized images of oak trees started appearing on T-shirts, bumper stickers and even Mayor Libby Schaafs election-night earrings in November, there were actually oak woodlands in Oakland.

title: The Victory for Same-Sex Marriage in Ireland
description: Months ago, it seemed to some like a long shot that love, common sense and justice would prevail as voters in Ireland began contemplating whether same-sex couples should be allowed to marry under their Constitution. On Friday, love didnt just prevail across Irish cities and villages. It triumphed.

title: A Tale of Many Cities
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Kevin G. Der has published 32 puzzles in The New York Times, and I believe that I have liked all of them. They are generally clever, clean and tight when they contain a theme.

title: Body Found in Hudson River Near Where Kayaker Disappeared
description: New York State Police troopers discovered a body in the Hudson River on Saturday, near the United States Military Academy at West Point, not far from where a kayaker who authorities say was murdered by his fiance disappeared.

title: Matt Harvey Stumbles and the Mets Fall to the Pirates
description: PITTSBURGH  Before the first pitch here on Saturday afternoon, the pressing question was whether the Mets would provide Matt Harvey the runs to support his recent dominant form. The answer quickly became inconsequential as Harvey slogged through one of the worst starts of his short career, giving up more runs than he had in his previous five starts combined.

title: T.K. Jones, 82, Dies; Arms Official Saw Nuclear War as Survivable
description: Thomas K. Jones, an American defense official and arms negotiator who turned Nikita Khrushchevs defiant We will bury you threat on its head when he declared in 1982 that Americans could survive a Soviet nuclear attack by digging shelters  If there are enough shovels to go around, he said, everybodys going to make it  died on May 15 in Bellevue, Wash. He was 82.

title: Denver Brings the West to the Title Game
description: PHILADELPHIA  None of the traditional motivational ploys  the guest speakers and the playoff beards  had worked in the past, so Coach Bill Tierney cut it out, all of it.

title: With Victories, ISIS Dispels Hope of a Swift Decline
description: BAGHDAD  Just last month, when Western and Iraqi officials talked about the Islamic State, it was mostly to list a series of setbacks to the terrorist group: defeated in the Syrian town of Kobani, battered by a heavy airstrike campaign, forced out of a growing list of towns and cities in Iraq.

description: Savoring the specialties in Hanoi and Hoi An restaurants that preserve the informality and limited menus of Vietnams beloved street stalls.

Ethiopias Ruling
Party Is Expected to
Keep Grip on Power
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia  Like the other people in his village, Berhanu Wodajo, a 40-year-old farmer, is planning to vote for the bee.

title: Saudis Say ISIS Ordered Suicide Bombing of Mosque
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  The Saudi Interior Ministry on Saturday said that a Saudi man taking direction from the Islamic State had carried out a deadly suicide bombing a day earlier, bolstering the groups claim of responsibility.

description: Everything to do with technology is a window to the outside world, and there is nothing out there that our young people dont know about.

title: Carolyn Luu, Jesse Go
description: Carolyn Luu and Jesse Reynes Go were married Friday at Maritime Parc, an event space in Jersey City. The Rev. John Cuffari, an interfaith minister ordained by the One Spirit Interfaith Seminary, officiated.

title: Torey Van Oot,  Chase Davis
description: Torey Abrams Van Oot and Chase James Davis were married Saturday at the Skinner Barn in Waitsfield, Vt. Scott M. Calvin, a friend of the couple, received permission from Vermont to officiate.

title: B.J. Wiley and Leslie Williams Jr.
description: Benaree Mildred Wiley, the daughter of Benaree Pratt Wiley and Fletcher H. Wiley of Brookline, Mass., was married Saturday evening to Leslie Howard Williams Jr., the son of E. Eretha Williams and Mr. Williams Sr. of Alexandria, Va. Pratt N. Wiley, the brother of the bride, who received permission from Massachusetts to officiate, led the ceremony at their parents summer home in West Tisbury, Mass.

title: Eva Leidman, Bryan Thomas
description: Eva Z. Leidman and Bryan Gordon Beirne Thomas are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Stacy Friedman at the Ralston White Retreat in Mill Valley, Calif.

title: Rhonda Carter and Decker Ngongang
description: Rhonda Marie Carter and Decker Tanke Ngongang are to be married Sunday. The Rev. Bertram G. Johnson, a Presbyterian minister, is to officiate at the Columbia Tower Club in Seattle.

title: Nicole Conkling, Eric Wang
description: Dr. Nicole Conkling, the daughter of Thomas P. Conkling and Donna M. Conkling of Ossining, N.Y., is to be married Sunday to Dr. Eric Daniel Wang, a son of Dr. Neng Eva Wu of Vestal, N.Y., and Dr. Hong Wang of DeWitt, N.Y. The Rev. Brian McSweeney, a Roman Catholic priest, is to perform the ceremony at the Church of St. Augustine in Ossining.

title: Stephanie Simoni, Roger Susanin
description: Stephanie Elizabeth Simoni and Roger John Susanin are to be married Sunday evening at the OceanCliff, a hotel in Newport, R.I. The Rev. Dr. Frederick Harling, a Methodist minister and a great-uncle of the bride, is to officiate.

title: Saumya Dave, Samir Sheth
description: Dr. Saumya Jaimini Dave and Samir Hemant Sheth were married Saturday in Atlanta. Dr. Bhagirath Majmudar, a Hindu priest, officiated at the Ritz-Carlton.

title: Emily Hankin, James Petrila
description: Emily Gordon Hankin, a daughter of Ann D. Hankin and Michael D. Hankin of Butler, Md., was married Saturday to James Joseph Petrila, a son of Judith E. Stein and James P. Petrila of Washington. The Rev. Tracy A. Bruce performed the ceremony at St. Johns Episcopal Church in Glyndon, Md.

title: Lauren Iacocca, Evan Galbraith
description: Lauren Ann Iacocca and Evan Winston Galbraith are to be married Sunday evening at Greens Restaurant in San Francisco. The officiant will be Robin Y. Horton, a friend of the couple who became a minister with American Marriage Ministries for the event.

title: Danny Tolli, Garrett Greer
description: Danny Christopher Tolli and Garrett David Greer are to be married Sunday at Rancho del Cielo, an event space in Malibu, Calif. The officiant will be Amy J. Aniobi, a friend of the couple who was named a deputy commissioner of civil marriages for Los Angeles County for the occasion.

title: Kim Clarkin and Jody Arends
description: Dr. Kim Stephanie Clarkin and Jody Lynn Arends are to be married Sunday at Naninas in the Park, an event space in Belleville, N.J. The poet Elizabeth Alexander, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, is to officiate.

title: Brianne Frazier,  Andrei Greenawalt
description: Brianne Holloran Frazier and Andrei Milenko Kenneth Greenawalt were married Saturday in Cambridge, Md. Judge Raymond J. Dearie of the Federal District Court in Brooklyn, for whom the groom was a law clerk in 2005 and 2006, officiated at the Hyatt Regency Chesapeake Bay, with Eric H. Holder Jr., the former United States attorney general, taking part.

title: Mimi Zheng and Jeffrey Weaver
description: Dr. Mi Zheng and Jeffrey Broadman Weaver were married Saturday at the Dwight Chapel at Yale. Christopher Travis, a minister with the Everyday Christian Church, performed the ceremony.

title: Rosalie Fazio, Elnara Eynullayeva
description: Rosalie Hughes Fazio and Elnara Eynullayeva are to be married Sunday at Squantum Point Park in Quincy, Mass., by Michael J. Barrett, a Massachusetts state senator who received permission from the Commonwealth of Massachusetts to officiate. The couple will take the surname Fazio-Eynullayeva.

title: Jill Hotchkiss, Jonathan Block
description: Jill Amanda Hotchkiss and Dr. Jonathan Sloane Block are to be married Sunday at Summit Rock in Central Park. Rabbi Dr. Andrew Ross Dubin will officiate.

title: Annie Penaco, Scott Duong
description: Dr. Annie Lynn Wong Penaco and Dr. Scott Duong are to be married Sunday by the Rev. Daniel Ulloa, a Roman Catholic priest, at St. John the Baptist Church in Yonkers.

title: Tze-cheng Chun and Geoffrey Lewis
description: Tze-cheng Chun and Geoffrey Patton Lewis are to be married Sunday at Basilica Hudson, an arts and performance space in Hudson, N.Y. The officiant will be the Rev. Rudy Torres, a retired Seventh-day Adventist minister and a friend of the grooms family.

title: Molly Dinnerstein, Norman Birenbaum
description: Molly Ida Dinnerstein and Norman Edward Birenbaum are to be married Sunday at the Park Savoy, an event space in Florham Park, N.J. Cantor Theodore Aronson is to officiate.

title: Daniel Belkin, John Holland
description: Dr. Daniel Aaron Belkin and John Reid Holland were married Saturday. Lauren R. MacLellan, a sister of Mr. Holland who became a Universal Life minister for the ceremony, officiated at Tribeca Rooftop in New York.

title: Emily Cole and Alexander Groden
description: Emily Constance Cole, a daughter of Constance and Thomas Cole of Kenilworth, Ill., is to be married Sunday to Alexander Lee Groden, the son of Randie R. Groden and Dr. Joseph M. Groden of Belmont, Mass.

title: Laura Carey, Michael Carpenter Jr.
description: Laura Griffith Carey, the daughter of Gretchen Frank Carey of Philadelphia and Francis J. Carey III of Ambler, Pa., was married Saturday to Michael Hiram Carpenter Jr., the son of Jo Ann Carpenter and Mr. Carpenter of Gahanna, Ohio. The Rev. Marek P. Zabriskie, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the home of the brides father.

title: Jennifer Berno, Michael DeCleene
description: Jennifer Rynd Berno and Michael Joseph DeCleene were married Saturday at the Co-Cathedral of the Sacred Heart in Houston. The Very Rev. Lawrence W. Jozwiak, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Katherine Cowing, Jon Hurdle
description: Katherine Elizabeth Cowing and Jon Hurdle were married Saturday at the Corinthian Yacht Club of Philadelphia in Essington, Pa. They were joined under Pennsylvanias self-uniting marriage statute. Michael P. Shea, a cousin of the bride and a United States district judge for the District of Connecticut, took part in the ceremony.

title: They Both Liked What They Saw
description: Cheryl Yvette Dawson and Madifing Kaba are to be married Sunday evening at the Alger House, an event space in Manhattan. The Rev. Jill Flowers, who was ordained by the One Spirit Interfaith Seminary, is to officiate.

title: Theyll Take Romance for $100, Alex
description: Dr. Suchita Rajendra Shah, a daughter of Manda R. Shah and Rajendra N. Shah of Old Bridge, N.J., is to be married Sunday morning to Dr. Siddharth Devendra Sata, the son of Nayana D. Sata and Devendra C. Sata of Glen Oaks, N.Y. Pandit Nayan Pathak, a Hindu priest, is to lead the ceremony at Chutney Manor, a banquet hall in Monmouth Junction, N.J.

title: Kathleen Jones, Patrick Sheehan
description: Kathleen Walker Jones, a daughter of Barbara Cannon Jones and Robert C. Jones of Summit, N.J., was married there Saturday to Patrick Timothy Sheehan, a son of Aida A. Sheehan and John M. Sheehan of Temperance, Mich. The Rev. Brian G. Plate performed the ceremony at St. Teresa of Avila Roman Catholic Church.

title: Antonia Henry, Martin Diaz III
description: Dr. Antonia Jocelyn Henry and Martin Diaz III were married Saturday in Cambridge, Mass. The Rev. Leslie K. Sterling officiated at St. Bartholomews Episcopal Church, where she is the rector.

title: Marlee Berman, Thomas Dillon
description: Marlee Kind Berman and Thomas Edward Dillon were married Saturday evening at HollyHedge Estate, an inn in New Hope, Pa. Brian Dillon, a cousin of the groom who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Laura Lane, Nicholas Radkowsky
description: Laura Rose Lane and Nicholas Edward Radkowsky were married Saturday evening at the Brooklyn Museum. The officiant was Stephen Soroka, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event.

title: Stephen Curry, With a Little Help, Tramples the Rockets
description: HOUSTON  The Golden State Warriors were planning to practice once they arrived here Friday afternoon, but their scheduled flight out of California was delayed because the airplane needed a new part. The delay stretched from minor (two hours) to major (six hours) after the people in charge concluded that the team needed a different plane entirely.

title: Hundreds Along River in Nepal Are Forced to Evacuate After Landslide
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  Hundreds of residents living along a mountain river in the Myagdi District in western Nepal have been forced to seek higher ground after a massive landslide near the village of Kafaldanda blocked the Kali Gandaki River and created a huge natural dam that could burst.

title: Corrections: May 24, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Peace Activists Cross Demilitarized Zone Separating Koreas
description: PAJU, South Korea  A group of 30 female peace activists, including the feminist leader Gloria Steinem and two Nobel Peace Prize laureates, crossed the demilitarized zone from North Korea to South Korea on Sunday, calling for an end to the Korean War, whose unresolved hostility has been symbolized by the heavily armed border for six decades.

title: Three American Ballet Theater Dancers Plan Their Last Steps
description: This season, three principal dancers will bid American Ballet Theater farewell: Paloma Herrera and Xiomara Reyes dance their final performances, both in Giselle on Wednesday (Ms. Herrera in the afternoon and Ms. Reyes in the evening), while Julie Kent follows suit in Romeo and Juliet on June 20. Each recognizes that its time. But that doesnt make it easy. As Ms. Reyes pointed out, Its a heartbreak, dont get me wrong.

title: 1915: Germany at War With Italy
description: LONDON  Following on Italys declaration of war on Austria-Hungary, says an Amsterdam despatch, Germany declared war this morning [May 24] on Italy. A Berlin official telegram says: The Italian Government yesterday caused to be declared through Duca dAvarna, Italian Ambassador to the Austro-Hungarian Government, that Italy considered herself from midnight in a state of war with Austria-Hungary. The Italian Government by this provocative attack on the Dual Monarchy has also broken without right or reason the alliance with Germany. The loyal relation existing according to treaty between Austria-Hungary and the German Empire which has been still more firmly welded by comradeship in arms has remained uninjured by the defection of the third ally and her desertion to the enemies camp. The German Ambassador, Prince Blow, has therefore received instructions to leave Rome conjointly with the Austro-Hungarian Ambassador, Baron Macchio. Prince Blow left Rome this evening at 9.45. The Prussian Minister to the Vatican and the Bavarian Ministers to the Quirinal and the Vatican left by the same train.  The New York Herald, European Edition, May 25, 1915

title: Thanks to a 4-Year-Old, a Laugh Stronger Than Death
description: My 4-year-old son came careening down the nursing home hallway in my grandmas wheeled walker, and I surrendered all semblance of control.

title: Shrine to a Honky-Tonk Hero
description: Like George Joness music, his museum in Nashville is a trove of raw feeling, tragedy, humor, hokiness and eccentricity.

title: 1965: Forces of OAS Take Over Job In S. Domingo
description: SANTO DOMINGO  An inter-American peace-keeping force, comprised primarily of U.S. troops, today [May 24] took over the job of ending the Dominican crisis. A Brazilian general, Hugo Panasco Alvim, was named to command the Organization of American States forces, the first such in hemispheric history. The U.S. ground commander, Lt. Gen. Bruce Palmer jr., was named deputy commander. Jose A. Mora, secretary-general of the OAS, last night signed documents officially putting the unit into operation as junta and rebel troops continued to observe an informal cease-fire.

title: A Lot of Heroes Around Here
description: Darrell Stafford, a 32-year veteran of Arlington National Cemetery, reflects on his job as interment supervisor, in which he oversees proper burials of both coffins and cremated remains.

title: Before a Soldiers Rest, a Panoply of Details
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  Darrell Stafford inspected a freshly dug grave at Arlington National Cemetery recently and nodded. The burial plot, 5 feet by 10 feet, was ready for the coming ceremony. It was just one of 28 funerals that he would help oversee that day.

title: John F. Nash Jr., Math Genius Defined by a Beautiful Mind, Dies at 86
description: John F. Nash Jr., a mathematician who shared a Nobel in 1994 for work that greatly extended the reach and power of modern economic theory and whose long descent into severe mental illness and eventual recovery were the subject of a book and a film, both titled A Beautiful Mind, was killed, along with his wife, in a car crash on Saturday in New Jersey. He was 86.

title: Long Hours at Work Leave Her Little Time for Brother in Need
description: Every workday morning, DeBorah Palmer pulls on her navy blazer and starts her rounds. She is a security guard who patrols the galleries of a Manhattan museum and assists the visitors streaming through its doors.

title: A Flattering Biographical Video as the Last Exhibit for the Defense
