Obviously, a defense based on that is merely to invite future attack.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, May 28, 1940

title: Coming to a Comic Book Store Near You: Hillary Clinton
description: Campaign fever is hitting the comic book stands. The Timess ArtsBeat culture blog reports that Bluewater Productions is set to release Hillary Clinton: The Road to the White House, written by Michael L. Frizell and illustrated by Joe Paradise.

title: Members of Original Into the Woods Cast to Reunite
description: Twenty-eight years after they gathered to perform an innovative fairy tale mash-up musical, key members of the original cast and creative team behind one of Stephen Sondheims most beloved musicals will reunite to discuss what happened in the woods and their own ever afters.

title: Theft of Copper Cables Disrupts Service on A and C Subway Lines
description: New York Citys subway system, with hundreds of miles of electrified rail, is a tantalizing, if treacherous, target for copper thieves. But even so, the theft that came to light on Wednesday in Queens was brazen.

title: DJI and Accel Partners Form Drone Investment Fund
description: Accel Partners, the venture capital firm, and DJI, the Chinese drone maker, have formed a small investment fund to support more drone and advanced robotics start-ups.

title: Creating The Timess Apple Watch App
description: Andrew Phelps, a product manager, and Eric Bishop, a mobile editor, talked with Insider about The Timess Apple Watch news app.

title: What Rick Santorum Would Need to Do to Win
description: Mr. Santorum, a two-term former senator from Pennsylvania, enters the 2016 presidential race on Wednesday, pursuing the Republican Party nomination.

title: Rick Santorum Announces New Presidential Bid, and New Focus on Middle Class
description: CABOT, Pa.  Rick Santorum, the runner-up in the Republican nomination race four years ago, announced his second presidential bid on Wednesday, pledging to restore a middle class hollowed out by government policies.

title: Rick Santorum on the Issues
description: Rick Santorum, the former senator from Pennsylvania who won the Iowa caucuses and several other Republican nominating contests in 2012, said Wednesday that he would join the race for the Republican presidential nomination. A conservative Catholic, he is known for his strong opposition to same-sex marriage and for favoring a crackdown on illegal immigration. He has also delivered pointed warnings about the threat of Islamic extremism. GERRY MULLANY

title: Yemeni-Americans, Thrust Into Limbo, Say U.S. Embassy Unfairly Revokes Passports
description: For nearly five hours on Jan. 21, 2013, in a windowless room at the United States Embassy in Sana, Yemen, an American citizen and Brooklyn grocery store owner held his crying infant daughter while insisting he was exactly who he said he was.

title: U.S. Urges European Leaders to Solve Greek Crisis Quickly
description: DRESDEN, Germany  The United States Treasury secretary urged European leaders on Wednesday to find a solution quickly to the crisis in Greece, stressing that the countrys deteriorating financial condition poses a threat to the global economy.

title: Obama Announces New Rule Limiting Water Pollution
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday announced a sweeping new clean water regulation meant to restore the federal governments authority to limit pollution in the nations rivers, lakes, streams and wetlands.

title: The Rise and Fall of Sepp Blatter
description: Scandal and accusations have dotted the FIFA reign of Sepp Blatter.

title: Hundreds Form Search Parties to Seek Survivors in Texas Floods
description: WIMBERLEY, Tex.  They descended on this tiny town in the hundreds on Wednesday, volunteers who spread out on foot, in off-road vehicles and fanboats and even aboard private helicopters to search the wreckage and muck along normally idyllic rivers for seven people still missing three days after floodwaters ravaged the area.

title: If Theres a Top 10 List, Chris Christie Says Hes on It
description: Gov. Chris Christies presidential hopes have lost some luster in the last year, but when it comes to limiting candidates onstage at debates the potential White House hopeful still considers himself first tier.

title: Simona Halep Falls as Other Top Players Cruise at French Open
description: PARIS  Simona Haleps loss at the French Open on Wednesday was a delayed aftershock.

title: Anxious Students Strain College Mental Health Centers
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  One morning recently, a dozen college students stepped out of the bright sunshine into a dimly lit room at the counseling center here at the University of Central Florida. They appeared to have little in common: undergraduates in flip-flops and nose rings, graduate students in interview-ready attire.

title: Watch Report
description: The offhand appeal of timepieces with interchangeable nylon straps.

title: App Smart | Science Lessons
description: Three apps that use videos and interactive features to help explain the principles of physics, chemistry and other scientific disciplines.

title: Video Feature: Apps That Bring Science to Life
description: PHYSICS, chemistry, biology and lots of other sciences are behind almost every part of our technology-driven lives. But learning about those topics is often not easy, which is where tech steps in to help illuminate some of sciences fascinating secrets.

title: Officials React to FIFA Arrests
description: The manager of the British soccer club Arsenal and other officials discussed the arrest of several high-ranking FIFA officials and what it means for Russias and Qatars World Cup bids.

title: 36 Hours in Chapel Hill
description: Collegiate Chapel Hill and free-spirited Carrboro offer a perfect combination of fine dining, fun bars and local music.

title: 36 Hours in Chapel Hill-Carrboro
description: Explore street view, find things to do in Chapel Hill-Carrboro.

title: 36 Hours in Chapel Hill-Carrboro, N.C.
description: Outsiders tend to lump Chapel Hill with nearby Durham, but the more sensible pairing is with Carrboro, the adjacent town that was once a mere offshoot known as West End. Even today the transition from Chapel Hill, anchored by North Carolinas flagship public university, into downtown Carrboro is virtually seamless. And although the charming college town is more buttoned-up than its free-spirited neighbor, both towns share a love of live music, a range of new drinking spots, and sophisticated dining options that belie the areas youthful atmosphere. Together, this intertwined pair is growing up right.

title: As Jason Rezaian Stands Trial in Iran, Former Prisoners Share Their Experiences
description: Few facts are known about the espionage case against Jason Rezaian, the Washington Post correspondent in Iran who went on trial Tuesday in a closed Tehran courtroom, in front of a Revolutionary Court judge known for harsh sentences.

title: Groups Seek Inquiry Into Charade of Jeb Bushs Undeclared Candidacy
description: WASHINGTON  Two leading campaign finance watchdog groups called on the Justice Department Wednesday to appoint a special outside counsel to investigate what they called the charade of Jeb Bushs non-candidacy for president.

title: Other Foreigners Detained in Iran
description: In the past seven years, other journalists and American travelers have been arrested in Iran for spying. All have denied the accusations.

title: Decline and Schism in Religion
description: I dont think Ive linked to it in this space yet, but regular readers have probably already seen my long piece in the May issue of the Atlantic on Pope Franciss biography and agenda and what his pontificate might mean for the future of Catholicism. The essay was written a little while before its actual appearance, as long-form magazine pieces tend to be, and there have been all sorts of recent developments around the churchand the pontiff that deserve to be discussed afresh. Im hoping to wade more fully into those issues next month, but first, before itslips too far into the past, I want to talk about the s word, schism which featuresin my Atlantic essay, though perhaps not quite so prominently as the title suggests  in the context of the Pew religious data that made waves two weeks ago.

title: Hiding Smartphone Photo Location Information
Tony Blair to Resign in June as Special Middle East Envoy
description: LONDON  Tony Blair, former prime minister of Britain, will resign as special Middle East envoy at the end of June, he informed the United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, in a letter, diplomats said Wednesday.

title: Why Lehman Brothers Lives On
description: The repercussions of Lehman Brothers bankruptcy can still be felt. It has been almost seven years since the firms failure started a global financial crisis and deep recession in most developed countries. Yet the real damage is only now becoming clear.

title: 1965: Bolivia Rocked by Terrorism
description: LA PAZ  Terrorists sniped at police and dynamited power stations here today [May 27] in renewed violence following changes in Bolivias military junta. Official sources attributed the violence to a terrorist plan to intimidate the people after the junta decided yesterday that Gen. Ren Barrientos Ortuna must share his presidency with Gen. Alfredo Ovando Candia, commander-in-chief of the armed forces. There were reports of dead and wounded but the casualties could not be confirmed immediately.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, May 28, 1965

title: Lindsey Graham Reiterates Support for Israel, Our Best Friend
description: JERUSALEM  Senator Lindsey Graham vowed on Wednesday to lead violent pushback against the United Nations if it tries to take over the peace process between Israel and the Palestinians, and against any nation that pushes to prosecute Israeli soldiers for war crimes through the International Criminal Court.

title: A Hemisphere of Soccer Corruption
description: More than 40 defendants have been charged by the United States Justice Department in the continuing corruption case focused on international soccer. In all, the charges encompass 24 nationalities, most in North, Central and South America.

title: Review: Mulder Meets Manson in NBCs Compelling Aquarius
description: Sixties music is a vital part of Aquarius, an NBC series set in 1967 Los Angeles, but one of the classic songs not on the soundtrack is For What Its Worth. That Buffalo Springfield hit is best known by the line Stop, children, whats that sound and is woven into almost every retrospective look at the counterculture.

title: In a Five-Star Setting, FIFA Officials Are Arrested, the Swiss Way
description: ZURICH  The lobby of the Baur au Lac, a 171-year-old five-star hotel here in downtown Zurich, was serene in the early hours of Wednesday morning.

title: France Rejects Iran Leaders Ban on Unlimited Nuclear Inspections
description: France challenged Irans supreme leader on Wednesday over a disputed element of the Iranian nuclear talks, asserting that it would not sign any pact unless Iran allowed all its nuclear installations, including military sites, to be inspected.

title: Keeping Your Classic Tech Devices Running
description: WHAT if planned obsolescence does not fit into your personal plans? Because of pragmatism, frugality, nostalgia or all of the above, some people just do not  or cannot  upgrade the latest version of a device or program, even when the manufacturer stops supporting its old products to focus on developing sleek new hardware and state-of-the-art software to sell.

title: Indians Urged to Stay Indoors as Sweltering Heat Kills More Than 1,300
description: NEW DELHI  Large swaths of India were baking again on Wednesday under intense heat that has killed more than 1,300 people and left the government scrambling to warn an often unheeding population about the dangers of stepping outside in the blazing midday sun.

title: Excerpt: Aquarius
description: David Duchovny is a Los Angeles detective in this period crime drama on NBC.

title: A Robot That Can Perform Brain Surgery on a Fruit Fly
description: STANFORD, Calif.  On a small darkened platform a handful of fruit flies wander aimlessly. There is a brief flash of light and a robotic arm darts downward, precisely targeting a flys thorax, a moving target roughly the size of a pinhead.

title: Muslim Women on the Veil
description: To some, a Muslim head scarf represents patriarchal oppression in a backward society. To others, it symbolizes modesty, identity and respect for a higher being.

title: Vatican Official Denounces Irelands Vote for Same-Sex Marriage
description: ROME  In the Vaticans eyes, the referendum in Ireland that legalized same-sex marriage last week was a defeat for humanity, a top Vatican official said in remarks published late on Tuesday.

title: Carly Fiorina, in an Ambush of Hillary Clinton, Gets Defensive
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Carly Fiorina spends a lot of her time as a Republican presidential candidate attacking Hillary Rodham Clinton, the leading Democratic candidate, and has earned considerable news coverage for it. On Wednesday, with Mrs. Clinton set to give a speech at a South Carolina hotel, Ms. Fiorina arranged a news conference outside  for little reason, it seemed, other than to taunt her.

title: Ask Grover: How to Get Children to Eat Vegetables
description: This week, Sesame Streets Grover is taking over Ask Well to answer questions about the new cookbook Sesame Street Lets Cook! and how to encourage healthful eating for children. You can read his answers below and watch the video, and learn more from Susan McQuillan, a family nutritionist and the author of Sesame Street Lets Cook!

title: Yahoos Tax-Free Spinoff Plan Parallels a Historic Case
description: Perhaps the most quoted dictum from any tax case comes from Judge Learned Hand of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit in the 1934 case of Evelyn Gregory against Guy T. Helvering (then the commissioner of the I.R.S.):

title: Azealia Banks to Star in RZA-Directed Musical Film
description: Azealia Banks is well known for her theatrics on Twitter and in concerts. Now shell get to prove her chops on the big screen: shell make her major acting debut in the coming musical drama It Doesnt Have to Rhyme, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

title: Ancient Skull Suggests an Early Murder
description: Lethal wounds on an ancient human skull may point to one of the oldest cases of murder on record, a new study reports.

title: The Silliest Things Republican Contenders Are Saying This Week
description: It may be early to say this as the 2016 presidential marathon grinds through the first of two long years, but the Republican contenders  including the ones who are faking indecision to rake in dark money  seem determined to set a new record for saying imbecilic things. (Before someone makes the what about Democrats point, let me say that Mrs. Clinton says a lot of things, good, bad and indifferent, but rarely are they idiotic.)

title: Officials Discuss FIFA Investigation
description: Loretta E. Lynch, the attorney general, along with the I.R.S. Criminal Investigation unit and the F.B.I., announced on Wednesday the charges and arrests of FIFA officials as part of fraud inquiries.

title: Bernie Sanders Suggests More Time Off for Workers
description: As Senator Bernie Sanders kicked off his presidential campaign in Vermont on Tuesday afternoon, he told Americans something everyone wants to hear as the summer heat sets in: take more time off.

title: A Tour of Sardinia, Full of Discoveries
description: At one end of the church plaza, men stirred a caldron of oil so big it could have staved off invaders at a medieval castle.

title: Ruling Party in Ethiopia Appears Headed for Sweeping Victory
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia  Ethiopias ruling coalition appears headed for a sweeping victory following Sundays national elections, according to provisional results announced Wednesday.

title: Bernie Sanders Attacks Hillary Clinton Directly on Trade Deal
description: CONCORD, N.H.  It took a New Hampshire farmer to show that Senator Bernie Sanders could land a political punch squarely on Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: Jawbone Accuses Fitbit of StealingInformation by Hiring Workers Away
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Close to what should be one of the biggest events of Fitbits life  its initial public offering of stock  the maker of wearable health trackers is facing an unexpected challenge: a lawsuit from one of its biggest competitors.

title: James Holmess Notebook Used in the Aurora Shooting Trial
description: Prosecutors hope the journal will show jurors how Mr. Holmes plotted to kill; defense lawyers hope it reveals the depth of his mental illness.

title: On Immigration, Its Texas 2, Obama 0
description: Score another one for immigration paralysis. President Obamas policies seeking to protect millions of unauthorized immigrants from deportation suffered another setback on Tuesday.

title: Russia Says FIFA Corruption Investigation Is No Threat to 2018 World Cup
description: MOSCOW  Russian officials said Wednesday that the arrests of top FIFA officials in Zurich and the promise of new investigations into corrupt practices at soccers international governing body would not derail Russia from hosting the World Cup in 2018.

title: Avago in Talks to Acquire Broadcom
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The chip maker Avago Technologies is in advanced talks to buy Broadcom, a rival whose semiconductors are used in the iPhone and other popular devices, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.

title: Podcast | Inside The Timess Apple Watch News App
description: When Apple offered its latest product, the Apple Watch, The Times was ready with a news app designed to catch readers up on the latest news stories with just a glance at their wrists.

title: Dashiell Hammett Papers Go to University of South Carolina
description: The University of South Carolina has acquired two archives of material relating to Dashiell Hammett, bolstering a crime fiction collection that also includes James Ellroys manuscripts and Elmore Leonards Hawaiian shirts.

title: H.I.V. Treatment Should Start at Diagnosis, U.S. Health Officials Say
description: People with H.I.V. should be put on antiretroviral drugs as soon as they learn they are infected, federal health officials said Wednesday as they announced that they were halting the largest ever clinical trial of early treatment because its benefits were already so clear.

title: A Scientist who Modeled Texass Blanco River in 2007 Probes for Lessons After the Deadly Flash Flood
description: The Austin Disaster Relief Network has established a Memorial Day Weekend Flood Fund.

title: Classical Playlist: Haydn, Grieg and Morton Feldman
description: HAYDN: The Creation Arlen Auger, Philip Langridge, David Thomas, soloists; Simon Rattle, conductor; City of Birmingham Symphony Orchestra and Chorus(EMI)Researching an article on Bostons Handel and Haydn Society led me to several recordings of Haydns sparkling, joyous masterpiece. Even hearing accounts by Karajan, Davis, Dorati and Jacobs  each a pearl in its own way  I kept returning to Simon Rattles vigorous issue from 1991. Period-inflected but not period-beholden, and with superb singing, its a reminder that although Rattle is unreliable in much of the Mozart-Beethoven-Brahms lineage, his Haydn is beyond reproach. (David Allen)

title: Christopher Bollens North Fork Inspirations
description: Christopher Bollens Orient, a richly drawn thriller set on Long Islands North Fork, is one of the summers most buzzed-about reads. Here, Bollen, who is also the longtime editor at large of Interview magazine, shares some of the local haunts that influenced the book.

title: FIFA Arrests Come at a Time of Continued Swiss Cooperation
description: LONDON  The arrests of top soccer officials Wednesday on accusations of engaging in racketeering and fraud while working for the sports governing body may seem surprising in Switzerland, a country with a vaunted culture of secrecy. But analysts say the long arm of American justice had already been shaking up the country.

title: Russian Political Activist Is Hospitalized With Mysterious Illness
description: MOSCOW  A prominent Russian political opposition activist, whose civic group this week released a film critical of an ally of President Vladimir V. Putin, has been hospitalized in Moscow after collapsing and losing consciousness on Tuesday from a mysterious illness.

title: Fiat Boss Too Cautious on Case for Industry Consolidation
description: Sergio Marchionne is fighting for automobile industry mergers with one hand tied behind his back.

title: Jawbone Sues Fitbit
description: Jawbone accused its rival of systematically plundering confidential information by poaching employees who improperly downloaded sensitive materials shortly before leaving.

title: A Wartime Bomb, Unearthed in Germany, Recalls Darker Days
description: BERLIN  Traffic on the Rhine halted, trams and cars could not cross a main highway bridge, and about 20,000 Cologne residents on either side of the river were forced to leave their homes and gather, for safetys sake, in the gyms of schools closed for the day.

title: Immigration Overhaul May Be in Limbo Until Late in Obamas Term
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas overhaul of the nations immigration system, which he announced in a prime-time speech to the nation last November, may remain under a cloud of legal uncertainty until months before he leaves office in 2017, legal experts and administration officials said Wednesday.

title: Alex Rodriguez, With Three Important R.B.I., Passes Two Big Names
description: If Derek Jeter had passed Babe Ruth and Lou Gehrig in an important baseball category, one can only imagine the pomp and pageantry that would have accompanied the feat.

title: Emergency Official on Texas Flooding
description: Kenneth Bell, the emergency management coordinator for San Marcos, Tex., spoke about the continuing search and rescue operation for 11 people missing after extreme flooding.

title: Review: 3AM on Showtime Peeps In on a World After Hours
description: Showtime and HBO have come a long way from their early flesh-peddling days, when a healthy share of their audiences (and images) depended on late-night fare like Red Shoe Diaries and Real Sex. Now that theyre not only respectable but also pre-eminent, they can go ahead and put the jiggle in prime time (Masters of Sex, Game of Thrones)  having their cake and winning Emmys for it, too.

title: Museum of Contemporary African Diasporan Arts to Move to Larger New Space in Brooklyn
description: The Museum of Contemporary African Diasporan Arts, known as MoCADA, is moving from one part of the Brooklyn cultural district to another.

title: Reviews: New Books From Anne Roiphe, Nickolas Butler and More
description: ACADEMY STREET

title: A Jewelry and Home Wares Designer With a Penchant for White Porcelain
description: ARC Objects, a year-old collection of jewelry and household wares in organic silhouettes, was born out of the designer Daniela Jacobss senior thesis at Parsons  and many of its pieces, fashioned using small-scale production techniques, were originally intended to be one-offs for Jacobs herself. Asan Integrated Design major, Jacobss curriculum encouraged alternative approaches to fashion rather than following normative industry practices. For one required class, students had to make an ensemble every week and come to class wearing it. Throughout the course, Jacobs became interested in considering an outfit as an overall composition  that is, how all the elements go together  rather than clothing design specifically, she explains. Jewelry as an ingredient in this mix emerged as something I wanted to explore.

title: Noah Syndergaard Helps Mets Sweep Phillies With Bat and Arm
description: Noah Syndergaards 3-for-3 performance at the plate on Wednesday came just 11 days after another young Mets pitcher, Jacob deGrom, also had three hits in three at-bats. If only the Mets as a team could hit with that kind of consistency.

title: Five Steps to Secure Your Data After I.R.S. Breach
description: The Internal Revenue Service has been added to a long list of companies and government agencies that hackers have breached in the last year.

title: Goodbye F.A.O. Schwarz: Toy Lovers Prepare for Stores Closing
description: Melissa Quiones remembers the promises her parents made before they immigrated to New York from Colombia in the early 1990s: You get to go to McDonalds and the biggest toy store there is, Ms. Quiones, now 32, recalled.

title: Review: In Disclaimer, by Rene Knight, Secrets Wind Up in Print
description: What self-respecting genre writer can begin a book with a murder anymore? Or with the discovery of a corpse? These standard openers have been done to death, so to speak, to the point where youd be crazy to read a mystery or thriller that uses one. A new, improved opening gambit is an absolute must for any author who wants your attention.

title: Luis Estvez, a CFDA Loss
description: At some point on Monday, the generally fizzy Council of Fashion Designers of America award ceremony will be stilled by the roll call of in memoriam, this year including John Fairchild, Eileen Ford and Oscar de la Renta.

title: Review: ASAP Rocky Returns to a Haze in At.Long.Last.ASAP
description: The one true love song on the new ASAP Rocky album, At.Long.Last.ASAP, is called LSD. A wobbly, slightly morbid affair, LSD is about the drug and the love you make  or cant make  on it. I look for ways to say, I love you,/But I aint into making love songs/Baby, Im just rapping to this LSD, Rocky sing-raps languidly, finding feelings inside the high but losing grip of them just as easily.

title: A Dinner With Ted Cruz Shines an Unwelcome Spotlight on Two Gay Businessmen
description: Maybe the clearest indication that Ian Reisner and Mati Weiderpass were having a public relations meltdown was how quickly the articles about them stopped mentioning the 23-year-old man who died of a drug overdose after being found in a bathtub at their Central Park South home.

title: Twenty One Pilots Tops Chart With Blurryface
description: This week on the music charts Twenty One Pilots, a duo from Columbus, Ohio, that throws some reggae and hip-hop in with its pop-rock, earns its first No. 1 album.

title: Pictures of the Day: Greece, India and Elsewhere
description: Gaza, Syria and Elsewhere  Pictures of the Day

title: Video Review: The BMW 428i, a Coupe Not Done by the Numbers
Driven | 2015 BMW 428i Gran Coupe
description: A four-door coupe with two-door style gives loyal 3 Series owners a reason to consider moving up a number.

title: Ryan Roche Is Crafting on Her Own Terms
description: On a return trip from Nepal, where she had gone last month to oversee production of her knitwear line, Ryan Roche found herself marooned. With the airport shut down and no flights until dawn, the designer, who was traveling with her husband and three children, got ready to settle in for the night.

title: Nebraska Bans Death Penalty, Defying a Veto
description: LINCOLN, Neb.  Nebraska on Wednesday became the first conservative state in more than 40 years to abolish the death penalty, with lawmakers defying their Republican governor, Pete Ricketts, a staunch supporter of capital punishment who had lobbied vigorously against banning it.

title: Rangers Thoughts Drift to a Friendly Place: A Game 7 at Home
description: TAMPA, Fla.  There were still about 10 minutes left in Game 6 of the N.H.L.s Eastern Conference finals on Tuesday night, and Henrik Lundqvist could feel his concentration slipping far from his net at Amalie Arena.

title: Joshua Ozersky Drowned After a Seizure, Autopsy Shows
description: Joshua Ozersky, the food writer who died suddenly on May 4, drowned in the shower in his room at the Conrad Chicago hotel, according to final autopsy results from the Cook County, Ill., medical examiner.

title: May 27, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Greece, Syria, Kosovo and England.

title: For Mass Appeal, Try Appealing to the Masses
description: Anyone who did the Bus Stop under the palms at Le Jardin, the Times Square disco, will have no trouble recalling how Stephen Burrows bolted to fame in the early 1970s in a joyous, rainbow carnival of appliqus, nailheads and rippling lettuce hems under the nourishing aegis of Geraldine Stutz at Henri Bendel.

title: Chuck Blazer, a Soccer Bon Vivant Laid Low
description: In his room at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell hospital, Chuck Blazer held his smartphone and checked his email on Wednesday morning. He was far from the soccer bon vivant who once had an enormous appetite for expensive meals, luxury travel, extravagant living and, according to the federal authorities, corrupt self-enrichment.

title: In South Carolina, Hillary Clinton Calls for a Civil Campaign
description: COLUMBIA , S.C.  Hillary Rodham Clintons second attempt at the White House is focused squarely on the future. But in a speech here on Wednesday, she addressed an unhappy memory from her last campaign in South Carolina, when her battle with Barack Obama grew intense and ugly.

title: Led by Ava DuVernay, Black Filmmakers Take to Twitter for Day of Insight and Advice
description: Long before Selma came along, its director, Ava DuVernay, was working to help distribute films with black themes through the African-American Film Festival Releasing Movement. As she said in 2011, explaining why independent black artists needed the organization, No one is ever going to care about their film except the people its made for, which is, black folks.

title: Miranda Hart Stars With Melissa McCarthy in Spy
description: The British actress and comedian Miranda Hart stands 6-foot-1, which is a good sight taller than Melissa McCarthy, her co-star in the coming comedy Spy. Ive just seen Melissa for the first time in a year, and Id forgotten the height difference, Ms. Hart said. I was like, Im giving you a hug, and she was like, Im in your bosom.

title: Sorry, Batman: Dick Grayson Outgrows the Robin Costume
description: The boy who was once Batmans sidekick is now a man.

title: How Clash of Clans Is Taking Bullying to the Virtual Playground
description: I visited my 10-year-old nephew, Luca, earlier this month, and he spent the entire weekend checking his mothers iPhone. But, sadly, he wasnt having fun.

title: A Look Inside Vito Schnabels Bowery Bank Show
description: For decades, a hulking former bank building at 190 Bowery has been a canvas and de facto gallery for graffiti artists and fans, one of the last places in SoHo where street art was allowed to flourish. Now the building is a showcase for a far more rarefied art installation, offering select visitors a tantalizing glimpse inside for just two weeks.

title: Review: In With You, Armenia, Kissin and Others Honor the Slaughtered
description: This month Carnegie Hall had to set up five rows of stage seats to meet the demand for the Russian pianist Evgeny Kissins much-anticipated solo recital. So it was unusual to see empty seats in the hall for his appearance on Tuesday night. But this was an unusual and intensely meaningful occasion.

title: Review: Hot Girls Wanted, About the Choices Actresses in Pornography Make
description: Hot Girls Wanted is a documentary with a provocative subject and title but an uncertain tone that vacillates between weary outrage and motherly concern. Hanging out with young women  from 18 to their early 20s  who have chosen to work in pornography, the directors Jill Bauer and Ronna Gradus and the writer Brittany Huckabee face a challenge: respecting the right of their subjects to make the choices they do while abhorring those decisions.

title: Review: Wendy Whelans Restless Creature Is Full of Jagged Rhythms
description: Wendy Whelan, one of the most extraordinary ballerinas of her generation, doesnt want to be a ballerina anymore. In the long-awaited New York premiere of Restless Creature, postponed from last year because of hip surgery, Ms. Whelan does more than experiment with another form: She commits to contemporary dance. At this stage in her post-New York City Ballet career, it feels more like an arranged marriage, but if this showcase proves anything, it is that Ms. Whelan, 48, shouldnt stop dancing anytime soon.

title: Sunnis Fleeing ISIS Find Few Doors Open Elsewhere in Iraq
description: AMIRIYAT FALLUJA, Iraq  On one side of a rickety bridge that spans a narrow stretch of the Euphrates River were panicked families on the run from Islamic State forces, hoping to escape Anbar Province and reach safety in Baghdad. On the other side were Iraqi Army officers and Shiite militiamen, under orders to keep the bridge closed because of fears that militants could slip in among the displaced civilians.

title: Young Women Say No to Thongs
description: A young generation of women is discovering a new brand of sexy in the most unlikely of places: their grandmothers underwear drawers.

title: The 2015 Scripps National Spelling Bee
description: A look at the words they tackled. How would you do?

title: Teenage Motherhood in Latin America
description: For his project on teenage pregnancy in Latin America, Christian Rodriguez looked at his own upbringing as the son of a single, teenage mother.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Byredo Brings Its Scent Memories to SoHo
description: Ben Gorham was looking for his coasters.

title: Q. and A.: Liao Ran on the Trial of Zhou Yongkang and Chinas New Gang of Four
description: Later this year, Zhou Yongkang, Chinas former security chief, is expected to appear in court in the countrys most significant political trial since that of the Maoist Gang of Four in 1981. This time the action revolves around a new Gang of Four, says Liao Ran, an anticorruption advocate who has followed Mr. Zhous career closely.

title: The Human Family Tree Bristles With New Branches
description: For scientists who study human evolution, the last few months have been a whirlwind. Every couple of weeks, it seems, another team pulls back the curtain on newly discovered bones or stone tools, prompting researchers to rethink what we know about early human history.

title: How to Get Your Arms Ready for Summer
description: Unless youre Diane Keaton, baring your arms is practically required in fair weather. Loose linen trousers may hide knobby knees elegantly, but a long-sleeve top can suggest a stick-in-the-mud, especially in the Michelle Obama era.

title: FIFA Indictments
description: The indictments against soccer officials and sports marketing executives announced on Wednesday.

title: Alex Edelman Makes Religion a Laughing Matter
description: AGE 26

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: A Nod to Everyday Glamour With a Touch of Whimsy
description: How to get a ladylike look without appearing to take fashion too seriously.

title: Umberto Pasti, in Nature
description: For gardeners, paradise doesnt exist elsewhere; it is here.

title: You Can Now Buy a $90,000 Richard Prince Instagram Work or a $90 Copy
description: Whos appropriating whom?

title: FIFAs Corruption Stains World Soccer
description: FIFA, soccers global governing body, has always hoped to get America more involved in their sport. Well, theyve succeeded. In a sudden and stunning move, the Justice Department charged 14 soccer officials and sports-marketing executives with rampant, systemic and deep-rooted corruption.

title: An Online Luxury Consignment House
description: PARIS  It was the purses silver clasp and the Tic Tac size metal plate bolted into the lining that most captivated Victoire Boyer Chammard on a chilly Wednesday afternoon.

title: Chinas High Hopes for Growing Those Rubber Tree Plants
description: JINGHONG, China  In the farming village of Tuanjie, in the hills above Jinghong, in southwest Yunnan Province, nearly every family lives in a two- or three-story concrete house, testament to a prosperity built during the boom years for natural rubber production.

title: U2s Tour Manager Dies in Los Angeles
description: Dennis Sheehan, U2s tour manager for more than three decades, was found dead early Wednesday while on the road with the band.

title: Entenda as acusaes contra os dirigentes da FIFA
description: O FBI e a polcia sua prenderam dirigentes e empresrios ligados  FIFA sob acusao de corrupo. O esquema se estendeu por mais de duas dcadas. Veja a seguir o papel dos acusados dentro da FIFA e detalhes da investigao.

title: El papel de los acusados en la FIFA
description: Estos son los altos funcionarios del ftbol y ejecutivos de empresas deportivas cuyos nombres aparecen en la investigacin a la FIFA, as como algunas de las maniobras que se detallan en la acusacin formal del Departamento de Justicia que sostiene que la corrupcin ha sido generalizada durante las ltimas dos dcadas.

title: U.S. Rebukes China on Efforts to Build Artificial Islands
description: PEARL HARBOR, Hawaii  A day after China laid out its vision for a navy that can project power into the open seas, Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter on Wednesday criticized Beijings efforts to build artificial islands in the South China Sea, making it clear that the United States would not be deterred by Chinese claims to newly built territories.

title: Hugh Ambrose, Historian Who Wrote The Pacific, Dies at 48
description: Hugh Ambrose, a writer whose best-selling World War II history, The Pacific, was the companion volume to the Emmy Award-winning HBO mini-series of the same name, died on Saturday in Helena, Mont. He was 48.

title: Google and Apple Adjust Strategies on Mobile Payments
description: The battle for mobile software dominance revolves around two companies: Apple and Google. Now both giants are also going head-to-head in mobile payments, as they prepare to push deeper into digital wallets.

title: Hospital Says Man Who Died of Lassa Fever Initially Didnt Disclose Trip to Africa
description: A New Jersey hospital identified itself on Wednesday as the one that released a man on May 18 who later died of a rare disease that he may have contracted in Liberia.

title: Armed With Google and YouTube, Analysts Gauge Russias Presence in Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  An unusual investigation using publicly available videos, smartphone photographs and satellite images shows that Russia is continuing to defy the West by conducting protracted military operations inside Ukraine, according to an independent report.

title: Rick Santorum Announces Presidential Bid
description: Mr. Santorum, a former two-term senator from Pennsylvania, said he was running for the 2016 Republican presidential nomination.

title: HillaryClinton, in South Carolina, Reminds Black Women of Her Support for Obama
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  In 2008, Hillary Rodham Clinton suffered a traumatic loss to Barack Obama in South Carolina. The battle was the beginning of the end of her primary campaign, and its nasty racial overtones cost her dearly among African-American voters  a bedrock Clinton constituency for decades.

title: Noah Syndergaard Is Front and Center in Mets New Six-Man Rotation
description: The fastball came in low, just 89 miles an hour, tailing a bit from the Mets batter but still on the plate. Noah Syndergaard unleashed a furious left-handed swing, like another lefty hitter in the National League East who wears No. 34. This was not Bryce Harper batting, but the result made it seem that way: a laser over the center field wall, just to the left of the Home Run Apple at Citi Field.

title: Borrowing to Replenish Depleted Pensions
description: HARRISBURG, Pa.  Facing a shortfall of more than $50 billion in his states pensions, and with no simple solution at hand, Gov. Tom Wolf of Pennsylvania is proposing to issue $3 billion in bonds, despite the role that such bonds have already played in the fiscal woes of other places.

title: F.B.I. Investigates Whether Harm From Surgical Power Tool Was Ignored
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation has begun looking into whether medical device makers, doctors and hospitals broke the law by failing to report problems linked to a power tool used during gynecologic surgery, according to two people who said they were interviewed by investigators.

title: Al Qaedas Branch in Syria Denies Planning Attacks Abroad
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The leadership of Al Qaeda has ordered its Syrian branch, the Nusra Front, to not attack targets abroad because that could disrupt its goal of toppling President Bashar al-Assad, the head of the Nusra Front said in a television interview broadcast Wednesday.

title: A Regions Soccer Strongmen Are Facing a Hard Fall
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  After rising as a governor under Brazils military dictatorship, Jos Maria Marin became such a towering figure in the world of Brazilian sports that the headquarters of the nations soccer federation was recently named in his honor.

title: I.R.S. Data Breach May Be Sign of More Personalized Schemes
description: The plot to steal information on 100,000 taxpayers from the Internal Revenue Service and hijack nearly $50 million in refunds not only reveals a previous security breach but hints at a wider fraud that may bedevil Americans in the future.

title: Former Breakthrough Players Endure Breakdowns in Paris
description: PARIS  Watching Eugenie Bouchard suffer at the French Open on Tuesday and watching Simona Halep and Ernests Gulbis suffer on Wednesday, it was hard not to marvel at the games long-running success stories.

title: Obamas Chief Negotiator in Iran Nuclear Talks Plans to Depart After Deadline for Deal
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas chief negotiator with Iran, Wendy R. Sherman, said on Wednesday that she planned to leave the administration shortly after the June 30 deadline for a final deal on limiting the countrys nuclear program.

title: Medical Need Climbs Alongside Death Toll in Yemen
description: SANA, Yemen  Airstrikes by a Saudi-led military coalition were said to have killed at least 80 people in Yemen on Wednesday, and the World Health Organization warned that roughly one-third of the countrys population was in urgent need of medical care.

title: Walter Byers, Ex-N.C.A.A. Leader Who Rued Corruption, Dies at 93
description: Walter Byers, who as executive director of the National Collegiate Athletic Association for more than three decades forged a moneymaking colossus from the concept of the student-athlete only to decry, finally, the college sports world he had wrought as corrupt and unfair, died on Tuesday at his home near Emmett, Kan. He was 93.

title: White House Presses for Deal on Phone Data Bill
description: WASHINGTON  Obama administration officials on Wednesday intensified pressure on Congress to strike a deal before a Sunday deadline over legislation governing the National Security Agencys bulk collection of telephone records, arguing that failing to do so would suspend crucial domestic surveillance authority at a time of mounting terrorism threats.

title: Scientists Warn to Expect More Weather Extremes
description: Torrential rains and widespread flooding in Texas have brought relief from a yearslong drought to many parts of the state. Such unpredictable and heavy rains are a big part of what climate scientists say that many Texans can expect in years to come.

title: Sepp Blatter: In Charge, but Left Unscathed
description: If Wednesdays sweeping arrests of several FIFA officials at a five-star hotel in Zurich turn out to be the moment when everything finally started to unravel for Sepp Blatter, it would be hard to imagine a more appropriate setting. Mr. Blatter, the president of soccers governing body, has long been accused of running his organization like a Swiss bank, providing a minimum of transparency when it comes to the billions of dollars that flow into and out of its coffers every year.

title: Baltimore Officers Charged in Freddie Grays Death Seek to Move Trial
description: The six Baltimore police officers who were charged this month in the death of Freddie Gray asked a Maryland judge on Wednesday to move their trial from the city, where suspicions of police misconduct provoked both violent unrest and days of peaceful demonstrations.

title: Arguing in Court Whether 2 Chimps Have the Right to Bodily Liberty
description: A state judge heard arguments on Wednesday on whether chimpanzees can be considered persons with some legal rights, as advocates seeking to free two chimps in captivity on Long Island asserted they were autonomous beings and compared their plight to that of human slaves.

title: Review: In Nice Girl, a Sudden Ray of Hope in a Dead-End Life
description: Sadness sits lightly on the small shoulders of Josephine, the heroine of Nice Girl, a tenderly drawn drama by Melissa Ross about stunted lives in a middle-class suburb of Boston. Josephine, known as Jo and portrayed with fine delicacy by Diane Davis, goes about her daily business without drawing attention to the hole in her heart. She cooks and cares for her mother, Francine, and dutifully performs her secretarial chores at an accounting firm. But in moments of repose and reflection, tears spring to her eyes, and the life she might have led seems to shimmer before her like a mirage.

title: 50-50 Chance
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  When is a math equation not really a math equation? When its wordplay, of course.

title: Scandal Creates a Tricky Spot for FIFA Sponsors
description: Hours after the Justice Department indicted nine FIFA officials on Wednesday on corruption charges, Visa vowed to reassess its World Cup sponsorship if soccers world governing body did not change its ways.

title: After the Deluge, a Search for Survivors and Remains
description: A grass-roots search effort after the Texas floods involved over 200 volunteers comprising family members, friends and concerned strangers.

title: Rangel Reflects on His Life and Marriage at a Dance Class, Sitting Down
description: In 1950s Harlem on a Sunday afternoon, Alma Carter arrived at the Savoy Ballroom in a mauve-colored strapless ball gown. I wore a tiara with diamonds, she said, quickly adding, Not real diamonds.

title: Brooklyn Bridge Park Settles Housing Lawsuit
description: The Brooklyn Bridge Park Corporation has settled a lawsuit brought last summer by a community group, allowing park officials to begin to move forward with the final phase of their development plan.

title: Plan to Build Tower at Grand Central in Exchange for Transit Upgrades Is Approved
description: The New York City Council voted on Wednesday to approve plans for a developer to build a 63-story office tower just west of Grand Central Terminal in exchange for $220 million in transit upgrades.

title: Giants Shift Things Up as Ereck Flowers Gets Nod at Left Tackle
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Giants lost their most accomplished and experienced offensive lineman last week when left tackle Will Beatty tore a pectoral muscle and had surgery that will sideline him until at least early November.

title: Blackhawks Hold Off Ducks to Force Game 7
description: CHICAGO  The Blackhawks have been pushed to the brink of elimination time and again during their seven-year run of excellence that has included five Western Conference finals appearances and two Stanley Cup championships. So often they have had an answer, summoning, as if by magic, a spectacular goal, a stunning comeback or just a bit of luck when it was needed most.

title: Vintage Photographs, Reinterpreted
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: F.C.C. Chief Seeks Broadband Plan to Aid the Poor
description: For 30 years, the federal government has helped millions of low-income Americans pay their phone bills, saying that telephone service is critical to summoning medical help, seeking work and, ultimately, climbing out of poverty. Now, the nations top communications regulator will propose offering those same people subsidized access to broadband Internet.

title: Word of the Day | iconoclastic
description: iconoclastic  \()i-k-n-klas-tik\  adjective

title: Stephen Curry Bounces Back, and the Warriors Head to the Finals
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Stephen Curry looked different during warm-ups Wednesday. He wore a bright yellow sleeve on his right arm, his lone concession to a fall he had taken earlier in the week. The entire right side of his body still ached before Game 5 of the Western Conference finals, and Curry sought additional protection.

title: Sesil Karatantcheva, a Onetime Rising Star, Is Rising Again at Age 25
description: PARIS  Sesil Karatantcheva was not aware that there was an anniversary for her to commemorate this year at the French Open.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 8:30 P.M. (Starz Cinema) A BIRDERS GUIDE TO EVERYTHING (2014) On the eve of his fathers marriage to the woman who cared for his dying mother, a 15-year-old (Kodi Smit-McPhee) spies a duck previously thought to be extinct, pitting the awkward members of his high school birder society against an adult fanatic (Ben Kingsley) with a distinctly avian demeanor, who they worry will steal the credit for their potential discovery. This gentle comedy, the first feature directed by Rob Meyer, is an eye opener for anyone who takes the everyday natural world for granted, Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times. It is also a quiet brief for the cultivation of intellectual curiosity and scientific exploration at an age when hormones rule so much behavior.

title: Corrections: May 28, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Sir, Im just calling you to say that were going to need you to come to your door and open it for us, or were going to have to kick it in.

title: For Turkeys Ruler, Criticism From New York Is Not Fit to Print
description: Having already moved from the prime ministers office to the new presidential palace, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan seems to have assumed a new, unofficial role this week as Turkeys chief press critic.

title: Teenage Motherhood in Latin America
description: Christian Rodriguez likes to immerse himself in projects, which have taken far from his native Uruguay, like the months he spent photographing circus workers in Vietnam. In many ways, his projects give him time to reflect on himself, his work and his life.

title: F.D.A. Blood Donor Policy
description: To the Editor:

title: At Commencement
description: To the Editor:

title: How California Regulates Toxic Chemicals
description: To the Editor:

title: Obamacare and the State
description: To the Editor:

title: Lets Do Some Railing
description: Just before Congress slunk away for the three-day weekend  which it was, of course, planning to stretch into a week  senators from the Northeast held a press conference to denounce Republicans for underfunding Amtrak passenger rail service.

title: My Night With a Flash Flood in Houston
description: HOUSTON  MANY people picture tumbleweeds rolling across dusty plains when they think of Texas, but Houston is actually more like Calcutta, or Panama; it is very green here, because it rains a lot. On the other hand, it usually doesnt rain for long; violent storms come and go quickly, with some attendant street flooding because Houston is also very flat. Most of the time, however, a little water is no big deal, though its frequency helps explain why so many Houstonians drive large pickups and S.U.V.s, a fact I tend to recall only when I am stuck in rising water in my Honda Civic.

title: Polluted Political Games
description: Ive admired the Clintons foundation for years for its fine work on AIDS and global poverty, and Ive moderated many panels at the annual Clinton Global Initiative. Yet with each revelation of failed disclosures or the appearance of a conflict of interest from speaking fees of $500,000 for the former president, I have wondered: What were they thinking?

title: The Death Penalty Ends in Nebraska
description: Not so long ago, the murder of Kerrie Orozco, an Omaha police officer, would have been held up as the sort of crime that the death penalty was meant for.

title: Talking About Peace, When Despots Dont Care
description: The 30 women arrived on the South Korean side of the demilitarized zone proud and triumphant. We have accomplished what no one said can be done, which is to be a trip for peace, for reconciliation, for human rights, declared Gloria Steinem, the feminist icon and primary spokeswoman for the group.

title: We Need More Nurses
description: SEVERAL emergency-room nurses were crying in frustration after their shift ended at a large metropolitan hospital when Molly, who was new to the hospital, walked in. The nurses were scared because their department was so understaffed that they believed their patients  and their nursing licenses  were in danger, and because they knew that when tensions ran high and nurses were spread thin, patients could snap and turn violent.

title: Blame Genes for Extramarital Affairs?
description: To the Editor:

title: Pollings Secrecy Problem
description: The debunking of a recent academic paper on changing views about same-sex marriage has raised concerns about whether other political science research is being properly vetted and verified. But the scandal may actually point to vulnerabilities in a different field: public polls.

title: Test Yourself | High Heels, Celebrity and Power
description: Below are several paragraphs from the May 24 Sunday Review essay Shoes That Put Women in Their Place.

title: 6 Qs About the News | FIFA Inquiry Yields Indictments; U.S. Officials Vow to Pursue More
description: In FIFA Inquiry Yields Indictments; U.S. Officials Vow to Pursue More, Matt Apuzzo, Stephanie Clifford and William K. Rashbaum report on a criminal investigation into FIFA.

title: How Do Your Parents Share the Responsibilities of Parenting?
description: Parenting roles have shifted since previous generations, when mothers generally played the role of parent in chief while fathers earned a living. But that still doesnt mean that everything is shared equally.

title: New Jersey Faces a Transportation Funding Crisis, With No Clear Solution
description: SECAUCUS, N.J.  Bridges across the state are falling apart. Roads are rife with potholes. Frustrated New Jersey Transit riders are facing another fare increase.

title: Hilary Mantel on Taking Her Wolf Hall Novels to the Stage
description: Ten years ago, I started to build a theater inside my head. I wanted to tell  or rather, to show  a story about Henry VIII, the second Tudor king. It would be about his court, his country and three of his six wives: one sad, one serpentine, one sneaky. I would create  or unleash, for they were real people  a heaving mob of courtiers, who listened at doors, who opened each others letters. I would turn out their pockets and count their cash. I would look into their houses and their hearts. My focus would be the kings fixer, the ferociously ambitious Thomas Cromwell.

title: Long Island City for the Good Commute
description: Anthony Altamuras family had a running joke: Oh, Anthony is complaining about the commute again.

title: Review: In San Andreas, Dwayne Johnson Rushes to Rescue His Collapsing World
description: The big earthquake in San Andreas  excuse me, the seismic swarm event  has its pros and cons. On one hand, it tears the state of California asunder. On the other, it brings a family together. As is the custom in movies of this kind, destruction is both universal and selective. Two major American cities are pretty much obliterated, catastrophes that presumably cause death on a huge scale. But the half-dozen or so people we care about struggle for survival with what the conventions of genre if not the laws of nature assure us are reasonably good odds.

title: Arrest Underscores Chinas Role in the Making and Spread of a Lethal Drug
description: MILWAUKEE  Scores of travelers streamed through Los Angeles International Airport in March, just off a flight from China. But one passenger, a 33-year-old Chinese chemist, never reached baggage claim.

title: Science Fiction and Fantasy
description: Often, reading a book that calls to mind your teenage favorites is, at best, an exercise in nostalgia: a slightly uncomfortable reminder of a time when coming-of-age tales seemed to offer magnificent maps of the possible. But under those bright, forthright tales with the air of the mythic about them, you could sometimes find a messier story (courtesy of Angela Carter or Tanith Lee, say) that struck deeper, a story that knew you had already seen the outline of the dark and understood that no easy map was going to work.

title: Travel
description: As you riffle through this springs rucksack of enticing new travel books, seeking somewhere to go, you might give a thought to going nowhere  that is, in the Greek sense of nowhere, to utopia, a word Thomas More coined five centuries ago, meaning no place. The best nowhere destination of all is undoubtedly Atlantis, that utopian underwater city (or subterranean city, given millenniums of earth-crust shimmies) whose rumored existence captivated Plato, around 360 B.C., and whose whereabouts continues to tantalize archaeologists, oceanographers, classicists, geographers and mythomanes. If youve traveled to a distant continent or four, it isnt inconceivable that youve already trod upon the legendary land  without knowing it.

title: I Take You, by Eliza Kennedy
description: Should a woman have sex before marriage? The answer, according to I Take You, a salty, lively first novel from Eliza Kennedy, is yes, but only if its with half of the wedding party.

title: Committing to a Dog After Cancer
description: Leap Year Day, 1986: I drove up to a ramshackle house in Berkeley to pick out my first dog. It was a month before my two-year cancer anniversary, at which point I would be considered cured, and I was ready to make a commitment  to life, longevity and a puppy.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: New York Today: Whats That You Say?
description: Good morning on this cloudy Thursday.

title: Kaisa Takeover Bid by Sunac Is Dropped
description: SHANGHAI  Kaisa Group, the troubled Chinese property developer, needs another lifeline.

title: You Draw It: How Family Income Predicts Childrens College Chances
description: Draw your guess for every income level, then compare it with the actual data on college enrollment and the drawings of other readers.

title: Today in Politics: Immigration Ruling Stymies Obama and Those Seeking His Job
description: Immigration Ruling Stymies Obama and Those Seeking His Job

title: Supreme Court Litmus Testing in the 2016 Election
description: Hillary Clinton has been telling people  a group of financial backers in Brooklyn, a house party in Iowa  that as president, she would appoint Supreme Court justices who would overturn the Citizens United decision erasing limits on political spending by corporations.

title: What We Dont See
description: Pics or it didnt happen is the response you get online when you share some unlikely experience or event and one of your friends, followers or stalkers calls you out for evidence. Next thing I know, Im bowling with Bill Murray! Pics or it didnt happen. I taught my cockatoo how to rap Baby Got Back  in pig Latin. Pics or it didnt happen. Against all odds, I briefly smiled today. Pics or it didnt happen!

title: The Secret Sadness of Pregnancy With Depression
description: At the beginning of spring in 2013, Mary Guest, a lively, accomplished 37-year-old woman, fell in love, became pregnant and married after a short courtship. At the time, Mary taught children with behavioral problems in Portland, Ore. Her supervisor said that he had rarely seen a teacher with Marys gift for intuiting students needs. Mary was a powerful person, he wrote to her mother, Kristin. Around Mary, one felt compassion, drive, calmness and support.

title: Letter of Recommendation: The Dohm Sound Machine
description: Late one night in 1962, a resourceful insomniac named Jim Buckwalter found himself wide awake once again. Unlike so many of us, though, Buckwalter put his sleeplessness to use, fiddling and tinkering, hoping to find a way to sleep through the night. He installed a motorized fan in a metal dog-food dish and sealed it off with a piece of wood. When he turned the fan on, the contraption produced a pleasant whir that was strangely effective at drowning out other noises. He began to sleep better with the machine on, and his rudimentary device became the prototype for the Dohm sound conditioner  one of todays top-selling white-noise machines.

title: Drizzy and the New Celebrity Worship
description: A few weeks ago, I messaged a friend to ask how her film project was going. She replied, Always felt like my vision been bigger than the bigger picture. Then, a few days later, after filling me in on her summer plans, she sent another non sequitur: I am on a 24-hour Champagne diet!!! Eventually, she confessed that she was using an app called Drizzy, which lets users send text messages made of snippets of the rapper Drakes lyrics. Such a service might sound limited in its appeal, but that hasnt stopped half a million people from downloading the app since it was released in March; right after it was released, so many people were searching and texting Drake lyrics that the server crashed. Its just one of several dozen apps that exist only to help smartphone users relish in and broadcast their love of Drake.

title: The Rise of Social Liberalism and G.O.P. Resistance
description: There is a fascinating phenomenon taking shape in America: As the country becomes less religious, it is also becoming more socially liberal.

title: Restaurant Report: The Grey in Savannah, Georgia
description: Rare is the bus station that compels customers to linger willingly. But the building that housed Savannahs old Greyhound Bus Depot, built in 1938, is no ordinary way station. In December, the space reopened as the Grey, an elegant restaurant that evokes an era in which bus travel entailed a degree of glamour and sophistication.

title: Hotel Review: Tierras Enamoradas
description: Rooms from $99 to $117 in high season; pet hotel, $20 a night.

title: Todays Travel News and Tips
description: In Transit is trying out a new schedule. We will be posting a digest each weekday morning that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know. Wed love your feedback as we refine the format and focus, so please email travmail@nytimes.com or comment below to share your thoughts.

title: In Omaha, Farmers and Chefs Are Good Together
description: Farm-to-table dining starts with the farm, so thats where this story will begin.

title: The Wrath of Grapes
description: In the steep hills of Central California near Lompoc, on a slope that runs along Santa Rosa Road, two vineyards lie side by side. To all appearances, the Sea Smoke and Wenzlau properties occupy one continuous parcel of land. The vines are indistinguishable; they grow in the same soil and get the same sunlight. Nevertheless, grapes planted only a few feet apart end up in bottles of pinot noir that have little in common.

title: Maria Contreras-Sweet | Agent of Change
description: Its not necessary to have all the answers, said Ms. Contreras-Sweet, head of the Small Business Administration. A leaders job is to create an empowering environment where the best ideas can surface.

title: Maria Contreras-Sweet on Taking Your Skills With You
description: This interview with Maria Contreras-Sweet, administrator of the United States Small Business Administration, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Scientists Curbing the Use of Science
Morning Agenda: Avago in Talks to Buy Broadcom
description: AVAGO IN TALKS TO BUY BROADCOM | Avago Technologies, a chip maker based in Singapore, is in advanced talks to buy Broadcom, a rival semiconductor maker based in the United States,  Michael J. de la Merced and Quentin Hardy report in DealBook, citing people briefed on the matter. A deal could be announced as soon as Thursday, one of the people said, but cautioned that talks could collapse. Avago, which specializes in chips for things like fiber-optic lines and lighting, has relatively little overlap with Broadcoms products, which are used in iPhones and other popular devices. A merger could combine the two companies wares to offer comprehensive products to big communications companies, while negotiating cheaper manufacturing costs from the third-party factories where both companies chips are made.

title: Sepp Blatter Is Unfazed Entering FIFA Election
description: ZURICH  Soccers world governing body will hold a presidential election Friday, two days after a group of its leading officials were charged with corruption, its headquarters were raided and the governments of two countries announced they were investigating more allegations of bribery.

title: Putin, on Guard for 2018 World Cup in Russia, Denounces FIFA Arrests
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin sought to transform the burgeoning scandal over corruption in soccers international governing body into an extension of the confrontation between Russia and the West on Thursday, accusing the United States of global overreach while invoking the fates of Edward J. Snowden and Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder.

title: Throwback Thursday | The Advertisements of Times Past
description: Use Times Machine to page through any edition of The New York Times from 1851 to 1980 , and youll soon realize that looking at the ads is half the fun.

title: Avago Agrees to Buy Broadcom for $37 Billion
description: When the chip maker Avago Technologies went public in 2009, it seemed like a modest player in the semiconductor industry with a market value of just $3.5 billion. But the company has long wanted to grow through deal-making, and it took its most ambitious step on Thursday.

title: George Pataki Adds a Socially Liberal Voice to the Race for the G.O.P. Nomination
description: EXETER, N.H.  It had the outlines of a significant event: A three-term governor of New York, who forced Mario M. Cuomo from office and led his state through the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks, announced Thursday that he was running for president.

title: The FIFA Case: Questions, Answers and Updates
description: Questions and answers about the indictments of 14 soccer officials and marketing executives, including top FIFA officials, on corruption charges.

title: David McCullough: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of The Wright Brothers originally planned to write fiction. Again and again come vivid reminders that the truth often is not only stranger than fiction, but far more remarkable as a story.

title: George Pataki Joins Republican Hopefuls Wanting to Be President
description: Former Gov. George E. Pataki of New York announced on Thursday that he is seeking the Republican presidential nomination, arguing that his message of people over politics is the way for Americans to reclaim their government.

title: On the Trail of a Creole Music Pioneer, Still Alive in Song
description: PINEVILLE, La.  Somewhere among the thousands beneath a grassy hill here lies the body of Amd Ardoin.

title: Why I Stopped Giving Hair Advice to White Moms of Brown Kids
description: When I was 10 years old, my Aunt Peggy, the fashion icon of the family, arrived at a party with her long, sleek hair shaped into a massive Afro.Cool, Aunt Peggy! my older cousins chimed. I was mesmerized by the shock on my grandparents faces. Girl, what did you? Granddad bellowed.

title: George Pataki on the Issues
description: George E. Pataki served three terms as governor of New York, winning office as a fiscal conservative who was considered a moderate on social issues, and earned strong support among environmental advocates. Like Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, he has cited his stewardship of a traditionally Democratic state as evidence of his bipartisan appeal. Here are Mr. Patakis positions on some important issues.

title: What George Pataki Would Need to Do to Win
description: A look at the strategic challenges facing the former New York governor.

title: When to Blame the Sidewalk
description: Dear Diary:

title: Hospitalized Opposition Activist Needs Treatment Outside Russia, Wife Says
description: MOSCOW  The wife of a Russian opposition activist who has been hospitalized in Moscow with a mysterious illness urged on Thursday that he be evacuated to a hospital in Europe or Israel, saying his condition had not improved despite emergency dialysis.

title: Daily Report: As Mobile Payments Rise, Apple and Google Prepare Their Moves
description: The battle for mobile software dominance revolves around two companies: Apple and Google. Now both giants are also going head-to-head in mobile payments, as they prepare to push deeper into digital wallets, Mike Isaac and Brian X. Chen report.

title: Teva Settles Cephalon Generics Case With F.T.C. for $1.2 Billion
description: The pharmaceutical company Cephalon had a cash cow on its hands. In the United States alone, its prescription drug Provigil, which treats sleep disorders, generated over $475 million in sales in 2005 and almost double that in 2007. It made up about half of Cephalons business.

title: The True Cost, a Different Kind of Fashion Documentary
description: I suppose it was inevitable that after the spate of fashion brands embracing documentaries (see Dior, Gucci, Chanel, Valentino, Gaultier), many of which proved surprisingly effective pieces of industry propaganda, a director would come along to put the whole thing in context.

title: Putin: FIFA Arrests Show U.S. Meddling
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia accused the United States on Thursday of meddling outside its jurisdiction after the arrests of leading officials from FIFA.

title: 1940: King Leopold Capitulates
description: Newsreel footage reporting the surrender of Belgium. britishpathe.com.

title: The Sleeping Beauty Awakes to Vibrant Ballet Costumes
description: To speak of the new ballet one must speak most of all about its physical production, a critic wrote after the premiere of Marius Petipas The Sleeping Beauty in St. Petersburg, Russia in 1890. Critics commented on the magnificence of the sets and, especially, of the extravagance of the costumes, which were rendered in silk, velvet, plush, gold and silver embroideries, wonderful brocades, feathers, and flowers.

title: Senator Charles Grassley Asks S.E.C. to Explain False Bid on Database
description: A United States senator wants securities regulators to explain how a previously unknown investment firm was able to electronically submit an apparently bogus takeover bid for Avon Products with a top federal database for filing securities documents.

title: George Patakis Announcement Video
description: In a video on his website on Thursday, the former New York governor George E. Pataki announced that he was running for the 2016 Republican nomination for president of the United States.

title: Punchy Hues
description: Eye makeup as seen on the catwalk.

title: For de Blasio, a Red Sox Fan, the Simple Pleasure of Baseball Gets Complicated
description: The trouble began in Milwaukee, after the first ballgame that Mayor Bill de Blasio found time for during a Midwest swing to discuss income inequality  but before the second.

title: N.B.A. Finals: A First Look at Cavaliers vs. Warriors
description: With the conference finals having wrapped up quickly, the N.B.A. finds itself in an awkward situation: There will be a record seven days between postseason basketball games. Unable to alter the schedule because of logistics, the N.B.A. will get a taste of what the N.F.L. experiences in the run-up to the Super Bowl, when every angle is analyzed to such a ridiculous extent that most of it begins to feel meaningless.

title: Looking Back to the Early Stages of Fiddler on the Roof
description: Sheldon Harnick still remembers that night more than a half-century ago.

title: What to Do This Weekend
description: Need help finding something to do?

title: Betty Buckley and Rachel York to Star in Grey Gardens in Sag Harbor
description: The Tony Award-winning actress Betty Buckley will star with Rachel York in a revival of the musical Grey Gardens this summer at the Bay Street Theater in Sag Harbor, N.Y., the theater announced Thursday.

title: Market Report
description: Streamlined black bathing suits.

title: Bernie Sanderss Message Resonates With a Certain Age Group: His Own
description: EPPING, N.H.  Fit and quick-witted at age 73, Senator Bernie Sanders was still going strong after speaking for an hour in 90-degree heat on Wednesday when he fielded a question from a man who could have been an older brother.

title: The Butterfly Guide, Illustrated
description: The artist Leanne Shapton painted this series based on images from W.J. Hollands book published in 1925 by Doubleday Page & Company.

title: Women in Tunisia Tell of Decades of Police Cruelty, Violence and Rape
description: TUNIS  She was just 21 when she was arrested by Tunisias state police, who hauled her into an Interior Ministry office and beat me up so hard that I dont even remember how I found myself there. But that was not the worst part.

title: Burundis Catholic Church Withdraws Support for Elections
description: BUJUMBURA, Burundi  The Roman Catholic Church of Burundi announced Thursday that it would withdraw its priests appointed to help organize the elections at the heart of the political upheaval in the country.

title: Punda Tibetan
description: An outpost for Tibetan dumplings in Sunnyside, Queens.

title: Tibetan Food Finds a New Home at Punda
description: Tenzing Tsering grew up as a Tibetan refugee in the northeast Indian state of Meghalaya, whose Sanskrit name means abode of clouds, perhaps because more rain falls there  more than 400 inches a year  than anywhere else on earth. His rsum could be a case study in culinary diaspora: He cooked in Moscow and Siberia, at Kathmandus only vegetarian hotel and at the high-end Indian restaurant Tulsi in Manhattan, and was the personal chef to the president of the Russian (and predominantly Tibetan Buddhist) republic of Kalmykia.

title: Smuggling a Beer for My Hospital Patient
description: My pager went off late one afternoon with a message from the oncology service at my hospital, asking me to see a 70-year-old man with metastatic cancer and trouble breathing. I wasnt hopeful. I had chosen to train in pulmonary and critical care medicine because I wanted to be someone who saved lives. But, it turned out, there was so much sickness I couldnt fix.

title: Republican Field Stays Muddled as More Candidates Arrive
description: The announcements are arriving seemingly by the day from places like Pennsylvania, New Hampshire, Arkansas and sometimes just online.

title: Tracy Morgan to Appear on Today Show
description: Tracy Morgan is set to make his first television appearance since being severely injured in a car crash last June. The actor and comedian will be interviewed on Monday by Matt Lauer on the Today show on NBC, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

title: In Fun Home, a Wifes Late, Desperate Outcry
description: You cant set your watch by it anymore, but the Broadway musicals climactic 11 oclock number is still very much a thing, even in musicals that defy convention. A holdover from the days when shows began at 8:30 p.m. and ran closer to three hours, the 11 oclock number has typically referred, in musical comedies, to a song late in the second act thats designed to wow the audience before the finale, or in musical dramas to a song that feels like an inevitable emotional destination  an end point, if not the shows ending.

title: Review: Kamel Daoud Interrogates Camus in The Meursault Investigation
description: Harun, the narrator of Kamel Daouds stunning debut novel, The Meursault Investigation, is the brother of the nameless Arab murdered by Meursault, the narrator of Camuss existential classic, The Stranger. No one even remembers his dead brother, Harun says, because the author of that book depicted him as a poor illiterate whose sole purpose, apparently, was taking a bullet and returning to dust  an anonymous person with no name, no face, no words.

title: Luis Gisperts Art of Gold
description: Luis Gispert had been in his Brooklyn studio, putting the finishing touches on his latest series, for weeks; then he was interrupted. His wife, Teresa Lopez-Castro, went into labor for more than 30 hours, before his daughter, Lucia Mar, was born on May 20. My wife is so tough, he says. Somehow, it didnt stop Gispert  whose bling-inflected exhibition Aqua Regia, named for the only chemical that can dissolve gold, opens on May 29 at OHWOW Gallery in Los Angeles  from completing his series and shipping it out on time.

title: Mary-Louise Parker Stars in Heisenberg, a Play About the Implications of a Kiss
description: When Mary-Louise Parker puckers up, youd better brace yourself for something wild. New York theatergoers first fell love with her 25 (can it be?) years ago when she appeared in Craig Lucass Prelude to a Kiss, in which she set off a fairy-tale transformation by locking lips with an old man. Now she is again demonstrating the miraculous powers of osculation in Heisenberg, a play by Simon Stephens, opening on Wednesday. In this latest offering from Mr. Stephens, the intellectually adventurous author of Punk Rock and The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time, Ms. Parker plays a woman who alters destiny when she kisses a stranger (Denis Arndt) on the neck in a London train station. This Manhattan Theater Club production is staged by Mark Brokaw, who memorably directed Ms. Parker in Paula Vogels How I Learned to Drive. (Wednesday through June 28, the Studio at Stage II, City Center, 131 West 55th Street; 212-582-1212, nycitycenter.org.)

title: Chemical Weapon Stockpiles Greatly Reduced, Treaty Group Reports
description: In the nearly two decades since the global treaty prohibiting chemical weapons took effect, 90 percent of stockpiles declared by its members have been eradicated, the organization responsible for monitoring compliance said Thursday.

title: The Daily Show Sets Sept. 28 as Debut for New Host Trevor Noah
description: Trevor Noah has had a nice long honeymoon period  well, it wasnt always nice, though it certainly felt long  but his time as Jon Stewarts heir apparent now has an end date. On Sept. 28, Mr. Noah will take over as host of The Daily Show, the Comedy Central news satire show, the network announced on Thursday. Mr. Stewart, who has anchored the program since 1999, previously said that his final show will be Aug. 6, after which it will take a production hiatus.

title: Serena Williams Struggles, but Clears a Mental Hurdle at the French Open
description: PARIS  Serena Williams joked after her first-round victory at the French Open on Tuesday that she was simply relieved to have defended the ranking points she had earned at the tournament last year, when she crashed out in the second round.

title: Sepp Blatter Addresses FIFA Congress
description: FIFA President Sepp Blatter discussed the arrests of top officials on Thursday at the opening ceremony of the 65th FIFA Congress.
