This weekend, Frances main conservative party, under the leadership of former President Nicolas Sarkozy, voted to rename itself the Republicans, dropping its rather unwieldy identity as the Union for a Popular Movement.

title: Our Water-Guzzling Food Factory
description: LETS start with a quiz.

title: The Prospects for Polygamy
description: ON every issue save abortion, social liberalism is suddenly ascendant in America. The shift on same-sex marriage has captured the headlines, but the change is much more comprehensive: In just 15 years, we have gone from being a society divided roughly evenly between progressive and traditionalist visions to a country where social conservatism is countercultural and clearly in retreat.

title: FIFAs Outsize Generosity
description: Under FIFAs system, the smallest country has the same voting power as the biggest, and payments from FIFA for projects help to ensure allegiance to Sepp Blatter.

title: Yorkville, Where Hastert Taught, Is Shaken by Charges for Denny
description: YORKVILLE, Ill.  For years, J. Dennis Hastert has been the pride of this small city. There may not be a bronze statue in his honor, but that would be counter to what people here have most admired about Mr. Hastert: that someone who once wielded so much power could also be so ordinary, so much like them, so Yorkville.

title: After Speakership, Hastert Amassed His Millions Lobbying Former Colleagues
description: WASHINGTON  J. Dennis Hastert, the longest-serving Republican House speaker in history, was swept from leadership in 2006 on a wave of Republican revulsion over what critics saw as a legislative favor factory he presided over in Congress. That wave deposited him on K Street, a prime address for the capitals lobbyists, where his influence and good name kept the favors flowing  including into his bank accounts.

title: Martin OMalleys Star-Spangled, Snafu-Speckled Debut
description: BALTIMORE  Martin OMalley couldnt have asked for a more picturesque backdrop for his presidential campaign announcement on Saturday: A blue sky met the clear water of Baltimores Inner Harbor off Federal Hill Park.

title: Rangers Left to Digest Another Empty Result
description: For these Rangers, simply skating in Game 7 of the Eastern Conference finals  scoreless with the Tampa Bay Lightning heading into third period  was something of a postseason miracle.

title: With Veteran Help, Lightning Gain Finals
description: Last season, the Tampa Bay Lightning watched the Rangers win the Prince of Wales Trophy as the Eastern Conference champions, after being swept out of the playoffs by the Montreal Canadiens in the first round.

title: Gregorius Inherited Jeters Position, but So Far, Not His Defensive Instincts
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The signature play in Derek Jeters long Yankees career occurred here. During the 2001 playoffs, the Yankees, clinging to their postseason life against the As, were rescued when Jeter raced across the diamond to cut off a throw home and flipped it backhanded to catcher Jorge Posada, who tagged out Jeremy Giambi just before he touched home plate for what would have been a crucial run.

title: Leadership on View in Art Walk Near West Point
description: Under a tree in Ladycliff Park in Highland Falls, three life-size concrete women sit together, their knees jutting up toward their chests. Featureless, armless, their rough-hewed bodies face one another as if engrossed in conversation.

title: Yogi Berras Values Shape Museums Mission
description: May 12 marked Yogi Berra Day in New York and New Jersey, and except for the Drums of Thunder, a drum corps of fourth and fifth graders from Hillside Elementary School in Montclair, it was a quiet, tender affair  part photo opportunity, part nostalgia.

title: Nashville Debates How to Prevent Another Devastating Flood
description: NASHVILLE  As Texas reels from catastrophic flooding, this booming city on the Cumberland River is contemplating what to do to protect itself in the wake of its own disaster from five years ago, the May 2010 flood that killed 10 people and damaged or destroyed 11,000 properties.

title: Review of Rock of Ages at Gateway Playhouse in Bellport
description: Rock of Ages, now at the Gateway Playhouse in Bellport, is an entertaining, high-energy party. It is also exceedingly silly, but thats a good thing. If this musical, featuring broad humor and 1980s pop songs, many of them from hair-metal bands like Poison and Twisted Sister, took itself seriously, it could easily become insufferable.

title: Camping in Church? Make Way for Champers
description: Glampers, make way for champers. Travelers can now spend a night surrounded by history in three of Englands treasured country churches as part of the champing program  camping in churches  run by the Churches Conservation Trust. The trust, which cares for more than 340 churches no longer used for regular worship, is offering overnight stays as a way to help preserve the buildings, raise money and promote slow tourism.

title: Japanese Towns Thank Their Moneyed Donors
description: The patrons who help finance Japans poorer areas not only get tax benefits, they also receive fresh local foods from the towns they support.

title: In Japan, You Get a Tax Break and a Side of Lobster and Beef
description: HIRADO, Japan  Tax breaks come in many forms. Charitable gifts. Health care expenses. Mortgage interest payments.

title: Review: A Rambunctious Production of Kiss Me Kate in Hartford
description: The most notorious spanking in theater history is being delivered with good-humored gusto at Hartford Stage, where the musical Kiss Me, Kate is happily conflating Shakespeare and Cole Porter in a rambunctious production masterminded by the director Darko Tresnjak and the choreographer Peggy Hickey.

title: E.P.A. Proposal Will Put Bigger Trucks on a Fuel Diet
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  Inside the National Vehicle and Fuel Emissions Laboratory here, a mammoth contraption, with steel rollers, advanced electronics and exhaust tubes, is nearing completion.

title: Japanese Towns Thank Their Moneyed Donors
description: The patrons who help finance Japans poorer areas not only get tax benefits, they also receive fresh local foods from the towns they support.

title: Making Projections
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE   When The Girl was of pre-school age, she liked to dress herself and, as the mature, authority figure in her life, I (metaphorically, Officer) threw her under the bus to her teacher. Those of you who are parents or guardians of small children can probably already see where this is going, but I feel like I need to get this off my chest.

title: A Florida Police Killing Like Many, Disputed and Little Noticed
description: OAKLAND PARK, Fla.  The witnesses who saw a Broward County deputy sheriff kill a man who had strolled through his apartment complex with an unloaded air rifle propped on his shoulders agreed: Just before he was gunned down, Jermaine McBean had ignored the officers who stood behind him shouting for him to drop his weapon.

title: Iowa Republicans Move to Draw Candidates to Straw Poll
description: With multiple presidential hopefuls indicating that they will not spend money on the Iowa Republican straw poll this summer, the importance of a decadeslong tradition increasingly seems diminished. Concerned about this prospect, a group of Republican activists in Iowa is moving to press candidates into actively participating in the Aug. 8 gathering.

title: Democrats Seek a Richer Roster to Match G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  Over the last few months, Harold M. Ickes, a longtime ally of Hillary Rodham Clinton, has helped organize private meetings around the country with union leaders, Clinton backers and Democratic strategists. The pressing topic: Who will step up to be the Democrats megadonors in the 2016 presidential race?

title: Ukrainian Migrants Fleeing Conflict Get a Cool Reception in Europe
description: WARSAW  Volodymyr Zelenyuk knew it was time to bolt when the pro-Russian separatists came to the carwash he owned in the eastern Ukrainian coal town of Antratsyt and demanded his help making and repairing weapons.

title: Jon Nieses Troubles Continue as Marlins Thrash Mets
description: Through Jon Nieses first six starts of the season for the Mets, his successes were largely overshadowed.

title: Building of Islands Is Debated, but China and U.S. Skirt Conflict at Talks
description: SINGAPORE  It was an unexpectedly direct exchange: With nearly every significant Asian defense official gathered in a single room, a senior Chinese military officer on Saturday defended his countrys island-building spree in the South China Sea and rebuked Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter for saying it threatened the regions stability.

title: Rare Stumble for U.S. Women Against South Korea
description: HARRISON, N.J.  The United States will enter the Womens World Cup on a nine-match unbeaten streak, but a scoreless tie with South Korea on Saturday raised more questions than it answered about the teams ability to win its first world title since 1999.

title: Malaysians Seek Escape in Pulp Fiction as Governments Grip Tightens
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  When Anis Suhaila wants a cheap thrill, she turns to Instagram and Twitter to learn about the latest Malaysian paperback releases. But she does not buy them in ordinary bookstores here, some of which do not carry the titles she is most interested in.

title: Lionel Messi Powers Barcelona to Victory in Copa del Rey
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Barcelona completed the second leg of a possible treble by winning the Copa del Rey on Saturday, led by an unstoppable Lionel Messi, who opened and closed Barcelonas scoring in a 3-1 win over Athletic Bilbao.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: FIFA Charges Merited, but Timing Seems Questionable

title: Sparks and Words Fly as Serena Williams Upends a Rival
description: PARIS  Her latest match with Serena Williams had been over for more than an hour, and Victoria Azarenka was still shaking her head in disbelief as she sat at a table in the French Open players lounge on Saturday night.

title: Ex-President of Georgia to Lead Ukraine Region
description: MOSCOW  President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine on Saturday appointed the former president of Georgia, Mikheil Saakashvili, as governor of the Odessa region, turning to a longtime nemesis of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia for help governing an area coveted by pro-Russian separatists.

title: Russias Barring of Officials Seen as Reprisal
description: BERLIN  Russia has barred dozens of European officials from entering its territory in what appears to be retaliation for the European Unions barring of Russian politicians, officials and businessmen who Europe says have supported the annexation of Crimea or the pro-Russian forces fighting in eastern Ukraine.

title: Beau Biden, Vice President Joe Bidens Son, Dies at 46
description: WASHINGTON  Joseph R. Biden III, the former attorney general of Delaware and the elder son of Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., died on Saturday in Bethesda, Md. He was 46.

title: Outlander Season 1 Finale Recap: Jamie Is Broken
description: Season 1, Episode 16: To Ransom a Mans Soul

title: The Outlander Show Runner, Ron Moore, on That Harrowing Season Finale
description: It was the episode that Outlander fans had long been awaiting  and dreading. In this Starz dramas first-season finale, the 18th-century Scottish warrior Jamie Fraser (Sam Heughan) submitted to the brutal sexual advances of the evil redcoat Black Jack Randall (Tobias Menzies) in an attempt to free our heroine, Claire Randall (Caitriona Balfe).

title: U.S. Paid Residents Linked to Nazi Crimes $20 Million in Benefits, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  The American government paid $20.2 million in Social Security benefits to more than 130 United States residents linked to Nazi atrocities over the course of more than a half-century, with some of the payments made as recently as this year, according to a federal investigation.

title: Chicago Blackhawks Win the West and a Spot in the Finals
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  The Chicago Blackhawks earned a spot in the Stanley Cup finals for the third time in six seasons by defeating the Anaheim Ducks, 5-3, on Saturday night in Game 7 of the Western Conference finals at Honda Center.

title: Rivka Liss-Levinson, Benjamin Aronin
description: Rivka Chana Liss-Levinson and Benjamin Shepard Aronin are to be married Sunday at Temple Israel of Great Neck, N.Y. Rabbi Lester Bronstein is to perform the ceremony.

description: Natalia Nemchinov, a daughter of Elena Nemchinov and Sergei Nemchinov of Rye, N.Y., was married Friday to Jovan Kandic, the son of Ljiljana Kandic and Zarko Kandic of Belgrade, Serbia. Edwina Townes, a staff member in the New York City clerks office, officiated at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau.

Richardson of Rye, N.Y., was married Saturday to Christopher Joshua Khouri, the son of Barbara Tanca Khouri of New York and George A. Khouri of Greenwich, Conn. The Rev. Peter A. Sulyok performed the ceremony at the Bridgehampton Presbyterian Church in Bridgehampton, N.Y. On May 28, the Rev. Constantine Lazarakis led another ceremony at the Greek Orthodox Church of the Hamptons in Southampton, N.Y.

description: Jonathan Daniel Gregg and James Derek Mize were married Saturday by Jack Harrison, a Universal Life minister, at Bryant Park Grill in New York.

description: Molly Lisbeth Cyphers and Nicholas McGraw Berry were married Saturday. The Rev. Dr. Hillary D. Raining performed the ceremony at St. Christophers Episcopal Church in Gladwyne, Pa., with the Rev. C. Hugh Hildesley, another Episcopal priest, taking part.

description: Elizabeth Wells Murphy, the daughter of Elizabeth K. Breckinridge and Peter L. Murphy, both of Columbia, S.C., was married Saturday to Mason Douglas Scherer, a son of Cynthia A. Scherer and Douglas K. Scherer of Pottstown, Pa. The Rev. Kevin M. Roberts, a Baptist minister, officiated at a nondenominational ceremony at the Lace House, a historic home on the grounds of the South Carolina Governor's Mansion in Columbia.

title: Davlyn Grant and Kyle Mosley
description: Davlyn Cecile Grant, the daughter of Dr. Lynn J. McKinley-Grant and Dr. David C. Grant Jr. of Washington, was married Saturday to Kyle Aaron Mosley, the son of Camille Riggs Mosley of Washington and the late Dwight A. Mosley. The Rev. John Matthew Borders III, a Baptist minister, officiated at the Agricultural Hall in West Tisbury, Mass.

description: Kimberlea Anne Tracey and Stephen Benjamin Jeffries were married Saturday evening at Trinity Church in Boston. The Rev. Samuel T. Lloyd III, the church rector, performed the ceremony, with the Right Rev. Dean E. Wolfe, the Episcopal bishop of Kansas, taking part.

description: Amanda Waters Calkins and Andrew Stevens Baker were married Saturday. Benjamin B. Baker, the father of the groom, received permission from the Commonwealth of Massachusetts to officiate at the Shining Tides, a Y.M.C.A. camp in Mattapoisett, Mass.

title: A Night in Cuba, a Run in the Park
description: Elena Cecilia Castaeda, a daughter of Elena Couriel and Javier E. Castaeda of Miami, was married Saturday evening to David Alexander Gottesman, a son of Andrea Carson Gottesman of Roslyn Heights, N.Y., and Dr. Malcolm H. Gottesman of Glen Head, N.Y. Rabbi Lawrence M. Schuval officiated at the Fontainebleau Hotel in Miami Beach.

title: Alexandra Lippman,  Daniel Landy
description: Alexandra Nicole Lippman, the daughter of Linda F. Lippman and James M. Lippman of Los Angeles, was married at her parents house Saturday evening to Daniel Max Landy, a son of Alice J. Radin and Alex P. Landy of North Caldwell, N.J. Rabbi Morley Feinstein officiated.

title: Kirby Taylor, Hardwick Caldwell
description: Jessica Kirby Taylor and Joseph Hardwick Caldwell were married Saturday at the Tennessee River Gardens, a wildflower garden and wildlife preserve in Chattanooga that is owned by the grooms family. The Rev. John Talbird, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Ted Sperling and Noah Waxman
description: Ted Sperling and Noah Waxman were married Monday at the boat house at the Sedgewood Club in Carmel, N.Y. Rabbi Benjamin H. Spratt officiated.

title: Marissa Schaffer, Daniel Sartori
description: Marissa Lauren Schaffer, the daughter of Toby R. Schaffer and Dr. Jonathan L. Schaffer of Moreland Hills, Ohio, is to be married Sunday to Dr. Daniel John Sartori, the son of Clara C. Sartori and Dominic J. Sartori of Darien, Conn. Rabbi David H. Aaron is to officiate at the Cleveland Botanical Garden.

title: Stephanie Santoro, Spencer Acker
description: Stephanie Dawn Santoro, the daughter of Susan S. Santoro and Michael J. Santoro of Guilford, Conn., was married Saturday evening to Spencer Bryan Acker, a son of Andrea P. Acker and David Acker of Melville, N.Y. Rabbi Herbert N. Brockman officiated at Cipriani 42nd Street in New York.

title: Claire Natale and Elijah Visbal
description: Claire Maureen Natale and Elijah Francis Visbal were married Saturday at St. Andrew Church in Erie, Pa. James P. Power, a Roman Catholic deacon and a cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony.

title: Kaylan Christianer,  Andrew Teich
description: Dr. Kaylan Christianer and Andrew Franklin Teich are to be married on Sunday by the Rev. Dr. Robert Moore, a Lutheran minister, at Healdsburg Country Gardens in Healdsburg, Calif.

title: Emily Simon and Matthew Crystal
description: Emily Campbell Simon, the daughter of Janet M. Simon and J. Peter Simon of Green Village, N.J., was married Saturday to Dr. Matthew Alan Crystal, a son of Elizabeth Crystal and Norman Crystal of Green Brook, N.J. The Rev. Patrick G. ODonovan, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of Christ the King in New Vernon, N.J.

title: Melanie Gudesblatt,  James Apgar
description: Melanie Gail Gudesblatt and James Campbell Nelson Apgar are to be married Sunday by Daniel Lamb, an uncle of the bride and a justice for the Town of Saugerties, N.Y., at the Tribeca Rooftop in New York.

title: Sarah Paiji, Kenneth Yoo
description: Sarah Lee Paiji and Kenneth Yoo were married Saturday. Eugene Lee, an uncle of the bride who is a minister of the World Evangelical Mission Alliance, officiated at Oheka Castle, the Otto Kahn estate in Huntington, N.Y.

title: Amy Shyer, Alan Rodrigues
description: Amy Elizabeth Shyer, the daughter of Nancy Gibbons Shyer and Bruce N. Shyer of Oakland, Calif., was married Saturday to Alan Rohit Rodrigues, a son of Sheeba R. Rodrigues and Dr. Joseph V. Rodrigues of Dresher, Pa. The Rev. Richard P. Meyer, a Conservative Baptist minister, officiated at Monson Vineyards in Geyserville, Calif.

title: Amelia Huck, Francis Manley V
description: Amelia Emerson Huck and Francis James Manley V were married Saturday by the Rev. David R. Anderson, an Episcopal priest, at St. Lukes Parish in Darien, Conn.

title: Emily Sussman and Kevin Craw
description: Emily Tisch Sussman, a daughter of Laurie M. Tisch of New York and S. Donald Sussman of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., was married Saturday evening to Kevin James Craw, a son of Joanne T. Craw and James M. Craw of Oakland, N.J. Senator Cory Booker became a minister of the American Fellowship Church for the event. He officiated in an outdoor ceremony at Four Freedoms Park at Roosevelt Island, N.Y.

title: Deborah Ho and David Zhou
description: Dr. Deborah Yuan-Yu Ho and David Zhou were married Friday in Manhattan in the chambers of Judge Pierre N. Leval of the Federal Court of Appeals, for whom the groom was a law clerk in 2011 and 2012.

title: Allison Urbanik, Daniel Kimmel
description: Allison Elizabeth Hong Urbanik, the daughter of Frances Hong Urbanik and David Urbanik of Farmington, Conn., was married Monday to Daniel Mifflin Kimmel, a son of Lawrie A. Mifflin and Arthur G. Kimmel, both of Brooklyn. Mary A. Coburn, a Universal Brotherhood minister, officiated at St. Clements Castle in Portland, Conn.

title: Amanda Tomney, Luke Rooney
description: Amanda Grace Tomney and Luke Austin Rooney were married Saturday by the Rev. Peter Fink, a Roman Catholic priest, at the Church of St. Francis Xavier in New York.

title: Elizabeth Fisch, Michael Dishi
description: Elizabeth Fisch, a daughter of Rachel N. Davidson and Mark Fisch of Manhattan, is to be married Sunday to Michael Dishi, a son of Rachel Dishi and Avi Dishi, also of Manhattan. Rabbi Jacob Nasirov is to officiate at the American Museum of Natural History.

title: Lynn Starace, Benjamin Ritter
description: Lynn Patricia Starace, the daughter of James O. Starace and Maureen E. Starace of Matawan, N.J., was married Saturday to Benjamin Peter Ritter, the son of Valerie J. Ritter and Peter H. Ritter of East Brunswick, N.J. The Rev. John Scully, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Clement Church in Matawan, N.J.

title: Marisa Sargent, Joshua Bernhardt
description: Marisa Joleen Sargent and Joshua Aaron Bernhardt were married Saturday in New York. Rabbi Renee Feller officiated at the New York Palace Hotel with the Rev. Neil OConnell, a Roman Catholic priest, assisting.

title: Sochie Nnaemeka, Edward Fertik
description: Sochie Ursula Nnaemeka, a daughter of Geraldine M. Nnaemeka and Dr. Peter E. Nnaemeka of New Rochelle, N.Y., is to be married Sunday to Edward Stolper Fertik, the son of Antonia E. Stolper and Robert A. Fertik of New York. The Rev. Dr. F. Paul De Hoff, a Presbyterian minister, is to officiate at the Union Church of Pocantico Hills in Sleepy Hollow, N.Y.

title: Anna Gurvich, Jeffrey Hadzima
description: Anna M. Gurvich, a daughter of Michael B. Gurvich and Maria A. Shtaveman of Mount Pleasant, N.Y., was married Saturday evening to Jeffrey Joseph Hadzima, the son of Margaret D. Hadzima and Joseph G. Hadzima Jr. of Wellesley Hills, Mass. The Rev. Kirkland F. Russell Jr., an Anglican priest, officiated on Pink Sands Beach at the Ocean View Club on Harbour Island, the Bahamas.

title: Alexandra Costanza,  Morgan Whitworth
description: Alexandra Katherine Costanza, the daughter of Philip J. Costanza and Katherine R. Costanza of San Jose, Calif., was married Saturday to Morgan Edwin Whitworth, a son of Elizabeth N. Whitworth and Dr. Hall B. Whitworth of Winter Park, Fla. Chief Judge Anne C. Conway of the United States District Court for the Middle District of Florida, for whom the groom is a law clerk, officiated at Tehama Golf Club in Carmel, Calif.

title: Two Sidekicks Take On All Forces
description: Rebecca Rose Lewis and Timothy Allan Hade were married Saturday at Twin Willows, an estate owned by a family friend in Lyme, N.H. The brides brother, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: In Sickness and in Laughs
description: Elyse Christine Jasmund, the daughter of Elizabeth Donlin Jasmund and David J. Jasmund of Winter Park, Fla., was married Saturday to Andrew Mifflin Starling, a son of Susanne Hollyday Starling and Alan C. Starling of Orlando, Fla. The Very Rev. Richard M. Walsh, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Knowles Memorial Chapel on the campus of Rollins College in Winter Park.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Our side isnt used to being asked for that kind of money. If you asked them to put up $100 million for a hospital wing, theyd be the first in line.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Catch up on the weeks top stories.

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 10:30 A.M. (CBS) FACE THE NATION After 24 years as this shows host and 46 with CBS, Bob Schieffer, above, signs off by interviewing Jeb Bush, the Republican presidential candidate and former Florida governor.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Catch up on the weeks top stories.

title: Corrections: May 31, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Outfielder Makes His Debut With the Yankees in a Win Over the Athletics
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Here was outfielder Ramon Flores on Saturday afternoon, sitting in a major league clubhouse, wearing a major league uniform. He was at the airport in Philadelphia at 5 a.m., connected in Minneapolis and arrived in the Bay Area in time for lunch. He had seen his name in the starting lineup posted on the wall, had just been congratulated by several teammates and was talking to about a dozen reporters.

title: The Worlds Coming Broadband Divide
description: Several events last week pointed out how much business success, economic development and even international competition is starting to depend on once unimaginably fast Internet speeds.

title: For Some in Chicago, Spike Lees Chiraq Has a Title That Rankles
description: CHICAGO  In his 1914 poem, an admiring Carl Sandburg called Chicago the City of the Big Shoulders, a proud label for the working people who called it home. During the winter of the polar vortex 100 years later, as temperatures dipped below zero and bitter winds whipped off Lake Michigan, miserable Chicagoans quipped that they were living in Chiberia.

title: John Kerry Cuts Europe Trip Short After Breaking Leg in Bicycle Accident
description: GENEVA  Secretary of State John Kerry plans to cut short his trip to Europe after breaking a leg while bicycling on Sunday and will return to Boston for medical treatment.

title: Doctors Seek Test for Deploying New Life-Extending Cancer Drugs
description: CHICAGO  New drugs that boost the immune systems ability to fight tumors may be one of the greatest medical advances in years, cancer doctors say, pulling some patients from deaths door and keeping them in remission for years.

title: China Says It Could Set Up Air Defense Zone in South China Sea
description: BEIJING  A Chinese admiral said Sunday that Beijing could set up an air defense zone above disputed areas of the South China Sea if it thought it was facing a large enough threat, according to Chinese news media.

title: A Special-Needs Parent Against My Will, Learning My Own Adaptive Lesson
description: I recently attended my 3-year-old daughters first ballet recital. It was one of the hardest things Ive ever done.

title: Western Officials Alarmed as ISIS Expands Territory in Libya
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  The branch of the Islamic State that controls Surt has expanded its territory and pushed back the militia from the neighboring city of Misurata, militia leaders acknowledged Sunday.

title: Grim History Surfaces With Wreckage of Slave Vessel
description: The Portuguese slave ship So Jos Paquete Africa left Mozambique in 1794 bound for Brazil, but never made it past the Cape of Good Hope.

title: Grim History Traced in Sunken Slave Ship Found Off South Africa
description: WASHINGTON  On Dec. 3, 1794, a Portuguese slave ship left Mozambique, on the east coast of Africa, for what was to be a 7,000-mile voyage to Maranho, Brazil, and the sugar plantations that awaited its cargo of black men and women.

title: 1890: A Railway Horror
description: NEW YORK  Later telegrams from San Francisco give the following additional details of the accident to the Oakland train, an account of which was cabled yesterday [May 30].

title: Skylight Revival on Broadway Makes Back Investment
description: The Broadway revival of Skylight, starring Carey Mulligan and Bill Nighy, has recouped its capitalization despite a relatively limited run, the producers said Sunday.

title: Grim History Surfaces With Wreckage of Slave Vessel
description: The Portuguese slave ship So Jos Paquete Africa left Mozambique in 1794 bound for Brazil, but never made it past the Cape of Good Hope.

title: This Age of Derp, Kansas Edition
description: Menzie Chinn notes the continuing failure of the Kansas experiment with supply-side tax cuts. And yes, it is an experiment  Gov. Brownback said it was, and by cutting taxes radically on the basis of ideology rather than any compelling event, Kansas in effect provided us with a natural experiment on exactly what such cuts accomplish. Menzie uses business indicators; I just look at employment growth since Brownback took office, compared with the nation as a whole (red line). No hint whatsoever of a supply-side boost, and of course a terrible fiscal crisis.

title: Crane Accident in Midtown Manhattan Injures 7 and Damages Buildings
description: A heating and air-conditioning unit weighing several tons came untethered from a crane and fell 30 stories to the ground in Midtown Manhattan on Sunday, leaving seven people scraped, bruised and shaken up, officials said.

title: Beau Biden Introduces His Father in 2012
description: Joseph R. Biden III, who was known as Beau, introduced his father, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., during the 2012 Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C.

title: A Peep Inside the Former Home of Walter Winchell, Americas Top Transom Peeper
description: The temptation is to begin with a Winchellism like this: Good evening, Mr. and Mrs. America from border to border and coast to coast and all the ships at sea. Lets go to press. So much time has passed since that was a national catchphrase that an explanation would be necessary  an explanation of what Winchellisms were and who coined them.

title: Seismic Swarms of San Andreas Top Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  Dwayne Johnson became a bona fide movie star over the weekend, powering his San Andreas disaster thriller to a better-than-expected $53.2 million in North American ticket sales.

title: An Artist With Too Many Ideas to Consider Retiring
description: The thought sometimes flashes through her mind in the sleepless hours after midnight, when she is energized and annoyed by the deluge of ideas flooding her brain.

title: Netanyahu Lashes Out at Criticism of Israel
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said on Sunday that his country faced an international campaign to blacken its name based not on his policies toward the Palestinians but connected to our very existence, likening the mounting boycott movement to anti-Semitic libels of previous eras.

title: Lennie Merullo, the Last Cub to Play in a World Series, Dies at 98
description: Lennie Merullo was honored by the Chicago Cubs at a June 2014 game, throwing out the ceremonial first pitch and leading the crowd in Take Me Out to the Ballgame during the seventh-inning stretch, part of the many events marking Wrigley Fields 100th anniversary.

title: 1940: Flanders Evacuation Continues Orderly as Bad Weather Hampers Nazi Bombers
description: LONDON  A series of dramatic eyewitness descriptions of Allied soldiers arriving in English ports after being evacuated from Flanders was given today [May 31] by the British Broadcasting Corporation.

title: Beau Bidens Death Triggers an Outpouring of Grief
description: WASHINGTON  In a town where few events ever truly break through the thick layer of partisanship, the death of Joseph R. Biden III on Saturday night unleashed an outpouring of sorrow.

title: Big Bang Theory Creates Science Scholarship
description: The stars of the The Big Bang Theory will be putting their very big paychecks to good use. Actors on the sitcom, as well as members of the crew and the CBS shows co-creator Chuck Lorre, have created a scholarship at the Univerity of California, Los Angeles, for science students seeking financial aid.

title: Review: Matthew Aucoins Crossing Is a Taut, Inspired Opera
description: BOSTON  At 25, the American composer, conductor, pianist, poet and sometime critic Matthew Aucoin has already been an assistant conductor at the Metropolitan Opera, made his conducting debut with the Chicago Symphony Orchestra and written pieces for Yo-Yo Ma, among other renowned artists, not to mention lecturing on music and poetry at the Shakespeare Society in New York.

title: Doris Hart, a Tennis Star Who Deftly Overcame Leg Ailments, Dies at 89
description: Doris Hart, who overcame a life-threatening leg infection as a child and became one of the worlds best tennis players in the decade after World War II, died on Friday at her home in Coral Gables, Fla. She was 89.

title: As Rafael Nadal Awaits, Jack Sock Hopes to Win a Battle of Forehands
description: PARIS  Jack Sock has already experienced a Jack Sock Day, which took place last September in Lincoln, Neb. He has also been honored at a University of Nebraska football game and is still hoping to take batting practice with the Kansas City Royals in his other touchstone city.

title: Jeb Bush Says He Is Still Just Considering a Presidential Run
description: Jeb Bush continued to maintain he was merely thinking about a presidential bid when asked on Sunday if he was delaying an announcement to continue courting wealthy donors.

title: Review: A Human Being Died That Night, a Look at an Apartheid Assassin, at BAM
description: The words are sober, almost clinical: A Human Being Died That Night. The play that bears this title, on the other hand, reveals in searing, sometimes heart-rending detail the atrocities committed by the South African police forces during the terrible years of apartheid.

title: Obamas Trade Deal Faces Bipartisan Peril in the House
description: WASHINGTON  The bruising battle over President Obamas push for the power to negotiate two potentially far-reaching trade pacts will shift this week to the House, where the White House faces entrenched opposition from Democrats and the stirring of rebellion from the Republicans right flank.

title: Ex-FIFA Official Cites Satirical Article From The Onion in His Self-Defense
description: Jack Warner, a former vice president of world soccers governing body, FIFA, defended himself against corruption charges on Sunday by citing an article from The Onion, apparently unaware that it was satire.

title: Review: Donald Berman Balances Fire and Rhapsody at Bargemusic
description: In the middle of an aphoristic gallery of portrait pieces by Scott Wheeler on Friday night, the pianist Donald Berman paused, seemingly to look out the window.

title: Review: Jane Comfort Signals a Departure With a Moody New Work
description: Jane Comfort is a choreographer with a penchant for fusing text and movement  until now. Altiplano, which received its premiere on Thursday as part of the La MaMa Moves! Dance Festival, signals a departure for this longtime modern choreographer, who in past dance-theater works has explored the myth of Persephone and notions of beauty with Barbie.

title: Review: To Life!, a Show of Songs Cut From Fiddler on the Roof
description: Unless youre a finicky musical-theater historian or a fanatical devotee of the show being examined, a program of songs discarded from Fiddler on the Roof should be a tough sell.

title: Review: School of American Ballet Workshop Includes Harlequinade
description: At the annual workshop performances of the School of American Ballet you can see the past becoming the future: the stars of tomorrow, often coached by the stars of yesterday, frequently in ballets and roles that the teachers danced back when they were promising students. The historical continuity is strong, as is the connection to New York City Ballet. Thats where the teachers had their dancing careers and where many of the best pupils end up. Many of the students have already performed with City Ballet, as children in The Nutcracker or Harlequinade.

title: Bartolo Colon Adds a Double to His Legend in a Win Over the Marlins
description: The Mets pitching staff already has a Thor in Noah Syndergaard and a Dark Knight in Matt Harvey. But Bartolo Colon may be the true superhero.

title: Review: Stephen King Leaps Through Time in Finders Keepers
description: Stephen King has won many specialized awards  the Black Quill, the Balrog, the Bram Stoker, just to name a few of the Bs  during his long, incredibly prolific career. But until April he had never won an Edgar for best novel. This is the greatest genre-specific accolade available for crime books and thrillers, and Mr. King finally won it for Mr. Mercedes, an atypical King novel published last June. It features a vicious, teasing killer determined to inflict mass violence on crowds of Americans. And it describes him in what is, for Mr. King, a pretty no-frills fashion.

title: Key Parts of Patriot Act Expire Temporarily as Senate Moves Toward Limits on Spying
description: WASHINGTON  The governments authority to sweep up vast quantities of phone records in the hunt for terrorists expired at 12:01 a.m. Monday after Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky, blocked an extension of the program during an extraordinary and at times caustic Sunday session of the Senate.

title: Review: Red Hot + Arthur Russell Pays Funky, Introspective Tribute to a Composer and Musician
description: Red Hot + Arthur Russell, which started its two nights at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Friday, was a tribute to the kind of genre-busting artist who defined downtown New York City in the 1970s and 80s.

title: Lifetimes UnREAL Traces the Cracks in Reality TVs Fourth Wall
description: Imagine everything on The Bachelorette is nonfiction. The kisses and the heavy petting. The warp-speed growth of love-like feeling. The letdowns and the meltdowns. The belief in a happy ending. The current season of the show  the 11th, or 30th if you include its partner show, The Bachelor  is only two weeks in, and already, all of those things have erupted.

title: Review: The Whispers, on ABC, an Imaginary Friend With Dangerous Intentions
description: The brightly creepy opening scene of The Whispers gives you what you want in the television equivalent of a beach read. While children cavort on an idyllic suburban lawn, one little girl stands off to the side talking to her imaginary friend. Having received her instructions, she goes in the house and gathers the tools  a hammer, a saw  that shell need to build a booby trap designed to kill her mother.

title: Review: American Genius Focuses on Rivalries on the Road to Innovations
description: Serious historians would surely find an abundance of oversimplification in American Genius, an eight-part series that begins with two episodes Monday night on the National Geographic Channel. But the treatments still have a lot to recommend them, whether its raising the profile of some less-heralded historical figures or simply reminding us of the speed of change.

title: Review: The Sleeping Beauty, Reawakened by American Ballet Theater
description: The ballet of The Sleeping Beauty  new in St. Petersburg in 1890  addresses tradition, renewal and diverse aspects of dance theater. To Serge Diaghilev, the idea of staging it in the West first arose from Tchaikovskys music, which, in 1920, he and Stravinsky (Russians unable to return to Russia) found themselves continually playing. But when Diaghilevs production was realized, in London in 1921 with designs by Lon Bakst, Stravinsky found that its greatest revelation was not Tchaikovskys score  for many of us the best and most abundant of all his compositions  but Marius Petipas choreography. Its classicism showed, as Stravinsky wrote in his An Autobiography, the triumph of rule over the arbitrary and the perfect expression of the Apollonian principle.

title: Review: American Symphony Orchestras George Perle Centennial Tribute
description: It is a rare encounter with the great musical revivalists Leon Botstein and the American Symphony Orchestra that does not involve a lot of scholarly baggage or special pleading for a forgotten composer. But American Variations: Perle at 100, an attractive program well played at Carnegie Hall on Friday evening, pretty much spoke for itself.

title: Challenging Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders Gains Momentum in Iowa
description: DES MOINES  A mere 240 people live in the rural northeast Iowa town of Kensett, so when more than 300 crowded into the community center on Saturday night to hear Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, many driving 50 miles, the cellphones of Democratic leaders statewide began to buzz.

title: Cogito Ergo Sum
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Confession: One of my favorite cuisines is Korean  I was introduced to it a while back when I was studying a Korean martial art  and I briefly entertained the idea of starting a blog about Korean cooking that I was going to call SEOUL Food.

title: The Population Bomb?
description: In the 1960s, fears of overpopulation sparked campaigns for population control. But whatever became of the population bomb?

title: The Unrealized Horrors of Population Explosion
description: The second half of the 1960s was a boom time for nightmarish visions of what lay ahead for humankind. In 1966, for example, a writer named Harry Harrison came out with a science fiction novel titled Make Room! Make Room! Sketching a dystopian world in which too many people scrambled for too few resources, the book became the basis for a 1973 film about a hellish future, Soylent Green. In 1969, the pop duo Zager and Evans reached the top of the charts with a number called In the Year 2525, which postulated that humans were on a clear path to doom.

title: A House Is a Spinning Dome
description: It takes only a motor the size of a lawn mower with the strength of a blow dryer to rotate a 2,500-square-foot house in New Paltz, N.Y.

title: Federal Investigators Fault Medicares Reliance on Doctors for Pay Standards
description: WASHINGTON  The government relies too heavily on advice from the American Medical Association in deciding how much to pay doctors under Medicare, and the decisions may be biased because the doctors have potential conflicts of interest, federal investigators say in a new report.

title: Saudis Turn Birthplace of Wahhabism Ideology Into Tourist Spot
description: DIRIYAH, Saudi Arabia  More than 250 years ago, in this sunbaked oasis of mud-brick houses and ramparts, the ancestors of the Saudi royal family and an outcast fundamentalist preacher formed an alliance that has shaped this land ever since.

title: Families of 1972 Munich Victims Find New Hope for Remembrance
description: For 43 years, the families of the victims of the terrorist attack at the 1972 Munich Olympics have pushed and lobbied the German government and the International Olympic Committee for some kind of official acknowledgment to publicly honor those killed in the massacre.
